      39             : /*
      40             : Structure for keeping track of fixup information for a particular function or
      41             : member function, including both the cached tokens comprising default argument
      42             : expressions of its parameters and -- for a function defined inside a class
      43             : definition -- the cached tokens comprising the function body.  Currently only
      44             : used for non-member, non-friend declarations when that declaration includes
      45             : default arguments.
      46             : */
      47             : /* a_routine_fixup_ptr is already defined in symbol_tbl.h. */
      48             : typedef struct a_routine_fixup {
      49             :   a_routine_fixup_ptr
      50             :                 next;
      51             :                         /* Next in a linked list of routine fixup blocks,
      52             :                            each of which is associated with a particular
      53             :                            member function of a given class. */
      54             :   a_type_ptr    class_type;
      55             :                         /* Pointer to the class that is current when the
      56             :                            declaration requiring a fixup was encountered.
      57             :                            Usually the parent class of "symbol".  This is NULL
      58             :                            for functions appearing outside any class. */
      59             :   a_symbol_ptr  symbol;
      60             :                         /* Pointer to a symbol entry with which the fixup
      61             :                            is associated.  Usually, it is a member function
      62             :                            symbol, but it can be any member symbol with an
      63             :                            associated routine type for which default args
      64             :                            have been specified (a typedef or data member of
      65             :                            type ptr-to-routine).  NULL in the case of a
      66             :                            function declaration appearing outside a class
      67             :                            definition. */

     451         208 : void prescan_function_default_arg_expr(a_decl_parse_state  *dps,
     452             :                                        a_param_type_ptr    ptp)
     453             : /*
     454             : Cache a default argument for an ordinary (i.e., not a template) function or
     455             : member function declared outside a class definition and record an end-of-parse
     456             : action to scan the cached tokens when the declaration is complete.
     457             : 
     458             : *dps keeps track of the declaration of the function or member function (that
     459             : declaration is not completed yet), and ptp represents the parameter associated
     460             : with the default argument.  ptp->has_default_arg is set to TRUE at this time.
     461             : */
     462             : {
     463         208 :   if (dps->routine_fixup == NULL) {
     464             :     /* This is the first default argument for this declaration: Allocate the
     465             :        associated routine fixup entry. */

     467             :     /* dps->routine_fixup->func_info must be updated later. */
     468             :     /* Record an end-of-parse action to parse the default argument cached

     470         128 :     add_end_of_parse_action(scan_cached_default_args, dps,
     471             :                             /*secondary_decls=*/FALSE);
     472             :   }  /* if */
     473         208 :   prescan_default_function_arg_expr(

     480             : 
     481       57900 : static a_boolean is_invalid_scope_for_class(void)
     482             : /*
     483             : Determine whether the current scope is valid for a class definition.  This
     484             : is used to suppress the fixup of routines declared in the class for classes
     485             : found in unexpected locations.  (It is also used for error recovery purposes.)
     486             : */

     488       57900 :   a_boolean            result = FALSE;

     491       60826 :   while (ssep->kind == (a_scope_kind)sck_template_declaration) {

     493             :        to find the enclosing class. */

     501             :   /* Skip any block scopes. */
     502       57980 :   while (ssep->kind == (a_scope_kind)sck_block) ssep--;

     504             :      an invalid scope.  If so, treat this as an invalid scope for a class. */

     506         992 :       ssep->assoc_routine->is_lambda_body) {
     507           0 :     a_scope_stack_entry  *closure_ssep = ssep-1;

     933             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
     934             : 
     935             : /*
     936             : Data structure to record a near-match encountered between a C++/CLI base
     937             : interface member and a derived class member.  For example, an entry is
     938             : recorded if the two members differ only in return type: For ordinary C++
     939             : classes differing only in return type is an error, but with interface
     940             : members there is no error if the base member is overridden using a named
     941             : override specifier.
     942             : */

     948             :                            there is no next entry). */

     952             :                            "almost" matches a derived class function. */

     956             :                            a derived class function. */
     957             :   a_source_position

     961             :                            member declaration). */

     964             :                            mismatch. */

     967             :                            "virtual" specifier. */
     968             :   a_bit_field   reduced_access:1;
     969             :                         /* TRUE if this entry is due to an attempt to override 
     970             :                            a member with a member that has reduced
     971             :                            accessibility. */
     972             :   a_bit_field   nonpublic_interface_match:1;
     973             :                         /* TRUE if this entry is due to a nonpublic member
     974             :                            function implicitly matching an interface member
     975             :                            (it is not treated as an override). */
     976             : } a_quasi_override_descr;
     977             : 
     978             : /* Available list of "quasi-override" descriptions. */
     979             : static a_quasi_override_descr_ptr avail_quasi_override_descrs;
     980             : 
     981             : #if DEBUG
     982             : static unsigned long
     983             :                 num_quasi_override_descrs_allocated;
     984             : 
     985             : unsigned long db_show_quasi_override_descrs_used(unsigned long grand_total)
     986             : /*
     987             : Show space used by the "quasi-override" descriptions.  This is called by the
     988             : symbol table space used routine.  The space used by these entries is reported
     989             : as part of the symbol table memory used.
     990             : */
     991             : {
     992             :   unsigned long  num, size, total;
     993             : 
     994             :   db_space_used_lost("quasi-override descr.",
     995             :                      avail_quasi_override_descrs,
     996             :                      num_quasi_override_descrs_allocated,
     997             :                      a_quasi_override_descr);
     998             :   return grand_total;
     999             : }  /* db_show_quasi_override_descrs_used */
    1000             : 
    1001             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    1002             : 
    1003             : 
    1004             : static a_quasi_override_descr_ptr append_quasi_override_descr(
    1005             :                                       a_quasi_override_descr_ptr  *p_list,
    1006             :                                       a_base_class_ptr            base_class,
    1007             :                                       a_symbol_ptr                base_member,
    1008             :                                       a_source_position           *diag_pos)
    1009             : /*
    1010             : Append a new "quasi-override" description entry to the list of entries pointed
    1011             : to by *p_list (which is NULL if the list is empty).  Initialize the new entry
    1012             : (using base_class, base_member, and diag_pos) and return that entry.
    1013             : */
    1014             : {
    1015             :   a_quasi_override_descr_ptr  qodp, *p_end = p_list;
    1016             : 
    1017             :   /* Reuse a entry from the available list; otherwise, allocate a new entry. */
    1018             :   if (avail_quasi_override_descrs != NULL) {
    1019             :     qodp = avail_quasi_override_descrs;
    1020             :     avail_quasi_override_descrs = avail_quasi_override_descrs->next;
    1021             :   } else {
    1022             :     qodp =
    1023             :          (a_quasi_override_descr_ptr)alloc_fe(sizeof(a_quasi_override_descr));
    1024             : #if DEBUG
    1025             :     num_quasi_override_descrs_allocated += 1;
    1026             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    1027             :   }  /* if */
    1028             :   /* Initialize its fields. */
    1029             :   qodp->next = NULL;
    1030             :   qodp->base_class = base_class;
    1031             :   qodp->base_member = base_member;
    1032             :   qodp->diag_pos = *diag_pos;
    1033             :   qodp->return_type_mismatch = FALSE;
    1034             :   qodp->missing_virtual_specifier = FALSE;
    1035             :   qodp->reduced_access = FALSE;
    1036             :   qodp->nonpublic_interface_match = FALSE;
    1037             :   /* Append it to the end of the list. */
    1038             :   while (*p_end != NULL) p_end = &(*p_end)->next;
    1039             :   *p_end = qodp;
    1040             :   return qodp;
    1041             : }  /* append_quasi_override_descr */
    1042             : 
    1043             : 
    1044             : static void free_quasi_override_descr_list(a_quasi_override_descr_ptr  *p_list)
    1045             : /*
    1046             : Place the list of "quasi-override" description entries on the "available" list
    1047             : and set *p_list to NULL.
    1048             : */
    1049             : {
    1050             :   a_quasi_override_descr_ptr  end = *p_list;
    1051             : 
    1052             :   if (end != NULL) {
    1053             :     while (end->next != NULL) end = end->next;
    1054             :     end->next = avail_quasi_override_descrs;
    1055             :     avail_quasi_override_descrs = *p_list;
    1056             :     *p_list = NULL;
    1057             :   }  /* if */
    1058             : }  /* free_quasi_override_descr_list */
    1059             : 
    1060             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    1061             : 
    1062             : #if IA64_ABI
    1063             : /*
    1064             : Data structure to record covariant overriding virtual functions.

    1066             : typedef struct a_covariant_override *a_covariant_override_ptr;
    1067             : typedef struct a_covariant_override {
    1068             :   a_covariant_override_ptr
    1069             :                 next;

    1071             :                            last entry on the list. */
    1072             :   a_base_class_ptr
    1073             :                 bcp;

    1079             :                            adjustment is computed. */

    1083             :   a_routine_ptr
    1084             :                 overriding;

    1086             :                            the base class member function. */

    1097             : /*
    1098             : A class-definition-state block, which tracks properties of the class as its
    1099             : definition proceeds.
    1100             : */
    1101             : typedef struct a_class_def_state* a_class_def_state_ptr;
    1102             : typedef struct a_class_def_state {
    1103             :   a_type_ptr    class_type;
    1104             :                         /* The class being defined. */
    1105             :   a_bit_field   is_first_field:1;
    1106             :                         /* TRUE until the first nonstatic data member of the
    1107             :                            class has been seen. */
    1108             :   a_bit_field   class_aggregate_ruled_out:1;
    1109             :                         /* TRUE if a property of the class (e.g., the
    1110             :                            declaration of a virtual function) disqualifies it
    1111             :                            as an "aggregate". */
    1112             :   a_bit_field   cpp03_POD_ruled_out:1;
    1113             :                         /* TRUE if a property of the class disqualifies it as
    1114             :                            a "POD". */
    1115             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    1116             :   a_bit_field   potentially_interface_like:1;
    1117             :                         /* TRUE if we haven't ruled out this type from being
    1118             :                            an "interface-like" type (Microsoft mode only).
    1119             :                            Not set until after the opening brace of the
    1120             :                            definition is seen. */
    1121             :   a_bit_field   current_decl_valid_in_property_or_event_def:1;
    1122             :                         /* TRUE if a member declaration that was just processed
    1123             :                            is allowed within the braces of a C++/CLI property
    1124             :                            or event.  (Currently, this is true only for member
    1125             :                            function declarations, empty declarations, and some
    1126             :                            error cases.  The latter only to inhibit additional
    1127             :                            diagnostics.) */
    1128             :   a_bit_field   interfaces_pending:1;
    1129             :                         /* TRUE if interfaces implemented by the current class
    1130             :                            will be specified later in the class' body. */
    1131             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    1132             :   a_bit_field   any_fields_other_than_unnamed_bitfields:1;
    1133             :                         /* TRUE if any fields other than unnamed bit-fields
    1134             :                            are declared. */
    1135             :   a_bit_field   any_friend_decls:1;
    1136             :                         /* TRUE if any friend declarations are encountered. */
    1137             :   a_bit_field   any_const_or_ref_fields:1;
    1138             :                         /* TRUE if any nonstatic data members have reference
    1139             :                            or const-qualified type. */
    1140             :   a_bit_field   is_template_instantiation:1;
    1141             :                         /* TRUE if the class is a template instantiation
    1142             :                            (real or nonreal), including classes nested within
    1143             :                            template instances. */
    1144             :   a_bit_field   is_nonreal_instantiation:1;
    1145             :                         /* TRUE if the class is a prototype instantiation of
    1146             :                            a class template. */
    1147             :   a_bit_field   is_generic_definition:1;
    1148             :                         /* TRUE if the class is the definition of a C++/CLI
    1149             :                            generic. */
    1150             :   a_bit_field   is_generic_instance:1;
    1151             :                         /* TRUE if the class is the instantiation of a C++/CLI
    1152             :                            generic, including classes nested with a generic
    1153             :                            instantiation. */
    1154             :   a_bit_field   is_local_class:1;
    1155             :                         /* TRUE if the class is local to a function. */
    1156             :   a_bit_field   last_field_is_incomplete_array:1;
    1157             :                         /* TRUE if the most recently declared field in a
    1158             :                            non-union is an incomplete array type. */
    1159             :   a_bit_field   default_ctor_is_nontrivial:1;
    1160             :                         /* TRUE if the implied default constructor (if any)
    1161             :                            must be nontrivial because the class has virtual
    1162             :                            base classes, virtual functions, or base classes or
    1163             :                            members with nontrivial default constructors. */
    1164             :   a_bit_field   member_destruction_required:1;
    1165             :                         /* TRUE if the class has a direct member requiring
    1166             :                            destruction. */
    1167             :   a_bit_field   base_destruction_required:1;
    1168             :                         /* TRUE if the class has a base class requiring
    1169             :                            destruction. */
    1170             :   a_bit_field   trivial_deleted_subobject_destructor:1;
    1171             :                         /* TRUE if the class has a base or member with a
    1172             :                            trivial deleted destructor. */
    1173             :   a_bit_field   ms_parenthesized_member:1;
    1174             :                         /* Some versions of the Microsoft compiler allow a
    1175             :                            member declaration to start with a left parenthesis.
    1176             :                            The matching right parenthesis can appear almost
    1177             :                            anywhere in the declaration, or not at all.
    1178             :                            For example:
    1179             :                              struct S { (int a)[3]; };       */
    1180             :   a_bit_field   rule_out_trivial_copy_for_volatile_class_field:1;
    1181             :                         /* TRUE if trivial copying should be ruled out because
    1182             :                            a field of volatile class type has been seen where
    1183             :                            the unqualified class type is trivially copyable.
    1184             :                            For example:
    1185             :                              struct T {};
    1186             :                              struct S { volatile T v; };
    1187             :                              S x, y(x);  // Error.
    1188             :                            The trivial copy constructor of T cannot copy a
    1189             :                            volatile T since it takes a "T const&".  The copy
    1190             :                            constructor of S is therefore marked "deleted".
    1191             :                            Perhaps surprisingly, __is_trivially_copyable(S)
    1192             :                            remains true (after the resolution of Core issue
    1193             :                            2094). */
    1194             :   a_bit_field   rule_out_bitwise_copy_for_deleted_ctor:1;
    1195             :                         /* TRUE if bitwise copying should be ruled out because
    1196             :                            a copy/move constructor is deleted. */
    1197             :   a_bit_field   rule_out_trivial_assign_for_volatile_class_field:1;
    1198             :                         /* TRUE if trivial assignment should be ruled out
    1199             :                            because a field of volatile class type has been seen
    1200             :                            where the unqualified class type is trivially
    1201             :                            assignable.   (Such a type can still be considered
    1202             :                            "bitwise" copyable.) */
    1203             :   a_bit_field   rule_out_bitwise_assign_for_deleted_operator:1;
    1204             :                         /* TRUE if bitwise copying should be ruled out because
    1205             :                            a copy/move assignment operator is deleted. */
    1206             :   a_bit_field   needs_constructor_symbol:1;
    1207             :                         /* TRUE if constructors must be represented explicitly
    1208             :                            (for simple class types, constructors are not always
    1209             :                            generated, but some member or base types do require
    1210             :                            that generation). */
    1211             :   a_bit_field   needs_assignment_symbol:1;
    1212             :                         /* TRUE if assignment operators must be represented
    1213             :                            explicitly (for simple class types, assignment
    1214             :                            operators are not always generated, but some member
    1215             :                            or base types do require that generation). */
    1216             :   a_bit_field   has_inheriting_constructors:1;
    1217             :                         /* TRUE if a using-declaration introducing inheriting
    1218             :                            constructors has been encountered. */
    1219             :   a_bit_field   any_defaulted_special_members:1;
    1220             :                         /* TRUE if a defaulted special member declaration has
    1221             :                            been seen. */
    1222             :   an_access_specifier
    1223             :                 access;
    1224             :                         /* The current access. */
    1225             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    1226             :   an_access_specifier
    1227             :                 assembly_access;
    1228             :                         /* Current access outside of the parent assembly.
    1229             :                            (C++/CLI only.) */
    1230             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    1231             :   an_override_registry_entry_ptr
    1232             :                 override_registry;
    1233             :                         /* The registry of virtual function overrides for
    1234             :                            the current class. */
    1235             :   a_field_ptr   end_of_field_list;
    1236             :                         /* The last nonstatic data member declared for the
    1237             :                            current class. */
    1238             :   a_symbol_ptr  corresp_prototype_tag_sym;
    1239             :                         /* If the current class is a instance of a class
    1240             :                            template, a pointer to the symbol for the
    1241             :                            prototype instantiation of that template. */
    1242             : #if IA64_ABI
    1243             :   a_covariant_override_ptr
    1244             :                 covariant_overrides, last_covariant_override;
    1245             :                         /* A list keeping track of the virtual function
    1246             :                            overrides that involve a covariant return type. */
    1247             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    1248             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    1249             :   a_property_or_event_descr_ptr
    1250             :                 property_or_event_descr;
    1251             :                         /* While parsing C++/CLI property or event accessor
    1252             :                            functions, this points to the associated IL
    1253             :                            descriptor.  Otherwise, NULL. */
    1254             :   a_member_decl_info_ptr
    1255             :                 pe_info;
    1256             :                         /* Information block describing a property or event
    1257             :                            declaration whose processing was suspended until
    1258             :                            an accessor declaration is encountered. */
    1259             :   a_symbol_locator
    1260             :                 *pe_loc;
    1261             :                         /* Locator associated with pe_info. */
    1262             :   a_quasi_override_descr_ptr
    1263             :                 quasi_overrides;
    1264             :                         /* A list of descriptions of base-derived member pairs
    1265             :                            that almost matched for overriding purposes.  Used
    1266             :                            for diagnosing certain cases in C++/CLI mode. */
    1267             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    1268             : } a_class_def_state;
    1269             : 
    1270             : 
    1271       17898 : static void initialize_class_def_state(a_type_ptr            class_type,
    1272             :                                        a_class_def_state_ptr cdsp)
    1273             : /*
    1274             : Initialize fields of a class-definition-state block.  class_type is the
    1275             : class being defined.
    1276             : */
    1277             : {
    1278       17898 :   cdsp->class_type = class_type;
    1279       17898 :   cdsp->is_first_field = TRUE;
    1280       17898 :   cdsp->class_aggregate_ruled_out = FALSE;
    1281       17898 :   cdsp->cpp03_POD_ruled_out = FALSE;

    1372             : 
    1373             : static void record_override_exception_check(
    1374             :                                          a_symbol_ptr           overriding_sym,
    1375             :                                          a_symbol_ptr           overridden_sym,
    1376             :                                          a_source_position      *diag_pos)
    1377             : /*
    1378             : Allocate an override exception check entry and add it to the list pointed to
    1379             : by the file-scope variable override_exception_check_entries.  Initialize the
    1380             : record with the given information.
    1381             : */
    1382             : {
    1383             :   an_override_exception_check_entry_ptr  oecp;
    1384             : 
    1385             :   if (avail_override_exception_check_entries != NULL) {
    1386             :     oecp = avail_override_exception_check_entries;
    1387             :     avail_override_exception_check_entries =
    1388             :                                  avail_override_exception_check_entries->next;
    1389             :   } else {
    1390             :     oecp = (an_override_exception_check_entry_ptr)
    1391             :                           alloc_fe(sizeof(an_override_exception_check_entry));
    1392             : #if DEBUG
    1393             :     ++num_override_exception_check_entries;
    1394             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    1395             :   }  /* if */
    1396             :   oecp->next = override_exception_check_entries;
    1397             :   override_exception_check_entries = oecp;
    1398             :   oecp->overridden_sym = overridden_sym;
    1399             :   oecp->overriding_sym = overriding_sym;
    1400             :   oecp->diag_pos = *diag_pos;
    1401             : }  /* record_override_exception_check */
    1402             : 
    1403             : 
    1404           0 : static void report_override_exception_spec_mismatch(
    1405             :                                                a_symbol_ptr       overrider,
    1406             :                                                a_symbol_ptr       overridden,
    1407             :                                                a_source_position  *source_pos)
    1408             : /*
    1409             : The member function represented by overrider overrides the virtual member
    1410             : represented by overridden, but its exception specification is less
    1411             : restrictive.  Issue an appropriate diagnostic at the given position.
    1412             : */
    1413             : {
    1414           0 :   if (overrider->variant.routine.ptr->compiler_generated) {
    1415             :     /* In non-strict modes, issue a warning on a compiler-generated
    1416             :        constructor, destructor, or assignment operator.  In strict
    1417             :        modes, an error should be issued by default (discretionary). */
    1418           0 :     pos_sy2_diagnostic(strict_ansi_mode ?
    1419             :                               strict_ansi_discretionary_severity : es_warning,
    1420             :                        ec_generated_exception_spec_override_incompat,
    1421             :                        source_pos, overrider, overridden);
    1422             :   } else {
    1423             :     /* Microsoft compilers don't diagnose this (and in fact, they don't do
    1424             :        much with exception specifications at all). */
    1425           0 :     pos_sy2_diagnostic(ms_extensions ? es_warning : es_discretionary_error,
    1426             :                        ec_exception_spec_override_incompat,
    1427             :                        source_pos, overrider, overridden);
    1428             :   }  /* if */
    1429           0 : }  /* report_override_exception_spec_mismatch */
    1430             : 
    1431             : 
    1432       20530 : static void process_override_exception_check_entries(void)
    1433             : /*
    1434             : Perform any pending checks indicated by the override_exception_check_entries
    1435             : list and free that list.
    1436             : */
    1437             : {
    1438       20530 :   an_override_exception_check_entry_ptr  oecp, *p_oecp;
    1439             : 
    1440             :   
    1441       20530 :   p_oecp = &override_exception_check_entries;
    1442       20530 :   oecp = *p_oecp;
    1443       21291 :   while (oecp != NULL) {
    1444         761 :     a_routine_ptr  brp = oecp->overridden_sym->variant.routine.ptr;
    1445         761 :     a_routine_ptr  drp = oecp->overriding_sym->variant.routine.ptr;
    1446         761 :     a_type_ptr     dtp = parent_class_of(drp);
    1447         761 :     if (!dtp->incomplete) {
    1448         761 :       if (type_has_less_restrictive_exception_spec(drp->type, brp->type)) {
    1449             :         /* The exception specification for the overriding virtual function is
    1450             :            less restrictive than that of the overridden function. */
    1451           0 :         report_override_exception_spec_mismatch(oecp->overriding_sym,
    1452             :                                                 oecp->overridden_sym,
    1453             :                                                 &oecp->diag_pos);
    1454             :       }  /* if */
    1455         761 :       *p_oecp = oecp->next;
    1456         761 :       oecp->next = avail_override_exception_check_entries;
    1457         761 :       avail_override_exception_check_entries = oecp;
    1458             :     } else {
    1459           0 :       p_oecp = &oecp->next;
    1460             :     }  /* if */
    1461         761 :     oecp = *p_oecp;
    1462             :   }  /* while */
    1463       20530 : }  /* process_override_exception_check_entries */
    1464             : 
    1465             : 
    1466             : #if IA64_ABI
    1467             : 
    1468             : /* Available list of covariant override entries. */
    1469             : static a_covariant_override_ptr  avail_covariant_overrides;
    1470             : 
    1471             : #if DEBUG
    1472             : 
    1473             : /*
    1474             : Counter to track total use of memory.
    1475             : */
    1476             : static unsigned long
    1477             :                 num_covariant_overrides_allocated;
    1478             : 
    1479           0 : unsigned long db_show_covariant_overrides_used(unsigned long grand_total)
    1480             : {
    1481           0 :   unsigned long  num, size, total;
    1482             : 
    1483           0 :   db_space_used_lost("covariant overrides", avail_covariant_overrides,
    1484           0 :                      num_covariant_overrides_allocated, a_covariant_override);
    1485           0 :   return grand_total;
    1486             : }  /* db_show_covariant_overrides_used */
    1487             : 
    1488             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    1489             : 
    1490             : static void record_covariant_override(a_class_def_state_ptr  cdsp,
    1491             :                                       a_base_class_ptr       bcp,
    1492             :                                       a_base_class_ptr       adjustment_bcp,
    1493             :                                       a_routine_ptr          overridden,
    1494             :                                       a_routine_ptr          overriding)
    1495             : /*
    1496             : Allocate a covariant override record and append it to the end of the list
    1497             : pointed to by cdsp.  Initialize the record with the given information.
    1498             : */
    1499             : {
    1500             :   a_covariant_override_ptr  cop;
    1501             : 
    1502             :   if (avail_covariant_overrides != NULL) {
    1503             :     cop = avail_covariant_overrides;
    1504             :     avail_covariant_overrides = avail_covariant_overrides->next;
    1505             :   } else {
    1506             :     cop = (a_covariant_override_ptr)alloc_fe(sizeof(a_covariant_override));
    1507             : #if DEBUG
    1508             :     ++num_covariant_overrides_allocated;
    1509             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    1510             :   }  /* if */
    1511             :   cop->next = NULL;
    1512             :   cop->bcp = bcp;
    1513             :   cop->adjustment_bcp = adjustment_bcp;
    1514             :   cop->overridden = overridden;
    1515             :   cop->overriding = overriding;
    1516             :   if (cdsp->covariant_overrides == NULL) {
    1517             :     cdsp->covariant_overrides = cop;
    1518             :   } else {
    1519             :     cdsp->last_covariant_override->next = cop;
    1520             :   }  /* if */
    1521             :   cdsp->last_covariant_override = cop;
    1522             : }  /* record_covariant_override */
    1523             : 
    1524             : 
    1525         538 : static void free_covariant_overrides(a_class_def_state_ptr  cdsp)
    1526             : /*
    1527             : Make the covariant override records pointed to by cdsp available for future
    1528             : use.
    1529             : */
    1530             : {
    1531         538 :   if (cdsp->covariant_overrides != NULL) {
    1532           0 :     cdsp->last_covariant_override->next = avail_covariant_overrides;
    1533           0 :     avail_covariant_overrides = cdsp->covariant_overrides;
    1534           0 :     cdsp->covariant_overrides = NULL;
    1535           0 :     cdsp->last_covariant_override = NULL;
    1536             :   }  /* if */
    1537             : }  /* free_covariant_overrides */
    1538             : 
    1539             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    1540             : 
    1541             : /*
    1542             : A member-declaration-info block, for tracking information about a class member
    1543             : declaration as it appears.
    1544             : */  
    1545             : typedef struct a_member_decl_info {
    1546             :   a_decl_parse_state
    1547             :                 decl_state;
    1548             :                         /* General declaration information. */
    1549             :   a_decl_pos_block
    1550             :                 decl_pos_block;
    1551             :                         /* Additional source position information on the
    1552             :                            declaration. */
    1553             :   a_bit_field   is_first_in_declarator_list:1;
    1554             :                         /* TRUE for the first declarator in a declarator list,
    1555             :                            FALSE thereafter. */
    1556             :   a_bit_field   is_constructor:1;
    1557             :                         /* TRUE if the current declaration is a constructor.
    1558             :                            In unusual cases this value may be different from
    1559             :                            (dso_flags & DSO_CONSTRUCTOR). */
    1560             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    1561             :   a_bit_field   is_static_constructor:1;
    1562             :                         /* TRUE if the current declaration is a C++/CLI static
    1563             :                            constructor.  If this is TRUE, is_constructor must
    1564             :                            be FALSE. */
    1565             :   a_bit_field   multiple_overrides_diagnostic_issued:1;
    1566             :                         /* TRUE if the ec_multiple_overrides error has been
    1567             :                            issued (used to avoid multiple diagnostics that
    1568             :                            look identical). */
    1569             :   a_bit_field   is_named_override:1;
    1570             :                         /* TRUE if a virtual override currently being
    1571             :                            considered uses the C++/CLI "named override"
    1572             :                            mechanism.  Note that even when named override
    1573             :                            specifiers appeared (see named_overrides below),
    1574             :                            this may be FALSE because name override
    1575             :                            specifiers do not by themselves inhibit ordinary
    1576             :                            overriding in ref classes. */
    1577             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    1578             :   a_bit_field   is_trivial_default_constructor:1;
    1579             :                         /* TRUE for an implicit declaration of a trivial
    1580             :                            default constructor. */
    1581             :   a_bit_field   is_destructor:1;
    1582             :                         /* TRUE if the current declaration is a destructor.
    1583             :                            In unusual cases this value may be different from
    1584             :                            (dso_flags & DSO_DESTRUCTOR). */
    1585             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    1586             :   a_bit_field   is_finalizer:1;
    1587             :                         /* TRUE if the current declaration is a finalizer.
    1588             :                            In unusual cases this value may be different from
    1589             :                            (dso_flags & DSO_FINALIZER). */
    1590             :   a_bit_field   is_idisposable_dispose:1;
    1591             :                         /* TRUE if the current declaration is the generated
    1592             :                            IDisposable::Dispose() that is part of the C++/CLI
    1593             :                            dispose pattern. */
    1594             :   a_bit_field   is_dispose_bool:1;
    1595             :                         /* TRUE if the current declaration is the generated
    1596             :                            Dispose(bool) that is part of the C++/CLI dispose
    1597             :                            pattern. */
    1598             :   a_bit_field   is_object_finalize:1;
    1599             :                         /* TRUE if the current declaration is the generated
    1600             :                            Object::Finalize override that is part of the
    1601             :                            C++/CLI dispose pattern. */
    1602             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    1603             :   a_bit_field   invalid_virtual_specifier:1;
    1604             :                         /* TRUE when (dso_flags & DSO_VIRTUAL) is TRUE but
    1605             :                            it is not a valid use of the specifier. */
    1606             :   a_bit_field   is_unnamed_field:1;
    1607             :                         /* TRUE if the declaration is an unnamed field. */
    1608             :   a_bit_field   is_anonymous_union:1;
    1609             :                         /* TRUE if the declaration is an anonymous union. */
    1610             :   a_bit_field   is_nonstd_anonymous_union:1;
    1611             :                         /* TRUE if is_anonymous_union is TRUE but it is not
    1612             :                            a standard C++ construct.  For historical reasons,
    1613             :                            this flag is also TRUE for C11 anonymous unions and
    1614             :                            anonymous structs. */
    1615             :   a_bit_field   return_type_def_err:1;
    1616             :                         /* TRUE if an error has issued on defining a class or
    1617             :                            enum in a member function return type (used to
    1618             :                            avoid issuing multiple errors when there is more
    1619             :                            than one declarator). */
    1620             :   a_bit_field   is_member_template:1;
    1621             :                         /* TRUE if the declaration is of a member template. */
    1622             :   a_bit_field   is_bit_field:1;
    1623             :                         /* TRUE for a nonstatic data member that is a bit
    1624             :                            field. */
    1625             :   a_bit_field   is_captured_this:1;
    1626             :                         /* TRUE for a field that captures a this pointer. */
    1627             :   a_bit_field   is_captured_pack_element:1;
    1628             :                         /* TRUE for a field that captures a pack element. */
    1629             :   a_bit_field   invalid_member_template:1;
    1630             :                         /* TRUE if the current declaration has been diagnosed
    1631             :                            as an invalid member template declaration. */
    1632             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
    1633             :   a_source_position
    1634             :                 bit_field_size_pos;
    1635             :                         /* Size of the start of the ":" of the bit field
    1636             :                            size. */
    1637             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
    1638             :   a_constant_ptr
    1639             :                 bit_field_size;
    1640             :                         /* Constant that represents the bit field size.  NULL
    1641             :                            unless is_bit_field is TRUE. */
    1642             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    1643             :   a_symbol_list_entry_ptr
    1644             :                 named_overrides;
    1645             :                         /* A list of symbols representing named override
    1646             :                            specifiers in C++/CLI mode. */
    1647             :   a_pending_pragma_ptr
    1648             :                 suspended_pragmas;
    1649             :                         /* A list of current construct pragmas that were
    1650             :                            temporarily "suspended" because this declaration's
    1651             :                            processing may have to be delayed until after other
    1652             :                            pragmas appear.  (Used in for C++/CLI properties
    1653             :                            and events.) */
    1654             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    1655             : } a_member_decl_info;
    1656             : 
    1657             : 
    1658             : static void initialize_member_decl_info(a_member_decl_info_ptr mdip,
    1659             :                                         a_source_position      *pos)
    1660             : /*
    1661             : Initialize a member-declaration-info block, used to track information about
    1662             : a class member declaration as it appears.
    1663             : */
    1664             : {
    1665             :   init_decl_parse_state(&mdip->decl_state);
    1666             :   mdip->decl_state.auto_type_allowed = auto_type_specifier_enabled;
    1667             :   mdip->decl_state.trailing_return_type_allowed =
    1668             :                                                 trailing_return_types_enabled;
    1669             :   mdip->decl_state.in_class_scope = TRUE;
    1670             :   mdip->decl_state.start_pos = *pos;
    1671             :   clear_decl_pos_block(&mdip->decl_pos_block);
    1672             :   mdip->is_first_in_declarator_list = TRUE;
    1673             :   mdip->is_constructor = FALSE;
    1674             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    1675             :   mdip->is_static_constructor = FALSE;
    1676             :   mdip->multiple_overrides_diagnostic_issued = FALSE;
    1677             :   mdip->is_named_override = FALSE;
    1678             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    1679             :   mdip->is_trivial_default_constructor = FALSE;
    1680             :   mdip->is_destructor = FALSE;
    1681             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    1682             :   mdip->is_finalizer = FALSE;
    1683             :   mdip->is_idisposable_dispose = FALSE;
    1684             :   mdip->is_dispose_bool = FALSE;
    1685             :   mdip->is_object_finalize = FALSE;
    1686             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    1687             :   mdip->invalid_virtual_specifier = FALSE;
    1688             :   mdip->is_unnamed_field = FALSE;
    1689             :   mdip->is_anonymous_union = FALSE;
    1690             :   mdip->is_nonstd_anonymous_union = FALSE;
    1691             :   mdip->return_type_def_err = FALSE;
    1692             :   mdip->is_member_template = FALSE;
    1693             :   mdip->is_bit_field = FALSE;
    1694             :   mdip->is_captured_this = FALSE;
    1695             :   mdip->is_captured_pack_element = FALSE;
    1696             :   mdip->invalid_member_template = FALSE;
    1697             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
    1698             :   mdip->bit_field_size_pos = null_source_position;
    1699             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
    1700             :   mdip->bit_field_size = NULL;
    1701             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    1702             :   mdip->named_overrides = NULL;
    1703             :   mdip->suspended_pragmas = NULL;
    1704             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    1705             : }  /* initialize_member_decl_info */
    1706             : 
    1707             : 
    1708             : /* Forward declaration. */
    1709             : static a_field_ptr decl_nonstatic_data_member(
    1710             :                                      a_symbol_locator        *locator,
    1711             :                                      a_class_def_state_ptr   class_state,
    1712             :                                      a_member_decl_info_ptr  decl_info,
    1713             :                                      a_scope_depth           decl_scope_depth);
    1714             : 
    1715             : 
    1716             : static a_lambda_capture_ptr find_lambda_capture(a_lambda_ptr    lambda,
    1717             :                                                 a_variable_ptr  vp,
    1718             :                                                 a_field_ptr     fp)
    1719             : /*
    1720             : If the indicated lambda already has a capture entry for the indicated variable
    1721             : or field (i.e., init-capture), return a pointer it.  Otherwise, return NULL.
    1722             : */
    1723             : {
    1724             :   a_lambda_capture_ptr  lcp;
    1725             : 
    1726             :   if (vp != NULL) {
    1727             :     for (lcp = lambda->capture_list; lcp != NULL; lcp = lcp->next) {
    1728             :       if (!lcp->is_init_capture && lcp->captured.variable == vp) {
    1729             :         break;
    1730             :       }  /* if */
    1731             :     }  /* for */
    1732             :   } else if (fp != NULL) {
    1733             :     a_symbol_header_ptr  sym_hdr;
    1734             :     check_assertion(fp->is_init_capture);
    1735             :     /* Since fp is visible in the current context, we can just look for a
    1736             :        capture with an associated field of the same name as fp. */
    1737             :     sym_hdr = symbol_for(fp)->header;
    1738             :     for (lcp = lambda->capture_list; lcp != NULL; lcp = lcp->next) {
    1739             :       a_field_ptr   closure_field = lcp->closure_field;
    1740             :       a_symbol_ptr  field_sym;
    1741             :       if (closure_field->is_captured_this) {
    1742             :         continue;
    1743             :       }  /* if */
    1744             :       field_sym = symbol_for(closure_field);
    1745             :       if (field_sym == NULL) {
    1746             :         expect_error();
    1747             :       } else if (field_sym->header == sym_hdr) {
    1748             :         break;
    1749             :       }  /* if */
    1750             :     }  /* if */
    1751             :   } else {
    1752             :     /* A "this" capture in a context that has no "this" variable (e.g., a
    1753             :        field initializer). */
    1754             :     for (lcp = lambda->capture_list; lcp != NULL; lcp = lcp->next) {
    1755             :       if (lcp->is_param_ref_capture) {
    1756             :         break;
    1757             :       }  /* if */
    1758             :     }  /* if */
    1759             :   }  /* if */
    1760             :   return lcp;
    1761             : }  /* find_lambda_capture */
    1762             : 
    1763             : 
    1764             : static a_field_ptr make_field_for_lambda_capture(a_lambda_ptr          lambda,
    1765             :                                                  a_lambda_capture_ptr  lcp)
    1766             : /*
    1767             : Create the field of the closure class (associated with lambda) to store the
    1768             : capture described by lcp.  Return the field entry.
    1769             : */
    1770             : {
    1771             :   a_variable_ptr           vp;
    1772             :   a_boolean                by_reference = lcp->capture_by_reference;
    1773             :   a_source_position_ptr    pos = &lcp->position;
    1774             :   a_field_ptr              fp;
    1775             :   a_type_ptr               field_type;
    1776             :   a_type_ptr               orig_field_type;
    1777             :   a_boolean                is_this = FALSE, is_ref = FALSE;
    1778             :   a_class_def_state_ptr    class_state;
    1779             :   a_scope_stack_entry_ptr  ssep;
    1780             :   a_symbol_locator         locator;
    1781             :   a_member_decl_info       decl_info;
    1782             :   a_scope_depth            closure_scope_depth;
    1783             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
    1784             :   a_boolean                saved_source_sequence_entries_disallowed =
    1785             :                                            source_sequence_entries_disallowed;
    1786             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
    1787             : 
    1788             :   vp = lcp->is_init_capture ? (a_variable_ptr)NULL : lcp->captured.variable;
    1789             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
    1790             :   /* Don't issue source sequence entries for generated fields. */
    1791             :   source_sequence_entries_disallowed = TRUE;
    1792             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
    1793             :   /* Find the scope stack entry for the lambda closure class. */
    1794             :   for (ssep = scope_stack_entry_for(depth_scope_stack);
    1795             :        !(scope_is(ssep, sck_class_struct_union) &&
    1796             :          ssep->assoc_type == lambda->closure_class);
    1797             :        ssep = previous_scope_of(ssep)) {
    1798             :     check_assertion(ssep != NULL);
    1799             :   }  /* for */
    1800             :   class_state = ssep->class_def_state;
    1801             :   /* Set up the context that is needed so that decl_nonstatic_data_member
    1802             :      can be used to create the field. */
    1803             :   initialize_member_decl_info(&decl_info, pos);
    1804             :   closure_scope_depth = scope_depth_of(ssep);
    1805             :   clear_locator(&locator, pos);
    1806             :   if (lcp->is_init_capture) {
    1807             :     /* A C++14-style init-capture. */
    1808             :     make_locator_for_symbol(lcp->capture_info.init_capture_dps->sym, &locator);
    1809             :     field_type = lcp->capture_info.init_capture_dps->type;
    1810             :     /* Copy the decl_parse_state from the state created while scanning the
    1811             :        capture... */
    1812             :     decl_info.decl_state = *lcp->capture_info.init_capture_dps;
    1813             :     /* ... except the pointer from the init_state back to the associated
    1814             :        decl_parse_state. */
    1815             :     decl_info.decl_state.init_state.decl_parse_state = &decl_info.decl_state;
    1816             :   } else {
    1817             :     /* A simple capture. */
    1818             :     if (vp != NULL) {
    1819             :       /* The captured entity is a variable. */
    1820             :       decl_info.is_captured_pack_element = vp->is_pack_element;
    1821             :       if (vp->is_this_parameter) {
    1822             :         /* "this" variables do not have associated symbols. */
    1823             :         is_this = TRUE;
    1824             :         if (by_reference) {
    1825             :           /* Capture of "this". */
    1826             :           orig_field_type = field_type = vp->type;
    1827             :         } else {
    1828             :           /* Capture of "*this". */
    1829             :           orig_field_type = field_type = type_pointed_to(vp->type);
    1830             :         }  /* if */
    1831             :       } else {
    1832             :         a_symbol_ptr var_sym = symbol_for(vp);
    1833             :         if (var_sym != NULL) {
    1834             :           /* Create a symbol locator that can be used to declare the field. */
    1835             :           locator.symbol_header = var_sym->header;
    1836             :         } else {
    1837             :           /* This is a rare error situation that can occur when capturing an
    1838             :              element of a function parameter pack.  Use an error locator to
    1839             :              proceed. */
    1840             :           expect_error();
    1841             :           set_to_error_locator(locator);
    1842             :         }  /* if */
    1843             :         orig_field_type = field_type = vp->type;
    1844             :       }  /* if */
    1845             :     } else {
    1846             :       /* No variable to capture.  Either this is a direct or indirect capture
    1847             :          of an init-capture, or the capture of "this" in a context that has
    1848             :          no actual "this" variable (i.e., a field initializer). */
    1849             :       a_field_ptr  parent_field = lcp->capture_info.source_closure_field;
    1850             :       if (parent_field != NULL) {
    1851             :         /* A capture of an init-capture or param-ref capture. */
    1852             :         if (parent_field->is_captured_this) {
    1853             :           is_this = TRUE;
    1854             :         } else {
    1855             :           make_locator_for_symbol(symbol_for(parent_field), &locator);
    1856             :         }  /* if */
    1857             :         field_type = parent_field->type;
    1858             :       } else if (lcp->is_param_ref_capture) {
    1859             :         /* A capture of "this" or "*this" in a context with no "this"
    1860             :            variable. */
    1861             :         a_variable_ptr  this_var;
    1862             :         is_this = variable_this_exists(&this_var, &field_type);
    1863             :         check_assertion(is_this && this_var == NULL);
    1864             :         if (!by_reference) {
    1865             :           /* Capture of "*this". */
    1866             :           field_type = type_pointed_to(field_type);
    1867             :         }  /* if */
    1868             :       } else {
    1869             :         expect_error();
    1870             :         set_to_error_locator(locator);
    1871             :         field_type = error_type();
    1872             :       }  /* if */
    1873             :       orig_field_type = field_type;
    1874             :     }  /* if */
    1875             :     /* If the variable is a reference, drop the reference. */
    1876             :     if (is_any_reference_type(field_type)) {
    1877             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    1878             :       check_assertion(!skip_typerefs(field_type)->variant.pointer.is_handle);
    1879             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    1880             :       is_ref = TRUE;
    1881             :       field_type = type_pointed_to(field_type);
    1882             :     }  /* if */
    1883             :     if (is_this) {
    1884             :       /* The field type is the type of the "this" parameter (already set
    1885             :          above). */  
    1886             :     } else if (by_reference) {
    1887             :       /* The variable is being captured by reference.  Create a reference
    1888             :          type based on the variable's type. */
    1889             :       a_field_ptr  enclosing_field = lcp->capture_info.source_closure_field;
    1890             :       if (enclosing_field != NULL) {
    1891             :         /* If this is a nested lambda, the capture may be indirect through a
    1892             :            capture from the enclosing lambda, and the type should be determined
    1893             :            by the associated field of the enclosing lambda's capture. */
    1894             :         if (is_reference_type(enclosing_field->type)) {
    1895             :           /* The new field should just have the same type as the enclosing
    1896             :              field, but since we are adding a reference type layer below, just
    1897             :              skip the reference layer here to compensate. */
    1898             :           field_type = type_pointed_to(enclosing_field->type);
    1899             :         } else {
    1900             :           /* The variable is being indirectly captured through a value capture
    1901             :              from an enclosing lambda.  If the enclosing lambda is not mutable,
    1902             :              the reference should be to a const type. */
    1903             :           a_type_ptr     enclosing_closure = parent_class_of(enclosing_field);
    1904             :           a_routine_ptr  enclosing_body = lambda_body_for_closure(
    1905             :                                                             enclosing_closure);
    1906             :           check_assertion(enclosing_body != NULL);
    1907             :           if (enclosing_body->type->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_routine &&
    1908             :               enclosing_body->type->variant.routine.extra_info
    1909             :                                   ->qualifiers == TQ_CONST) {
    1910             :             field_type = make_qualified_type(field_type, TQ_CONST);
    1911             :           }  /* if */
    1912             :         }  /* if */
    1913             :       }  /* if */
    1914             :       field_type = make_reference_type(field_type);
    1915             :     } else if (is_ref && is_function_type(field_type)) {
    1916             :       /* A variable with reference-to-function type is captured with its
    1917             :          original type. */
    1918             :       field_type = orig_field_type;
    1919             :     } else {
    1920             :       /* The variable is being captured by value.  The type is the type
    1921             :          of the captured variable. */
    1922             :     }  /* if */
    1923             :   }  /* if */
    1924             :   decl_info.decl_state.type = field_type;
    1925             :   if (is_this) {
    1926             :     decl_info.is_captured_this = TRUE;
    1927             :     decl_info.is_unnamed_field = TRUE;
    1928             :   }  /* if */
    1929             :   /* The field must be private. */
    1930             :   class_state->access = (an_access_specifier)as_private;
    1931             :   fp = decl_nonstatic_data_member(&locator, class_state, &decl_info,
    1932             :                                   closure_scope_depth);
    1933             :   if (is_this) {
    1934             :     /* Create a symbol for the field (it has none so far because it is an
    1935             :        unnamed field).  The symbol is needed because fields not generated by
    1936             :        lowering are usually traversed through the symbol list. */
    1937             :     a_symbol_ptr  sym = make_unnamed_symbol((a_symbol_kind)sk_field, pos);
    1938             :     a_boolean     err = FALSE;
    1939             :     sym->variant.field.ptr = fp;
    1940             :     add_symbol_to_scope_list(sym, closure_scope_depth, &err);
    1941             :     check_assertion(!err);
    1942             :   } else if (lcp->is_init_capture) {
    1943             :     a_symbol_ptr            sym = decl_info.decl_state.sym;
    1944             :     /* Mark the declared field as being associated with an init-capture. */
    1945             :     if (symbol_is(sym, sk_field)) {
    1946             :       sym->variant.field.ptr->is_init_capture = TRUE;
    1947             :     } else {
    1948             :       expect_error();
    1949             :     }  /* if */
    1950             :     /* Process the initializer (which was prescanned when the init-capture was
    1951             :        scanned). */
    1952             :     init_capture_initializer(lcp, &decl_info.decl_state);
    1953             :   } else {
    1954             :     /* The field for an ordinary capture should be invisible to lookup.
    1955             :        (That's not the case for init-capture fields.) */
    1956             :     decl_info.decl_state.sym->is_invisible = TRUE;
    1957             :   }  /* if */
    1958             :   class_state->access = (an_access_specifier)as_public;
    1959             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
    1960             :   /* Restore the previous state wrt. generating source sequence entries. */
    1961             :   source_sequence_entries_disallowed =
    1962             :                                      saved_source_sequence_entries_disallowed;
    1963             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
    1964             :   return fp;
    1965             : }  /* make_field_for_lambda_capture */

    1967             : 
    1968           0 : static a_lambda_capture_ptr alloc_capture_for_lambda(a_lambda_ptr  lambda)
    1969             : /*
    1970             : Allocate and initialize a lambda capture entry and return a pointer to it.
    1971             : Also, append it to the captures list of the given lambda.
    1972             : */
    1973             : {
    1974           0 :   a_lambda_capture_ptr  lcp = alloc_lambda_capture();
    1975             : 
    1976           0 :   if (lambda->capture_list == NULL) {
    1977             :     /* This is the first entry. */
    1978           0 :     lambda->capture_list = lcp;
    1979             :   } else {
    1980             :     /* Find the last entry on the capture list so that we can add the new
    1981             :        entry to the end of the list. */

    1987           0 :   return lcp;

    1990             : 
    1991           0 : static a_lambda_capture_ptr r_add_lambda_capture(
    1992             :                                        a_lambda_ptr           lambda,
    1993             :                                        a_variable_ptr         vp,
    1994             :                                        a_field_ptr            fp,
    1995             :                                        a_scope_depth          depth,
    1996             :                                        a_boolean              is_implicit,
    1997             :                                        a_boolean              by_reference,
    1998             :                                        a_source_position_ptr  pos,
    1999             :                                        a_boolean              *no_impl_capture)
    2000             : /*
    2001             : Helper routine for add_lambda_capture to handle the recursion.  Parameters
    2002             : are the same, plus depth is the scope stack depth at which the capture is
    2003             : being done.
    2004             : */
    2005             : {
    2006           0 :   a_lambda_capture_ptr   lcp;
    2007           0 :   a_memory_region_number region_to_switch_back_to = curr_il_region_number;
    2008           0 :   a_field_ptr            source_field = NULL;
    2009             : 
    2010           0 :   check_assertion(!((vp != NULL) && (fp != NULL)));
    2011             :   /* See if there is a lambda around the current one, which must capture the
    2012             :      variable or field so that we can capture it at this level. */
    2013           0 :   { a_lambda_ptr         enclosing_lambda;
    2014           0 :     a_scope_depth        enclosing_depth;
    2015           0 :     a_boolean            enclosing_is_implicit = TRUE;
    2016           0 :     a_boolean            enclosing_by_reference;
    2017           0 :     a_lambda_capture_ptr enclosing_lcp = NULL;
    2018           0 :     enclosing_depth = scope_depth_for_capture(vp, depth, &enclosing_lambda);
    2019           0 :     if (enclosing_lambda != NULL) {
    2020             :       /* There is an enclosing lambda, so generate a capture at that level
    2021             :          first. */
    2022           0 :       enclosing_lcp = find_lambda_capture(enclosing_lambda, vp, fp);
    2023           0 :       if (enclosing_lcp != NULL) {
    2024             :         /* There's already a capture for vp/fp at this level.  That also means
    2025             :            the capture is taken care of in all enclosing lambdas, so we can
    2026             :            stop the recursion. */
    2027           0 :       } else if (!enclosing_lambda->has_capture_default) {
    2028             :         /* No capture default, so implicit captures are not allowed.
    2029             :            The caller will issue an error. */
    2030           0 :         *no_impl_capture = TRUE;
    2031             :       } else {
    2032             :         /* The implicit capture is by value or by reference depending on the
    2033             :            default capture setting of the enclosing lambda. */
    2034           0 :         enclosing_by_reference = enclosing_lambda->default_is_by_reference;
    2035             :         /* Make a recursive call to add the capture at the next level up. */
    2036           0 :         enclosing_lcp = r_add_lambda_capture(enclosing_lambda, vp, fp,
    2037             :                                              enclosing_depth,
    2038             :                                              enclosing_is_implicit,
    2039             :                                              enclosing_by_reference,

    2041             :       }  /* if */
    2042           0 :       if (enclosing_lcp != NULL) {
    2043             :         /* The capture at this level copies from the closure field at the
    2044             :            next level up. */
    2045           0 :         source_field = enclosing_lcp->closure_field;
    2046           0 :         check_assertion(source_field != NULL);
    2047             :       }  /* if */
    2048           0 :     } else if (fp != NULL) {
    2049             :       /* We're capturing an init-capture.  If we didn't find the enclosing
    2050             :          lambda (e.g., because of an intermediate non-closure class scope),

    2053           0 :       pos_sy_error(ec_bad_init_capture_capture, pos, symbol_for(fp));

    2056             :   /* Switch to the memory region of the scope in which the capture will

    2063             :                                          scope_stack[depth].il_memory_region);
    2064           0 :   lcp = alloc_capture_for_lambda(lambda);
    2065             :   /* Note that lcp->captured.variable is set even when source_field is

    2067             :      be cleared soon after it's been used to generate the capture copy code. */
    2068           0 :   lcp->captured.variable = vp;
    2069           0 :   lcp->capture_info.source_closure_field = source_field;
    2070           0 :   if (vp == NULL && fp == NULL && !*no_impl_capture && source_field == NULL) {
    2071           0 :     lcp->is_param_ref_capture = TRUE;
    2072             :   }  /* if */
    2073           0 :   lcp->capture_by_reference = by_reference;
    2074           0 :   lcp->is_implicit = is_implicit;
    2075           0 :   lcp->position = *pos;
    2076           0 :   if (is_implicit) {
    2077             :     /* For implicit captures, create the capture field now.  For explicit
    2078             :        captures this was done when the capture was specified. */
    2079           0 :     if ((vp != NULL && vp->is_this_parameter) ||

    2083           0 :       lcp->capture_by_reference = TRUE;

    2086             :   }  /* if */

    2088           0 :   switch_back_to_original_region(region_to_switch_back_to);
    2089           0 :   return lcp;

    2092             : 
    2093           0 : static a_lambda_capture_ptr add_lambda_capture(
    2094             :                                        a_lambda_ptr           lambda,
    2095             :                                        a_variable_ptr         vp,
    2096             :                                        a_field_ptr            fp,
    2097             :                                        a_boolean              is_implicit,
    2098             :                                        a_boolean              by_reference,
    2099             :                                        a_source_position_ptr  pos,
    2100             :                                        a_boolean              *no_impl_capture)
    2101             : /*
    2102             : Create a lambda capture entry for the lambda specified by "lambda" for the
    2103             : variable vp (if a variable is being captured) or for the field fp (if an
    2104             : init-capture is being captured).  is_implicit is TRUE if this is an implicit
    2105             : capture.  by_reference indicates if this is a by-reference or by-value capture.
    2106             : Create the lambda capture entry and the associated field of the closure class.
    2107             : Add the lambda capture entry to the list of captures for "lambda" and return a
    2108             : pointer to the capture entry.  pos is the source position to be used for the
    2109             : capture.  If necessary, also record implicit capture entries on any lambdas
    2110             : between the current one and the scope where the variable appears.
    2111             : *no_impl_capture will be returned TRUE if an implicit capture like that can't
    2112             : be done because the intermediate lambda does not allow implicit captures.
    2113             : */
    2114             : {
    2115           0 :   a_lambda_capture_ptr lcp;
    2116           0 :   a_scope_depth        depth;
    2117             : 
    2118           0 :   *no_impl_capture = FALSE;
    2119             :   /* Find the scope stack entry for the level at which the (innermost) capture
    2120             :      will occur. */
    2121           0 :   if (is_implicit) {
    2122           0 :     a_lambda_ptr temp_lambda;
    2123           0 :     depth = scope_depth_for_capture(vp, NO_SCOPE_DEPTH, &temp_lambda);
    2124           0 :     check_assertion(temp_lambda != NULL && temp_lambda == lambda);
    2125             :   } else {
    2126             :     /* For explicit captures (i.e., in the capture list), we're already in the
    2127             :        scope of the capture. */
    2128           0 :     a_scope_stack_entry_ptr  ssep;
    2129           0 :     depth = depth_scope_stack;
    2130           0 :     ssep = &scope_stack[depth];
    2131           0 :     if (scope_is(ssep, sck_func_prototype) && ssep->decl_parse_state != NULL &&
    2132             :         ssep->decl_parse_state->is_lambda) {
    2133             :       /* If the lambda appears in the prototype scope of another lambda, start
    2134             :          the search from outside the class scope of that other lambda.
    2135             :          Currently, this can only occur in error situations. */
    2136           0 :       expect_error();
    2137           0 :       if (scope_is(ssep-1, sck_template_instantiation)) {
    2138             :         /* Generic lambdas have a template instantiation scope surrounding the
    2139             :            function scope of the call operator. */
    2140           0 :         depth -= 3;
    2141             :       } else {
    2142           0 :         depth -= 2;
    2143             :       }  /* if */
    2144             :     }  /* if */
    2145             :   }  /* if */
    2146           0 :   lcp = r_add_lambda_capture(lambda, vp, fp, depth, is_implicit, by_reference,
    2147             :                              pos, no_impl_capture);
    2148           0 :   return lcp;
    2149             : }  /* add_lambda_capture */

    2151             : 
    2152           0 : a_lambda_capture_ptr lambda_capture_for_variable(
    2153             :                                           a_variable_ptr         vp,
    2154             :                                           a_source_position_ptr  pos,
    2155             :                                           a_boolean              *rvalue_only)
    2156             : /*
    2157             : vp is a local variable that is being used in a lambda or it is NULL to indicate
    2158             : that "this" is being captured in a context with no "this" variable.  Find or
    2159             : create a corresponding lambda capture entry and return a pointer to that.  pos
    2160             : is the source position of the variable reference.  If there is no existing
    2161             : capture entry, an implicit capture will be created if the lambda allows it and
    2162             : if the variable is appropriate to be captured.  If no capture can be found or
    2163             : created, issue an error and return NULL if rvalue_only is NULL or if vp is not
    2164             : constant-valued (and set *rvalue_only to FALSE).  If rvalue_only is non-NULL
    2165             : and no capture can be found or created, return NULL and set *rvalue_only to
    2166             : TRUE.
    2167             : */
    2168             : {
    2169           0 :   a_lambda_ptr          lambda = get_current_lambda();

    2173           0 :   if (rvalue_only != NULL) *rvalue_only = FALSE;
    2174             :   /* Find any existing lambda capture for this variable. */
    2175           0 :   lcp = find_lambda_capture(lambda, vp, (a_field_ptr)NULL);
    2176           0 :   if (lcp == NULL) {
    2177             :     /* No existing capture.  See if one can be created. */
    2178           0 :     an_error_code err_code = ec_no_error;

    2180           0 :     if (vp != NULL &&
    2181           0 :         !check_var_for_lambda_capture(vp, /*implicit=*/TRUE, &err_code)) {
    2182             :       /* The variable is not valid.  err_code explains why. */
    2183           0 :     } else if (!lambda->has_capture_default) {
    2184             :       /* No capture default, so implicit captures are not allowed.  However,
    2185             :          if the variable is constant-valued, the use of the constant value
    2186             :          does not require capture. */
