    2188           0 :         *rvalue_only = TRUE;
    2189             :       } else {
    2190           0 :         err_code = (vp != NULL && vp->is_this_parameter) ?
    2191           0 :                         ec_not_captured_this_in_lambda :
    2192             :                         ec_not_captured_local_var_in_lambda;
    2193             :       }  /* if */
    2194             :     } else {
    2195             :       /* The variable (or reference to "this") is valid.  Add a new capture
    2196             :          entry for it. */
    2197           0 :       a_boolean no_impl_capture;
    2198           0 :       lcp = add_lambda_capture(lambda, vp, (a_field_ptr)NULL,
    2199             :                                /*is_implicit=*/TRUE, by_ref, pos,
    2200             :                                &no_impl_capture);

    2209             :     }  /* if */
    2210             :   }  /* if */
    2211           0 :   return lcp;
    2212             : }  /* lambda_capture_for_variable */

    2215           0 : a_lambda_capture_ptr lambda_capture_for_init_capture(
    2216             :                                                 a_field_ptr            fp,
    2217             :                                                 a_source_position_ptr  pos)
    2218             : /*
    2219             : fp is a field created by an init-capture for an enclosing lambda and used (at

    2221             : entry capturing the associated value for the innermost lambda (this could be
    2222             : the capture entry for the init-capture itself, or a capture entry that directly
    2223             : or indirectly captures the associated field).  Capture entries are created as
    2224             : needed in intermediate lambdas.  If there is no matching capture entry and none
    2225             : can be created, return NULL and issue an error at the given position.

    2227             : {

    2242           0 :       an_error_code err_code = ec_no_error;

    2249             :            of a capture entry. */

    2265             : 
    2266             : 
    2267           0 : static a_type_ptr make_closure_class(a_scope_depth      decl_level,
    2268             :                                      a_source_position  *decl_position,
    2269             :                                      a_boolean          bad_scope)
    2270             : /*
    2271             : Create the class type that is used to represent a lambda closure.  Return
    2272             : a pointer to the class type.  decl_level determines which scope the class
    2273             : belongs to.  decl_position is the declaration position to be used for the
    2274             : lambda.  bad_scope is TRUE if the lambda appeared in an invalid scope.
    2275             : 
    2276             : The class is created as an incomplete type.  It will be completed when its
    2277             : various members have been added (call operator, constructors, destructor, and
    2278             : the fields implied by the lambda's capture list).
    2279             : */
    2280             : {
    2281           0 :   a_type_ptr                     type;
    2282           0 :   a_symbol_ptr                   sym;
    2283           0 :   a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr  cssp;
    2284           0 :   a_class_type_supplement_ptr    ctsp;
    2285           0 :   a_boolean                      is_prototype_instantiation = FALSE;
    2286             : 
    2287             :   /* Create an unnamed symbol for the lambda class. */
    2288           0 :   sym = make_unnamed_tag_symbol((a_symbol_kind)sk_class_or_struct_tag,

    2384             : static
    2385        7496 : a_boolean prescan_function_definition(a_token_sequence_number *first_tsn,

    2393             : constructor initializer is present, a colon.  Return the token cache

    2465             : 
    2466       23306 : void def_arg_and_eh_spec_fixup_for_class(a_type_ptr  class_type,
    2467             :                                          a_boolean   is_template_based,
    2468             :                                          a_boolean   template_second_pass)
    2469             : /*
    2470             : Process the default argument expressions for the indicated class, as well as
    2471             : the operands of exception specifications that were delayed.
    2472             : 
    2473             : is_template_based is TRUE if the class is the result of a template
    2474             : instantiation.  When nonclass prototype instantiations are performed this
    2475             : routine is called twice for each class.   The second pass (when
    2476             : template_second_pass is TRUE) does prototype instantiations of default
    2477             : arguments for member function templates of both normal and template classes,
    2478             : and for member functions of template classes.
    2479             : */
    2480             : {
    2481       23306 :   a_routine_fixup_ptr               rfp;
    2482       23306 :   a_def_arg_expr_fixup_ptr          daefp;
    2483       23306 :   a_type_ptr                        curr_scope_class_type = NULL;
    2484       23306 :   a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr     cssp;
    2485       23306 :   a_symbol_ptr                      sym;
    2486       23306 :   a_template_symbol_supplement_ptr  tssp;
    2487       23306 :   a_boolean                         is_real_template_instantiation = FALSE;
    2488       23306 :   a_boolean                         is_nonreal_template_instantiation = FALSE;
    2489       23306 :   a_boolean                         is_friend;
    2490             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
    2491             : #if TEMPLATE_INSTANTIATIONS_IN_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
    2492       23306 :   a_scope_depth                     scope_depth = NO_SCOPE_DEPTH;

    2494             : #endif /* TEMPLATE_INSTANTIATIONS_IN_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */

    2496             : 
    2497       23306 :   db_enter(3, "def_arg_and_eh_spec_fixup_for_class");
    2498             :   /* Go through all the routine fixup entries created for the class twice,
    2499             :      once for the default arguments, then for the function bodies.  This
    2500             :      is desirable to control dependencies, e.g.:
    2501             :        class A {
    2502             :          void f1() { f2(); }
    2503             :          static void f2(int i=1) {}
    2504             :        };
    2505             :      Here we want to know about the default arguments for f2 before
    2506             :      processing the call to it in the body of f1.  In between default arg
    2507             :      processing and inline function body processing, recursive calls are
    2508             :      made to handle nested classes.  This assures that all default arguments
    2509             :      are processed, even those belonging to member functions of nested
    2510             :      classes, before any inline member function bodies are scanned. */
    2511             :   /* This does not, however, fix dependency problems in a case like this:
    2512             :        class A {
    2513             :          int f1(int i=f2()) { return i; }
    2514             :          static int f2(int i=1) { return i; }
    2515             :        };
    2516             :      where the default argument for f2 must be dealt with before that of
    2517             :      f1.  Currently, if the declaration for f1 precedes that of f2, we
    2518             :      issue an error ("too few arguments in function call"), but vice versa
    2519             :      is okay.  Is this order dependence appropriate?  Or should the
    2520             :      language impose some restrictions on what can appear in a default
    2521             :      argument expression?
    2522             :   */
    2523             :   /* First go though the routine fixup entries and scan the default
    2524             :      argument expressions. */

    2556             :        scope; it must appear before the default argument that references it;

    2880           0 : static void deferred_friend_function_fixup(a_routine_fixup_ptr  rfp)
    2881             : /*
    2882             : Does the fixup on the friend function that is otherwise done when the
    2883             : enclosing class is instantiated.  Normally, the fixup of such routines
    2884             : is deferred until the first use of the routine.  But in some modes the
    2885             : fixup is further postponed until the end of the translation unit.  This
    2886             : routine is called by add_to_deferred_friend_function_fixup_list in the
    2887             : former case and by process_deferred_friend_fixup list in the latter.

    2991           0 : void add_to_deferred_friend_function_fixup_list(a_routine_fixup_ptr     rfp)
    2992             : /*
    2993             : When deferring the fixup of friend functions, this routine is called when
    2994             : a friend function defined in a class template is first used.  This either
    2995             : does the fixup of the routine or adds it to a list of fixups to be done at
    2996             : the end of the translation unit.  This routine is also used for Microsoft
    2997             : in-class member function template specializations.

    3003             :      process from being attempted again. */
    3004           0 :   rp->routine_fixup = NULL;
    3005             :   /* use_deferred_friend_fixup_list is TRUE in some modes when the deferred
    3006             :      fixup of friend functions should be postponed until the end of the
    3007             :      translation unit.  In such modes, the flag is cleared once the fixups
    3008             :      have completed so that any additional fixups that are needed will be done
    3009             :      when this routine is called.  (The flag is ignored for constexpr functions
    3010             :      and for functions with a deducible return type since their definitions
    3011             :      must be processed before evaluating a call.) */
    3012           0 :   if (use_deferred_friend_fixup_list &&
    3013           0 :       !rp->is_constexpr && !rp->has_deducible_return_type) {
    3014           0 :     if (deferred_friend_fixup_list == NULL) deferred_friend_fixup_list = rfp;

    3016           0 :       deferred_friend_fixup_list_tail->next = rfp;
    3017             :     }  /* if */
    3018           0 :     deferred_friend_fixup_list_tail = rfp;
    3019             :   } else {
    3020           0 :     deferred_friend_function_fixup(rfp);
    3021             :   }  /* if */
    3022           0 : }  /* add_to_deferred_friend_function_fixup_list */
    3023             : 
    3024             : 
    3025          66 : void process_deferred_friend_fixup_list(void)

    3038             :        additional instantiations. */

    3042             :      needed. */

    3045             :      again. */

    3051       11653 : static void inline_function_fixup_for_class(a_type_ptr  class_type,
    3052             :                                             a_boolean   is_template_based)

    3055             : class contains nested classes, call this routine recursively for each

    3489             : 
    3490             : 
    3491             : static a_symbol_ptr get_generated_default_ctor(
    3492             :                                           a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr  cssp)
    3493             : /*

    3495             : defaulted) default constructor associated with cssp, or NULL if there is none.
    3496             : */
    3497             : {
    3498             :   a_symbol_ptr  ctor = cssp->constructor;
    3499             : 
    3500             :   if (ctor != NULL) {
    3501             :     a_boolean  is_list = symbol_is(ctor, sk_overloaded_function);
    3502             :     if (is_list) ctor = ctor->variant.overloaded_function.symbols;
    3503             :     /* Search the constructors for one that is generated/defaulted and is a
    3504             :        simple default constructor (i.e., has no explicit parameter). */

    3520             : 
    3521           0 : void update_class_for_last_parsed_field_initializer(a_type_ptr  class_type)

    3549       11653 : static void inclass_initializer_fixup_for_class(a_type_ptr  class_type,
    3550             :                                                 a_boolean   is_template_based)
    3551             : /*
    3552             : Process the in-class initializers for the indicated class and its nested
    3553             : classes.  If the indicated class is a nested class defined in its parent,
    3554             : start the process in the lexically outermost class.  is_template_based is TRUE
    3555             : for template instantiations (including prototype instantiations).  The class
    3556             : type must be complete.
    3557             : */
    3558             : {
    3559       11653 :   a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr  cssp;
    3560       11653 :   an_initializer_fixup_ptr       fixup_list, ifp, next_ifp;
    3561             : 
    3562       11653 :   if (class_type->incomplete
    3563             :       if_microsoft_extensions(&& !is_partial_class(class_type))) {
    3564             :     /* We can end up here with unusual error cases involving template
    3565             :        declarations (deferred class fixups are processed at the end of a
    3566             :        template declaration). */
    3567           0 :     expect_error();

    3569             :   }  /* if */
    3570       11653 :   while (class_type_supp(class_type)->defined_in_parent_class) {
    3571             :     /* For nested classes defined inside their parent class, the fixups are
    3572             :        actually recorded in the outermost enclosing class. */
    3573           0 :     class_type = parent_class_of(class_type);

    3575       11653 :   cssp = class_symbol_supp(symbol_for(class_type));
    3576       11653 :   fixup_list = cssp->initializer_fixup_list;
    3577       11653 :   if (fixup_list != NULL) {
    3578             :     /* Clear the list early to avoid recursion. */

    3586       11653 :   for (ifp = fixup_list; ifp != NULL; ifp = next_ifp) {

    3662             : 
    3663        3480 : void ensure_inclass_static_member_constant_initializer_is_scanned(
    3664             :                                                           a_variable_ptr  var)
    3665             : /*
    3666             : The given variable entry is for a static member of a managed class type or of
    3667             : a GNU C++ class template instantiation (non-prototype).  The declaration of
    3668             : that member may have an in-class initializer, but if so scanning of that
    3669             : initializer was delayed.  Do this scanning now, so that the static data member
    3670             : can be used as a constant-expression.
    3671             : 
    3672             : For the managed class case, this is similar to
    3673             : inclass_initializer_fixup_for_class, except only a specific fixup entry is
    3674             : processed, and the initializer is scanned with the constraints of a
    3675             : constant-expression.
    3676             : */
    3677             : {
    3678        3480 :   a_symbol_ptr   var_sym = symbol_for(var);
    3679        3480 :   a_type_ptr     class_type = sym_parent_class(var_sym);
    3680        3480 :   a_token_cache  *token_cache = NULL;
    3681             : 
    3682        3480 :   check_assertion(symbol_is(var_sym, sk_static_data_member));
    3683        3480 :   if (gpp_mode && gnu_version >= 40100 && !clang_mode &&
    3684             :       var->is_template_variable) {
    3685             :     /* For GNU static data members, we record a cache in the static data
    3686             :        member supplement. */
    3687        3480 :     a_static_data_member_supplement_ptr
    3688        3480 :                sdmsp = sdm_supp(var_sym);
    3689        3480 :     if (sdmsp != NULL) {
    3690        3480 :       token_cache = sdmsp->token_cache;
    3691             :       /* Clear the cache pointer to avoid runaway recursion. */
    3692        3480 :       sdmsp->token_cache = NULL;
    3693        3480 :       if (var->is_specialized) {
    3694             :         /* If the static data member was explicitly specialized, its
    3695             :            initializer can no longer be instantiated. */
    3696             :         token_cache = NULL;
    3697             :       }  /* if */
    3698             :     }  /* if */
    3699             :   } else if (cli_or_cx_enabled) {
    3700             :     if (!class_type->incomplete ||
    3701             :         (scope_is(&scope_stack_top(), sck_class_struct_union) &&
    3702             :          same_entities(scope_stack_top().assoc_type, class_type))) {
    3703             :       /* For managed classes, the token cache is recorded in a fixup entry. */
    3704             :       a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr  cssp;
    3705             :       an_initializer_fixup_ptr       *p_ifp, ifp;
    3706             :       cssp = symbol_supplement_for_class(class_type);

    3708             :         p_ifp = &cssp->initializer_fixup_list;

    3721             :         }  /* for */
    3722             :       }  /* if */
    3723             :     }  /* if */
    3724             :   }  /* if */
    3725        3480 :   if (token_cache != NULL) {
    3726         217 :     a_decl_parse_state           dps;

    3733             :           class_type, /*is_template_based=*/gpp_mode,

    3821             : 
    3822             : static void check_trans_unit_for_class(a_type_ptr  class_type,
    3823             :                                        a_boolean   *trans_unit_pushed)
    3824             : /*
    3825             : This routine is called when going through the class fixup lists to
    3826             : ensure that the correct translation unit is on the top of the stack.
    3827             : "trans_unit_pushed" is TRUE if a prior call of this routine pushed a
    3828             : new translation unit.  It is set to TRUE if this call pushes a new
    3829             : translation unit.
    3830             : */
    3831             : {
    3832             :   a_symbol_ptr            sym = symbol_for(class_type);
    3833             :   a_translation_unit_ptr  tup_needed = trans_unit_for_symbol(sym);
    3834             : 
    3835             :   if (tup_needed != curr_translation_unit) {
    3836             :     /* The current translation unit is not the right one.  If we previously
    3837             :        pushed a translation unit, pop it now. */
    3838             :     if (*trans_unit_pushed) {
    3839             :       pop_translation_unit_stack();
    3840             :       *trans_unit_pushed = FALSE;
    3841             :     }  /* if */
    3842             :     /* If the new top of stack is still not the right one, push a new entry
    3843             :        for the translation unit needed. */
    3844             :     if (tup_needed != curr_translation_unit) {
    3845             :       push_translation_unit_stack(tup_needed);
    3846             :       *trans_unit_pushed = TRUE;
    3847             :     }  /* if */
    3848             :   }  /* if */
    3849             : }  /* check_trans_unit_for_class */
    3850             : 
    3851             : 
    3852           0 : static void update_cached_defaulted_noexcept_arg(
    3853             :                                           an_exception_specification_ptr  esp,
    3854             :                                           a_routine_ptr                   rp)
    3855             : /*
    3856             : rp is a defaulted special member whose declared exception specification is
    3857             : described by esp.  If esp has a cached operand and we are in the surrounding
    3858             : class scope (i.e., we're not dealing with a late template instantiation),
    3859             : force the early scanning of that operand.
    3860             : */
    3861             : {
    3862           0 :   if (esp->arg_cached &&
    3863           0 :       scope_is(&scope_stack_top(), sck_class_struct_union)) {
    3864             :     /* Look for a routine fixup entry corresponding to this exception
    3865             :        specification and use it to set up the environment needed to scan
    3866             :        the cached operand. */

    3873           0 :       if (rfp->symbol == rsym) {
    3874           0 :         if (rfp->process_exception_spec) {

    3901             : 
    3902             : 
    3903             : static void form_exception_specification_for_generated_function(

    3907             : 
    3908         373 : void complete_defaulted_exc_spec(a_routine_ptr  rp)
    3909             : /*
    3910             : The given routine entry is a defaulted special member.  If needed, establish
    3911             : its exception specification.  If an exception specification was specified
    3912             : explicitly, verify that it matches that of a corresponding generated member
    3913             : and issue an error if it does not.
    3914             : */
    3915             : {
    3916         373 :   if (exceptions_enabled) {
    3917             :     /* If a special member is defaulted inside the parent class, it
    3918             :        implicitly gets the exception specification that the corresponding
    3919             :        implicitly generated member would have had.  If an explicit
    3920             :        exception specification is provided, it must be equivalent to the
    3921             :        implicitly generated one. */

    3923             :                                              ->variant.routine.extra_info;

    3925             :        the generated specification. */

    3930             :         /* We already generated this one. */
    3931           0 :         goto done;
    3932          30 :       } else if (declared_exception_spec->arg_cached) {
    3933           0 :         update_cached_defaulted_noexcept_arg(declared_exception_spec, rp);

    4080             : 
    4081       20530 : static void process_deferred_class_fixups(a_boolean     for_instantiation)
    4082             : /*
    4083             : Do the delayed scanning of default arguments and inline function bodies.
    4084             : Note that this routine can be called recursively if, during the fixup
    4085             : of a default argument or inline function, a local class is defined or
    4086             : a template class is instantiated.  When this routine is invoked recursively,
    4087             : only the default argument processing is done.  The inline function body
    4088             : processing is only done by the outermost call.  This is done to permit an
    4089             : inline function body of an instantiation or local class to make use of
    4090             : a default argument of a class being fixed up at an outer level, for which
    4091             : the fixups have not yet been done.
    4092             : 
    4093             : for_instantiation is TRUE if this routine is being called to do the fixup
    4094             : after a class instantiation.
    4095             : */

    4097       20530 :   a_class_fixup_header_ptr      cfhp;
    4098       20530 :   a_class_fixup_ptr             fixup_list, cfp, next_cfp;
    4099       20530 :   a_boolean                     trans_unit_pushed = FALSE;
    4100             : 
    4101       20530 :   db_enter(3, "process_deferred_class_fixups");
    4102             :   /* cfhp points into the scope_stack, so refresh the pointer for each
    4103             :      iteration. */

    4106             :     /* Clear the pointers to the start of the fixup lists so that classes
    4107             :        created by the fixup process can be fixed up by the next iteration

    4109             :        nested class, for example. */

    4194             : 
    4195       28561 : void process_deferred_class_fixups_and_instantiations(
    4196             :                                         a_boolean       for_instantiation)
    4197             : /*
    4198             : While one or more class definitions are pending, the fixup of member function
    4199             : bodies and default arguments is deferred until all class definitions have
    4200             : been complete.  Nonclass template definitions are also deferred.  When the
    4201             : count of pending class definitions and deferred inline function fixups are
    4202             : zero, all class definitions have been completed and any deferred class
    4203             : fixups and instantiations may now be done.
    4204             :

    4286             : 
    4287             : 
    4288          64 : static void report_virtual_function_ambiguities(a_type_ptr class_type)
    4289             : /* 
    4290             : Report errors in virtual function declarations that result from the failure
    4291             : to redeclare a virtual function originally declared in a virtual base class.
    4292             : 
    4293             : The situation we are looking for (discussed in ARM 10.10c) is of this sort:
    4294             :         class A { virtual int f(); };
    4295             :         class B : virtual A { int f(); };
    4296             :         class C : virtual A { int f(); };
    4297             :         class D : B, C { };
    4298             : or in graphical terms:
    4299             :            A          virtual function A::f() is declared
    4300             :           / \
    4301             :          B   C        B::f() overrides A::f()
    4302             :           \ /         C::f() overrides A::f()
    4303             :            D          No D::f() was declared.
    4304             : The problem is, what function should replace A::f() in the virtual function
    4305             : table for base class A of class D, B::f() or C::f()?  This ambiguity must be
    4306             : reported to the user.
    4307             : 
    4308             : The technique is as follows.  A list of overriding virtual functions is
    4309             : maintained for each base class.  For instance, for base class A in class D
    4310             : entries would have been created for both B::f() and C::f() when the base
    4311             : classes were declared; both would have indicated that A::f() was being
    4312             : overridden.  If D::f() were then defined, it would be added to the list
    4313             : and both B::f() and C::f() removed, but otherwise the two overriding
    4314             : functions would remain.  When this routine finds two or more overriding
    4315             : virtual function entries that override the same function, it reports the
    4316             : ambiguity.
    4317             : */
    4318             : {
    4319          64 :   a_base_class_ptr                    bcp;
    4320          64 :   an_overriding_virtual_function_ptr  ovfp;
    4321          64 :   a_routine_ptr                       vfp;
    4322          64 :   a_boolean                           is_nonreal_instantiation;
    4323             : 
    4324          64 :   db_enter(4, "report_virtual_function_ambiguities");
    4325          64 :   is_nonreal_instantiation =
    4326          64 :                        class_type->variant.class_struct_union.is_nonreal_class;
    4327             :   /* Make a pass over all the base classes (direct and indirect both) of
    4328             :      the class indicated by class_type. */
    4329         208 :   for (bcp = base_classes_of(class_type); bcp != NULL; bcp = bcp->next) {
    4330             :     /* See if there any overriding virtual functions.  If there are,

    4401           0 : static void find_final_overrider(a_base_class_ptr  *p_bcp,

    4433        1009 : static void insert_in_virtual_function_override_list(
    4434             :                                 a_base_class_ptr                   base_class,
    4435             :                                 an_overriding_virtual_function_ptr new_ovfp)

    4438             : the list pointed to from base_class.  The list should be maintained in the
    4439             : order of the virtual function numbers of the functions being overridden,
    4440             : which is the order of the routine entries in the routines list on the scope

    4484             : 
    4485             : static void copy_virtual_function_override_list(
    4486             :                                               a_base_class_ptr  old_bcp,
    4487             :                                               a_base_class_ptr  new_bcp,
    4488             :                                               a_base_class_ptr  new_direct_bcp)
    4489             : /*
    4490             : Copy the list of overriding virtual functions associated with old_bcp and add
    4491             : each of the copies to the list belonging to new_bcp.  The entries are
    4492             : being copied from a base class of new_direct_bcp->type to a base class of
    4493             : new_direct_bcp->derived_class.
    4494             : */
    4495             : {
    4496             :   an_overriding_virtual_function_ptr  ovfp_to_copy, new_ovfp;
    4497             :   an_overriding_virtual_function_ptr  ovfp_from_new_list;
    4498             :   a_base_class_ptr                    new_ovfp_base_class;
    4499             :   a_boolean                           check_new_list;
    4500             : 
    4501             :   db_enter(4, "copy_virtual_function_override_list");
    4502             :   if (old_bcp->overriding_virtual_functions == NULL) {
    4503             :     /* Nothing to copy. */
    4504             :   } else {
    4505             :     /* if new_bcp does not have a list of overriding virtual functions, no
    4506             :        cross checking is required before doing the copies. */
    4507             :     check_new_list = (new_bcp->overriding_virtual_functions != NULL);
    4508             :     /* Make a pass over the list from old_bcp.  For each entry on it, see if
    4509             :        a copy needs to be made.  If so, allocate an new entry and add it to
    4510             :        the appropriate place in the list. */
    4511             :     for (ovfp_to_copy = old_bcp->overriding_virtual_functions;
    4512             :          ovfp_to_copy != NULL;
    4513             :          ovfp_to_copy = ovfp_to_copy->next) {
    4514             :       /* The base class of the overriding function must be translated into
    4515             :          the new class. */
    4516             :       if (ovfp_to_copy->base_class == NULL) {
    4517             :         /* The overriding function was declared in new_direct_bcp->type
    4518             :            (rather than in a base class thereof). */
    4519             :         new_ovfp_base_class = new_direct_bcp;
    4520             :       } else {
    4521             :         /* Be sure to select the right base class (its type could appear
    4522             :            multiple times in the object hierarchy). */
    4523             :         new_ovfp_base_class = 
    4524             :                  corresp_base_class(ovfp_to_copy->base_class, new_direct_bcp);
    4525             :       }  /* if */
    4526             :       if (check_new_list) {
    4527             :         for (ovfp_from_new_list = new_bcp->overriding_virtual_functions;
    4528             :              ovfp_from_new_list != NULL;
    4529             :              ovfp_from_new_list = ovfp_from_new_list->next) {
    4530             :           if (ovfp_from_new_list->primary_function ==
    4531             :                                             ovfp_to_copy->primary_function) {
    4532             :             if (ovfp_from_new_list->overriding_function ==
    4533             :                                          ovfp_to_copy->overriding_function &&
    4534             :                 ovfp_from_new_list->base_class == ovfp_to_copy->base_class) {
    4535             :               /* This override is already recorded.  No copy is needed. */
    4536             :               goto next_entry_from_old_list;
    4537             :             } else if (is_on_any_derivation_of(new_ovfp_base_class,
    4538             :                                              ovfp_from_new_list->base_class)) {
    4539             :               /* The override that is already recorded dominates the new
    4540             :                  once, since the base class to which the new override belongs
    4541             :                  is on a derivation of the other one.  Don't enter the
    4542             :                  override from the dominated base class.  For example:
    4543             :                         A virtual A::f()
    4544             :                        / \
    4545             :                      AA   B B::f()    -- B is new_ovfp_base_class
    4546             :                        \ / \
    4547             :                         BB  C C::f()  -- C is ovfp_from_new_list->base_class
    4548             :                          \ /
    4549             :                           D
    4550             :                  In other words, we don't want to enter the override of
    4551             :                  A::f by B::f in D if the override of B::f by C::f is already
    4552             :                  on the list.  If that were done, a spurious ambiguity would
    4553             :                  be diagnosed.  In this case, C::f dominates B::f since C-in-D
    4554             :                  is on at least one derivation of B-in-D. */
    4555             :               goto next_entry_from_old_list;
    4556             :             } else if (is_on_any_derivation_of(ovfp_from_new_list->base_class,
    4557             :                                                new_ovfp_base_class)) {
    4558             :               an_overriding_virtual_function_ptr  ovfp, prev_ovfp;
    4559             : 
    4560             :               /* Similar to last case, but with the dominance relation
    4561             :                  reversed.  Change the entry on the list to reflect the new
    4562             :                  override. */
    4563             :               ovfp_from_new_list->overriding_function =
    4564             :                                            ovfp_to_copy->overriding_function;
    4565             :               ovfp_from_new_list->base_class = new_ovfp_base_class;
    4566             :               ovfp_from_new_list->return_adjustment_base_class =
    4567             :                                 ovfp_to_copy->return_adjustment_base_class;
    4568             :               /* If there are any other entries on the list that are
    4569             :                  similarly dominated by the new override, they should be
    4570             :                  removed from the list.  Otherwise spurious ambiguity errors
    4571             :                  would be issued. */
    4572             :               prev_ovfp = ovfp_from_new_list;
    4573             :               ovfp = ovfp_from_new_list->next;
    4574             :               while (ovfp != NULL &&
    4575             :                      ovfp->primary_function ==
    4576             :                                          ovfp_to_copy->primary_function) {
    4577             :                 if (is_on_any_derivation_of(ovfp->base_class,
    4578             :                                             new_ovfp_base_class)) {
    4579             :                   /* Same dominance relation.  Remove ovfp from the list. */
    4580             :                   prev_ovfp->next = ovfp->next;
    4581             :                 } else {
    4582             :                   prev_ovfp = ovfp;
    4583             :                 }  /* if */
    4584             :                 /* Advance to the next entry, and continue looping. */
    4585             :                 ovfp = ovfp->next;
    4586             :               }  /* while */
    4587             :               goto next_entry_from_old_list;
    4588             :             } else {
    4589             :               /* We've found another entry on the list that records an
    4590             :                  override of the very same primary function, but the
    4591             :                  overriding function is distinct.  Keep looping. */
    4592             :             }  /* if */
    4593             :           } else if (ovfp_from_new_list->primary_function->
    4594             :                                                    virtual_function_number >
    4595             :                      ovfp_to_copy->primary_function->virtual_function_number) {
    4596             :             /* Since the lists are ordered by virtual_function_number,
    4597             :                no further checking is required. */
    4598             :             break;
    4599             :           }  /* if */
    4600             :         }  /* for */
    4601             :       }  /* if */
    4602             :       /* Allocate a new entry and copy fields from the original. */
    4603             :       new_ovfp = alloc_overriding_virtual_function();
    4604             :       new_ovfp->primary_function = ovfp_to_copy->primary_function;
    4605             :       new_ovfp->overriding_function = ovfp_to_copy->overriding_function;
    4606             :       new_ovfp->base_class = new_ovfp_base_class;
    4607             :       new_ovfp->return_adjustment_base_class =
    4608             :                                 ovfp_to_copy->return_adjustment_base_class;
    4609             : #if DEBUG
    4610             :       if (debug_level >= 4) {
    4611             :         fputs("copy for base class ", f_debug);
    4612             :         db_type_name(new_bcp->type);
    4613             :         fputs(": ", f_debug);
    4614             :         db_virtual_function_override(ovfp_to_copy);
    4615             :       }  /* if */
    4616             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    4617             :       /* Add it to the new list. */
    4618             :       insert_in_virtual_function_override_list(new_bcp, new_ovfp);
    4619             : next_entry_from_old_list:;
    4620             :     }  /* for */
    4621             :   }  /* if */
    4622             :   db_exit();
    4623             : }  /* copy_virtual_function_override_list */
    4624             : 
    4625             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    4626             : 
    4627             : static a_boolean matching_cli_accessors(a_routine_ptr  overrider,
    4628             :                                         a_routine_ptr  candidate,
    4629             :                                         a_symbol_ptr   named_sym)
    4630             : /*
    4631             : Overrider is a function that might override virtual function "candidate".
    4632             : named_sym represents a potential "named override specifier" (NULL if none).
    4633             : If either function is a C++/CLI property or event accessor return FALSE if
    4634             : the properties or events do not match for overriding purposes.  Otherwise,
    4635             : return TRUE.
    4636             : */
    4637             : {
    4638             :   a_boolean                      mismatch = FALSE;
    4639             :   a_property_or_event_descr_ptr  pdp1 = NULL, pdp2 = NULL;
    4640             : 
    4641             :   if (rout_is_cli_accessor(overrider)) {
    4642             :     pdp1 = overrider->variant.property_or_event_descr;
    4643             :   }  /* if */
    4644             :   if (rout_is_cli_accessor(candidate)) {
    4645             :     pdp2 = candidate->variant.property_or_event_descr;
    4646             :   }  /* if */
    4647             :   if (pdp1 == NULL && pdp2 == NULL) {
    4648             :     /* No accessors involved.  Return TRUE. */
    4649             :   } else if (pdp2 == NULL) {
    4650             :     /* The candidate overridden function is not an accessor, but the
    4651             :        overrider is: Mismatch. */
    4652             :     mismatch = TRUE;
    4653             :   } else if (named_sym != NULL) {
    4654             :     if (symbol_is(named_sym, sk_member_function)) {
    4655             :       /* The overrider is a named overrider.  Check that the property/event
    4656             :          name of the candidate matches the name mentioned in the named
    4657             :          overrider. */
    4658             :       a_routine_ptr  named_rp = named_sym->variant.routine.ptr;
    4659             :       if (rout_is_cli_accessor(named_rp) && !pdp2->is_static) {
    4660             :         a_field_ptr  fp1, fp2 = pdp2->variant.field;
    4661             :         pdp1 = named_rp->variant.property_or_event_descr;
    4662             :         check_assertion(!pdp1->is_static);
    4663             :         fp1 = pdp1->variant.field;
    4664             :         if (strcmp(fp1->source_corresp.name, fp2->source_corresp.name) != 0) {
    4665             :           /* Properties with different names don't match. */
    4666             :           mismatch = TRUE;
    4667             :         }  /* if */
    4668             :       } else {
    4669             :         mismatch = TRUE;
    4670             :       }  /* if */
    4671             :     } else {
    4672             :       mismatch = TRUE;
    4673             :     }  /* if */
    4674             :   } else if (pdp1 == NULL) {
    4675             :     /* The candidate is an accessor, but the overrider is not (and it doesn't
    4676             :        name the overridden function): Mismatch. */
    4677             :     mismatch = TRUE;
    4678             :   } else if (pdp1->is_static || pdp2->is_static) {
    4679             :     /* If one property is static, it cannot participate in overriding. */
    4680             :     mismatch = TRUE;
    4681             :   } else {
    4682             :     a_field_ptr  fp1 = pdp1->variant.field, fp2 = pdp2->variant.field;
    4683             :     if (strcmp(fp1->source_corresp.name, fp2->source_corresp.name) != 0) {
    4684             :       /* Properties with different names don't match. */
    4685             :       mismatch = TRUE;
    4686             :     }  /* if */
    4687             :   }  /* if */
    4688             :   return !mismatch;
    4689             : }  /* matching_cli_accessors */
    4690             : 
    4691             : 
    4692             : static a_boolean is_quasi_direct_base_interface(a_base_class_ptr  bcp)
    4693             : /*
    4694             : Return TRUE if bcp is a base of C++/CLI interface type that is either a direct
    4695             : base or whose derivation paths include only interfaces (not including the
    4696             : derived class).
    4697             : */
    4698             : {
    4699             :   a_boolean  result = FALSE;
    4700             : 
    4701             :   if (cli_class_type_kind_is(bcp->type, cctk_interface)) {
    4702             :     result = TRUE;
    4703             :     if (!bcp->direct) {
    4704             :       a_base_class_derivation_ptr  derivation = bcp->derivation;
    4705             :       a_derivation_step_ptr        step;
    4706             :       for (; derivation != NULL; derivation = derivation->next) {
    4707             :         for (step = derivation->path; step != NULL; step = step->next) {
    4708             :           if (!cli_class_type_kind_is(step->base_class->type,
    4709             :                                       cctk_interface)) {
    4710             :             /* At least one derivation path includes a non-interface base
    4711             :                class. */
    4712             :             result = FALSE;
    4713             :             goto done;
    4714             :           }  /* if */
    4715             :         }  /* for */
    4716             :       }  /* for */
    4717             :     }  /* if */
    4718             :   }  /* if */
    4719             : done:
    4720             :   return result;

    4722             : 
    4723             : 
    4724             : static a_boolean check_if_interface_member_implemented_by_inheritance(
    4725             :                                                     a_routine_ptr      irp,
    4726             :                                                     a_base_class_ptr   ibcp,
    4727             :                                                     a_class_def_state  *cdsp)
    4728             : /*
    4729             : irp is an interface member function declared in the interface base described
    4730             : by ibcp.  This interface member is not implemented by a direct member of the
    4731             : class being defined (described by cdsp).  Check if irp is implemented by a
    4732             : member of a proper base class of the class being defined, and if so return
    4733             : TRUE and update the IL to record the associated "override".
    4734             : */
    4735             : {
    4736             :   a_boolean            match_found = FALSE;
    4737             :   a_type_ptr           class_type = cdsp->class_type;
    4738             :   a_base_class_ptr     bcp;
    4739             :   a_symbol_header_ptr  sym_header = symbol_for(irp)->header;
    4740             : 
    4741             :   /* Search the bases for a member with the same name and type as irp.  This
    4742             :      search is somewhat similar to that done in check_for_virtual_override. */
    4743             :   check_assertion(!special_kind_is(irp, sfk_destructor));
    4744             :   for (bcp = base_classes_of(class_type); bcp != NULL; bcp = bcp->next) {
    4745             :     a_symbol_ptr  sym, sym_next;
    4746             :     if (cli_class_type_kind_is(bcp->type, cctk_interface)) {
    4747             :       /* Members of interfaces cannot implement irp. */
    4748             :       continue;
    4749             :     }  /* if */
    4750             :     /* Inner loop:  go through all the symbols for this name from the base
    4751             :        class, looking for one which represents a member function (overloaded
    4752             :        or simple) from the base class under examination. */
    4753             :     sym = find_symbol_list_in_table(&symbol_supplement_for_class(bcp->type)
    4754             :                                                              ->pointers_block,
    4755             :                                     sym_header);
    4756             :     /*lint --e{445,850} sym modified in loop */
    4757             :     for (; sym != NULL; sym = sym_next) {
    4758             :       sym_next = sym->next_in_lookup_table;
    4759             :       if (sym->decl_scope == class_type_supp(bcp->type)->assoc_scope->number) {
    4760             :         a_boolean  overloaded;
    4761             :         /* sym represents a member of bcp's class. */
    4762             :         if (symbol_is(sym, sk_overloaded_function)) {
    4763             :           overloaded = TRUE;
    4764             :           sym = sym->variant.overloaded_function.symbols;
    4765             :         } else if (symbol_is(sym, sk_member_function)) {
    4766             :           overloaded = FALSE;
    4767             :         } else if (symbol_is(sym, sk_field) ||
    4768             :                    symbol_is(sym, sk_static_data_member)) {
    4769             :           /* It's not a symbol for a function, but it's in the same name
    4770             :              space, so we've looked far enough for this base class. */
    4771             :           goto next_base_class;
    4772             :         } else {
    4773             :           /* It's not a symbol for a function, but it's not in the same name
    4774             :              space (e.g., a struct name) so keep scanning. */
    4775             :           continue;
    4776             :         }  /* if */
    4777             :         /* Innermost loop is run only once for simple functions but more
    4778             :            for overloaded functions. */
    4779             :         for (; sym != NULL; sym = overloaded ? sym->next : NULL) {
    4780             :           /* An overload set could include other symbol kinds, but only
    4781             :              sk_member_functions are checked. */
    4782             :           if (symbol_is(sym, sk_member_function)) {
    4783             :             a_routine_ptr  rp = sym->variant.routine.ptr;
    4784             :             if (!rp->is_virtual) {
    4785             :               /* sym does not represent a virtual function, so (if this is an
    4786             :                  overload set) keep looking. */
    4787             :               continue;
    4788             :             } else if (rp->source_corresp.access ==
    4789             :                                             (an_access_specifier)as_private) {
    4790             :               /* Microsoft compilers appear to ignore private base members in
    4791             :                  this context. */
    4792             :               continue;
    4793             :             } else if (!f_types_are_compatible(
    4794             :                                    irp->type, rp->type,
    4795             :                                    TCF_IGNORE_THIS_CLASS_TYPE |
    4796             :                                    TCF_ERROR_TYPE_COMPATIBLE_WITH_ANYTHING) ||
    4797             :                        !this_param_types_correspond(
    4798             :                                                irp->type, rp->type,
    4799             :                                                /*check_as_conversion=*/FALSE,
    4800             :                                                /*check_as_operands=*/FALSE)) {
    4801             :               /* The types don't match. */
    4802             :               continue;
    4803             :             } else if (!matching_cli_accessors(irp, rp, (a_symbol_ptr)NULL)) {
    4804             :               /* One or both routines is a property accessor and the other one
    4805             :                  doesn't match (either because it is not an accessor, or
    4806             :                  because it is an accessor for a non-matching property). */
    4807             :               continue;
    4808             :             } else {
    4809             :               /* Match: Record the override. */
    4810             :               an_overriding_virtual_function_ptr  new_ovfp;
    4811             :               /* Replace the (bcp, rp) pair by the final overrider, if any. */
    4812             :               find_final_overrider(&bcp, &rp);
    4813             :               /* Allocate and insert an overriding-virtual-function entry. */
    4814             :               new_ovfp = alloc_overriding_virtual_function();

    4819             :               match_found = TRUE;
    4820             :               goto done;
    4821             :             }  /* if */
    4822             :           }  /* if */
    4823             :         }  /* for */
    4824             :       }  /* if */
    4825             :     }  /* for */
    4826             : next_base_class:;
    4827             :   }  /* for */
    4828             : done:
    4829             :   return match_found;
    4830             : }  /* check_if_interface_member_implemented_by_inheritance */
    4831             : 
    4832             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    4833             : 
    4834             : static void wrapup_overrides(a_class_def_state  *cdsp)
    4835             : /*
    4836             : If the current class is not already marked as "abstract", run through its base
    4837             : classes to determine whether it is "abstract by inheritance" (i.e., if it
    4838             : inherits any pure virtual functions which are not redeclared in the current
    4839             : class).  If it is, mark the class accordingly.  Also, if the class is a
    4840             : C++/CLI ref class or value class, determine if any interface members are
    4841             : implemented by a base class member, and issue a diagnostic if it fails to
    4842             : implement an interface member.
    4843             : */
    4844             : {
    4845             :   a_type_ptr                   class_type = cdsp->class_type;
    4846             :   a_base_class_ptr             bcp;
    4847             :   a_class_type_supplement_ptr  bctsp;
    4848             :   a_routine_ptr                rp;
    4849             :   a_boolean                    check_abstract, check_interfaces = FALSE;
    4850             : 
    4851             :   db_enter(4, "wrapup_overrides");
    4852             :   if (class_type->variant.class_struct_union.is_nonreal_class) {
    4853             :     /* If the class is nonreal and not marked abstract, it could only be
    4854             :        abstract because it doesn't override an inherited pure virtual.
    4855             :        However, if that pure virtual member function comes from a dependent
    4856             :        base we cannot make a good decision yet.  Similarly, interface
    4857             :        compliance cannot be checked reliably. */
    4858             :     check_abstract = FALSE;
    4859             :     check_interfaces = FALSE;
    4860             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    4861             :   } else if (class_type->variant.class_struct_union.is_generic_constraint) {
    4862             :     /* Generic constraint classes are somewhat like nonreal classes in this
    4863             :        context. */
    4864             :     check_abstract = FALSE;
    4865             :     check_interfaces = FALSE;
    4866             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    4867             :   } else {
    4868             :     /* If we already know that the given class type is abstract (e.g.,
    4869             :        because it contains a pure virtual member declaration), we need not
    4870             :        search for a non-overridden pure virtual member among the base
    4871             :        classes.  However, for ref and value classes, we must still check
    4872             :        for non-overridden interface members (which are also implicitly
    4873             :        pure). */
    4874             :     check_abstract = !class_type->variant.class_struct_union.abstract;
    4875             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    4876             :     check_interfaces = cli_or_cx_enabled &&
    4877             :                        (cli_class_type_kind_is(class_type, cctk_ref) ||
    4878             :                         cli_class_type_kind_is(class_type, cctk_value));
    4879             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    4880             :   }  /* if */
    4881             :   if (check_abstract || check_interfaces) {
    4882             :     /* Traverse the base classes to look for a pure virtual function that is
    4883             :        inherited without an intervening declaration that overrides it. */
    4884             :     for (bcp = base_classes_of(class_type); bcp != NULL; bcp = bcp->next) {
    4885             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    4886             :       if (!check_abstract &&
    4887             :           (!cli_class_type_kind_is(bcp->type, cctk_interface) ||
    4888             :            !is_quasi_direct_base_interface(bcp))) {
    4889             :         /* We are only checking direct C++/CLI interface bases.  (And only
    4890             :            interface bases that aren't bases of a ref class base.) */
    4891             :         goto next_base;
    4892             :       }  /* if */
    4893             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    4894             :       if (bcp->type->variant.class_struct_union.any_pure_virtual_functions) {
    4895             :         /* This base class *is* abstract, with at least one pure virtual
    4896             :            function.  For each of the base class's pure virtual functions,
    4897             :            inspect the appropriate virtual function function override list.
    4898             :            If the pure virtual function is not overridden (i.e., if no entry
    4899             :            on the override list points to it as the primary function) then
    4900             :            mark the current class as abstract. */
    4901             :         bctsp = bcp->type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info;
    4902             :         rp = bctsp->assoc_scope->routines;
    4903             :         for (; rp != NULL; rp = rp->next) {
    4904             :           if (rp->pure_virtual) {
    4905             :             /* Found a pure virtual function among the routines.  See if it is
    4906             :                overridden. */
    4907             :             a_routine_ptr     orp = rp;
    4908             :             a_base_class_ptr  obcp = bcp;
    4909             :             find_final_overrider(&obcp, &orp);
    4910             :             if (orp == rp) {
    4911             :               /* No overriding virtual function entry was found that refers to
    4912             :                  the pure virtual function routine entry.  The pure virtual
    4913             :                  function is therefore inherited, and so the derived class
    4914             :                  is also abstract.  For C++/CLI ref and value classes (i.e.,
    4915             :                  check_interfaces == TRUE), not overriding an interface member
    4916             :                  is not treated as making the class abstract: such a lack of
    4917             :                  overriding is diagnosed as an error and making the class
    4918             :                  abstract would likely trigger additional unhelpful
    4919             :                  diagnostics. */
    4920             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    4921             :               if (check_interfaces) {
    4922             :                 if (cli_class_type_kind_is(bcp->type, cctk_interface)) {
    4923             :                   if (is_quasi_direct_base_interface(bcp)) {
    4924             :                     /* A C++/CLI interface from which the derived class derives
    4925             :                        directly or whose derivation chain involves only other
    4926             :                        interfaces.  Such an interface must be completely
    4927             :                        implemented by the derived class.  We have already
    4928             :                        established that no direct member of the derived class
    4929             :                        implements the member rp of the interface.  Before
    4930             :                        issuing a diagnostic, check whether a base class member
    4931             :                        implements rp. */
    4932             :                     if (check_if_interface_member_implemented_by_inheritance(
    4933             :                                                              rp, bcp, cdsp)) {
    4934             :                       /* rp is implemented by a base class member. */
    4935             :                     } else {
    4936             :                       /* The base interface member rp is not implemented (i.e.,
    4937             :                          not overridden): Issue an error. */
    4938             :                       pos_sy_error(ec_interface_not_implemented,
    4939             :                                    &error_position, symbol_for(rp));
    4940             :                     }  /* if */
    4941             :                   }  /* if */
    4942             :                   continue;
    4943             :                 } else {
    4944             :                   /* We now know the class is abstract, but we don't yet know
    4945             :                      if it implements all its interfaces. */
    4946             :                   class_type->variant.class_struct_union.abstract = TRUE;
    4947             :                   check_abstract = FALSE;
    4948             :                   goto next_base;
    4949             :                 }  /* if */
    4950             :               }  /* if */
    4951             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    4952             :               class_type->variant.class_struct_union.abstract = TRUE;
    4953             :               goto done;
    4954             :             }  /* if */
    4955             :             /* An overriding virtual function was found, so the pure
    4956             :                virtual function is not inherited. */
    4957             :           }  /* if */
    4958             :           /* Get the next routine on the list. */
    4959             :         }  /* for */
    4960             :       }  /* if */
    4961             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    4962             : next_base:;
    4963             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    4964             :       /* Get the next base class. */
    4965             :     }  /* for */
    4966             :   }  /* if */
    4967             : done:;
    4968             :   db_exit();
    4969             : }  /* wrapup_overrides */
    4970             : 
    4971             : 
    4972           0 : static void report_pure_virtual_functions(a_type_ptr        class_type,
    4973             :                                           a_base_class_ptr  base_class,
    4974             :                                           a_diagnostic_ptr  dp,
    4975             :                                           an_error_code     error_code,
    4976             :                                           a_boolean         *found)
    4977             : /*
    4978             : Add to the list of non-overridden pure virtual functions put out with the
    4979             : diagnostic about abstract class objects.  class_type is the abstract
    4980             : most-derived-type.  base_class is on the base_classes list of class_type;
    4981             : it may be NULL.  dp is the diagnostic entry for the diagnostic that is
    4982             : being generated.  error_code indicates what message to put out.  *found is
    4983             : updated to TRUE if one or more non-overridden pure virtual functions is
    4984             : located.
    4985             : */
    4986             : {
    4987           0 :   a_type_ptr        tp;
    4988           0 :   a_base_class_ptr  bcp;
    4989           0 :   a_routine_ptr     rp;
    4990           0 :   a_boolean         overridden;
    4991             : 
    4992           0 :   tp = base_class == NULL ? class_type : base_class->type;
    4993           0 :   if (tp->variant.class_struct_union.any_pure_virtual_functions) {
    4994             :     /* tp is a class type with pure virtual functions.  List them only if
    4995             :        they are not overridden in a more derived class. */
    4996             :     /* Traverse the routines list. */
    4997           0 :     rp = tp->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info->assoc_scope->routines;
    4998           0 :     for (; rp != NULL; rp = rp->next) {
    4999           0 :       if (rp->pure_virtual) {
    5000             :         /* Found a virtual function declared pure.  But is it overridden? */
    5001           0 :         overridden = FALSE;

    5003             :           /* There is a more derived class in which there may be an overriding
    5004             :              function.  This check is required only when we're looking at

    5014           0 :           *found = TRUE;
    5015             :         }  /* if */
    5016             :       }  /* if */

    5044           0 : void abstract_class_diagnostic(an_error_severity  severity,
    5045             :                                an_error_code      error_code,
    5046             :                                a_type_ptr         class_type,
    5047             :                                a_source_position  *diag_pos)
    5048             : /*
    5049             : Issue a diagnostic (using the message specified by error_code and with the
    5050             : given severity) on an incorrect use of an object of abstract class type, as
    5051             : indicated by class_type.  *diag_pos is the source position at which the
    5052             : diagnostic should be issued.  Except for some Microsoft-specific cases, the
    5053             : diagnostic includes a list of pure virtual functions, to assist the user in
    5054             : correcting the class declarations that produced the problem.

    5056             : {
    5057           0 :   a_boolean        found = FALSE;

    5099             : static a_boolean is_overriding_function(a_type_ptr    class_type,
    5100             :                                         a_routine_ptr derived_class_routine,
    5101             :                                         a_routine_ptr base_class_routine)
    5102             : /*
    5103             : Return TRUE if, in the given class_type, derived_class_routine overrides
    5104             : base_class_routine.
    5105             : */
    5106             : {
    5107             :   a_boolean  result = FALSE;
    5108             : 
    5109             :   if (derived_class_routine->is_virtual &&
    5110             :       derived_class_routine->overrides_base_member) {

    5122             :   }  /* if */

    5125             : 
    5126             : 
    5127             : static a_boolean is_named_overriding_pair(a_routine_ptr  drp,
    5128             :                                           a_routine_ptr  brp)
    5129             : /*
    5130             : Return TRUE if brp is on the overridden_functions list of drp (indicating that
    5131             : the declaration for drp used a named override specifier to override brp).

    5143             :   }  /* for */
    5144             :   return result;

    5146             : 
    5147             : 
    5148             : a_routine_ptr find_finalize_routine(a_type_ptr class_type,
    5149             :                                     a_boolean  *p_is_object_finalize)
    5150             : /*
    5151             : Return the routine entry for the Finalize() member function of the given class
    5152             : type, or NULL if there is no such function.  If such a member function is found
    5153             : and it meets the requirements of the "CLI Dispose pattern", set
    5154             : *p_is_object_finalize to TRUE; otherwise, set it to FALSE.
    5155             : */
    5156             : {
    5157             :   a_routine_ptr    finalize_routine = NULL;
    5158             :   a_symbol_locator locator;
    5159             :   a_symbol_ptr     sym;
    5160             : 
    5161             :   check_assertion(!cppcx_enabled);
    5162             :   check_assertion(p_is_object_finalize != NULL); 
    5163             :   *p_is_object_finalize = FALSE;
    5164             :   clear_locator(&locator, &class_type->source_corresp.decl_position);
    5165             :   (void)find_symbol("Finalize", sizeof("Finalize")-1, &locator);
    5166             :   clear_specific_symbol(locator);
    5167             :   sym = class_qualified_id_lookup(&locator, class_type,
    5168             :                                   IDL_DIRECT_CLASS_MEMBERS_ONLY);
    5169             :   /* A valid Finalize routine is a member function with the following
    5170             :      signature: protected: virtual void Finalize(); */
    5171             :   if (sym != NULL && is_member_function_symbol(sym)) {
    5172             :     a_boolean  is_overloaded_function;
    5173             :     /* Lookup found a Finalize function (or an overload set of them). */
    5174             :     if (sym->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_overloaded_function) {
    5175             :       sym = sym->variant.overloaded_function.symbols;
    5176             :       is_overloaded_function = TRUE;
    5177             :     } else {
    5178             :       is_overloaded_function = FALSE;
    5179             :     }  /* if */
    5180             :     for (; sym != NULL; sym = is_overloaded_function ? sym->next : NULL) {
    5181             :       if (symbol_is(sym, sk_member_function)) {
    5182             :         a_routine_ptr  routine = sym->variant.routine.ptr;
    5183             :         if (function_type_params(routine->type) == NULL) {
    5184             :           finalize_routine = routine;
    5185             :           if (routine->is_virtual && !routine->pure_virtual &&
    5186             :               !routine->final &&
    5187             :               is_void_type(routine->type->variant.routine.return_type) &&
    5188             :               routine->source_corresp.access ==
    5189             :                                           (an_access_specifier)as_protected &&
    5190             :               (is_cli_system_object_type(class_type) ||
    5191             :                is_overriding_function(class_type, routine,
    5192             :                                       get_object_finalize_routine()))) {
    5193             :             *p_is_object_finalize = TRUE;
    5194             :           }  /* if */
    5195             :           break;
    5196             :         }  /* if */
    5197             :       }  /* if */
    5198             :     }  /* for */
    5199             :   }  /* if */
    5200             :   return finalize_routine;
    5201             : }  /* find_finalize_routine */
    5202             : 
    5203             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    5204             : 
    5205         817 : static void record_virtual_function_override(
    5206             :                                 a_member_decl_info_ptr  decl_info,
    5207             :                                 a_base_class_ptr        base_class,
    5208             :                                 a_routine_ptr           primary_func,
    5209             :                                 a_base_class_ptr        return_adjustment_bcp)
    5210             : /*
    5211             : Record the overriding of virtual function "primary_func", which was declared
    5212             : in a base class ("base_class") of the current class, by the function described
    5213             : by "decl_info", which was declared in the current class.  The override entry
    5214             : appears on a linked list pointed to from base_class.
    5215             : */
    5216             : {
    5217         817 :   a_decl_parse_state_ptr  dps = &decl_info->decl_state;
    5218         817 :   a_routine_ptr           overriding_func = dps->sym->variant.routine.ptr;
    5219         817 :   an_overriding_virtual_function_ptr
    5220             :                           ovfp;
    5221             : 
    5222         817 :   db_enter(4, "record_virtual_function_override");
    5223             :   /* If there is already an override entry, created when the primary routine
    5224             :      was overridden by a function in another base class (one on the path
    5225             :      between the current class and the class of which the primary function
    5226             :      is a member), we can simply reuse that entry. */
    5227         817 :   ovfp = base_class->overriding_virtual_functions;
    5228        1533 :   for (; ovfp != NULL; ovfp = ovfp->next) {
    5229         952 :     if (ovfp->primary_function == primary_func) {
    5230             :       /* Usually, this is an entry copied when base classes are added (by
    5231             :          copy_virtual_function_override_list) that can now be reused to
    5232             :          represent the new overrider in the most-derived class.  However, in
    5233             :          Microsoft mode, this may also occur because the base was selected
    5234             :          multiple times for selective overriding in the same derived class.
    5235             :          Check for the latter case first. */
    5236             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    5237             :       if (parent_scope_of(ovfp->overriding_function) ==
    5238             :                                            parent_scope_of(overriding_func) &&
    5239             :           (ovfp->overriding_function->overridden_functions != NULL ||
    5240             :            overriding_func->overridden_functions != NULL)) {
    5241             :         a_boolean  replace_override = FALSE;
    5242             :         check_assertion(microsoft_mode);
    5243             :         if (cli_or_cx_enabled && 
    5244             :             (cli_class_type_kind_is(base_class->type, cctk_interface) ||
    5245             :              (cli_class_type_kind_is(base_class->type, cctk_ref) &&
    5246             :               is_cli_system_object_type(base_class->type)))) {
    5247             :           /* When overriding C++/CLI interface members, named overriding
    5248             :              trumps ordinary (unnamed) overriding.  (As is often the case,
    5249             :              System::Object is considered an "interface class" in this
    5250             :              context, even though it is a ref class.) */
    5251             :           if (decl_info->is_named_override &&
    5252             :               !is_named_overriding_pair(ovfp->overriding_function,
    5253             :                                         primary_func)) {
    5254             :             /* The entry currently records an ordinary override and the new
    5255             :                declaration is a named override; replace the record by the
    5256             :                named override. */
    5257             :             replace_override = TRUE;
    5258             :           } else if (!decl_info->is_named_override &&
    5259             :                      is_named_overriding_pair(ovfp->overriding_function,
    5260             :                                               primary_func)) {
    5261             :             /* The entry already records a named override, and the current
    5262             :                declaration is an ordinary override: Ignore the overriding
    5263             :                implied by the current declaration for the given base class. */
    5264             :             goto done;
    5265             :           } else if (same_entities(overriding_func,
    5266             :                                    ovfp->overriding_function)) {
    5267             :             /* If the current override is equivalent to a previous one, nothing
    5268             :                needs to be done. */
    5269             :             goto done;
    5270             :           }  /* if */
    5271             :         }  /* if */
    5272             :         if (!replace_override) {
    5273             :           if (!decl_info->multiple_overrides_diagnostic_issued &&
    5274             :               !scope_stack_top().in_prototype_instantiation) {
    5275             :             /* During prototype instantiations, no diagnostic is issued since
    5276             :                the overridden base cannot always be identified reliably. */

    5278             :                           symbol_for(primary_func),
    5279             :                           symbol_for(ovfp->overriding_function));
