    5281             :           }  /* if */
    5282             :           ovfp = NULL;
    5283             :           break;
    5284             :         }  /* if */
    5285             :       }  /* if */
    5286             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    5287             : #if DEBUG
    5288         236 :       if (debug_level >= 4) {
    5289           0 :         fputs("existing entry: ", f_debug);
    5290           0 :         db_virtual_function_override(ovfp);
    5291             :       }  /* if */
    5292             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    5293         236 :       ovfp->overriding_function = overriding_func;
    5294         236 :       ovfp->base_class = NULL;
    5295         236 :       ovfp->return_adjustment_base_class = return_adjustment_bcp;
    5296             : #if DEBUG
    5297         236 :       if (debug_level >= 4) {
    5298           0 :         fputs("after modification: ", f_debug);
    5299           0 :         db_virtual_function_override(ovfp);
    5300             :       }  /* if */
    5301             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    5302             :       /* There can be more than one override entry from previous base classes
    5303             :          in a case like this:
    5304             :                         A
    5305             :                       /   \
    5306             :                      B     C
    5307             :                       \   /
    5308             :                         D
    5309             :          B and C are virtually derived from A, and all three declare a given
    5310             :          virtual function.  The declarations in B and C both override the
    5311             :          declaration in A; if there is no redeclaration in D, the overriding
    5312             :          declarations in B and C would be ambiguous (see ARM 10.10c), but if
    5313             :          there is a redeclaration in D, it overrides the declarations in B
    5314             :          and C and thereby eliminates the ambiguity.  Look for other
    5315             :          redeclarations (previously entered in the overriding list to mark
    5316             :          potential ambiguities) and remove them. */
    5317         268 :       while (ovfp->next != NULL &&
    5318         122 :              ovfp->next->primary_function == primary_func) {
    5319             : #if DEBUG
    5320          32 :         if (debug_level >= 4) {
    5321           0 :           fputs("removing: ", f_debug);
    5322           0 :           db_virtual_function_override(ovfp->next);
    5323             :         }  /* if */
    5324             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    5325          32 :         ovfp->next = ovfp->next->next;
    5326             :       }  /* while */
    5327             :       break;
    5328             :     }  /* if */
    5329             :   }  /* for */
    5330         817 :   if (ovfp == NULL) {
    5331             :     /* No previous virtual function override entry. */
    5332         581 :     ovfp = alloc_overriding_virtual_function();
    5333         581 :     ovfp->primary_function = primary_func;
    5334         581 :     ovfp->overriding_function = overriding_func;
    5335         581 :     ovfp->return_adjustment_base_class = return_adjustment_bcp;
    5336             : #if DEBUG
    5337         581 :     if (debug_level >= 4) {
    5338           0 :       fputs("newly created: ", f_debug);
    5339           0 :       db_virtual_function_override(ovfp);
    5340             :     }  /* if */
    5341             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    5342         581 :     insert_in_virtual_function_override_list(base_class, ovfp);
    5343             :   }  /* if */
    5344             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    5345             : done:
    5346             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    5347         817 :   db_exit();
    5348         817 : }  /* record_virtual_function_override */
    5349             : 
    5350             : 
    5351             : #if !ABI_CHANGES_FOR_COVARIANT_VIRTUAL_FUNC_RETURN || \
    5352             :     !MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    5353             : /*ARGSUSED*/ /* class_type is used only to support covariant return types. */
    5354             : #endif /* !ABI_CHANGES_FOR_COVARIANT_VIRTUAL_FUNC_RETURN || ... */
    5355             : static a_boolean return_types_are_override_compatible(
    5356             :                                  a_type_ptr        type_of_overriding_routine,
    5357             :                                  a_type_ptr        type_of_overridden_routine,
    5358             :                                  a_base_class_ptr  base_class,
    5359             :                                  a_base_class_ptr  *return_adjustment_bcp,
    5360             :                                  a_symbol_ptr      overridden_sym,
    5361             :                                  a_class_def_state *class_state,
    5362             :                                  a_source_position *diag_pos)
    5363             : /*
    5364             : Given the routine types of overriding and overridden virtual functions, return
    5365             : TRUE if the return types are identical or "covariant".  The overriding function
    5366             : is being declared in the class definition described by class_state.
    5367             : Covariance means both return types are references or pointers to class types
    5368             : that are related by derivation, where the class associated with the overridden
    5369             : function is a base class of the class associated with the overriding function.
    5370             : base_class is the base class containing the overridden_routine.
    5371             : When covariance is detected, return in *return_adjustment_bcp the base class
    5372             : entry for the class associated with the overridden function.  Compatibility
    5373             : problems are diagnosed at the given position for the given symbol describing
    5374             : the overridden symbol.
    5375             : */
    5376             : {
    5377             :   a_type_ptr             tp1, tp2;
    5378             :   a_boolean              compatible = FALSE;
    5379             : 
    5380             :   db_enter(4, "return_types_are_override_compatible");
    5381             :   tp1 = type_of_overriding_routine->variant.routine.return_type;
    5382             :   tp2 = type_of_overridden_routine->variant.routine.return_type;
    5383             :   *return_adjustment_bcp = NULL;
    5384             :   if (f_identical_types(tp1, tp2, ITF_CONTEXTUAL_GENERIC_PARAMETERS)) {
    5385             :     /* The types are identical. */
    5386             :     compatible = TRUE;
    5387             :   } else if (is_template_dependent_type(tp1) ||
    5388             :              is_template_dependent_type(tp2)) {
    5389             :     /* We must be within a prototype instantiation.  The types may be
    5390             :        compatible depending on the template argument in a real instantiation,
    5391             :        so issue no error now. */
    5392             :     compatible = TRUE;
    5393             :   } else if (is_error_type(tp1) || is_error_type(tp2)) {
    5394             :     /* Assume compatibility. */
    5395             :     compatible = TRUE;
    5396             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    5397             :   } else if (cli_class_type_kind_is(class_state->class_type, cctk_interface) ||
    5398             :              cli_class_type_kind_is(sym_parent_class(overridden_sym),
    5399             :                                     cctk_interface)) {
    5400             :     /* Don't consider covariant overrides for C++/CLI interface members. */
    5401             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    5402             :   } else {
    5403             :     /* They're not "simply" compatible.  Do the other checking. */
    5404             :     if ((types_are_references_of_the_same_kind(tp1, tp2) &&
    5405             :          is_rvalue_reference_type(tp1) == is_rvalue_reference_type(tp2)) ||
    5406             :         (types_are_both_pointers_or_both_handles(tp1, tp2) &&
    5407             :          type_qualifiers_match(tp1, tp2))
    5408             : #ifdef pointer_types_have_same_repr
    5409             :         && pointer_types_have_same_repr(tp1, tp2)
    5410             : #endif /* ifdef pointer_types_have_same_repr */
    5411             :                                                  ) {
    5412             :       /* Both types are references or both are pointers with identical type
    5413             :          qualifiers on top of the pointer type.  Now check the types pointed
    5414             :          to. */
    5415             :       a_boolean  pointers_to_classes;
    5416             :       tp1 = type_pointed_to(tp1);
    5417             :       tp2 = type_pointed_to(tp2);
    5418             :       pointers_to_classes = is_class_struct_union_type(tp1) &&
    5419             :                             is_class_struct_union_type(tp2);
    5420             :       if (pointers_to_classes || gpp_mode) {
    5421             :         /* In most modes, the types referenced/pointed to must both be
    5422             :            (related) classes.  GNU C++ accepts types that differ only in
    5423             :            qualification.  GNU C++ also accepts overriding a function with a
    5424             :            void* return type with a function that returns a different pointer
    5425             :            type. */

    5427             :         a_type_qualifier_set  tp2_quals = get_type_qualifiers(tp2);
    5428             :         if (!any_qualifier_in_set_missing(tp2_quals, tp1_quals)) {
    5429             :           /* The cv-qualification on the class of the overriding function's
    5430             :              return type (tp1) is equal to or less than the cv-qualification
    5431             :              on the class of the overridden function's return type (tp2). */
    5432             :           tp1 = skip_typerefs(tp1);
    5433             :           tp2 = skip_typerefs(tp2);
    5434             :           /* Next see if the class associated with the overridden function
    5435             :              is the same as or a base class of the class associated with the
    5436             :              overriding function.  (In GNU mode, they might also be nonclass
    5437             :              types.) */
    5438             :           if (f_identical_types(tp1, tp2, ITF_CONTEXTUAL_GENERIC_PARAMETERS) ||
    5439             :               is_void_type(tp2)) {

    5441             :                returns void* (ignoring cv-qualifiers). */
    5442             :             compatible = TRUE;

    5444             :               check_assertion(gpp_mode);

    5447             :                         diag_pos, overridden_sym,
    5448             :                         skip_typerefs(type_of_overridden_routine)
    5449             :                                                ->variant.routine.return_type);
    5450             :             }  /* if */
    5451             : #if ABI_CHANGES_FOR_COVARIANT_VIRTUAL_FUNC_RETURN
    5452             :           } else if (pointers_to_classes) {
    5453             :             a_base_class_ptr bcp;
    5454             :             complete_type_is_needed(tp1);
    5455             :             /* We don't need to test the completeness of the classes.  This
    5456             :                is done by find_base_class_of. */
    5457             :             bcp = find_base_class_of(tp1, tp2);
    5458             :             if (bcp != NULL) {
    5459             :               /* tp2 is a base class of tp1.  Be sure it's unambiguous and
    5460             :                  accessible in tp1. */
    5461             :               if (!bcp->ambiguous && is_accessible_base_class(bcp)) {
    5462             :                 compatible = TRUE;
    5463             :                 *return_adjustment_bcp = bcp;
    5464             :               }  /* if */
    5465             :             }  /* if */
    5466             : #endif /* ABI_CHANGES_FOR_COVARIANT_VIRTUAL_FUNC_RETURN */
    5467             :           }  /* if */
    5468             :         }  /* if */
    5469             :       }  /* if */
    5470             :     }  /* if */
    5471             :   }  /* if */
    5472             :   /* Issue an incompatibility diagnostic if needed. */
    5473             :   if (compatible) {
    5474             :     /* Nothing more to do. */
    5475             :   } else if ((gpp_mode || microsoft_mode) &&
    5476             :              is_prototype_instantiation_context()) {
    5477             :     /* GNU and Microsoft compilers appear not to check return type
    5478             :        compatibility during prototype instantiations. */
    5479             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    5480             :   } else if (cli_class_type_kind_is(class_state->class_type, cctk_interface)) {
    5481             :     /* A derived C++/CLI interface can validly contain a member whose type and
    5482             :        name match except for the return type: Do not issue a diagnostic. */
    5483             :   } else if (cli_class_type_kind_is(sym_parent_class(overridden_sym),
    5484             :                                     cctk_interface)) {
    5485             :     /* If the overridden member is from an interface, no error should be
    5486             :        issued until we are sure that the member won't be overridden in some
    5487             :        other way (via a named override).  Record a "quasi-override" entry to
    5488             :        revisit this case when the class is completed. */
    5489             :     a_quasi_override_descr_ptr  qodp;
    5490             :     qodp = append_quasi_override_descr(&class_state->quasi_overrides,
    5491             :                                        base_class, overridden_sym, diag_pos);
    5492             :     qodp->return_type_mismatch = TRUE;
    5493             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    5494             :   } else {
    5495             :     /* Error -- return type must be identical to or covariant with that of the
    5496             :        overridden function. */
    5497             :     an_error_code  error_code =
    5498             : #if ABI_CHANGES_FOR_COVARIANT_VIRTUAL_FUNC_RETURN
    5499             :                         ec_bad_return_type_on_virtual_function_override;
    5500             : #else /* !ABI_CHANGES_FOR_COVARIANT_VIRTUAL_FUNC_RETURN */
    5501             :                         ec_different_return_type_on_virtual_function_override;
    5502             : #endif /* ABI_CHANGES_FOR_COVARIANT_VIRTUAL_FUNC_RETURN */
    5503             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    5504             :     if (cli_or_cx_enabled &&
    5505             :         is_managed_class_type(sym_parent_class(overridden_sym))) {

    5507             :          managed class type, since covariant return types are not accepted in

    5509             :       error_code = ec_different_return_type_on_virtual_function_override;
    5510             :     }  /* if */
    5511             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */

    5516             :   db_exit();

    5520             : 
    5521        3262 : a_base_class_ptr find_disambiguator(a_base_class_ptr  bcp1,
    5522             :                                     a_base_class_ptr  bcp2)
    5523             : /*
    5524             : bcp1 is a base class and bcp2 is a base class of bcp1->type.  We need to
    5525             : find a base class of bcp1->derived_class that can serve as disambiguator for
    5526             : computing the base class of bcp1->derived_class to which bcp2 corresponds.
    5527             : Usually bcp1 itself can serve as disambiguator, but if bcp2 is ambiguous,
    5528             : more work needs to be done.
    5529             : */
    5530             : {
    5531        3262 :   a_base_class_ptr       disambiguator;

    5535        3262 :   if (bcp2->is_virtual) {
    5536             :     /* No disambiguator is required for virtual base classes. */
    5537             :     disambiguator = NULL;

    5540        3198 :     disambiguator = bcp1;

    5543             :          disambiguator to find the corresponding base class of class_type. */
    5544             :     } else {
    5545             :       /* Compute the disambiguator by traversing the derivation of bcp2. */

    5578             : 
    5579         817 : static a_boolean shares_virtual_function_info(a_type_ptr        class_type,
    5580             :                                               a_base_class_ptr  base_class)
    5581             : /*
    5582             : base_class points to a base class of class_type.  If class_type shares its
    5583             : virtual function info with a base class and that base class is base_class or
    5584             : the base class with which base_class shares its virtual function info, return
    5585             : TRUE.
    5586             : */
    5587             : {
    5588         817 :   a_boolean         shares = FALSE;
    5589             : #if IA64_ABI
    5590         817 :   a_base_class_ptr  primary;
    5591             : 
    5592        1886 :   for (primary = class_type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info->
    5593             :                                                             primary_base_class;
    5594        1069 :        primary != NULL;
    5595         252 :        primary = nominal_primary_base(primary)) {
    5596         957 :     if (primary == base_class) {
    5597             :       shares = TRUE;
    5598             :       break;
    5599             :     }  /* if */
    5600             :   }  /* for */
    5601             : #else /* !IA64_ABI */
    5602             :   a_base_class_ptr  virtual_function_info_base_class, bcp;
    5603             : 
    5604             :   virtual_function_info_base_class =
    5605             :                           class_type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info->
    5606             :                                               virtual_function_info_base_class;
    5607             :   if (virtual_function_info_base_class == base_class) {
    5608             :     /* base_class is the base class with which class_type shares its virtual
    5609             :        function info. */
    5610             :     shares = TRUE;
    5611             :   } else if (virtual_function_info_base_class != NULL) {
    5612             :     bcp = base_class->type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info->
    5613             :                                               virtual_function_info_base_class;

    5615             :       /* bcp now points to a base class of base_class; change it to point
    5616             :          to the corresponding base class of class_type. */

    5618             :       if (virtual_function_info_base_class == bcp) {
    5619             :         shares = TRUE;

    5621             :     }  /* if */
    5622             :   }  /* if */
    5623             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
    5624         817 :   return shares;
    5625             : }  /* shares_virtual_function_info */
    5626             : 
    5627             : 
    5628             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    5629             : /*
    5630             : If the given symbol is for a function generic, set it to the symbol for the
    5631             : underlying "generic definition" routine.
    5632             : */
    5633             : #define reduce_to_underlying_generic_definition_symbol_if_needed(sym)        \
    5634             :   if (symbol_is((sym), sk_function_template) &&                              \

    5643             : 
    5644             : 
    5645         189 : static void update_override_registry(
    5646             :                              an_override_registry_entry_ptr *registry_ptr,
    5647             :                              a_symbol_ptr                   overridden_sym,
    5648             :                              a_symbol_ptr                   nonoverriding_sym,
    5649             :                              a_base_class_ptr               bcp)
    5650             : /*
    5651             : A declaration in the current derived class has been seen, and it has the
    5652             : effect of overriding a virtual function from a base class.  The latter may be
    5653             : a member of an overload set: overridden_sym represents that overload set or
    5654             : a single overridden function if it is not part of an overload set.  Keep track
    5655             : of the number of overrides by updating the linked list pointed to by
    5656             : registry_ptr.  When all the virtual functions in the overload set have been
    5657             : overridden, the corresponding entry is removed from the registry.
    5658             : */
    5659             : {
    5660         189 :   an_override_registry_entry_ptr  orep, prev_orep;
    5661             : 
    5662             :   /* Loop through the current entries in the registry to see if this symbol
    5663             :      is already represented on the list. */
    5664         189 :   prev_orep = NULL;
    5665         519 :   for (orep = *registry_ptr; orep != NULL; orep = orep->next) {
    5666         370 :     if (orep->overridden_sym == overridden_sym && orep->base_class == bcp) {
    5667             :       /* It's a match. */
    5668             :       break;
    5669             :     }  /* if */
    5670         330 :     prev_orep = orep;
    5671             :   }  /* for */
    5672         189 :   if (orep == NULL) {
    5673             :     /* No matching entry was found in the registry.  Only if there is more
    5674             :        than one virtual function in the overload set do we need a partial-
    5675             :        override entry. */
    5676         149 :     a_symbol_ptr  sym, next_sym_in_set;
    5677         149 :     orep = alloc_override_registry_entry();
    5678         149 :     orep->overridden_sym = overridden_sym;
    5679         149 :     orep->base_class = bcp;
    5680         149 :     if (overridden_sym->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_overloaded_function) {
    5681             :       /* Count the number of functions in the overload set that are
    5682             :          virtual.  There should be at least one if this routine is being
    5683             :          called. */
    5684          40 :       unsigned int  count = 0;
    5685          40 :       sym = overridden_sym->variant.overloaded_function.symbols;
    5686             :       /*lint --e{850} sym modified in loop */
    5687         120 :       for (; sym != NULL; sym = next_sym_in_set) {
    5688          80 :         next_sym_in_set = sym->next;
    5689          80 :         reduce_to_underlying_generic_definition_symbol_if_needed(sym);
    5690          80 :         if (sym->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_member_function &&
    5691          80 :             sym->variant.routine.ptr->is_virtual) {
    5692          80 :           ++count;
    5693             :         }  /* if */
    5694             :       }  /* for */
    5695          40 :       check_assertion(count > 0);
    5696          40 :       orep->virtual_function_count = count;
    5697             :     } else {
    5698             : #if CHECKING
    5699         109 :       sym = overridden_sym;
    5700         109 :       reduce_to_underlying_generic_definition_symbol_if_needed(sym);
    5701         109 :       check_assertion(sym->variant.routine.ptr->is_virtual);
    5702             : #endif /* CHECKING */
    5703         109 :       orep->virtual_function_count = 1;
    5704             :     }  /* if */
    5705             :     /* Add the new entry to the end of the registry. */
    5706         149 :     if (prev_orep == NULL) {
    5707          83 :       *registry_ptr = orep;
    5708             :     } else {
    5709          66 :       prev_orep->next = orep;
    5710             :     }  /* if */
    5711             :   }  /* if */
    5712             :   /* If this routine is called with a non-NULL nonoverriding_sym, the
    5713             :      declaration failed to override a base class virtual function; if so,
    5714             :      add a new entry to the end of the list of "override failures".  But
    5715             :      if nonoverriding_sym is NULL, then this is a successful override, in
    5716             :      which case the override count should be bumped. */
    5717         189 :   if (nonoverriding_sym != NULL) {
    5718             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    5719             :     reduce_to_underlying_generic_definition_symbol_if_needed(
    5720             :                                                            nonoverriding_sym);
    5721             :     if (cli_or_cx_enabled &&
    5722             :         nonoverriding_sym->variant.routine.ptr->overridden_functions != NULL) {
    5723             :       /* The non-overriding derived class declaration selectively overrides
    5724             :          specific functions.  It is therefore likely that it intentionally
    5725             :          does not override its base-class homonym and no "failure" should be
    5726             :          recorded. */
    5727             :     } else
    5728             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    5729             :     /* Do not insert code here. */
    5730             :     {
    5731           0 :       a_symbol_list_entry_ptr  new_slep, slep;
    5732           0 :       new_slep = alloc_symbol_list_entry();
    5733           0 :       new_slep->symbol = nonoverriding_sym;
    5734           0 :       if (orep->override_failures == NULL) {
    5735           0 :         orep->override_failures = new_slep;

    5743             :     /* Increment the override count. */

    5746         189 : }  /* update_override_registry */
    5747             : 
    5748             : 
    5749             : static void remove_name_from_override_registry(
    5750             :                                          an_override_registry_entry_ptr  orep)
    5751             : /*
    5752             : Remove all override registry entries following the given one and pointing to
    5753             : an overridden symbol with the same header as the given one (orep).
    5754             : This filtering is used to avoid issuing many diagnostics on a single name.
    5755             : */

    5757             :   a_symbol_header_ptr  header = orep->overridden_sym->header;

    5768             :     }  /* if */
    5769             :   }  /* while */

    5773             : static a_boolean base_function_unhidden_by_projection(

    5797             :   }  /* for */

    5833             : 
    5834             : static void check_override_registry(a_class_def_state  *class_state)
    5835             : /*
    5836             : class_state describes a class definition that has just been completed.
    5837             : Check for cases where a set of overloaded virtual functions in the base class 
    5838             : was only partially overridden and issue a diagnostic if appropriate.
    5839             : Similarly, check for virtual functions that are hidden rather than overridden.
    5840             : (Whether a diagnostic is issued at all and the severity of any diagnostics is
    5841             : dependent on the use of the C++11 attributes "base_check" and "hiding".)
    5842             : */
    5843             : {
    5844             :   a_type_ptr    class_type = class_state->class_type;
    5845             :   a_symbol_ptr  tag_sym = symbol_for(class_type);
    5846             :   a_boolean     strict_checking =
    5847             :                    tag_sym->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info->base_check;
    5848             :   an_override_registry_entry_ptr
    5849             :                 orep = class_state->override_registry, next_orep;
    5850             : 
    5851             :   /* Loop through the registry of overrides. */
    5852             :   for (; orep != NULL; orep = next_orep) {
    5853             :     if (class_type->variant.class_struct_union.is_nonreal_class) {
    5854             :       /* Don't issue diagnostics for nonreal classes. */
    5855             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    5856             :     } else if (class_type_supp(class_type)->is_hide_by_sig) {
    5857             :       /* In managed class types, lookup is based on "signature": The
    5858             :          traditional hiding-instead-of-overriding problems are not an issue
    5859             :          in that context. */
    5860             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    5861             :     } else if (orep->override_count < orep->virtual_function_count) {
    5862             :       if (orep->override_count > 0) {
    5863             :         /* Issue a diagnostic on partial override of an overloaded
    5864             :            virtual function. */
    5865             :         if (base_function_unhidden_by_projection(tag_sym, orep)) {
    5866             :           /* The partial overriding is mitigated by having the nonoverridden
    5867             :              declarations projected through a using-declaration. */
    5868             :           goto next;
    5869             :         } else {
    5870             :           /* Issue a diagnostic, unless the C++11 attribute "hiding" was
    5871             :              specified on the function's name in the derived class. */
    5872             :           if (!class_member_name_marked_as_hiding(
    5873             :                                      tag_sym, orep->overridden_sym->header)) {
    5874             :             pos_sy2_diagnostic(strict_checking ? es_error : es_warning,
    5875             :                                ec_partial_override, &tag_sym->decl_position,
    5876             :                                orep->overridden_sym, tag_sym);
    5877             :           }  /* if */
    5878             :           /* No need to issue any more diagnostics on this name. */
    5879             :           remove_name_from_override_registry(orep);
    5880             :         }  /* if */
    5881             :       } else {
    5882             :         /* Report on hidden virtual functions. */
    5883             :         if (base_function_unhidden_by_projection(tag_sym, orep)) {
    5884             :           /* The partial overriding is mitigated by having the nonoverridden
    5885             :              declarations projected through a using-declaration. */
    5886             :           goto next;
    5887             :         } else {
    5888             :           a_symbol_list_entry_ptr  slep = orep->override_failures;
    5889             :           for (; slep != NULL; slep = slep->next) {
    5890             :             pos_sy2_warning(ec_virtual_function_decl_hidden,
    5891             :                             &slep->symbol->decl_position,
    5892             :                             slep->symbol, orep->overridden_sym);
    5893             :           }  /* for */
    5894             :           if (orep->override_failures != NULL) {
    5895             :             /* No need to issue any more diagnostics on this name. */
    5896             :             remove_name_from_override_registry(orep);
    5897             :           }  /* if */
    5898             :         }  /* if */
    5899             :       }  /* if */
    5900             :     } else {
    5901             :       /* Note that the count may be off in prototype instantiations because
    5902             :          explicit overriders may have an unknown overridden base. */
    5903             :       check_assertion(orep->override_count == orep->virtual_function_count ||
    5904             :                       is_prototype_instantiation_symbol(tag_sym) ||
    5905             :                       total_errors > 0);
    5906             :       /* Okay -- no diagnostic, even if there were additional nonoverriding
    5907             :          declarations of the same name. */
    5908             :     }  /* if */
    5909             :     /* Return the entry to the available list and advance. */
    5910             : next:;
    5911             :     next_orep = orep->next;
    5912             :     free_override_registry_entry(orep);
    5913             :   }  /* for */
    5914             : }  /* check_override_registry */
    5915             : 
    5916             : 
    5917        8923 : static void update_virtual_function_number(
    5918             :                                       a_routine_ptr             rp,
    5919             :                                       a_virtual_function_number *number_ptr)
    5920             : /*
    5921             : If the given routine is virtual and has not yet been assigned a virtual
    5922             : function number, assign one now.  number_ptr is the address of the field in
    5923             : a_class_type_supplement that tracks the highest number assigned thus far.
    5924             : */
    5925             : {
    5926        8923 :   if (!rp->is_virtual ||

    5928             :     /* The given routine is either nonvirtual or it already has a virtual
    5929             :        function number assigned: Nothing to do. */

    5932             :       /* No previous numbers, start at the first value. */
    5933         175 :       *number_ptr = FIRST_VIRTUAL_FUNCTION_NUMBER;

    5938             :            accurately for nonreal class instantiations. */
    5939             :       } else {
    5940           0 :         pos_error(ec_too_many_virtual_functions,
    5941             :                   &rp->source_corresp.decl_position);
    5942             :       }  /* if */

    5944           0 :       *number_ptr = FIRST_VIRTUAL_FUNCTION_NUMBER;
    5945             :     } else {
    5946             :       /* Increment the number for the virtual functions declared so far in the
    5947             :          current class and enter it in the routine entry.  It is used by the
    5948             :          front end in managing virtual function override entries and can be
    5949             :          used by the back end for indexing into a virtual function table. */

    5964             : static void check_deleted_function_overrides(a_symbol_ptr       overrider,

    5966             :                                              a_source_position  *source_pos)
    5967             : /*

    5969             : represented by overridden. Check that if one function is a deleted member, the
    5970             : other is also; issue an error at the given position otherwise.

    5985             : 
    5986             : static a_boolean is_interface_like(a_type_ptr  class_type)
    5987             : /*
    5988             : Return TRUE if the given class type is a Microsoft interface class or an
    5989             : interface-like class.
    5990             : */
    5991             : {

    5993             :   return class_type->variant.class_struct_union.is_interface ||
    5994             :          class_type->variant.class_struct_union.is_interface_like;
    5995             : }  /* is_interface_like */
    5996             : 
    5997             : 
    5998             : static a_boolean is_selectively_overridden_by(a_symbol_ptr  overridden_sym,
    5999             :                                               a_symbol_ptr  overriding_sym)
    6000             : /*
    6001             : Return TRUE if overridden_sym represents a member selectively overridden
    6002             : by the member function overriding_sym.  Selective overriding is a Microsoft
    6003             : extension.  For example:
    6004             :   struct B1 { virtual int f() = 0; };
    6005             :   struct B2 { virtual int f() = 0; };
    6006             :   struct D: B1, B2 {
    6007             :     int B1::f() { return 1; }  // Selectively overrides B1::f (not B2::f).
    6008             :     int B2::f() { return 2; }  // Selectively overrides B2::f (not B1::f).
    6009             :   };
    6010             : 
    6011             : Note: This function is only for use with non-C++/CLI-style selective
    6012             : overriding.
    6013             : */
    6014             : {
    6015             :   a_boolean      result = FALSE;
    6016             :   a_routine_ptr  overrider;
    6017             : 
    6018             :   check_assertion(overriding_sym->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_member_function);
    6019             :   overrider = overriding_sym->variant.routine.ptr;
    6020             :   if (overrider->overridden_functions == NULL) {
    6021             :     result = (overridden_sym == NULL);
    6022             :   } else if (overridden_sym == NULL) {
    6023             :     result = (overrider->overridden_functions == NULL);
    6024             :   } else if (overridden_sym->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_member_function) {
    6025             :     /* overridden_sym represents a known base class member function. */
    6026             :     result = (selectively_overridden_function(overrider) ==
    6027             :                                          overridden_sym->variant.routine.ptr);
    6028             :   } else if (is_nontype_template_param_symbol(overridden_sym) &&
    6029             :              overridden_sym->variant.constant->variant.template_param.kind ==
    6030             :                                 (a_template_param_constant_kind)tpck_member) {
    6031             :     /* overridden_sym represents a member of a dependent base class. */
    6032             :     a_tagged_pointer  ep = overrider->overridden_functions->entity;
    6033             :     if ((an_il_entry_kind)ep.kind == iek_constant) {
    6034             :       result = eq_constants((a_constant_ptr)ep.ptr,
    6035             :                             overridden_sym->variant.constant);
    6036             :     }  /* if */
    6037             :   } else {
    6038             :     unexpected_condition();
    6039             :   }  /* if */
    6040             :   return result;
    6041             : }  /* is_selectively_overridden_by */
    6042             : 
    6043             : 
    6044             : static a_boolean selective_override_match(a_routine_ptr     overrider,
    6045             :                                           a_routine_ptr     candidate,
    6046             :                                           a_base_class_ptr  base_class)
    6047             : /*
    6048             : overrider is a function that selectively overrides a base class function (i.e.,
    6049             : overrider->overridden_functions is non-NULL).  Return TRUE if it may override
    6050             : candidate in the given base class.  Selective overriding is a Microsoft C++
    6051             : extension.  For example:
    6052             :   struct B1 { virtual int f() = 0; };
    6053             :   struct B2 { virtual int f() = 0; };
    6054             :   struct D: B1, B2 {
    6055             :     int B1::f() { return 1; }  // Selectively overrides B1::f (not B2::f).
    6056             :     int B2::f() { return 2; }  // Selectively overrides B2::f (not B1::f).
    6057             :   };
    6058             : 
    6059             : Note: This function is only for use with non-C++/CLI-style selective
    6060             : overriding.
    6061             : */
    6062             : {
    6063             :   a_boolean         result = FALSE;
    6064             : 
    6065             :   check_assertion(overrider->overridden_functions != NULL);
    6066             :   if (is_interface_like(base_class->type)) {
    6067             :     /* For __interface-like base classes (which does not include C++/CLI
    6068             :        interface class/struct types), the overridden function is only the one
    6069             :        in the indicated base subobject.
    6070             :          __interface B {
    6071             :            virtual void f() = 0;
    6072             :          };
    6073             :          __interface C1: B {};
    6074             :          __interface C2: B {};
    6075             :          struct D: C1, C2 {
    6076             :            void C1::f() {}  // Overrides B::f (only) in the C1::B subobject.
    6077             :            void C2::f() {}  // Overrides B::f (only) in the C2::B subobject.
    6078             :          }; */
    6079             :     a_routine_ptr  ofp = selectively_overridden_function(overrider);
    6080             :     if (ofp == NULL) {
    6081             :       /* overrider selectively overrides an unknown (i.e., template dependent)
    6082             :          function.  So it "may" selectively override the given candidate. */
    6083             :       result = TRUE;
    6084             :     } else {
    6085             :       a_base_class_ptr  of_bcp = find_base_class_of(base_class->derived_class,
    6086             :                                                     parent_class_of(ofp));
    6087             :       /* Check that the given base is a subobject of the explicitly designated
    6088             :          base (of_bcp). */
    6089             :       check_assertion(!of_bcp->ambiguous);
    6090             :       if (is_on_any_derivation_of(base_class, of_bcp)) {
    6091             :         if (ofp == candidate) {
    6092             :           /* Direct overrider. */
    6093             :           result = TRUE;
    6094             :         } else {
    6095             :           /* Check for indirect overriding (via an interface slot). */
    6096             :           ofp = selectively_overridden_function(ofp);
    6097             :           while (ofp != NULL) {
    6098             :             if (ofp == candidate) {
    6099             :               result = TRUE;
    6100             :               break;
    6101             :             }  /* if */
    6102             :             ofp = selectively_overridden_function(ofp);
    6103             :           }  /* while */
    6104             :         }  /* if */
    6105             :       }  /* if */
    6106             :     }  /* if */
    6107             :   } else {
    6108             :     /* For non-__interface base classes, the overrider must directly indicate
    6109             :        the overridden function, and all the base subobjects are overridden.
    6110             :        For example:
    6111             :          struct B { virtual void f() = 0; };
    6112             :          struct C1: B {};
    6113             :          struct C2: B {};
    6114             :          struct D: C1, C2 {
    6115             :            void C1::f(); // Overrides f in both base subobjects.
    6116             :            void C2::f(); // Error: Redeclaration.
    6117             :          };
    6118             :     */
    6119             :     an_il_entity_list_entry_ptr  ofep = overrider->overridden_functions;
    6120             :     a_tagged_pointer             ep;
    6121             :     check_assertion(ofep != NULL && ofep->next == NULL);
    6122             :     ep = ofep->entity;
    6123             :     if ((an_il_entry_kind)ep.kind == iek_routine &&
    6124             :         (a_routine_ptr)ep.ptr == candidate) {
    6125             :       result = TRUE;
    6126             :     }  /* if */
    6127             :   }  /* if */
    6128             :   return result;
    6129             : }  /* selective_override_match */
    6130             : 
    6131             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    6132             : 
    6133         817 : static a_boolean base_is_final(a_base_class_ptr  bcp)
    6134             : /*
    6135             : Return TRUE if bcp is on a derivation path involving a "final" base class.
    6136             : */
    6137             : {
    6138         817 :   a_boolean                    result = FALSE;
    6139         817 :   a_base_class_derivation_ptr  derivation = bcp->derivation;
    6140             :   
    6141        1650 :   for (; derivation != NULL; derivation = derivation->next) {
    6142         833 :     a_derivation_step_ptr   ds = derivation->path;
    6143        1950 :     for (; ds != NULL; ds = ds->next) {
    6144        1117 :       if (ds->base_class->type->variant.class_struct_union.final) {
    6145           0 :         result = TRUE;
    6146           0 :         goto done;

    6149             :   }  /* for */
    6150         817 : done:
    6151         817 :   return result;

    6154             : 
    6155         817 : static void check_virtual_function_override(
    6156             :                                  a_class_def_state_ptr   class_state,
    6157             :                                  a_member_decl_info_ptr  decl_info,
    6158             :                                  a_symbol_ptr            overridden_sym,
    6159             :                                  a_base_class_ptr        bcp,
    6160             :                                  a_base_class_ptr        return_adjustment_bcp)
    6161             : /*
    6162             : A member function declaration (overrider_sym) was found to match a virtual
    6163             : member function (overridden_sym) in a base class (bcp) of the class currently
    6164             : being defined (described by class_state).  Check that the overriding is valid,
    6165             : and if not issue diagnostics at the given source position.  If appropriate,
    6166             : record that overriding in the IL.  If the override involves covariant return
    6167             : types, return_adjustment_bcp is the base class entry that was determined by
    6168             : return_types_are_override_compatible.

    6302             : static void check_constraints_for_generic_override(
    6303             :                                         a_symbol_ptr  d_templ,
    6304             :                                         a_symbol_ptr  b_templ,
    6305             :                                         a_boolean     constraints_inheritable)
    6306             : /*
    6307             : The current scope stack entry is an sck_template_declaration entry for a
    6308             : C++/CLI member generic (d_templ) that overrides the generic represented by
    6309             : b_templ.  If the constraint clauses associated with these generics do not
    6310             : match, issue an appropriate error.  If constraints_inheritable is TRUE,
    6311             : d_templ can inherit the constraints of b_templ it is doesn't specify any
    6312             : constraints of its own and this function copies the necessary structures to

    6356       38502 : static void check_for_virtual_override(
    6357             :                                      a_boolean               virtual_specified,
    6358             :                                      a_member_decl_info_ptr  decl_info,
    6359             :                                      a_class_def_state_ptr   class_state,
    6360             :                                      a_func_info_block_ptr   func_info)
    6361             : /*
    6362             : A nonstatic member function, represented by decl_info, has been declared and,
    6363             : depending on the value of virtual_specified, may have been explicitly declared
    6364             : to be a virtual function.  Even if it has not, it will need to be marked as
    6365             : virtual if it overrides a virtual function (i.e., if a function with the same
    6366             : name and type signature was declared virtual in a base class of the current
    6367             : class).  In addition, information about base class virtual functions that are
    6368             : overridden by the current declaration is recorded to allow for appropriate
    6369             : processing later (e.g., the construction of virtual function tables).  If the
    6370             : current routine is a virtual function either from explicit specification or
    6371             : from "inheriting" its virtualness, mark the routine entry and return TRUE;
    6372             : otherwise return FALSE.  class_state describes the parent class of the member
    6373             : function (which is being defined), and func_info points to some additional
    6374             : information about the function declarator.
    6375             : */
    6376             : {
    6377       38502 :   a_decl_parse_state_ptr          dps = &decl_info->decl_state;

    7323             : 
    7324             : static void verify_path_consistency(a_type_ptr        class_type,
    7325             :                                     a_base_class_ptr  base_class)
    7326             : /*
    7327             : Check for consistency of a derivation path.  Specifically, base_class is
    7328             : a base class of class_type.  It contains a pointer to a derivation path,
    7329             : represented as a linked list of entries that point to base classes.  We
    7330             : want to be sure that the base classes pointed to from the derivation
    7331             : path entries are also on the base classes list of class_type.
    7332             : */
    7333             : {
    7334             :   a_derivation_step_ptr        dsp;
    7335             :   a_base_class_ptr             bcp;
    7336             :   a_base_class_derivation_ptr  bcdp;
    7337             :   int                          count;
    7338             : 
    7339             :   /* Only a virtual base class may have more than one derivation. */
    7340             :   check_assertion(base_class->is_virtual ||
    7341             :                   base_class->derivation->next == NULL);
    7342             :   /* Count the number of direct derivations.  There should be exactly one
    7343             :      if base_class is marked as direct, none otherwise. */
    7344             :   count = 0;
    7345             :   for (bcdp = base_class->derivation; bcdp != NULL; bcdp = bcdp->next) {
    7346             :     if (bcdp->direct) ++count;
    7347             :   }  /* for */
    7348             :   check_assertion((a_boolean)base_class->direct == (count == 1));
    7349             :   /* There should be exactly one preferred derivation. */
    7350             :   count = 0;
    7351             :   for (bcdp = base_class->derivation; bcdp != NULL; bcdp = bcdp->next) {
    7352             :     if (bcdp->preferred) ++count;
    7353             :   }  /* for */
    7354             :   check_assertion(count == 1);
    7355             :   /* Examine each derivation's path. */
    7356             :   for (bcdp = base_class->derivation; bcdp != NULL; bcdp = bcdp->next) {
    7357             :     /* The path should not be NULL. */
    7358             :     check_assertion(bcdp->path != NULL);
    7359             :     /* The first step should be either a direct base class or a virtual base
    7360             :        class. */
    7361             :     check_assertion(bcdp->path->base_class->derivation->direct ||
    7362             :                     bcdp->path->base_class->is_virtual);
    7363             :     /* Go through each step of the path. */
    7364             :     for (dsp = bcdp->path; dsp != NULL; dsp = dsp->next) {
    7365             :       /* Be sure the base class entry pointed to from the step entry is
    7366             :          actually on the class type's list of base classes. */
    7367             :       for (bcp = base_classes_of(class_type); bcp != NULL; bcp = bcp->next) {
    7368             :         if (bcp == dsp->base_class) break;
    7369             :         check_assertion(bcp->next != NULL);
    7370             :       }  /* if */
    7371             :       /* The last step (and it alone) should refer to base_class. */
    7372             :       check_assertion((dsp->next == NULL) == (dsp->base_class == base_class));
    7373             :       /* Only the first step and the last step may be virtual. */
    7374             :       check_assertion(!dsp->base_class->is_virtual ||
    7375             :                       (dsp->next == NULL || dsp == bcdp->path));
    7376             :     }  /* for */
    7377             :   }  /* for */
    7378             : }  /* verify_path_consistency */
    7379             : 
    7380             : 
    7381             : static void verify_virt_func_override_list(a_class_def_state_ptr  class_state,
    7382             :                                            a_base_class_ptr       base_class)
    7383             : /*
    7384             : Verify that the base classes pointed to from overriding virtual function
    7385             : entries associated with base_class are on the list of base class associated

    7389             :   an_overriding_virtual_function_ptr  ovfp;

    7393             : #if DEBUG

    7400             : #endif /* DEBUG */
