    8600             :       if (access_already_specified) {
    8601             :         pos_error(ec_access_already_specified, &pos_curr_token);
    8602             :       } else {
    8603             :         if (curr_token == tok_public) {
    8604             :           *access = (an_access_specifier)as_public;
    8605             :         } else {
    8606             :           if (curr_token == tok_protected) {
    8607             :             *access = (an_access_specifier)as_protected;
    8608             :           } else {
    8609             :             *access = (an_access_specifier)as_private;
    8610             :           }  /* if */
    8611             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    8612             :           if (is_immediate_managed_class_type(type_ptr)) {
    8613             :             pos_error(
    8614             :                   ec_managed_class_type_cannot_have_private_or_protected_base,
    8615             :                   &pos_curr_token);
    8616             :             *access = (an_access_specifier)as_public;
    8617             :           } else if (type_ptr->variant.class_struct_union.is_interface) {
    8618             :             pos_error(ec_interface_cannot_have_private_or_protected,
    8619             :                       &pos_curr_token);
    8620             :             *access = (an_access_specifier)as_public;
    8621             :           }  /* if */
    8622             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    8623             :         }  /* if */
    8624             :         access_already_specified = TRUE;
    8625             :       }  /* if */
    8626             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    8627             :     } else if (cppcx_enabled && microsoft_attribute_tokens_next()) {
    8628             :       /* Scan Microsoft C++/CX attributes. */
    8629             :       scan_and_append_microsoft_attributes(p_ms_attributes,
    8630             :                                            /*is_param_or_base=*/TRUE);
    8631             :       /* scan_and_append_microsoft_attributes reads past the final "]", so the
    8632             :          current token is one past the attribute block.  Suppress getting the
    8633             :          next token for this loop iteration. */
    8634             :       skip_get_token = TRUE;
    8635             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    8636             :     } else {
    8637             :       /* Leave the loop and scan the class name. */
    8638             :       break;
    8639             :     }  /* if */
    8640             :     if (skip_get_token) {
    8641             :       skip_get_token = FALSE;
    8642             :     } else {
    8643             :       (void)get_token();
    8644             :     }  /* if */
    8645             :   }  /* for */
    8646             :   *explicit_access = access_already_specified;
    8647             : }  /* scan_inheritance_kind */
    8648             : 
    8649             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    8650             : 
    8651             : static void check_base_class_type_of_managed_class(a_type_ptr  type,
    8652             :                                                    a_type_ptr  base_type)
    8653             : /*
    8654             : Check that a managed class type (type) can validly derive from the class type
    8655             : given by base_type.  Issue a diagnostic if not.
    8656             : */
    8657             : {
    8658             :   /* Managed class types have different constraints.  Value classes and
    8659             :      interface classes can only derive from interface classes.  Ref classes
    8660             :      can derive from at most one other ref class; other base classes must be
    8661             :      interface classes. */
    8662             :   if (cppcx_enabled && is_value_class_type(type) &&
    8663             :       cli_class_type_kind_is(base_type, cctk_interface)) {
    8664             :     /* Value types are not allowed to implement interfaces in C++/CX mode. */
    8665             :     pos_error(ec_cppcx_value_type_deriving_from_interface,
    8666             :               &error_position);
    8667             :   } else if (!cli_class_type_kind_is(base_type, cctk_interface)) {
    8668             :     switch (class_type_supp(type)->cli_class_type_kind) {
    8669             :       case cctk_ref:
    8670             :         if (cli_class_type_kind_is(base_type, cctk_ref)) {
    8671             :           a_base_class_ptr  bcp = base_classes_of(type);
    8672             :           for (; bcp != NULL; bcp = bcp->next) {
    8673             :             if (bcp->direct && cli_class_type_kind_is(bcp->type, cctk_ref)) {
    8674             :               pos_ty_error(ec_ref_class_has_multiple_ref_bases,
    8675             :                            &error_position, bcp->type);
    8676             :               break;
    8677             :             }  /* if */
    8678             :           }  /* for */
    8679             :           /* A ref class type cannot derive from any of the following types:
    8680             :              System::Array, System::Delegate, System::MulticastDelegate,
    8681             :              System::Enum, or System::ValueType.  The only exception is the
    8682             :              cli::array ref class template, which is required to derive from
    8683             :              System::Array. */
    8684             :           if (class_type_supp(type)->assembly_scope_index == 0 &&
    8685             :               class_type_supp(base_type)->assembly_scope_index != 0 &&
    8686             :               ((!class_type_supp(type)->is_cli_array &&
    8687             :                 /* C++/CX does not have a System::Array counterpart. */
    8688             :                 !cppcx_enabled &&
    8689             :                 f_same_entities(base_type,
    8690             :                                 cli_class_type_for(csk_system_array))) ||
    8691             :                f_same_entities(base_type,
    8692             :                                cli_class_type_for(csk_system_delegate)) ||
    8693             :                (/* C++/CX does not have a System::MulticastDelegate
    8694             :                     counterpart. */
    8695             :                 !cppcx_enabled &&
    8696             :                 f_same_entities(
    8697             :                          base_type,
    8698             :                          cli_class_type_for(csk_system_multicast_delegate))) ||
    8699             :                /* A ref class type cannot derive from the C++/CX
    8700             :                   Platform::Box<T> type, but it itself is required to
    8701             :                   derive from Platform::Enum or Platform::ValueType. */
    8702             :                /* This test is disabled entirely while parsing
    8703             :                   vccorlib.h.  In vccorlib.h, ref classes are permitted
    8704             :                   to derive from Platform::Enum and
    8705             :                   Platform::ValueType. */
    8706             :                (!processing_vccorlib_header &&
    8707             :                 (class_type_supp(base_type)->is_cppcx_box ||
    8708             :                  (!class_type_supp(type)->is_cppcx_box &&
    8709             :                   (f_same_entities(base_type,
    8710             :                                    cli_class_type_for(csk_system_enum)) ||
    8711             :                    f_same_entities(base_type, cli_system_value_type()))))))) {
    8712             :             pos_ty_error(ec_invalid_specific_ref_class_base, &error_position,
    8713             :                          base_type);
    8714             :             break;
    8715             :           } else if (is_cli_generic_definition_type(type) &&
    8716             :                      is_cli_attribute_type(base_type)) {
    8717             :             /* A generic class cannot be a custom attribute. */
    8718             :             pos_error(ec_generic_class_cannot_be_custom_attribute,
    8719             :                       &error_position);
    8720             :           }  /* if */
    8721             :         } else {
    8722             :           pos_error(ec_invalid_ref_class_base, &error_position);
    8723             :         }  /* if */
    8724             :         break;
    8725             :       case cctk_value:
    8726             :         { a_type_ptr  system_value_type = cli_system_value_type();
    8727             :           if (!identical_types(base_type, system_value_type)) {
    8728             :             pos_error(ec_invalid_value_class_base, &error_position);
    8729             :           }  /* if */
    8730             :         }
    8731             :         break;
    8732             :       case cctk_interface:
    8733             :         pos_error(ec_invalid_interface_class_base, &error_position);
    8734             :         break;
    8735             :       default:
    8736             :         unexpected_condition();
    8737             :     }  /* switch */
    8738             :   }  /* if */
    8739             : }  /* check_base_class_type_of_managed_class */
    8740             : 
    8741             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    8742             : 
    8743             : #if !MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    8744             : /*ARGSUSED*/ /* type only used when Microsoft extensions are enabled. */
    8745             : #endif /* !MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    8746             : static a_boolean check_base_class_type(a_type_ptr        type,
    8747             :                                        a_type_ptr        base_type)
    8748             : /*
    8749             : Check whether a derived class type (type) can have a base class of type
    8750             : base_type.  If so, return TRUE, and, for some template base classes in
    8751             : some Microsoft modes, update the DLL interface of the base type.  Otherwise,
    8752             : issue an error and return FALSE.
    8753             : */
    8754             : {
    8755             :   a_boolean   okay = TRUE;
    8756             :   a_type_ptr  base_class_type = skip_typerefs(base_type);
    8757             : 
    8758             :   /* If it is the class now being defined or if it is a union or if it has
    8759             :      been declared but not yet defined, issue an error and skip over this
    8760             :      class: it is not a valid base class name. */
    8761             :   /* In Microsoft mode the last field of a class may be a zero-length array;
    8762             :      such a class may not be a base class. */
    8763             :   if (base_class_type->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_union ||
    8764             :       base_class_type->
    8765             :                   variant.class_struct_union.contains_flexible_array_member) {
    8766             :     pos_error(ec_bad_base_class, &error_position);
    8767             :     okay = FALSE;
    8768             :   } else {
    8769             :     /* Force instantiation if the base class is a template class. */
    8770             :     check_assertion(is_class_struct_union_type(base_class_type));
    8771             :     if (ms_extensions && is_immediate_class_type(type) &&
    8772             :         type->variant.class_struct_union.is_ms_instantiated_nonreal_class &&
    8773             :         !base_class_type->variant.class_struct_union.is_nonreal_class) {
    8774             :       /* Don't force the instantiation of base classes of Microsoft
    8775             :          instantiated nonreal base classes. */
    8776             :     } else {
    8777             :       complete_class_type_is_needed(base_class_type);
    8778             :     }  /* if */
    8779             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    8780             :     if (ms_extensions) {
    8781             :       if (is_immediate_managed_class_type(type)) {
    8782             :         check_base_class_type_of_managed_class(type, base_class_type);
    8783             :       } else {
    8784             :         if (cli_or_cx_enabled &&
    8785             :             is_immediate_managed_class_type(base_class_type)) {
    8786             :           pos_error(ec_managed_base_for_standard_class, &error_position);
    8787             :           if (cli_class_type_kind_is(base_class_type, cctk_interface)) {
    8788             :             /* If the base class is an interface class, do not place it in the
    8789             :                list of base classes because its lack of constructors would
    8790             :                cause difficulties later on. */
    8791             :             okay = FALSE;
    8792             :           }  /* if */
    8793             :         }  /* if */
    8794             :         if (microsoft_version >= 1300 &&
    8795             :             !type->variant.class_struct_union.is_nonreal_class) {
    8796             :           /* Recent Microsoft compilers apply the dllimport/dllexport
    8797             :              attributes of a derived class to any base class type that is an
    8798             :              implicit class template specialization (unless a DLL interface
    8799             :              was already specified on that type). */
    8800             :           a_decl_modifier  flags = class_type_supp(type)->decl_modifiers &
    8801             :                                                                   DM_DLLFLAGS;
    8802             :           if (flags != 0) {
    8803             :             update_dll_info_for_class(base_class_type, flags,
    8804             :                                       /*explicit_inst=*/FALSE,
    8805             :                                       /*adjust_template_base=*/TRUE,
    8806             :                                       &error_position);
    8807             :           }  /* if */
    8808             :         }  /* if */
    8809             :       }  /* if */
    8810             :     }  /* if */
    8811             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    8812             :     if (base_class_type->variant.class_struct_union.final) {
    8813             :       /* Final/sealed classes cannot be derived from. */
    8814             :       a_boolean  use_sealed = FALSE;
    8815             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    8816             :       use_sealed = base_class_type->variant.class_struct_union.sealed;
    8817             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    8818             :       pos_error(use_sealed ? ec_sealed_base_class : ec_final_base_class,
    8819             :                 &pos_curr_token);
    8820             :       okay = FALSE;
    8821             :     }  /* if */
    8822             :     if (is_incomplete_type(base_class_type)) {
    8823             :       if ((gpp_mode || microsoft_mode) &&
    8824             :           class_type_supp(base_class_type)->assoc_scope != NULL &&
    8825             :           is_template_param_or_nonreal_class_type(base_class_type)) {
    8826             :         /* Microsoft and GNU compilers never check the completeness of a
    8827             :            parameterized base class that has not been fully parsed yet.
    8828             :            That causes the following example to be accepted:
    8829             :              template<class T> struct S { struct N: S<T> {}; };
    8830             :            In other modes, such cases result in an error. */
    8831             :         pos_warning(ec_unfinished_base_class, &error_position);
    8832             :       } else if (microsoft_mode &&
    8833             :                  is_immediate_class_type(type) &&
    8834             :                  type->variant.class_struct_union
    8835             :                               .is_ms_instantiated_nonreal_class) {
    8836             :         /* We approximate the behavior of the Microsoft compiler by doing
    8837             :            "nonreal instantiations" of nonreal base classes.  However, such
    8838             :            base classes may involve real incomplete real base classes: Don't
    8839             :            issue errors on that. */
    8840             :       } else {
    8841             :         pos_error(ec_incomplete_type_not_allowed, &error_position);
    8842             :         okay = FALSE;
    8843             :       }  /* if */
    8844             :     }  /* if */
    8845             :   }  /* if */
    8846             :   return okay;
    8847             : }  /* check_base_class_type */
    8848             : 
    8849             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    8850             : 
    8851             : static void add_projections_for_symbols(a_symbol_ptr      b_sym_list,
    8852             :                                         a_boolean         single,
    8853             :                                         a_base_class_ptr  bcp,
    8854             :                                         a_symbol_ptr      *p_d_symbol_list)
    8855             : /*
    8856             : b_sym_list points to a list (possibly empty) list of symbols from the base
    8857             : class described by bcp.  Append projection symbols for every of element of
    8858             : that list (or just the first one if single is TRUE) to the list pointed to by
    8859             : *p_d_symbol_list (associated with the derived class).
    8860             : */
    8861             : {
    8862             :   a_type_ptr           d_type = bcp->derived_class;
    8863             :   a_symbol_ptr         b_sym, *p_d_sym = p_d_symbol_list;
    8864             :   an_access_specifier  bcp_access;
    8865             : 
    8866             :   if (is_immediate_managed_class_type(d_type)) {
    8867             :     /* Inheritance is always public in C++/CLI managed classes.  By special-
    8868             :        casing this, we allow this function to be called for managed class
    8869             :        types prior to computing preferred derivations. */
    8870             :     bcp_access = (an_access_specifier)as_public;
    8871             :   } else {
    8872             :     bcp_access = preferred_derivation_of(bcp)->access;
    8873             :   }  /* if */
    8874             :   /* Find the end of the derived class list (for adding projections). */
    8875             :   while (*p_d_sym != NULL) p_d_sym = &(*p_d_sym)->next;
    8876             :   /* Project each symbol in turn. */
    8877             :   for (b_sym = b_sym_list; b_sym != NULL; b_sym = b_sym->next) {
    8878             :     a_base_class_ptr  f_bcp;
    8879             :     if (symbol_is(b_sym, sk_projection)) {
    8880             :       f_bcp = b_sym->variant.projection.extra_info->fundamental_base_class;
    8881             :     } else {
    8882             :       f_bcp = bcp;
    8883             :     }  /* if */
    8884             :     *p_d_sym = make_projection_symbol(b_sym, d_type, f_bcp,
    8885             :                                       (a_derivation_step_ptr)NULL,
    8886             :                                       b_sym->ambiguous);
    8887             :     (*p_d_sym)->variant.projection.access =
    8888             :                          compute_access(access_for_symbol(b_sym), bcp_access);
    8889             :     p_d_sym = &(*p_d_sym)->next;
    8890             :     if (single) break;
    8891             :   }  /* for */
    8892             : }  /* add_projections_for_symbols */
    8893             : 
    8894             : 
    8895             : static void add_projections_for_accessors(a_symbol_ptr      b_accessors,
    8896             :                                           a_base_class_ptr  bcp,
    8897             :                                           a_symbol_ptr      *p_d_accessors)
    8898             : /*
    8899             : Add projections described by b_accessors (from the given base class) to
    8900             : *p_d_accessors (in the derived class).  b_accessors and/or *p_d_accessors may
    8901             : be NULL.
    8902             : */
    8903             : {
    8904             :   if (b_accessors != NULL) {
    8905             :     a_boolean     single;
    8906             :     a_symbol_ptr  b_sym_list, *p_d_sym_list, prev_d_next;
    8907             :     if (symbol_is(b_accessors, sk_overloaded_function)) {
    8908             :       b_sym_list = b_accessors->variant.overloaded_function.symbols;
    8909             :       single = FALSE;
    8910             :     } else {
    8911             :       b_sym_list = b_accessors;
    8912             :       single = TRUE;
    8913             :     }  /* if */
    8914             :     if (*p_d_accessors != NULL &&
    8915             :         symbol_is(*p_d_accessors, sk_overloaded_function)) {
    8916             :       p_d_sym_list = &(*p_d_accessors)->variant.overloaded_function.symbols;
    8917             :     } else {
    8918             :       p_d_sym_list = p_d_accessors;
    8919             :     }  /* if */
    8920             :     /* Remember the symbol following *p_d_accessor (if any), so we can
    8921             :        recognize the need for an overload set after possibly appending
    8922             :        overloaded projections. */
    8923             :     prev_d_next = (*p_d_accessors != NULL) ? (*p_d_accessors)->next
    8924             :                                            : (a_symbol_ptr)NULL;
    8925             :     add_projections_for_symbols(b_sym_list, single, bcp, p_d_sym_list);
    8926             :     if ((*p_d_accessors)->next != prev_d_next) {
    8927             :       /* The derived-class accessor set has become an overload set (it wasn't
    8928             :          before).  Create the sk_overloaded_function symbol for it. */
    8929             :       a_symbol_ptr      o_list = *p_d_accessors, last;
    8930             :       a_symbol_locator  loc;
    8931             :       make_locator_for_symbol(o_list, &loc);
    8932             :       *p_d_accessors =
    8933             :                      make_symbol((a_symbol_kind)sk_overloaded_function, &loc);
    8934             :       set_class_membership(*p_d_accessors, (a_source_correspondence *)NULL,
    8935             :                            bcp->derived_class);
    8936             :       (*p_d_accessors)->is_invisible = TRUE;
    8937             :       (*p_d_accessors)->variant.overloaded_function.symbols = o_list;
    8938             :       /* Skip to the last element of the overload set and set its "next"
    8939             :          pointer to NULL. */
    8940             :       for (last = o_list; last->next != prev_d_next; last = last->next) {
    8941             :         /* Nothing */
    8942             :       }  /* for */
    8943             :       last->next = NULL;
    8944             :       /* Place the elements that follow back on the original symbol list
    8945             :          (just following the new overload set symbol). */
    8946             :       (*p_d_accessors)->next = prev_d_next;
    8947             :       set_mixed_static_nonstatic_flag(*p_d_accessors);
    8948             :     }  /* if */
    8949             :   }  /* if */
    8950             : }  /* add_projections_for_accessors */
    8951             : 
    8952             : 
    8953             : static void inherit_default_indexed_properties(a_base_class_ptr  bcp)
    8954             : /*
    8955             : The given direct base class declares or inherits default indexed properties
    8956             : (a C++/CLI feature).  Add projection symbols for those properties (and their
    8957             : accessors) in the derived class.
    8958             : */
    8959             : {
    8960             :   a_type_ptr  d_type = bcp->derived_class, b_type = bcp->type;
    8961             :   a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr
    8962             :               d_cssp = symbol_supplement_for_class(d_type),
    8963             :               b_cssp = symbol_supplement_for_class(b_type);
    8964             :   a_property_set_symbol_supplement_ptr
    8965             :               d_set, b_set;
    8966             : 
    8967             :   if (cli_class_type_kind_is(b_type, cctk_interface) ||
    8968             :        (cli_class_type_kind_is(b_type, cctk_ref) &&
    8969             :         is_cli_system_object_type(b_type))) {
    8970             :     /* If lookup starts in a ref class, base interface members are ignored
    8971             :        (see ECMA-372, section 10.7).  So skip this process in such cases. */ 
    8972             :     if (!cli_class_type_kind_is(d_type, cctk_interface)) {
    8973             :       goto done;
    8974             :     }  /* if */
    8975             :   }  /* if */
    8976             :   check_assertion(b_cssp->default_indexed_properties != NULL);
    8977             :   b_set = b_cssp->default_indexed_properties->variant.property_info;
    8978             :   if (d_cssp->default_indexed_properties == NULL) {
    8979             :     /* No property set has been created (yet) in the derived class for the
    8980             :        default-indexed properties.  Create the symbol now (it will be added to
    8981             :        the class scope when that scope is pushed). */
    8982             :     a_symbol_locator  loc;
    8983             :     a_symbol_ptr      new_sym;
    8984             :     make_locator_for_symbol(b_cssp->default_indexed_properties, &loc);
    8985             :     new_sym = make_symbol((a_symbol_kind)sk_property_set, &loc);
    8986             :     set_class_membership(new_sym, (a_source_correspondence *)NULL, d_type);
    8987             :     d_cssp->default_indexed_properties = new_sym;
    8988             :   }  /* if */
    8989             :   d_set = d_cssp->default_indexed_properties->variant.property_info;
    8990             :   /* First add projections for the property member symbols to the set. */
    8991             :   add_projections_for_symbols(b_set->properties, /*single=*/FALSE, bcp,
    8992             :                               &d_set->properties);
    8993             :   /* Next, add projections for the accessors. */
    8994             :   add_projections_for_accessors(b_set->get_accessors, bcp,
    8995             :                                 &d_set->get_accessors);
    8996             :   add_projections_for_accessors(b_set->set_accessors, bcp,
    8997             :                                 &d_set->set_accessors);
    8998             : done:;
    8999             : }  /* inherit_default_indexed_properties */
    9000             : 
    9001             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    9002             : 
    9003             : #if IA64_ABI
    9004             : /*ARGSUSED*/  /* p_may_be_first_direct_nonvirtual_base is not used in some
    9005             :                  configurations. */
    9006             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    9007        5725 : static void add_new_direct_base(
    9008             :                 a_base_class_ptr       direct_bcp,
    9009             :                 a_class_def_state_ptr  class_state,
    9010             :                 an_access_specifier    access,
    9011             :                 a_base_class_ptr       *p_last_base,
    9012             :                 a_boolean              *p_may_be_first_direct_nonvirtual_base)
    9013             : /*
    9014             : Add direct_bcp as a base class to direct_bcp->derived_class, and recursively
    9015             : add any base classes of direct_bcp->type.  class_state describes the class
    9016             : definition in progress.  access is the (possibly implicit) access specified on
    9017             : the base class.  *p_last_base points to the last base currently recorded for
    9018             : the derived class and is updated by this function.
    9019             : *p_may_be_first_direct_nonvirtual_base is TRUE if this may be the first direct
    9020             : nonvirtual base of the direct base (in which case this function sets the flag
    9021             : to FALSE before returning).
    9022             : */
    9023             : {
    9024        5725 :   a_boolean                      is_virtual = direct_bcp->is_virtual;
    9025        5725 :   a_type_ptr                     bcp_type = direct_bcp->type;
    9026        5725 :   a_type_ptr                     class_type = direct_bcp->derived_class;
    9027        5725 :   a_class_type_supplement_ptr    ctsp = class_type_supp(class_type);
    9028        5725 :   a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr  bcp_cssp, cssp;
    9029        5725 :   a_derivation_step_ptr          path;
    9030        5725 :   a_base_class_ptr               bcp;
    9031        5725 :   a_boolean                      any_base_class_fixup_required = FALSE;

    9328             : 
    9329        5659 : static void scan_base_specifier_list(a_class_def_state_ptr  class_state)
    9330             : /*
    9331             : Scan a list of base class specifiers, which may appear only on a class
    9332             : or struct definition (described by class_state).
    9333             : 
    9334             : The current token is the leading colon.
    9335             : 
    9336             : In C++/CLI mode, this routine is also called to scan the "__implements"
    9337             : construct that can appear in code generated from metadata:
    9338             : 
    9339             :         __implements base-list
    9340             : 
    9341             : In that case, the current token is the "__implements" token and the base list
    9342             : can only contain CLI interfaces.
    9343             : */
    9344             : {
    9345        5659 :   a_type_ptr                    type_ptr = class_state->class_type;
    9346        5659 :   a_class_type_supplement_ptr   ctsp;
    9347        5659 :   a_base_class_ptr              bcp, end_of_base_classes_list = NULL;
    9348        5659 :   a_base_class_ptr              new_direct_bcp;
    9349        5659 :   an_access_specifier           access;
    9350        5659 :   a_boolean                     is_virtual;
    9351        5659 :   a_boolean                     explicit_access_specifier;

    9353        5659 :   a_symbol_ptr                  sym;
    9354        5659 :   a_type_ptr                    base_class_type;

    9356        5659 :   a_boolean                     ambiguous;

    9362        5659 :   a_boolean                     may_be_first_direct_nonvirtual_base = TRUE;
    9363             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    9364             :   a_boolean                     interface_definition =
    9365             :                                    ms_extensions &&
    9366             :                                    type_ptr->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_struct &&
    9367             :                                    type_ptr->variant.class_struct_union

    9369             :   a_boolean                     is_implements_construct = FALSE;
    9370             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    9371             : 
    9372        5659 :   db_enter(3, "scan_base_specifier_list");
    9373             : #if DEBUG
    9374        5659 :   if (debug_level >= 3 || db_flag_is_set("base_specifiers")) {

    9379             : #endif /* DEBUG */

    9383           0 :     pos_error(ec_base_class_not_allowed_for_union, &error_position);

    9386             :     /* Get the class type supplement entry for this class or struct. */
    9387        5659 :     ctsp = type_ptr->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info;
    9388             :   }  /* if */

    9391             :     is_implements_construct = TRUE;

    9393             :     may_be_first_direct_nonvirtual_base = FALSE;

    9396             :     end_of_base_classes_list = ctsp->base_classes;
    9397             :     check_assertion(end_of_base_classes_list != NULL);

    9402             :   /* Do not insert code here. */
    9403             :   {
    9404        5659 :     check_assertion(curr_token == tok_colon);
    9405             :   }  /* if */
    9406             :   /* Advance past the colon or __implements token. */
    9407        5659 :   (void)get_token();
    9408        5659 :   cssp = symbol_supplement_for_class(type_ptr);
    9409        5725 :   do {

    9416             :            __implements ...

    9418             :          implemented by the current class will be specified in the class'
    9419             :          body.  (This is needed because some CLI-based languages allow a class
    9420             :          to implement its own nested interface.) */
    9421             :       check_assertion(cli_or_cx_enabled);
    9422             :       (void)get_token();
    9423             :       if (required_token(tok_ellipsis, ec_exp_ellipsis)) {

    9425             :         break;
    9426             :       }  /* if */
    9427             :     }  /* if */

    9621             :                specialization for this class definition.  This can cause
    9622             :                problems for examples like the following:
    9623             :   
    9624             :                  template <typename T> struct X: T { };
    9625             :                  struct A { };
    9626             :                  struct Y {
    9627             :                    typedef A x;
    9628             :                    X<x> xx;
    9629             :                  };

    9631             :                The explicit specialization of X<A> will appear before the
    9632             :                definition of Y, so we must take care not to use the typedef

    9634             :                the scope stack to see if the parent class of the typedef is

    9785             : static void add_direct_base_of_type(
    9786             :                 a_type_ptr             tp,
    9787             :                 a_class_def_state_ptr  cdsp,
    9788             :                 a_base_class_sequence_number
    9789             :                                        direct_base_number,
    9790             :                 a_base_class_ptr       *p_last_base,
    9791             :                 a_boolean              *p_may_be_first_direct_nonvirtual_base)
    9792             : /*
    9793             : Add a public direct base of the given type to the class described by cdsp.
    9794             : */
    9795             : {
    9796             :   a_base_class_ptr  new_direct_bcp = alloc_base_class();
    9797             : 
    9798             :   new_direct_bcp->orig_type = tp;
    9799             :   new_direct_bcp->type = skip_typerefs(tp);
    9800             :   complete_type_is_needed(new_direct_bcp->type);
    9801             :   new_direct_bcp->derived_class = cdsp->class_type;
    9802             :   new_direct_bcp->direct = TRUE;
    9803             :   if (cli_or_cx_enabled && is_immediate_class_type(new_direct_bcp->type) &&

    9805             :        (cli_class_type_kind_is(new_direct_bcp->type, cctk_ref) &&
    9806             :         is_cli_system_object_type(new_direct_bcp->type)))) {
    9807             :     /* C++/CLI interfaces behave like virtual base classes when derived from.
    9808             :        System::Object does too (it is the root base of every ref and interface
    9809             :        class). */
    9810             :     new_direct_bcp->is_virtual = TRUE;
    9811             :   }  /* if */
    9812             :   new_direct_bcp->is_implicit_direct_base = TRUE;
    9813             :   new_direct_bcp->direct_base_number = direct_base_number;

    9815             :                       p_last_base, p_may_be_first_direct_nonvirtual_base);
    9816             : }  /* add_direct_base_of_type */
    9817             : 
    9818             : 
    9819             : static void add_implicit_cli_bases(a_class_def_state_ptr  class_state)
    9820             : /*
    9821             : The given class is being defined in C++/CLI mode and its explicit base classes
    9822             : have been scanned.  If the class type is a managed class type, add an implicit
    9823             : derivation from System::ObjectType, System::ValueType, or System::Attribute if
    9824             : appropriate.
    9825             : */
    9826             : {
    9827             :   a_type_ptr  class_type = class_state->class_type;
    9828             : 
    9829             :   if (is_immediate_managed_class_type(class_type)) {
    9830             :     /* If a ref class or interface class does not specify a ref class base, it
    9831             :        derives implicitly from System::Object.  Similarly, if a value class
    9832             :        does not derive explicitly from a ref class base (which can only be
    9833             :        System::ValueType) it derives from System::ValueType. */
    9834             :     a_base_class_ptr  bcp, system_object_base = NULL;
    9835             :     a_boolean         add_implicit_base = TRUE;
    9836             :     a_boolean         is_attribute =
    9837             :                                 class_type_supp(class_type)->is_cli_attribute;
    9838             :     for (bcp = base_classes_of(class_type); bcp != NULL; bcp = bcp->next) {
    9839             :       if (is_ref_class_type(bcp->type)) {
    9840             :         if (bcp->direct) {
    9841             :           add_implicit_base = FALSE;
    9842             :           break;
    9843             :         } else if (bcp->is_virtual) {
    9844             :           /* The type of this base must be type System::Object since it is the
    9845             :              only ref class that is inherited virtually. */
    9846             :           system_object_base = bcp;
    9847             :         }  /* if */
    9848             :       }  /* if */
    9849             :     }  /* for */
    9850             :     if (!add_implicit_base) {
    9851             :       /* The given class type already derives directly from a ref class.
    9852             :          Nothing more to do. */
    9853             :     } else if (system_object_base != NULL &&
    9854             :                cli_class_type_kind_is(class_type, cctk_interface)) {
    9855             :       /* An interface that already derives (indirectly) from System::Object
    9856             :          needs no update. */
    9857             :     } else if (system_object_base != NULL && !is_attribute &&
    9858             :                cli_class_type_kind_is(class_type, cctk_ref)) {
    9859             :       /* A ref class that already has System::Object as an indirect base but
    9860             :          no other ref base classes.  This happens when base interfaces are
    9861             :          specified but not a base ref class: Add a direct (implicit)
    9862             :          derivation for System::Object. */
    9863             :       a_base_class_sequence_number  direct_base_number = 0;
    9864             :       check_assertion(is_cli_system_object_type(system_object_base->type));
    9865             :       system_object_base->direct = TRUE;
    9866             :       system_object_base->is_implicit_direct_base = TRUE;
    9867             :       system_object_base->orig_type = system_object_base->type;
    9868             :       (void)update_base_class_derivation(system_object_base,
    9869             :                                          (a_derivation_step_ptr)NULL,
    9870             :                                          (an_access_specifier)as_public);
    9871             :       /* Find the largest direct base number assigned so far and assign the
    9872             :          next number to System::Object. */
    9873             :       bcp = base_classes_of(class_type);
    9874             :       direct_base_number = largest_direct_base_number(bcp,
    9875             :                                                       (a_base_class_ptr*)NULL);
    9876             :       system_object_base->direct_base_number = direct_base_number+1;
    9877             :     } else if (!is_cli_system_object_type(class_type)) {
    9878             :       a_base_class_ptr              last_bcp = NULL;
    9879             :       a_boolean                     may_be_first_direct_nonvirtual_base;
    9880             :       a_base_class_sequence_number  direct_base_number = 0;
    9881             :       a_type_ptr                    new_base_type;
    9882             :       /* Determine the last base class entry and the last direct base
    9883             :          number. */
    9884             :       bcp = base_classes_of(class_type);
    9885             :       if (bcp != NULL) {
    9886             :         direct_base_number = largest_direct_base_number(bcp, &last_bcp);
    9887             :       }  /* if */
    9888             :       /* System::Object is derived from virtually and so it cannot be the first
    9889             :          direct nonvirtual base class.  System::ValueType derives directly from
    9890             :          System::Object and hence must in fact be the first direct nonvirtual
    9891             :          base.  The same is true for the System::Attribute class. */
    9892             :       if (is_attribute) {
    9893             :         may_be_first_direct_nonvirtual_base = TRUE;
    9894             :         new_base_type =
    9895             :                   cli_class_type_for((a_cli_symbol_kind)csk_system_attribute);
    9896             :       } else if (cli_class_type_kind_is(class_type, cctk_value)) {
    9897             :         may_be_first_direct_nonvirtual_base = TRUE;
    9898             :         new_base_type = cli_system_value_type();
    9899             :       } else {
    9900             :         may_be_first_direct_nonvirtual_base = FALSE;
    9901             :         new_base_type = cli_system_object_type();
    9902             :       }  /* if */
    9903             :       add_direct_base_of_type(
    9904             :                    new_base_type, class_state, direct_base_number+1, &last_bcp,
    9905             :                    &may_be_first_direct_nonvirtual_base);
    9906             :     }  /* if */
    9907             :   }  /* if */
    9908             : }  /* add_implicit_cli_bases */
    9909             : 
    9910             : 
    9911             : static void add_implicit_coclass_bases(a_class_def_state_ptr  class_state)
    9912             : /*
    9913             : The class type specified by class_state->class_type is being defined and
    9914             : the COM "coclass" Microsoft attribute has been applied to it.  The effect of
    9915             : this attribute is to create a COM object that can implement a COM interface.
    9916             : MSVS does this by injecting base classes (documented as CComCoClass,
    9917             : CComObjectRootEx, and optionally IProvideClassInfo2Impl), and member functions
    9918             : (UpdateRegistry, GetObjectCLSID, GetObjectFriendlyName, GetProgID, and
    9919             : GetVersionIndependentProgID) as well as changes related to the COM map.
    9920             : 
    9921             : The full scope of these changes is beyond the scope of the front end (ATL
    9922             : attributes are deprecated), but this code does add ATL::CComCoClass<class_type,
    9923             : &__uuidof(class_type)> as an implicit direct base class.
    9924             : */
    9925             : {
    9926             :   a_type_ptr          class_type = class_state->class_type;
    9927             :   a_symbol_ptr        sym, ns_sym;
    9928             :   a_template_arg_ptr  tap, template_arg_list;
    9929             :   a_type_ptr          base_type, uuidof_type;
    9930             :   a_boolean           err = FALSE;
    9931             : 
    9932             :   check_assertion(is_immediate_class_type(class_type) &&
    9933             :                   class_type_supp(class_type)->has_coclass_attribute &&
    9934             :                   !no_injected_text);
    9935             :   ns_sym = look_up_name_string_in_namespace("ATL", (a_namespace_ptr)NULL,
    9936             :                                             IDL_MUST_BE_NAMESPACE);
    9937             :   if (ns_sym == NULL) {
    9938             :     /* No ATL namespace. */
    9939             :     err = TRUE;
    9940             :   } else {
    9941             :     check_assertion(symbol_is(ns_sym, sk_namespace));
    9942             :     sym = look_up_name_string_in_namespace("CComCoClass",
    9943             :                                            ns_sym->variant.namespace_info.ptr,
    9944             :                                            IDL_NO_OPTIONS);
    9945             :     if (sym == NULL ||
    9946             :         sym->kind != (a_symbol_kind)sk_class_template) {
    9947             :       /* No CComCoClass symbol or the wrong kind. */
    9948             :       err = TRUE;
    9949             :     } else {
    9950             :       a_boolean         template_case = FALSE;
    9951             :       a_constant_ptr    uuidof_con = local_constant();
    9952             :       /* Determine the proper uuidof type for the class. */
    9953             :       uuidof_type = underlying_uuidof_type(class_type, &template_case, &err);
    9954             :       if (!err) {
    9955             :         a_base_class_ptr bcp, last_bcp = NULL;
    9956             :         a_boolean        may_be_first_direct_nonvirtual_base = TRUE;
    9957             :         a_base_class_sequence_number direct_base_number = 0;
    9958             :         /* Create a template argument list for the class template that is to be
    9959             :            instantiated.  The first argument is class_type.  The second
    9960             :            argument is &__uuidof(class_type). */
    9961             :         tap = alloc_template_arg((a_templ_arg_kind)tak_type);
    9962             :         tap->variant.type = class_type;
    9963             :         template_arg_list = tap;
    9964             :         tap = alloc_template_arg((a_templ_arg_kind)tak_nontype);
    9965             :         make_uuidof_constant(uuidof_type, uuidof_con);
    9966             :         tap->variant.constant = move_local_constant_to_il(&uuidof_con);
    9967             :         template_arg_list->next = tap;
    9968             :         /* Instantiate (if necessary) the class template with the specified
    9969             :            template arguments. */
    9970             :         sym = find_class_template_instance(sym, &template_arg_list);
    9971             :         check_assertion(sym != NULL &&
    9972             :                         sym->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_class_or_struct_tag);
    9973             :         base_type = sym->variant.class_struct_union.type;
    9974             :         /* Determine the last base class entry for class_type and the last
    9975             :            direct base number. */
    9976             :         bcp = base_classes_of(class_type);
    9977             :         if (bcp != NULL) {
    9978             :           direct_base_number = largest_direct_base_number(bcp, &last_bcp);
    9979             :         }  /* if */
    9980             :         /* Add ATL::CComCoClass<class_type, &__uuidof(class_type)> as a
    9981             :            direct base class. */
    9982             :         add_direct_base_of_type(base_type, class_state, direct_base_number+1,
    9983             :                                 &last_bcp,
    9984             :                                 &may_be_first_direct_nonvirtual_base);
    9985             :       } else {
    9986             :         release_local_constant(&uuidof_con);
    9987             :       }  /* if */
    9988             :     }  /* if */
    9989             :   }  /* if */
    9990             :   if (err) {
    9991             :     /* Issue a generic remark if we fail to find ATL::CComCoClass. */
    9992             :     pos_remark(ec_coclass_base_requirements_not_met,
    9993             :                &class_type->source_corresp.decl_position);
    9994             :   }  /* if */
    9995             : }  /* add_implicit_coclass_bases */
    9996             : 
    9997             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    9998             : 
    9999             : static void wrapup_base_classes(a_class_def_state_ptr  class_state)
   10000             : /*
   10001             : The base specifier list has been scanned and any implicit base classes have
   10002             : been added.  Perform any needed post-processing for the resulting base class
   10003             : list (such as computing the preorder list for the IA-64 ABI).  This function
   10004             : may be called twice in C++/CLI mode, if the IDisposable interface is added
   10005             : implicitly as part of the dispose pattern implementation.
   10006             : */
   10007             : {
   10008             :   a_type_ptr                   type_ptr = class_state->class_type;
   10009             : #if IA64_ABI || EXPENSIVE_CHECKING
   10010             :   a_class_type_supplement_ptr  ctsp = class_type_supp(type_ptr);
   10011             : #endif /* IA64_ABI || EXPENSIVE_CHECKING */
   10012             :   a_base_class_ptr             bcp;
   10013             : #if IA64_ABI
   10014             :   a_base_class_ptr             first_indirect_primary_vbase = NULL;
   10015             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   10016             : 
   10017             : #if IA64_ABI
   10018             :   /* Compute the list of base classes in preorder, now that the postorder list
   10019             :      is complete. */
   10020             :   (void)compute_preorder_base_classes(type_ptr, (a_base_class_ptr)NULL, 
   10021             :                                       &preorder_base_classes_of(type_ptr));
   10022             :   /* See if there are any virtual base classes with which we could share 
   10023             :      a virtual function table. */
   10024             :   if (ctsp != NULL && ctsp->virtual_function_info_base_class == NULL) {
   10025             :     for (bcp = preorder_base_classes_of(type_ptr); bcp != NULL; 
   10026             :          bcp = bcp->next_preorder) {
   10027             :       if (bcp->is_virtual && is_nearly_empty_class(bcp->type)) {
   10028             :         if (!bcp->shares_virtual_function_info) {
   10029             :           set_virtual_function_info_base_class(bcp);
   10030             :           break;
   10031             :         } else if (first_indirect_primary_vbase == NULL) {
   10032             :           first_indirect_primary_vbase = bcp;
   10033             :         }  /* if */
   10034             :       }  /* if */
   10035             :     }  /* for */
   10036             :     /* If no satisfactory base has yet been found, use the first indirect
   10037             :        primary virtual base. */
   10038             :     if (ctsp->virtual_function_info_base_class == NULL &&
   10039             :         first_indirect_primary_vbase != NULL) {
   10040             :       set_virtual_function_info_base_class(first_indirect_primary_vbase);
   10041             :     }  /* if */
   10042             :   }  /* if */
   10043             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
   10044             :   if (type_ptr->variant.class_struct_union.any_virtual_base_classes &&
   10045             :       !is_immediate_managed_class_type(type_ptr)) {
   10046             :     /* Make a pass over the base class list to resolve duplicate virtual base
   10047             :        classes (if any).  (In managed classes, the preferred base was already
   10048             :        established earlier.) */
   10049             :     for (bcp = base_classes_of(type_ptr); bcp != NULL; bcp = bcp->next) {
   10050             :       if (bcp->is_virtual) {      
   10051             :         set_preferred_base_class_derivation(type_ptr, bcp);
   10052             :       }  /* if */
   10053             :     }  /* for */
   10054             :   }  /* if */
   10055             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
   10056             : #if TEMPLATE_INSTANTIATIONS_IN_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
   10057             :   if (!source_sequence_entries_disallowed) {
   10058             :     /* If a base specifier reference provokes an instantiation, the entries
   10059             :        representing it will end up in the wrong place -- after the entry for
   10060             :        the derived class instead of before it.  Move them to precede the
   10061             :        entry for the class. */
   10062             :     a_source_sequence_entry_ptr  ssep = type_ptr->source_corresp.
   10063             :                                                    source_sequence_entry;
   10064             :     if (ssep != NULL && ssep->next != NULL) {
   10065             : #if DEBUG
   10066             :       a_source_sequence_entry_ptr   prev = ssep->prev;
   10067             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   10068             : 
   10069             :       /* Unlink the source sequence entry for the current class and
   10070             :          replace it in the list with the new entry, if there is one. */
   10071             :       move_src_seq_entry(ssep, depth_scope_stack,
   10072             :                          (a_source_sequence_entry_ptr)NULL, depth_scope_stack);
   10073             : #if DEBUG
   10074             :       if (debug_level >= 4 ||
   10075             :           db_flag_is_set("dump_ss_full") ||
   10076             :           db_flag_is_set("base_specifiers")) {
   10077             :         fputs("moved base class ss entries for \"", f_debug);
   10078             :         db_type_name(type_ptr);
   10079             :         fputs("\":\n", f_debug);
   10080             :         db_ss_list(prev != NULL ?
   10081             :                       prev->next :
   10082             :                       scope_stack[depth_scope_stack].source_sequence_list);
   10083             :       }  /* if */
   10084             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   10085             :     }  /* if */
   10086             :   }  /* if */
   10087             : #endif /* TEMPLATE_INSTANTIATIONS_IN_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
   10088             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
   10089             : #if DEBUG
   10090             :   if (debug_level >= 3 || db_flag_is_set("base_specifiers")) {
   10091             :     db_base_class_list(type_ptr);
   10092             :   }  /* if */
   10093             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   10094             : #if EXPENSIVE_CHECKING
   10095             :   if (type_ptr->kind != (a_type_kind)tk_union) {
   10096             :     for (bcp = ctsp->base_classes; bcp != NULL; bcp = bcp->next) {
   10097             :       verify_path_consistency(type_ptr, bcp);
   10098             :       verify_virt_func_override_list(class_state, bcp);
   10099             :     }  /* for */
   10100             :   }  /* if */
   10101             : #endif /* EXPENSIVE_CHECKING */
   10102             : }  /* wrapup_base_classes */
   10103             : 
   10104             : 
   10105           0 : static a_boolean is_member_decl_start(void)
   10106             : /*
   10107             : Return TRUE if the current token looks like the start a member declaration
   10108             : of a C++ class, struct, or union or a C struct or union.
   10109             : */
   10110             : {
   10111           0 :   a_boolean     is_start = FALSE;
   10112             : 
   10113           0 :   if (is_type_start(/*is_expr_context=*/FALSE)) {
   10114             :     /* This is the only check required for C struct/union fields. */
   10115             :     is_start = TRUE;
   10116           0 :   } else if (C_dialect == C_dialect_cplusplus) {
   10117             :     /* C++ class/struct/union members can also start with one of the following
   10118             :        tokens. */
   10119           0 :     is_start = (curr_token == tok_static || curr_token == tok_typedef ||
   10120           0 :                 curr_token == tok_private || curr_token == tok_protected ||
   10121           0 :                 curr_token == tok_public || curr_token == tok_compl
   10122             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   10123             :                 || (cli_or_cx_enabled && curr_token == tok_not)
   10124             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   10125             :                                                             );
   10126             :   }  /* if */
   10127           0 :   return is_start;
   10128             : }  /* is_member_decl_start */
   10129             : 
   10130             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
   10131             : 
   10132             : #if !EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
   10133             : /*ARGSUSED*/ /* decl_info is not used in this case. */
   10134             : #endif /* !EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
   10135          16 : static void record_sse_for_special_friend_class(
   10136             :                                          a_type_ptr              friend_class,
   10137             :                                          a_member_decl_info_ptr  decl_info)
   10138             : /*
   10139             : Enter a secondary source sequence entry representing a friend declaration
   10140             : where either the class name is not expressed using an elaborated class name
   10141             : ("friend C;") or the class is dependent and therefore a "proxy" class that has
   10142             : no point of declaration per se.  friend_class points to the class denoted by
   10143             : the friend and decl_info describes the friend declaration overall.
   10144             : */
   10145             : {
   10146          16 :   if (!source_sequence_entries_disallowed) {
   10147             :     /* Since this type name did not involve an elaborated type name, we do not
   10148             :        yet have a source sequence entry for it. */
   10149          16 :     a_source_sequence_entry_ptr   ssep;
   10150          16 :     a_src_seq_secondary_decl_ptr  sssdp;
   10151          16 :     record_symbol_declaration(SRK_DECLARATION | SRK_FRIEND,
   10152          16 :                               symbol_for(friend_class),
   10153             :                               &locator_for_curr_id.source_position,
   10154             :                               (a_source_sequence_entry_ptr)NULL);
   10155          16 :     ssep = last_matching_source_sequence_entry((char *)friend_class);
   10156          16 :     check_assertion(ssep != NULL &&
   10157             :                     ss_entry_kind(ssep) == iek_src_seq_secondary_decl);
   10158          16 :     sssdp = ss_entry_ptr(ssep, a_src_seq_secondary_decl_ptr);
   10159          16 :     sssdp->friend_decl = TRUE;
   10160          16 :     sssdp->autonomous_tag_decl = TRUE;
   10161             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
   10162             :     /* Record extended position information. */
   10163          16 :     check_assertion(sssdp->decl_pos_info == NULL);
   10164          16 :     sssdp->decl_pos_info = make_decl_pos_supplement(
   10165          16 :                                                   in_file_scope(sssdp),
   10166          16 :                                                   &decl_info->decl_pos_block);
   10167             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
   10168             :   }  /* if */
   10169          16 : }  /* record_sse_for_special_friend_class */
   10170             : 
   10171             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
   10172             : 
   10173             : #if !GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
   10174             : /*ARGSUSED*/ /* for_friend_template is not used in some configurations. */
   10175             : #endif /* !GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
   10176         315 : void decl_friend_class(a_type_ptr  class_type,
   10177             :                        a_type_ptr  friend_class_type,
   10178             :                        a_boolean   for_friend_template)
   10179             : /*
   10180             : Do processing for declaring an entire class (friend_class_type) friend of the
   10181             : current class (class_type).  If for_friend_template is TRUE, the befriended
   10182             : class was generated from a friend template rather than specified through an
   10183             : ordinary friend class declaration.
   10184             : */
   10185             : {
   10186         315 :   a_class_list_entry_ptr       clep;
   10187         315 :   a_class_type_supplement_ptr  ctsp;
   10188             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
   10189         315 :   a_type_ptr                   declared_type = friend_class_type;
   10190             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
   10191             : 
   10192         315 :   if (is_error_type(friend_class_type)) {
   10193             :     /* Ignore it. */
   10194         315 :   } else if (!prototype_instantiations_in_il &&
   10195             :              class_type->variant.class_struct_union.is_nonreal_class) {
   10196             :     /* friend declarations are not processed during prototype instantiation
   10197             :        -- they're meaningless until a real instantiation is done. */
   10198             :   } else {
   10199             :     /* In non-strict mode (e.g., for cfront compatibility) it is sometimes
   10200             :        permitted to use a typedef name in the elaborated type specifier of
   10201             :        a friend class declaration as long as it refers to a class.  In
   10202             :        addition, declarations of the form "friend T", where T is a template
   10203             :        parameter, are permitted in class templates. */
   10204         315 :     friend_class_type = skip_typerefs(friend_class_type);
   10205         315 :     if (friend_class_type->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_template_param) {
   10206          16 :       friend_class_type = proxy_class_for_template_param(friend_class_type);
   10207             :     }  /* if */
   10208         315 :     check_assertion(is_immediate_class_type(friend_class_type));
   10209         315 :     if (class_type == friend_class_type &&
   10210           0 :         (scope_stack[depth_scope_stack].in_prototype_instantiation ||
   10211           0 :          !is_template_class_type(friend_class_type))) {
   10212             :       /* Diagnostic on excessive narcissism.  The diagnostic is not justified
   10213             :          on certain template cases, however.  For example:
   10214             :            template<class T> class C { friend class C<long>; ... };
   10215             :            template class C<long>;
   10216             :          The friend declaration might be needed if a member template of C
   10217             :          is specialized. */
   10218           0 :       pos_warning(ec_self_friendship, &error_position);
   10219             :     } else {
   10220         315 :       ctsp = friend_class_type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info;
   10221             :       /* Issue a remark if this is a duplicate friend declaration. */
   10222         467 :       for (clep = ctsp->befriending_classes; clep != NULL; clep = clep->next) {
   10223         152 :         if (clep->class_type == class_type) {

   10282             : 
   10283       34089 : static a_symbol_ptr member_function_redecl_sym_with_template_flag(
   10284             :                                        a_symbol_ptr          sym,
   10285             :                                        a_decl_parse_state    *dps,
   10286             :                                        a_template_param_ptr  templ_param_list,
   10287             :                                        a_boolean             templates_only,
   10288             :                                        a_symbol_ptr          *other_match)
   10289             : /*
   10290             : sym is a member function symbol or overloaded function symbol from a previous
   10291             : declaration.  *dps describes the current declaration.  If the new declaration
   10292             : is a function template, templ_param_list points to the template parameter list.
   10293             : Check the type dps->type for compatibility with sym or, if sym represents an
   10294             : overloaded function, with any of the instances.  If a match is found, return a
   10295             : pointer to the symbol.  If not, return NULL.  If other_match is non-NULL, set
   10296             : *other_match to an additional matching function if there is one (this can
   10297             : happen only with Microsoft-mode selective overriders) or to NULL otherwise.
   10298             : 
   10299             : If the routine type from the current declaration or one from the original
   10300             : declaration indicates that the function as a whole was qualified (e.g.,
   10301             : "int f(int) const"), then the type compatibility check must take the const
   10302             : qualification into account when seeking a match.  In other words, if one of
   10303             : the functions was so qualified, both must be for them to have compatible types.
   10304             : The qualification is indicated by a separate field "qualifiers" in the routine
   10305             : type supplement.  (Special care must be taken for nonstatic constexpr member
   10306             : functions: They are implicitly const, but we don't know whether the function
   10307             : is nonstatic until it matches a corresponding declaration in the class
   10308             : definition.)
   10309             : Otherwise, the type compatibility check is done based only on the return
   10310             : type and parameters; the type of the implicit "this" parameter, if any, is
   10311             : ignored.  This if for two reasons.  (1) When we are looking for a
   10312             : redeclaration within a class definition, two declarations with otherwise
   10313             : identical type signatures are not considered distinct because in one
   10314             : "static" is present and in the other it is not.  (2) When we are checking
   10315             : a member function definition that appears separately from the declaration
   10316             : in the class definition, there is no way for the user to specify whether
   10317             : it is a static or nonstatic member function; that can be determined only
   10318             : by looking back at the original declaration.  So, new_type cannot yet
   10319             : have a non-NULL this_class and the type match must be done without it.
   10320             : 
   10321             : When templates_only is TRUE, only function templates members are considered.
   10322             : */
   10323             : {
   10324       34089 :   a_boolean                      is_overloaded_function, match = FALSE;
   10325       34089 :   a_type_ptr                     new_type = dps->type;

   10540       17107 : a_symbol_ptr member_function_redecl_sym(
   10541             :                                 a_symbol_ptr          sym,
   10542             :                                 a_decl_parse_state    *dps,
   10543             :                                 a_template_param_ptr  templ_param_list,

   10545             : /*
   10546             : member_function_redecl_sym_with_template_flag does real processing for
   10547             : this routine.  See the header comment there.
   10548             : 
   10549             : When looking for a matching declaration the nesting depths are not considered.
   10550             : This allows us to produce the more helpful "nesting depths do not match"
   10551             : error instead of just a "no matching declaration" error.  It does mean,
   10552             : however, for the example below that a template declaration could match a
   10553             : nontemplate member of a template class.
   10554             : 
   10555             :   template<int N> struct A {
   10556             :     template <int M> int f();
   10557             :     int f();
   10558             :   };
   10559             :   
   10560             :   template<int N> template<int M> int A<N>::f(){ return M; }
   10561             :   template<int N> int A<N>::f(){ return 1; }
   10562             : 
   10563             : To prevent this, member_function_redecl_sym_with_template_flag is called
   10564             : twice; once to search for templates and again to search for nontemplates.
   10565             : */
   10566             : {
   10567       17107 :   a_symbol_ptr  result;
   10568             : 
   10569             :   /* First look for a matching template. */
   10570       17107 :   result = member_function_redecl_sym_with_template_flag(
   10571             :                      sym, dps, templ_param_list, /*templates_only=*/TRUE,
   10572             :                      other_match);
   10573       17107 :   if (result == NULL) {
   10574             :     /* No template was found, look for a normal member function. */
   10575       16982 :     result = member_function_redecl_sym_with_template_flag(
   10576             :                     sym, dps, templ_param_list, /*templates_only=*/FALSE,
   10577             :                     other_match);
   10578             :   }  /* if */
   10579       17107 :   return result;
   10580             : }  /* member_function_redecl_sym */

   10583         761 : void update_routine_type_exception_specification_if_needed(
   10584             :                                                          a_routine_ptr  rp,
   10585             :                                                          a_type_ptr     *p_tp)
   10586             : /*
   10587             : rp represents a function and *p_tp a type with which that function was
   10588             : declared.  If rp represents a destructor or operator delete and *p_tp does not
   10589             : include an exception specification, record in *p_tp the implied exception
   10590             : specification (for a destructor, the one that would be generated for a
   10591             : synthesized destructor if rp had not been declared explicitly).
   10592             : p_tp may equal &rp->type.
   10593             : */
   10594             : {
   10595             :   /* Implicit exception specifications are generated only if
   10596             :      implicit_noexcept_enabled is TRUE.  (They're not generated at all for
   10597             :      prototype instantiations.) */

   10599         761 :       !rp->is_prototype_instantiation) {
   10600         753 :     a_type_ptr  tp = *p_tp, old_tp;

   10602         753 :       a_routine_type_supplement_ptr  rtsp = tp->variant.routine.extra_info,

   10604         753 :       if (rtsp->exception_specification == NULL) {
   10605             :         /* No exception specification was supplied: Generate one if needed. */

   10608         481 :           if (special_kind_is(rp, sfk_operator) &&
   10609           0 :               is_delete_operator(rp->variant.opname_kind)) {

   10611             :                always noexcept. */

   10613         481 :           } else if (special_kind_is(rp, sfk_destructor)) {

   10616             :                prior exception specification is moved aside. */

   10619         481 :             saved_esp = old_rtsp->exception_specification;
   10620         481 :             old_rtsp->exception_specification = NULL;
   10621         481 :             form_exception_specification_for_generated_function(
   10622             :                                                       rp, (a_symbol_ptr)NULL);
   10623         481 :             if (p_tp == &rp->type) {
   10624             :               /* We're done: The exception specification was generated in
   10625             :                  rp->type. */
   10626             :             } else {

   10628             :                  restore the prior specification that was temporarily moved
   10629             :                  aside. */
   10630          16 :               rtsp->exception_specification =
   10631          16 :                                             old_rtsp->exception_specification;
   10632          16 :               old_rtsp->exception_specification = saved_esp;
   10633             :             }  /* if */
   10634             :           }  /* if */
   10635             :         } else {
   10636           0 :           expect_error();
   10637             :         }  /* if */
   10638             :       }  /* if */
   10639             :     } else {
   10640           0 :       expect_error();
   10641             :     }  /* if */
   10642             :   }  /* if */
   10643         761 : }  /* update_routine_type_exception_specification_if_needed */
   10644             : 
   10645             : 
   10646         698 : void update_friend_function_info(a_routine_ptr rout_ptr,
   10647             :                                  a_type_ptr    class_type)
   10648             : /*
   10649             : Update the list of befriending classes associated with rout_ptr to reflect
   10650             : that it is now a friend of class_type.  Also update class_type to indicate
   10651             : that the routine indicated by rout_ptr is a friend.
   10652             : */
   10653             : {
   10654         698 :   a_class_list_entry_ptr clep;
   10655         698 :   a_class_type_supplement_ptr ctsp;
   10656         698 :   a_routine_list_entry_ptr    rlep;
   10657             : 
   10658             :   /* Issue a remark if this is a duplicate friend declaration. */
   10659        1226 :   for (clep = rout_ptr->befriending_classes; clep != NULL; clep = clep->next) {
   10660         528 :     if (clep->class_type == class_type) {
   10661           0 :       pos_remark(ec_duplicate_friend_decl, &error_position);
   10662           0 :       break;

   10689             :   }  /* if */

   10693             : 
   10694          16 : void check_for_invalid_friend_declaration(
   10695             :                                         a_type_ptr              parent_type,
   10696             :                                         a_symbol_ptr            sym,
   10697             :                                         a_symbol_locator        *locator)
   10698             : /*
   10699             : g++ and Microsoft allow a friend declaration that refers to an undeclared
   10700             : member of a prototype instantiation.  For example:
   10701             : 
   10702             :   template <class T> struct A {
   10703             :     struct B {
   10704             :       friend void A::f();
   10705             :     };
   10706             :   };
   10707             : 
   10708             : When a construct like this is encountered in lookup, a nonreal class member
   10709             : is created for A<T>::f.  This routine detects the use of such a symbol
   10710             : and issues a warning.
   10711             : */
   10712             : {
   10713          16 :   if (locator->is_qualified_name &&
   10714             :       parent_type->variant.class_struct_union.is_prototype_instantiation) {
   10715           0 :     pos_stsy_warning(ec_not_a_member, &locator->source_position,
   10716           0 :                      sym->header->identifier,
   10717           0 :                      symbol_for(parent_type));
   10718             :   }  /* if */
   10719          16 : }  /* check_for_invalid_friend_declaration */
   10720             : 
   10721             : 
   10722             : #if !EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
   10723             : /*ARGSUSED*/  /* pos_info is not used in some configurations. */
   10724             : #endif /* !EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
   10725          28 : a_symbol_ptr decl_dependent_class_scope_function(
   10726             :                                         a_boolean               friend_decl,
   10727             :                                         a_boolean               expl_spec,
   10728             :                                         a_symbol_locator        *locator,
   10729             :                                         a_decl_parse_state      *dps,
   10730             :                                         a_func_info_block_ptr   func_info,
   10731             :                                         a_decl_pos_block        *pos_info)
   10732             : /*
   10733             : Create a routine and associated symbol for a template dependent function
   10734             : declaration of type dps->type appearing in class scope.  Although the
   10735             : declaration (and definition) of the function is template-dependent, it is not
   10736             : necessarily a template function (e.g., a friend function in a class template
   10737             : is an ordinary function).  The declaration is a friend declaration when
   10738             : friend_decl is TRUE and an (in-class) explicit specialization when expl_spec
   10739             : is TRUE.  The locator for the declarator and some extra declaration info are
   10740             : passed through locator, dps, func_info, and pos_info.  The routine symbol is
   10741             : returned (but not linked into the symbol table).  The routine entry itself is
   10742             : linked into the IL only if prototype instantiations are recorded in the IL.
   10743             : */
   10744             : {
   10745          28 :   a_type_ptr                    function_type = dps->type;
