   10909             : 
   10910             : 
   10911             : static a_symbol_ptr decl_friend_function(a_symbol_locator        *locator,
   10912             :                                          a_class_def_state_ptr   class_state,
   10913             :                                          a_func_info_block_ptr   func_info,
   10914             :                                          a_member_decl_info_ptr  decl_info)
   10915             : /*
   10916             : Do processing for declaring a function (identified by *locator and described
   10917             : by *func_info and *decl_info) friend of the current class (described through
   10918             : class_state).  Getting the correct symbol of a previously declared function
   10919             : means taking overloading into account.  For nonmember functions, this could
   10920             : be the initial declaration of the function, and again overloading is a
   10921             : possibility.
   10922             : */
   10923             : {
   10924             :   a_decl_parse_state           *state = &decl_info->decl_state;
   10925             :   a_type_ptr                   class_type = class_state->class_type;
   10926             :   a_type_ptr                   function_type = state->type;
   10927             :   a_symbol_ptr                 sym = NULL, ext_sym;
   10928             :   an_id_linkage_kind           linkage;
   10929             :   a_type_ptr                   old_type;
   10930             :   a_symbol_reference_kind      srk_flags;
   10931             :   a_source_sequence_entry_ptr  declarator_ssep = NULL;
   10932             : 
   10933             :   db_enter(3, "decl_friend_function");
   10934             :   if (is_template_dependent_context() &&
   10935             :       !scope_stack[depth_scope_stack].in_prototype_instantiation) {
   10936             :     /* Template dependent friend declarations should only be encountered in
   10937             :        prototype instantiation scopes, but severe syntax errors can get us
   10938             :        here nonetheless.  In that case we just skip the friend processing. */
   10939             :     set_to_named_error_locator(*locator);
   10940             :     discard_curr_construct_pragmas();
   10941             :   }  /* if */
   10942             :   if (!is_error_locator(*locator)) {
   10943             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   10944             :     if (ms_extensions) {
   10945             :       if (cppcli_enabled && is_immediate_managed_class_type(class_type)) {
   10946             :         /* Friend declarations cannot appear in C++/CLI managed classes. */
   10947             :         pos_error(ec_managed_class_cannot_have_friend, &state->start_pos);
   10948             :       } else if (class_type->variant.class_struct_union.is_interface) {
   10949             :         /* Friend declarations cannot appear in interface types. */
   10950             :         pos_error(ec_interface_cannot_have_friend, &state->start_pos);
   10951             :       }  /* if */
   10952             :       /* Microsoft Visual C++ 7.0 and earlier do not seem to instantiate the
   10953             :          body of a friend function definition as part of a class template
   10954             :          instantiation.  (Visual C++ 7.1 fixed that.) */
   10955             :       if (microsoft_version < 1310 && class_state->is_template_instantiation) {
   10956             :         func_info->is_definition = FALSE;
   10957             :       }  /* if */
   10958             :     }  /* if */
   10959             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   10960             :     sym = locator->specific_symbol;
   10961             :     if (sym == NULL && locator->is_template_id) {
   10962             :       /* If this is a template-id for which the symbol has not yet been
   10963             :          found, look it up now. */
   10964             :       an_id_lookup_options_set  idl_options = IDL_FRIEND_LOOKUP;
   10965             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   10966             :       if (cli_or_cx_enabled &&
   10967             :           state->declared_storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_static) {
   10968             :         idl_options |= IDL_IS_STATIC_DECL;
   10969             :       }  /* if */
   10970             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   10971             :       sym = normal_id_lookup(locator, idl_options);
   10972             :     }  /* if */
   10973             :     if (is_template_dependent_context()) {
   10974             :       if (func_info->is_definition && locator->is_qualified_name) {
   10975             :         /* A member function cannot be defined in a friend declaration. */
   10976             :         pos_sy_error(ec_bad_scope_for_definition,
   10977             :                      &locator->source_position, sym);
   10978             :         sym = NULL;
   10979             :         set_to_error_locator(*locator);
   10980             :       } else {
   10981             :         /* If the friend declaration appears in a template dependent context,
   10982             :            create a dummy routine and associated symbol.  Return that instead
   10983             :            of calling decl_routine. */
   10984             :         if (func_info->is_definition) {
   10985             :           state->is_definition = TRUE;
   10986             :         }  /* if */
   10987             :         sym = decl_dependent_class_scope_function(
   10988             :                                     /*friend_decl=*/TRUE, /*expl_spec=*/FALSE,
   10989             :                                     locator, state, func_info,
   10990             :                                     &decl_info->decl_pos_block);
   10991             :         state->sym = sym;
   10992             :         state->first_decl = TRUE;
   10993             :         goto decl_processed;
   10994             :       }  /* if */
   10995             :     }  /* if */
   10996             :   }  /* if */
   10997             :   if (!is_error_locator(*locator)) {
   10998             :     if (!no_access_check_on_friend_declarator_ids ||
   10999             :         (sym != NULL && sym->ambiguous)) {
   11000             :       /* Many compilers (Microsoft, GNU, ...) do not check access for the
   11001             :          declarator-id of a friend declaration. */
   11002             :       check_ambiguity_and_verify_access(locator);
   11003             :     }  /* if */
   11004             :     srk_flags = SRK_DECLARATION | SRK_FRIEND;
   11005             :     if (func_info->is_definition) srk_flags |= SRK_DEFINITION;
   11006             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
   11007             :     declarator_ssep = func_info->declarator_ssep;
   11008             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
   11009             :     if (microsoft_mode && sym != NULL && sym->is_class_member &&
   11010             :         sym->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_projection) {
   11011             :       /* Microsoft compilers allow naming inherited members; e.g.:
   11012             :            struct B { int f(); };
   11013             :            struct D: B {};
   11014             :            class X { friend int D::f(); };  // Okay in Microsoft mode.  */
   11015             :       reduce_projection_symbol_to_fundamental_symbol(sym);
   11016             :       if (is_member_function_symbol(sym) &&
   11017             :           function_type->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_routine &&
   11018             :           routine_type_is_nonstatic_member_function(function_type)) {
   11019             :         /* A qualified function type will have this_class set.  Adjust
   11020             :            this_class to the class inherited from. */
   11021             :         function_type->variant.routine.extra_info->this_class =
   11022             :                                                        sym->parent.class_type;
   11023             :       }  /* if */
   11024             :     }  /* if */
   11025             :     if (sym != NULL && sym->is_class_member &&
   11026             :         !is_member_function_symbol(sym)) {
   11027             :       /* If sym represents a member of a class, but it is not a member
   11028             :          function.  Issue an error. */
   11029             :       if (sym->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_projection) {
   11030             :         /* A member of a base class. */
   11031             :         pos_error(ec_inherited_member_not_allowed, &locator->source_position);
   11032             :       } else {
   11033             :         pos_sy_error(ec_not_compatible_with_previous_decl,
   11034             :                      &locator->source_position, sym);
   11035             :       }  /* if */
   11036             :       sym = NULL;

   11364             : static a_symbol_ptr symbol_for_member_function(
   11365             :                                    a_symbol_locator       *locator,
   11366             :                                    a_type_ptr             class_type,

   11368             :                                    a_member_decl_info_ptr decl_info,
   11369             :                                    a_symbol_ptr           *overload_sym)
   11370             : /*
   11371             : Return a pointer to an sk_member_function symbol to represent a function
   11372             : described by *locator and *decl_info.  If this is a redeclaration, the
   11373             : existing symbol is returned.  If this declaration overloads a function name,
   11374             : the symbol returned will be on the sk_overloaded_function symbol's list.  If
   11375             : there is an error in attempting to overload the function name, a new symbol
   11376             : is returned nonetheless, but it is not added to the list of overloaded
   11377             : function symbols.  In Microsoft mode, it is possible to declare several
   11378             : members of the same type, provided they explicitly override different
   11379             : virtual functions: The function explicitly overridden by this declaration

   11455             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */

   11569       17007 : void set_mixed_static_nonstatic_flag(a_symbol_ptr  overload_sym)
   11570             : /*

   11651         596 : static a_boolean types_of_decl_and_using_decl_conflict(a_symbol_ptr  decl_sym,
   11652             :                                                        a_symbol_ptr  using_sym,
   11653             :                                                        a_boolean     *err)
   11654             : /*
   11655             : decl_sym and using_sym represent routines in the same overload set, the
   11656             : former by direct declaration, the latter by a using declaration; compare
   11657             : their types and return TRUE if they conflict -- i.e., if they are too
   11658             : compatible to coexist in the same overload set.  There is special handling

   11660             : a diagnostic should be issued by the caller.

   11739       22256 : void check_for_conflicts_with_using_decls(a_symbol_ptr       overload_sym,
   11740             :                                           a_source_position  *pos)
   11741             : /*
   11742             : A function (either a member or nonmember function) has been declared and
   11743             : added to an overload list pointed to by overload_sym.  Check for conflicts
   11744             : between the newly declared function (which will head the overload list) and
   11745             : any other members of the overload set that have been introduced as a result
   11746             : of a using declaration.  For each case in which there's a conflict (there
   11747             : may be more than one), remove the using symbol from the overload list (so
   11748             : it won't cause ambiguity errors later), and if appropriate, issue an error,
   11749             : using *pos as the error position.
   11750             : */
   11751             : {
   11752       22256 :   a_symbol_ptr   decl_sym, sym, prev_in_overload_set, using_sym;
   11753       22256 :   a_boolean      err;
   11754       22256 :   a_symbol_kind  using_sym_kind;
   11755             : 
   11756       22256 :   db_enter(4, "check_for_conflicts_with_using_decls");
   11757             :   /* The first symbol on the overload list is the current declaration. */
   11758       22256 :   decl_sym = overload_sym->variant.overloaded_function.symbols;
   11759       22256 :   if (decl_sym->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_function_template) {
   11760             :     /* Ignore function templates. */
   11761             :   } else {
   11762       22256 :     if (decl_sym->is_class_member) {
   11763             :       /* It's a member function; we're looking for sk_projection symbols. */
   11764             :       using_sym_kind = (a_symbol_kind)sk_projection;
   11765             :     } else {
   11766             :       /* It's a nonmember function; we're looking for sk_namespace_projection
   11767             :          symbols. */
   11768        6550 :       using_sym_kind = (a_symbol_kind)sk_namespace_projection;
   11769             :     }  /* if */
   11770             :     /* Keep track of the previous symbol in the overload list, to enable
   11771             :        removing a symbol from the list. */
   11772       22256 :     prev_in_overload_set = decl_sym;
   11773       70933 :     for (sym = decl_sym->next; sym != NULL; sym = prev_in_overload_set->next) {
   11774       48677 :       if (sym->kind == using_sym_kind) {
   11775             :         /* Found a projection symbol.  Get the fundamental symbol so the types
   11776             :            can be compared. */
   11777         314 :         using_sym = fundamental_symbol_of(sym);
   11778             :         /* Check for a conflict between the type of the newly declared function

   11817             : 
   11818         738 : static a_symbol_ptr special_subobject_function_symbol(
   11819             :                                         a_type_ptr               class_type,
   11820             :                                         a_special_function_kind  sfkind,
   11821             :                                         a_param_type_ptr         first_param,
   11822             :                                         a_type_qualifier_set     subobj_qual,
   11823             :                                         a_source_position        *source_pos,
   11824             :                                         a_boolean                *ambiguous)
   11825             : /*
   11826             : Find a member function (a constructor, destructor, or assignment operator,
   11827             : as indicated by sfkind) whose parent class is class_type selected to perform
   11828             : an operation on a class-type subobject for a generated special function.
   11829             : first_param, which will be non-NULL for copy/move constructors and assignment
   11830             : operators, represents the first parameter of the generated member function.
   11831             : In the case of an assignment operator, subobj_qual is the qualification of the
   11832             : subobject to be copied (TQ_NONE for a base class subobject, but possibly
   11833             : different for a field subobject).  source_pos is a source position, used as
   11834             : the point of instantiation if a template ends up being instantiated.  If the
   11835             : lookup is successful, return a pointer to the symbol; otherwise, return NULL.
   11836             : If there is more than one matching function, set *ambiguous to TRUE.
   11837             : */
   11838             : {
   11839         738 :   a_symbol_ptr          sym = NULL;
   11840         738 :   a_boolean             class_bitwise_copy, is_move = FALSE;
   11841         738 :   a_type_qualifier_set  qualifiers = TQ_NONE;
   11842             : 
   11843         738 :   *ambiguous = FALSE;
   11844         738 :   if (is_incomplete_type(class_type) ||
   11845         738 :       !is_immediate_class_type(class_type)) {
   11846             :     /* An error of some short. */
   11847             :     sym = NULL;
   11848             :   } else {
   11849         738 :     a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr cssp;
   11850         738 :     cssp = symbol_supplement_for_class(class_type);
   11851         738 :     if (first_param != NULL) {
   11852             :       /* A copy constructor or an assignment operator.  If the parameter is
   11853             :          of reference type, the qualifier underneath the reference is
   11854             :          significant. */
   11855         312 :       a_type_ptr  tp = first_param->type;
   11856         312 :       if (is_any_reference_type(tp)) {
   11857             :         /* Reference argument. */
   11858         312 :         is_move = is_rvalue_reference_type(tp);
   11859         312 :         tp = type_pointed_to(tp);
   11860         312 :         qualifiers = get_type_qualifiers(tp);
   11861             :       }  /* if */
   11862             :     }  /* if */
   11863         738 :     switch (sfkind) {
   11864         196 :       case sfk_constructor:
   11865         196 :         if (first_param == NULL) {
   11866             :           /* Default constructor. */
   11867          32 :           sym = find_default_constructor(class_type,
   11868             :                                          /*include_templates=*/TRUE,
   11869             :                                          /*declarative_context=*/TRUE,
   11870             :                                          /*no_explicit=*/FALSE,
   11871             :                                          source_pos, ambiguous,
   11872             :                                          (a_symbol **)NULL,
   11873             :                                          (a_boolean *)NULL);
   11874             :         } else {
   11875             :           /* Copy constructor. */
   11876         164 :           sym = find_copy_constructor(class_type, qualifiers, is_move,
   11877             :                                       source_pos, ambiguous, (a_symbol **)NULL,
   11878             :                                       &class_bitwise_copy);
   11879             :         }  /* if */
   11880             :         break;
   11881         394 :       case sfk_destructor:
   11882             :         /* Destructor. */
   11883         394 :         sym = cssp->destructor;
   11884         394 :         break;
   11885             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   11886             :       case sfk_static_constructor:
   11887             :         check_assertion(cli_or_cx_enabled);
   11888             :         sym = cssp->static_constructor;
   11889             :         break;

   11894             :         break;

   11927         738 :   return sym;

   11929             : 
   11930             : 
   11931             : static a_boolean merge_exception_specifications(a_symbol_ptr  sym,
   11932             :                                                 a_type_ptr    new_rout_type)
   11933             : /*
   11934             : Update the exception specification of new_rout_type to reflect the exceptions
   11935             : that might be thrown by a call to the member function indicated by sym.  If
   11936             : that member function can throw any exception, return TRUE.
   11937             : */
   11938             : {
   11939             :   a_boolean                            throw_any, is_noexcept;
   11940             :   an_exception_specification_ptr       old_esp, new_esp;
   11941             :   an_exception_specification_type_ptr  old_estp, estp;
   11942             :   a_routine_ptr                        rp;
   11943             :   a_type_ptr                           rtp;
   11944             :   a_routine_type_supplement_ptr        old_rtsp, rtsp;
   11945             : 
   11946             :   check_assertion(sym->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_member_function);
   11947             :   rp = sym->variant.routine.ptr;
   11948             :   rtp = rp->type;
   11949             :   old_rtsp = rtp->variant.routine.extra_info;
   11950             :   if (rp->is_defaulted && !rp->is_deleted && !rp->defined_outside_of_parent &&
   11951             :       old_rtsp->exception_specification == NULL) {
   11952             :     /* A defaulted special member with no exception specification.  Make sure
   11953             :        the exception specification is generated. */
   11954             :     form_exception_specification_for_generated_function(
   11955             :                                                       rp, (a_symbol_ptr)NULL);

   11957             :   instantiate_exception_spec_if_needed(sym);
   11958             :   /* Fetch the exception specification associated with the member function
   11959             :      indicated by sym. */

   11962             :     /* A special member whose exception specification isn't determined yet.

   11965             :     old_esp = old_rtsp->exception_specification;

   11968             :     /* The function can throw any exception. */
   11969             :     throw_any = TRUE;
   11970             :   } else {
   11971             :     throw_any = FALSE;
   11972             :     if (exc_spec_in_func_type) {
   11973             :       /* Dynamic exception specifications are discarded.  So, don't attempt
   11974             :          to merge them. */
   11975             :       goto done;
   11976             :     }  /* if */

   11987             :       rtsp->exception_specification = new_esp;
   11988             :     }  /* if */
   11989             :     is_noexcept = is_nothrow_type(rtp);

   11995             :       for (; old_estp != NULL; old_estp = old_estp->next) {
   11996             :         if (old_estp->redundant) {
   11997             :           /* Skip it. */
   11998             :         } else {
   11999             :           /* See if it's already on the list. */
   12000             :           estp = new_esp->variant.exception_specification_type_list;

   12026             : 
   12027             : static void ensure_all_field_initializers_scanned(a_type_ptr  class_type);

   12029             : 
   12030         980 : static void form_exception_specification_for_generated_function(
   12031             :                                                          a_routine_ptr  rp,
   12032             :                                                          a_symbol_ptr   bctor)
   12033             : /*
   12034             : Synthesize an exception specification for the implicitly declared (i.e.,
   12035             : compiler-generated) member function rp -- a constructor, destructor, or
   12036             : assignment operator.  The synthesized exception specification is the union of
   12037             : all exception specifications for the routines that will be called when the
   12038             : definition of the compiler-generated member function is finally put out.  For
   12039             : instance, if a destructor is implicitly generated, it is assumed to throw all
   12040             : exceptions that any destructor it calls (for a base class or nonstatic data
   12041             : member) is able to throw.  bctor is non-NULL only for inheriting constructors:
   12042             : It indicates which base constructor generated the inheriting constructor.
   12043             : This routine is only called in C++ mode and only when exception support is
   12044             : enabled.
   12045             : */
   12046             : {
   12047         980 :   a_special_function_kind  sfkind = rp->special_kind;
   12048         980 :   a_type_ptr               rout_type = rp->type,
   12049         980 :                            class_type = parent_class_of(rp);
   12050         980 :   a_routine_type_supplement_ptr
   12051         980 :                            rtsp = rout_type->variant.routine.extra_info;
   12052         980 :   a_base_class_ptr         bcp;
   12053         980 :   a_field_ptr              fp;
   12054         980 :   a_type_ptr               tp, generating_base_type;
   12055         980 :   a_symbol_ptr             sym;
   12056         980 :   a_boolean                throw_any = FALSE;

   12058         980 :   a_param_type_ptr         first_param;

   12069         980 :     first_param = rtsp->param_type_list;

   12187             : 
   12188         600 : a_boolean conflicts_with_previous_function_decl(a_symbol_ptr       using_sym,
   12189             :                                                 a_symbol_ptr       sym,
   12190             :                                                 a_source_position  *pos)
   12191             : /*
   12192             : using_sym is a function symbol referred to by a using-declaration, either a
   12193             : member of base class or a member of a namespace.  Unless it conflicts with a
   12194             : function previously declared in the current scope, a projection symbol will
   12195             : be created for it and it will be added to an overload list involving sym
   12196             : (which may be an overload symbol).  Look for such a conflict, returning TRUE
   12197             : if one if found.  In some cases a diagnostic should be issued; use *pos
   12198             : as the error position.
   12199             : */
   12200             : {
   12201         600 :   a_boolean      conflicts = FALSE;
   12202         600 :   a_boolean      is_list = FALSE;
   12203         600 :   a_boolean      err;
   12204             :   
   12205         600 :   if (symbol_is(using_sym, sk_function_template) ||
   12206             :       symbol_is(using_sym, sk_constant)) {
   12207             :     /* No need to do a check on function templates or nonreal members. */
   12208             :   } else {
   12209         430 :     if (symbol_is(sym, sk_overloaded_function)) {
   12210             :       /* We need to search an overload set. */
   12211         317 :       is_list = TRUE;
   12212         317 :       sym = sym->variant.overloaded_function.symbols;
   12213             :     }  /* if */
   12214         430 :     check_assertion(using_sym->is_class_member ?
   12215             :                       symbol_is(using_sym, sk_member_function) :
   12216             :                       symbol_is(using_sym, sk_routine));
   12217             :     /* Go through all function declarations in the current scope with the
   12218             :        same name.  Ignore projection symbols. */
   12219        1371 :     for (; sym != NULL; sym = is_list ? sym->next : NULL) {
   12220         941 :       if (sym->kind == using_sym->kind) {
   12221             :         /* Check for a conflict between the type of the previously declared
   12222             :            function (sym) and the type for which a projection symbol is about
   12223             :            to be created (using_sym). */
   12224         564 :         if ((microsoft_mode || gpp_mode) && symbol_is(using_sym, sk_routine) &&
   12225         282 :             compatible_functions_with_c_linkage(using_sym, sym)) {
   12226             :           /* In Microsoft and GNU modes, extern "C" functions from different
   12227             :              namespaces create different entities even if they have the same
   12228             :              name and type.  However, two such entities do not conflict if
   12229             :              they are brought in the same scope with a using-declaration. */

   12239             :                           using_sym, sym);

   12242             :           break;

   12246             :           /* A prior using declaration refers to the very same base class

   12264             : 
   12265             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   12266             : 
   12267             : void merge_dll_flags_from_parent_class(a_type_ptr          class_type,
   12268             :                                        a_decl_parse_state  *dps)
   12269             : /*
   12270             : class_type is the type of the current class, in which the decl_modifiers
   12271             : field may have been set to indicate modifiers for the class as a whole, and
   12272             : a field in *dps represents the modifiers declared for the current member.
   12273             : Check for compatibility regarding the DM_DLLIMPORT/DM_DLLEXPORT flags and
   12274             : update *dps based on the two.
   12275             : */
   12276             : {
   12277             :   a_decl_modifier  decl_modifiers, class_decl_modifiers;
   12278             : 
   12279             :   class_decl_modifiers = class_type_supp(class_type)->decl_modifiers;
   12280             :   /* Only dllimport and dllexport are applied to members, so strip off any
   12281             :      others that may have been declared for the class as a whole (e.g.,
   12282             :      novtable). */
   12283             :   class_decl_modifiers &= DM_DLLFLAGS;
   12284             :   if (class_decl_modifiers != DM_NONE) {
   12285             :     decl_modifiers = dps->decl_modifiers.flags;
   12286             :     if (decl_modifiers & DM_DLLFLAGS) {
   12287             :       /* If there are dll modifiers on the class, they cannot appear on the
   12288             :          member declaration, too. */
   12289             :       pos_diagnostic(es_discretionary_error,
   12290             :                      ec_class_and_member_have_dll_interface, &dps->start_pos);
   12291             :       decl_modifiers &= ~(a_decl_modifier)DM_DLLFLAGS;
   12292             :     }  /* if */
   12293             :     if (dps->is_definition && (class_decl_modifiers & DM_DLLIMPORT)) {
   12294             :       /* Put no dll attribute on an inline member function. */
   12295             :     } else {
   12296             :       /* Merge the sets of flags. */
   12297             :       decl_modifiers |= class_decl_modifiers;
   12298             :     }  /* if */
   12299             :     dps->decl_modifiers.flags = decl_modifiers;
   12300             :   }  /* if */
   12301             : }  /* merge_dll_flags_from_parent_class */
   12302             : 
   12303             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   12304             : 
   12305       13757 : static void record_assignment_operator_in_class_symbol(
   12306             :                                  a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr  cssp,

   12327        4528 : void check_member_decl_is_copy_constructor(
   12328             :                                 a_routine_ptr           rout_ptr,
   12329             :                                 a_type_ptr              class_type,
   12330             :                                 a_boolean               compiler_generated)
   12331             : /*

   12333             : a move constructor.  Update the flags in the class symbol supplement

   12357             :          involve a trivial copy constructor even though after overload
   12358             :          resolution that may still be the case.  For example:
   12359             :              struct S {
   12360             :                S(S const&) = default;  // Trivial.
   12361             :                S(S&);                  // Nontrivial.
   12362             :              };

   12364             :          so that it reflects whether generated/defaulted copy constructors
   12365             :          would be trivial (see also mark_trivial_special_members). */
   12366         264 :       cssp->has_user_provided_copy_constructor = TRUE;
   12367             :     }  /* if */
   12368        3395 :   } else if (!compiler_generated && routine_is_move_constructor(rout_ptr)) {

   12371         179 :       cssp->has_user_provided_move_constructor = TRUE;
   12372             :     }  /* if */

   12390        6328 : a_boolean is_assignment_operator_for_copy(
   12391             :                                    a_symbol_ptr          sym,
   12392             :                                    a_boolean             move_assign_okay,
   12393             :                                    a_boolean             *is_ref_arg,
   12394             :                                    a_type_qualifier_set  *qualifiers,
   12395             :                                    a_boolean             *is_base_class_match)
   12396             : /*
   12397             : Return TRUE if sym, an sk_member_function symbol for an operator= function,
   12398             : qualifies as a "copy assignment operator" that can copy a class object.
   12399             : It qualifies if its first parameter has a type of "A", "A&", or "A const&",
   12400             : where "A" is the class of which it is a member.  If move_assign_okay is TRUE,
   12401             : the parameter can also have type "A&&" or "A const&&".  (In cfront
   12402             : compatibility mode, sym also qualifies if the first parameter involves type B
   12403             : where B is a base class of A.)  Set *is_ref_arg to TRUE if the first
   12404             : parameter is a reference type.  Set *qualifiers based on how the first
   12405             : parameter is qualified.  Return *is_base_class_match set to TRUE for the
   12406             : cfront compatibility case.  is_ref_arg, qualifiers, and/or is_base_class_match
   12407             : can be NULL if the corresponding bit of information is not needed by the
   12408             : caller.
   12409             : */

   12411        6328 :   a_boolean  found;
   12412        6328 :   a_type_ptr routine_type;

   12453             : 
   12454             : static a_boolean check_virtual_interface_member(a_class_def_state  *state,
   12455             :                                                 a_routine_ptr      rtn,
   12456             :                                                 a_symbol_locator   *locator)
   12457             : /*
   12458             : The given routine is being declared in a class type described by state.  Return
   12459             : whether the member should be (pure) virtual because it appears in an interface
   12460             : type.  If the current class is an interface type, issue an error for member
   12461             : functions that cannot be (user-) declared in interface class types.  If the
   12462             : current class is not an interface, state->potentially_interface_like may be
   12463             : set to FALSE (and FALSE is always returned).
   12464             : */
   12465             : {
   12466             :   a_boolean   is_implicitly_pure_virtual = FALSE, in_interface;
   12467             :   a_type_ptr  type = state->class_type;
   12468             : 
   12469             :   in_interface = (type->variant.class_struct_union.is_interface ||
   12470             :                   cli_class_type_kind_is(type, cctk_interface));
   12471             :   if (in_interface || state->potentially_interface_like) {
   12472             :     switch (rtn->special_kind) {
   12473             :       case sfk_none:
   12474             :         is_implicitly_pure_virtual = in_interface;
   12475             :         break;
   12476             :       case sfk_constructor:
   12477             :       case sfk_destructor:
   12478             :         if (!rtn->compiler_generated) {
   12479             :           if (in_interface) {
   12480             :             pos_error(ec_interface_cannot_have_ctor_or_dtor,
   12481             :                       &locator->source_position);
   12482             :           } else {
   12483             :             state->potentially_interface_like = FALSE;
   12484             :           }  /* if */
   12485             :         }  /* if */
   12486             :         break;
   12487             :       case sfk_conversion:
   12488             :       case sfk_operator:
   12489             :         if (!rtn->compiler_generated) {
   12490             :           if (cli_class_type_kind_is(type, cctk_interface)) {
   12491             :             /* C++/CLI interfaces cannot have an operator= member. */
   12492             :             if (rtn->variant.opname_kind == (an_opname_kind)onk_assign) {
   12493             :               pos_error(ec_cli_interface_cannot_have_assignment,
   12494             :                         &locator->source_position);
   12495             :             }  /* if */
   12496             :           } else if (type->variant.class_struct_union.is_interface) {
   12497             :             /* Old-style __interface classes cannot have any member operator
   12498             :                at all. */
   12499             :             pos_error(ec_interface_cannot_have_operator,
   12500             :                       &locator->source_position);
   12501             :           } else {
   12502             :             state->potentially_interface_like = FALSE;
   12503             :           }  /* if */
   12504             :           is_implicitly_pure_virtual = in_interface;
   12505             :         }  /* if */
   12506             :         break;
   12507             :       case sfk_static_constructor:
   12508             :       case sfk_property_get:
   12509             :       case sfk_property_set:
   12510             :       case sfk_event_add:
   12511             :       case sfk_event_remove:
   12512             :       case sfk_event_raise:
   12513             :         /* Static constructors, properties, and events are allowed on C++/CLI
   12514             :            managed interface types (e.g. "interface class"), but not on
   12515             :            non-CLI "__interface" types.  (Static interface constructors are
   12516             :            not implicitly pure virtual and need not be implemented by derived

   12539             :   return is_implicitly_pure_virtual;

   12541             : 
   12542             : 
   12543             : static a_symbol_ptr interface_slot_override(a_symbol_locator       *loc,
   12544             :                                             a_symbol_ptr           base_sym)
   12545             : /*
   12546             : A member function was declared with the qualified declarator described by loc,
   12547             : and the qualifier refers to a Microsoft __interface class.  The interface
   12548             : inherits (i.e., does not itself declare) the corresponding member function
   12549             : described by base_sym.
   12550             : Return (and, if needed, create) a special member function (an "interface slot")
   12551             : in the interface class that the function entry in the derived class can refer
   12552             : to (with its overridden_functions field).
   12553             : (Note: There is no counterpart for this in C++/CLI interface classes.)
   12554             : */
   12555             : {
   12556             :   a_symbol_ptr      result = NULL;
   12557             :   a_routine_ptr     rp;
   12558             :   a_routine_ptr     base_rp = base_sym->variant.routine.ptr;
   12559             :   a_type_ptr        parent_class = qualifier_class_type(*loc), rp_type;
   12560             :   a_scope_ptr       parent_scope = class_type_supp(parent_class)->assoc_scope;
   12561             : 
   12562             :   check_assertion(is_interface_like(sym_parent_class(base_sym)) &&
   12563             :                   base_rp->pure_virtual);
   12564             :   /* First look through the routines list of parent_class to see if we
   12565             :      already created the required entry. */
   12566             :   for (rp = parent_scope->routines; rp != NULL; rp = rp->next) {
   12567             :     if (rp->interface_slot &&
   12568             :         rp->overridden_functions->entity.ptr == (char*)base_rp) {
   12569             :       check_assertion(symbol_for(rp)->header == loc->symbol_header &&
   12570             :                       rp->pure_virtual);
   12571             :       check_assertion(rp->virtual_function_number ==
   12572             :                                             base_rp->virtual_function_number);
   12573             :       result = symbol_for(rp);
   12574             :       break;
   12575             :     }  /* if */
   12576             :   }  /* for */
   12577             :   if (result == NULL) {
   12578             :     /* Create a new interface entry slot (routine entry and associated symbol).
   12579             :        Note that since parent_class is complete (i.e., its scope is not on the
   12580             :        scope stack), we cannot call some of the more common routines to
   12581             :        enter and initialize the symbol. */
   12582             :     result = alloc_symbol((a_symbol_kind)sk_member_function,
   12583             :                           loc->symbol_header, &loc->source_position);
   12584             :     result->decl_scope = parent_scope->number;
   12585             :     rp_type = copy_routine_type_with_param_types(base_rp->type,
   12586             :                                                  /*copy_default_args=*/FALSE);
   12587             :     rp_type->variant.routine.extra_info->this_class = parent_class;
   12588             :     rp = make_routine(rp_type, (a_storage_class)sc_extern, NO_SCOPE_DEPTH);
   12589             :     rp->next = parent_scope->routines;
   12590             :     parent_scope->routines = rp;
   12591             :     result->variant.routine.ptr = rp;
   12592             :     rp->source_corresp.assoc_info = (char*)result;
   12593             :     set_source_corresp_name(&rp->source_corresp, result->header);
   12594             :     set_class_membership(result, &rp->source_corresp, parent_class);
   12595             :     rp->source_corresp.is_local_to_function =
   12596             :                             parent_class->source_corresp.is_local_to_function;
   12597             :     rp->interface_slot = TRUE;
   12598             :     rp->is_virtual = TRUE;
   12599             :     /* Don't call make_virtual_function_pure, because "interface slots" should
   12600             :        not cause the parent class' any_pure_virtual_functions flag to become
   12601             :        TRUE. */
   12602             :     rp->pure_virtual = TRUE;
   12603             :     rp->virtual_function_number = base_rp->virtual_function_number;
   12604             :     check_assertion(curr_il_region_number == file_scope_region_number);
   12605             :     rp->overridden_functions = alloc_il_entity_list_entry();
   12606             :     rp->overridden_functions->entity.kind = (a_byte_il_entry_kind)iek_routine;
   12607             :     rp->overridden_functions->entity.ptr = (char*)base_rp;
   12608             :     rp->compiler_generated = TRUE;
   12609             :     /* The symbol must be entered in the symbol table so it can be encountered
   12610             :        by check_for_virtual_override, but it shouldn't be found by name
   12611             :        lookup. */
   12612             :     result->is_invisible = TRUE;
   12613             :     enter_symbol_into_completed_class(result);
   12614             :   }  /* if */
   12615             :   return result;
   12616             : }  /* interface_slot_override */
   12617             : 
   12618             : 
   12619             : static a_symbol_ptr find_explicitly_overridden_member(
   12620             :                                            a_symbol_locator       *locator,
   12621             :                                            a_class_def_state_ptr  class_state,
   12622             :                                            a_decl_parse_state     *dps)
   12623             : /*
   12624             : A member function declaration described by *dps uses a qualified declarator
   12625             : described by locator.  class_state describes the class in which the member is
   12626             : being declared. This is a microsoft extension to select a virtual function
   12627             : from a particular base class type to be overridden.  Return that function or
   12628             : NULL if none can be found.
   12629             : */
   12630             : {
   12631             :   a_symbol_ptr   result = NULL;
   12632             :   a_type_ptr     class_type = class_state->class_type;
   12633             :   a_type_ptr     parent_class = qualifier_class_type(*locator);
   12634             : 
   12635             :   if (!locator->is_class_member ||
   12636             :       (!is_same_class_or_base_class_thereof(class_type, parent_class) &&
   12637             :        !is_template_dependent_type(parent_class))) {
   12638             :     /* The qualifier was not a base class: Issue an error. */
   12639             :     pos_ty_error(ec_qualifier_must_be_base_class, &locator->source_position,
   12640             :                  class_type);
   12641             :   } else if (same_entities(parent_class, class_type)) {
   12642             :     /* The qualifier was the class being defined.  This corresponds to a
   12643             :        different Microsoft bug/extension.  Nothing needs to be done here. */
   12644             :   } else if (locator->specific_symbol != NULL &&
   12645             :              locator->specific_symbol->ambiguous) {
   12646             :     pos_sy_error(ec_ambiguous_name, &locator->source_position,
   12647             :                  locator->specific_symbol);
   12648             :   } else {
   12649             :     a_symbol_ptr  sym = class_qualified_id_lookup(locator, parent_class,
   12650             :                                                   IDL_DO_NOT_CREATE_PROJ_SYM);
   12651             :     if (sym != NULL) {
   12652             :       if (is_member_function_symbol(sym)) {
   12653             :         /* The qualified declarator identified a known member function. */
   12654             :         dps->is_explicit_override = TRUE;
   12655             :         sym = member_function_redecl_sym_with_template_flag(
   12656             :                                                     sym, dps,
   12657             :                                                     (a_template_param_ptr)NULL,
   12658             :                                                     /*templates_only=*/FALSE,
   12659             :                                                     (a_symbol_ptr*)NULL);
   12660             :         if (sym != NULL) {
   12661             :           a_type_ptr  sym_parent = sym_parent_class(sym);
   12662             :           if (is_interface_like(sym_parent) && sym_parent != parent_class) {
   12663             :             /* Lookup might have found an inherited member.  That is okay if
   12664             :                the member is inherited from an interface class, but the
   12665             :                recorded base must be a proper member of the designated base
   12666             :                class. */
   12667             :             sym = interface_slot_override(locator, sym);
   12668             :           }  /* if */
   12669             :           if (!sym->variant.routine.ptr->is_virtual ||
   12670             :               !sym->variant.routine.ptr->pure_virtual) {
   12671             :             pos_error(ec_invalid_selective_overrider_declaration,
   12672             :                       &locator->source_position);
   12673             :           } else {
   12674             :             result = sym;
   12675             :           }  /* if */
   12676             :         }  /* if */
   12677             :       } else if (is_nontype_template_param_symbol(sym) &&
   12678             :                  sym->variant.constant->variant.template_param.kind ==
   12679             :                                 (a_template_param_constant_kind)tpck_member) {
   12680             :         /* A reference to a dependent base member. */
   12681             :         result = sym;
   12682             :       } else {
   12683             :         sym = NULL;
   12684             :       }  /* if */
   12685             :     }  /* if */
   12686             :     if (sym == NULL) {
   12687             :       pos_error(ec_invalid_selective_overrider_declaration,
   12688             :                 &locator->source_position);
   12689             :     }  /* if */
   12690             :   }  /* if */
   12691             :   return result;
   12692             : }  /* find_explicitly_overridden_member */
   12693             : 
   12694             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
   12695             : #if TEMPLATE_INSTANTIATIONS_IN_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
   12696             : #if FRIEND_AND_MEMBER_DEFINITIONS_MAY_BE_MOVED_OUT_OF_CLASS
   12697             : 
   12698             : a_boolean microsoft_routine_def_is_unmovable(a_boolean  explicit_overrider)
   12699             : /*
   12700             : Microsoft C++ allows some extended forms of member function definitions that
   12701             : cannot be moved outside a class definition.  The first case are members
   12702             : declared with a qualified name to indicate that overriding is limited to a
   12703             : specific base class (there is no syntax to define such functions outside their
   12704             : parent class definition).  The second are members defined in delayed nested
   12705             : class definitions that appear in class scope.  For example:
   12706             :     struct A {
   12707             :       struct B {
   12708             :         struct C;
   12709             :       };
   12710             :       struct B::C {
   12711             :         void f() {};
   12712             :       } x;
   12713             :     };
   12714             : The definition of A::B::C::f() cannot be placed immediately after the
   12715             : definition of A::B::C, nor after the definition of A.
   12716             : Return TRUE if the current declaration is such a member or friend that cannot
   12717             : be moved.  explicit_overrider is TRUE if the current declaration is an
   12718             : explicit overrider (which means this routine will return TRUE).
   12719             : */
   12720             : {
   12721             :   a_boolean   result = FALSE;
   12722             :   a_type_ptr  class_type;
   12723             : 
   12724             :   check_assertion(scope_stack_top().kind ==
   12725             :                                          (a_scope_kind)sck_class_struct_union);
   12726             :   class_type = scope_stack_top().assoc_type;
   12727             :   if (explicit_overrider && !is_immediate_managed_class_type(class_type)) {
   12728             :     /* An explicitly overridden function cannot be defined outside its parent
   12729             :        class (except in C++/CLI managed class types, which use a different
   12730             :        explicit overriding syntax).  */
   12731             :     result = TRUE;
   12732             :   } else {
   12733             :     if (class_type->source_corresp.is_class_member) {
   12734             :       /* A member or friend of a nested class.  If it we are in a delayed
   12735             :          nested class definition that appears in a class scope, we should not
   12736             :          attempt to move the member definition outside the class, because it
   12737             :          cannot appear there. */
   12738             :       a_scope_depth  d = depth_scope_stack - 1;
   12739             :       a_boolean      in_reactivated_class =
   12740             :                  (scope_stack[d].kind == (a_scope_kind)sck_class_reactivation);

   12761        9885 : static a_boolean assignment_operator_for_copy_exists(
   12762             :                                             a_symbol_ptr  sym,

   12765             :                                             a_boolean     *p_const_okay)
   12766             : /*

   12768             : can copy a class object (if move_assign_okay is TRUE, also consider move

   12833             : static a_boolean default_assignment_of_const_object_okay(a_type_ptr class_type)
   12834             : /*
   12835             : We are about to declare a compiler-generated or an explicitly-defaulted copy
   12836             : assignment operator for the given class type.  Return whether it can copy a
   12837             : const object.  This is dependent on the assignment operators defined for base
   12838             : classes and fields of the given class.

   12895         318 : static a_boolean constructor_can_be_defaulted(a_symbol_ptr  sym,
   12896             :                                               a_boolean     *is_default_ctor,
   12897             :                                               a_boolean     *has_default_arg)
   12898             : /*
   12899             : sym is a constructor.  Return whether it can be "defaulted".  I.e., if its
   12900             : parent class is X, it must have one of the following signatures and not include
   12901             : a default argument:
   12902             :         X()
   12903             :         X(X&)
   12904             :         X(X const&)
   12905             :         X(X&&)
   12906             : If the signature is the first in the list above, set *is_default_ctor to TRUE;
   12907             : otherwise set it to FALSE.  If the signature is one of the latter three and the
   12908             : parameter has an associated default argument set *has_default_arg to TRUE (and
   12909             : return FALSE); otherwise, set *has_default_arg to FALSE.  The last signature
   12910             : ("move constructor") can only be defaulted in modes that can generate move
   12911             : constructors and in some GNU C++ modes.
   12912             : */

   12914         318 :   a_boolean         result = FALSE;

   12917             :

   12968         256 : static a_boolean assignment_operator_can_be_defaulted(a_symbol_ptr  sym)
   12969             : /*
   12970             : sym is an assignment operator.  Check if it can be "defaulted".  I.e., if its
   12971             : parent class is X, it must have one of the following signatures:

   13028       46264 : void check_defaulted_or_deleted_function(a_decl_parse_state  *dps,
   13029             :                                          a_func_info_block   *func_info,
   13030             :                                          a_source_position   *def_pos)

   13141       38502 : static void copy_gnu_class_properties_to_routine(a_type_ptr     class_type,
   13142             :                                                  a_routine_ptr  routine)
   13143             : /*
   13144             : routine is a member function of class_type.  Copy any properties of class_type
   13145             : (specified by GNU attributes) that should be propagated to its member
   13146             : functions.
   13147             : */
   13148             : {
   13149             : #if GNU_VISIBILITY_ATTRIBUTE_ALLOWED
   13150       38502 :   if (routine->ELF_visibility == (an_ELF_visibility_kind)evk_unspecified) {
   13151       38502 :     routine->ELF_visibility = class_type_supp(class_type)->ELF_visibility;
   13152             :   }  /* if */
   13153             : #endif /* GNU_VISIBILITY_ATTRIBUTE_ALLOWED */
   13154             : }  /* copy_gnu_class_properties_to_routine */
   13155             : 
   13156             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   13157             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   13158             : 
   13159             : a_boolean in_cli_property_or_event_definition(void)
   13160             : /*
   13161             : Return TRUE if we are currently parsing the brace-enclosed definition of a
   13162             : non-trivial C++/CLI property or event.
   13163             : */
   13164             : {
   13165             :   a_class_def_state  *cdsp = scope_stack_top().class_def_state;
   13166             : 
   13167             :   return (cdsp != NULL && cdsp->property_or_event_descr != NULL);
   13168             : }  /* in_cli_property_or_event_definition */
   13169             : 
   13170             : 
   13171             : a_boolean in_static_cli_property_or_event_definition(void)
   13172             : /*
   13173             : Return TRUE if we are currently parsing the brace-enclosed definition of a
   13174             : non-trivial static C++/CLI property or event.
   13175             : */
   13176             : {
   13177             :   a_class_def_state  *cdsp = scope_stack_top().class_def_state;
   13178             : 
   13179             :   return (cdsp != NULL && cdsp->property_or_event_descr != NULL &&
   13180             :           cdsp->property_or_event_descr->is_static);
   13181             : }  /* in_static_cli_property_or_event_definition */
   13182             : 
   13183             : 
   13184             : static void check_property_accessor_type(a_routine_ptr       rp,
   13185             :                                          a_decl_parse_state  *dps)
   13186             : /*
   13187             : rp points to the entry of a property accessor function.  Check that its type
   13188             : is compatible with the declaration of the C++/CLI property it is associated
   13189             : with and issue diagnostics as needed.
   13190             : */
   13191             : {
   13192             :   a_type_ptr            rtp = skip_typerefs(rp->type), prop_type;
   13193             :   a_routine_type_supplement_ptr
   13194             :                         rtsp = rtp->variant.routine.extra_info;
   13195             :   a_param_type_ptr      ptp = function_type_params(rtp);
   13196             :   a_property_or_event_descr_ptr
   13197             :                         pdp = rp->variant.property_or_event_descr;
   13198             :   a_boolean             is_setter, err = FALSE;
   13199             : 
   13200             :   if (pdp->is_static) {
   13201             :     prop_type = pdp->variant.variable->type;
   13202             :   } else {
   13203             :     prop_type = pdp->variant.field->type;
   13204             :   }  /* if */
   13205             :   /* First check the return type. */
   13206             :   if (rp->special_kind == (a_special_function_kind)sfk_property_get) {
   13207             :     if (!types_are_compatible(rtp->variant.routine.return_type, prop_type)) {
   13208             :       pos_error(ec_bad_property_get_return, &dps->start_pos);
   13209             :       err = TRUE;
   13210             :     }  /* if */
   13211             :     is_setter = FALSE;
   13212             :   } else {
   13213             :     check_assertion(rp->special_kind ==
   13214             :                                    (a_special_function_kind)sfk_property_set);
   13215             :     if (!is_void_type(rtp->variant.routine.return_type) ||
   13216             :         is_qualified_type(rtp->variant.routine.return_type)) {
   13217             :       /* The return type of a property "set" accessor must be void; "void
   13218             :          const" is not acceptable. */
   13219             :       pos_error(ec_bad_property_set_return, &dps->start_pos);
   13220             :       err = TRUE;
   13221             :     }  /* if */
   13222             :     is_setter = TRUE;
   13223             :   }  /* if */
   13224             :   if (!err && pdp->indices != NULL) {
   13225             :     /* Check that the accessor parameters match the index types.  ECMA-372
   13226             :        requires identical types, but MSVC++ 10 doesn't appear to compare the
   13227             :        types at all: So type mismatches are diagnosed as warnings only. */
   13228             :     a_property_index_type_ptr  pitp = pdp->indices;
   13229             :     while (!err && ptp != NULL && pitp != NULL) {
   13230             :       if (is_error_type(pitp->type)) {
   13231             :         /* Some error occurred while parsing the index types: Additional
   13232             :            diagnostics are unlikely helpful. */
   13233             :         err = TRUE;
   13234             :         break;
   13235             :       } else if (!types_are_compatible(pitp->type, ptp->type)) {
   13236             :         pos_warning(is_setter ? ec_property_set_index_type_mismatch
   13237             :                               : ec_property_get_index_type_mismatch,
   13238             :                     &pitp->position);
   13239             :       }  /* if */
   13240             :       ptp = ptp->next;
   13241             :       pitp = pitp->next;
   13242             :     }  /* while */
   13243             :     if (!err && pitp != NULL) {
   13244             :       pos_error(is_setter ? ec_property_set_index_type_missing
   13245             :                           : ec_property_get_index_type_missing,
   13246             :                 &pitp->position);
   13247             :       err = TRUE;
   13248             :     }  /* if */
   13249             :   }  /* if */
   13250             :   if (!err) {
   13251             :     if (is_setter) {
   13252             :       /* Check that the setter has exactly one more parameter that
   13253             :          corresponds to the property type. */
   13254             :       if (ptp == NULL) {
   13255             :         pos_error(ec_property_set_missing_value_parameter,
   13256             :                   &dps->declarator_pos);
   13257             :         err = TRUE;
   13258             :       } else if (ptp->next != NULL) {
   13259             :         pos_error(ec_extra_property_accessor_parameters, &dps->declarator_pos);
   13260             :         err = TRUE;
   13261             :       } else if (cppcx_enabled &&
   13262             :                  is_handle_to_nonconst_cppcx_plain_array_type(prop_type)) {
   13263             :         /* The property is of type "Platform::Array<T>^". */
   13264             :         a_type_ptr const_array_prop_type = NULL,
   13265             :                    pointed_to_prop_type = type_pointed_to(prop_type);
   13266             :         const_array_prop_type = make_handle_type(
   13267             :                                   make_qualified_type(
   13268             :                                               pointed_to_prop_type, TQ_CONST));
   13269             :         if (!types_are_compatible_ignoring_qualifiers(ptp->type,
   13270             :                                                       const_array_prop_type)) {
   13271             :           /* For externally-visible setters, the parameter type must be
   13272             :              "const Platform::Array<T>^". For non-externally-visible setters,
   13273             :              the parameter type can be either "Platform::Array<T>^" or
   13274             :              "const Platform::Array<T>^". */
   13275             :           if (is_cppcx_externally_visible_symbol(symbol_for(rp))) {
   13276             :             pos_error(ec_cppcx_invalid_array_property_set_value_parameter,
   13277             :                       &dps->declarator_pos);
   13278             :             err = TRUE;
   13279             :           } else if (!types_are_compatible_ignoring_qualifiers(ptp->type,
   13280             :                                                                prop_type)) {
   13281             :             pos_error(ec_property_set_value_parameter_mismatch,
   13282             :                       &dps->declarator_pos);
   13283             :             err = TRUE;
   13284             :           }  /* if */
   13285             :         }  /* if */
   13286             :       } else if (!types_are_compatible_ignoring_qualifiers(ptp->type,
   13287             :                                                            prop_type)) {
   13288             :         pos_error(ec_property_set_value_parameter_mismatch,
   13289             :                   &dps->declarator_pos);
   13290             :         err = TRUE;
   13291             :       }  /* if */
   13292             :     } else if (ptp != NULL) {
   13293             :       /* The setter has extra parameters: Issue an error. */
   13294             :       pos_error(pdp->indices == NULL ? ec_property_get_cannot_have_parameter
   13295             :                                      : ec_extra_property_accessor_parameters,
   13296             :                 &dps->declarator_pos);
   13297             :       err = TRUE;
   13298             :     }  /* if */
   13299             :   }  /* if */
   13300             :   if (!err) {
   13301             :     if (rtsp->qualifiers != TQ_NONE &&
   13302             :         /* Qualifiers are permitted on accessor methods in C++/CX mode. */
   13303             :         !cppcx_enabled) {
   13304             :       pos_error(ec_qualified_cli_accessor, &dps->declarator_pos);
   13305             :       err = TRUE;
   13306             :     } else if (rtsp->has_ellipsis) {
   13307             :       pos_error(ec_ellipsis_cli_accessor, &dps->declarator_pos);
   13308             :       err = TRUE;
   13309             :     }  /* if */
   13310             :   }  /* if */
   13311             : }  /* check_property_accessor_type */
   13312             : 
   13313             : 
   13314             : static void check_property_accessor(a_symbol_ptr            sym,
   13315             :                                     a_member_decl_info_ptr  decl_info,
   13316             :                                     a_class_def_state_ptr   class_state)
   13317             : /*
   13318             : sym represents a member function declared in a property definition.  Check
   13319             : that it is a valid "get" or "set" accessor for the property and issue
   13320             : diagnostics as appropriate.  Update the associated IL entries to reflect that
   13321             : the member function is an accessor for the property (if the accessor is valid).
   13322             : */
   13323             : {
   13324             :   a_routine_ptr         rp = sym->variant.routine.ptr;
   13325             :   a_property_or_event_descr_ptr
   13326             :                         pdp = class_state->property_or_event_descr;
   13327             :   a_decl_parse_state    *dps = &decl_info->decl_state;
   13328             : 
   13329             :   check_assertion(pdp->kind == (a_property_or_event_kind)pek_cli_property);
   13330             :   if (rp->special_kind != (a_special_function_kind)sfk_none) {
   13331             :     /* A special member (like a constructor) declared in a property definition.
   13332             :        Issue an error. */
   13333             :     pos_error(ec_invalid_property_accessor_decl, &dps->declarator_pos);
   13334             :   } else if (strcmp(rp->source_corresp.name, "get") == 0) {
   13335             :     if (pdp->get_routine.ptr != NULL) {
   13336             :       pos2_diagnostic(es_error, ec_property_get_already_declared,
   13337             :                       &dps->declarator_pos,
   13338             :                       &pdp->get_routine.ptr->source_corresp.decl_position);
   13339             :     } else {
   13340             :       rp->special_kind = (a_special_function_kind)sfk_property_get;
   13341             :     }  /* if */
   13342             :   } else if (strcmp(rp->source_corresp.name, "set") == 0) {
   13343             :     if (pdp->set_routine.ptr != NULL) {
   13344             :       pos2_diagnostic(es_error, ec_property_set_already_declared,
   13345             :                       &dps->declarator_pos,
   13346             :                       &pdp->set_routine.ptr->source_corresp.decl_position);
   13347             :     } else {
   13348             :       rp->special_kind = (a_special_function_kind)sfk_property_set;
   13349             :     }  /* if */
   13350             :   } else {
   13351             :     /* We already ensured earlier that the accessor name is valid. */
   13352             :     unexpected_condition();
   13353             :   }  /* if */
   13354             :   if (rout_is_cli_accessor(rp)) {
   13355             :     rp->variant.property_or_event_descr = pdp;
   13356             :     if (rp->special_kind == (a_special_function_kind)sfk_property_get) {
   13357             :       pdp->get_routine.ptr = rp;
   13358             :     } else {
   13359             :       pdp->set_routine.ptr = rp;
   13360             :     }  /* if */
   13361             :     check_property_accessor_type(rp, dps);
   13362             :     if ((pdp->is_virtual &&
   13363             :          dps->declared_storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_static) ||
   13364             :         (pdp->is_static && (dps->dso_flags & DSO_VIRTUAL))) {
   13365             :       pos_error(ec_virtual_static_property_accessor, &dps->specifiers_pos);
   13366             :       decl_info->invalid_virtual_specifier = TRUE;
   13367             :     }  /* if */
   13368             :   }  /* if */
   13369             : }  /* check_property_accessor */
   13370             : 
   13371             : 
   13372             : static void check_event_accessor_type(a_routine_ptr       rp,
   13373             :                                       a_decl_parse_state  *dps)
   13374             : /*
   13375             : rp points to the entry of an event accessor function.  Check that its type
   13376             : is compatible with the declaration of the C++/CLI event it is associated
   13377             : with and issue diagnostics as needed.
   13378             : */
   13379             : {
   13380             :   a_type_ptr            rtp = skip_typerefs(rp->type), prop_type;
   13381             :   a_routine_type_supplement_ptr
   13382             :                         rtsp = rtp->variant.routine.extra_info;
   13383             :   a_param_type_ptr      ptp = function_type_params(rtp);
   13384             :   a_property_or_event_descr_ptr
   13385             :                         pdp = rp->variant.property_or_event_descr;
   13386             :   a_boolean             err;
   13387             : 
   13388             :   if (pdp->is_static) {
   13389             :     prop_type = pdp->variant.variable->type;
   13390             :   } else {
   13391             :     prop_type = pdp->variant.field->type;
   13392             :   }  /* if */
   13393             :   err = is_or_contains_error_type(prop_type);
   13394             :   if (err) {
   13395             :     /* Further error checks are unlikely to be helpful. */
   13396             :     expect_error();
   13397             :   } else if (cppcx_enabled && special_kind_is(rp, sfk_event_add)) {
   13398             :     a_type_ptr event_registration_token_type = cli_class_type_for(
   13399             :                              csk_windows_foundation_event_registration_token);
   13400             :     /* First check the return type. */
   13401             :     if (!identical_types(rtp->variant.routine.return_type,
   13402             :                          event_registration_token_type)) {

   13404             :          Windows::Foundation::EventRegistrationToken. */
   13405             :       if (!is_error_type(rtp->variant.routine.return_type)) {
   13406             :         pos_error(ec_bad_cppcx_event_add_return, &dps->start_pos);

   13408             :       err = TRUE;
   13409             :     } else {
   13410             :       /* Check that the "add" accessor has exactly one parameter that
   13411             :          corresponds to the delegate type. */
   13412             :       if (ptp == NULL) {
   13413             :         pos_error(ec_event_accessor_missing_value_parameter,
   13414             :                   &dps->declarator_pos);
   13415             :         err = TRUE;
   13416             :       } else if (ptp->next != NULL) {
   13417             :         pos_error(ec_extra_event_accessor_parameters, &dps->declarator_pos);
   13418             :         err = TRUE;
   13419             :       } else if (!types_are_compatible(ptp->type, prop_type)) {
   13420             :         pos_ty2_diagnostic(es_error,
   13421             :                            ec_event_accessor_value_parameter_mismatch,
   13422             :                            &dps->declarator_pos, ptp->type, prop_type);
   13423             :         err = TRUE;
   13424             :       }  /* if */
   13425             :     }  /* if */
   13426             :   } else if (cppcx_enabled && special_kind_is(rp, sfk_event_remove)) {
   13427             :     /* First check the return type. */
   13428             :     if (!is_void_type(rtp->variant.routine.return_type) ||
   13429             :         is_qualified_type(rtp->variant.routine.return_type)) {
   13430             :       /* The return type of a C++/CX event "remove" accessor must be void;
   13431             :          "void const" is not acceptable. */
   13432             :       if (!is_error_type(rtp->variant.routine.return_type)) {
   13433             :         pos_error(ec_bad_cppcx_event_remove_return, &dps->start_pos);
   13434             :       }  /* if */
   13435             :       err = TRUE;
   13436             :     } else {
   13437             :       a_type_ptr event_registration_token_type = cli_class_type_for(
   13438             :                              csk_windows_foundation_event_registration_token);
