   13440             :          that is of type Windows::Foundation::EventRegistrationToken. */
   13441             :       if (ptp == NULL) {
   13442             :         pos_error(ec_event_accessor_missing_value_parameter,
   13443             :                   &dps->declarator_pos);
   13444             :         err = TRUE;
   13445             :       } else if (ptp->next != NULL) {
   13446             :         pos_error(ec_extra_event_accessor_parameters, &dps->declarator_pos);
   13447             :         err = TRUE;
   13448             :       } else if (!identical_types(ptp->type, event_registration_token_type)) {
   13449             :         pos_error(ec_bad_cppcx_event_remove_parameter, &dps->declarator_pos);
   13450             :         err = TRUE;
   13451             :       }  /* if */
   13452             :     }  /* if */
   13453             :   } else if (special_kind_is(rp, sfk_event_add) ||
   13454             :              special_kind_is(rp, sfk_event_remove)) {
   13455             :     /* First check the return type. */
   13456             :     if (!is_void_type(rtp->variant.routine.return_type) ||
   13457             :         is_qualified_type(rtp->variant.routine.return_type)) {
   13458             :       /* The return type of an event "add" or "remove" accessor must be void;
   13459             :          "void const" is not acceptable. */
   13460             :       if (!is_error_type(rtp->variant.routine.return_type)) {
   13461             :         pos_error(ec_bad_event_add_or_remove_return, &dps->start_pos);
   13462             :       }  /* if */
   13463             :       err = TRUE;
   13464             :     } else {
   13465             :       /* Check that the "add" or "remove" accessor has exactly one parameter
   13466             :          that corresponds to the property type. */
   13467             :       if (ptp == NULL) {
   13468             :         pos_error(ec_event_accessor_missing_value_parameter,
   13469             :                   &dps->declarator_pos);
   13470             :         err = TRUE;
   13471             :       } else if (ptp->next != NULL) {
   13472             :         pos_error(ec_extra_event_accessor_parameters, &dps->declarator_pos);
   13473             :         err = TRUE;
   13474             :       } else if (!types_are_compatible(ptp->type, prop_type)) {
   13475             :         pos_ty2_diagnostic(es_error,
   13476             :                            ec_event_accessor_value_parameter_mismatch,
   13477             :                            &dps->declarator_pos, ptp->type, prop_type);
   13478             :         err = TRUE;
   13479             :       }  /* if */
   13480             :     }  /* if */
   13481             :   } else {
   13482             :     a_type_ptr  invocation_type;
   13483             :     check_assertion(rp->special_kind ==
   13484             :                                    (a_special_function_kind)sfk_event_raise);
   13485             :     if (is_template_param_type(prop_type)) {
   13486             :       /* The event's type is unknown; so we cannot examine the underlying
   13487             :          delegate invocation type. */
   13488             :     } else {
   13489             :       invocation_type = delegate_invocation_type(type_pointed_to(prop_type));
   13490             :       if (invocation_type != NULL &&
   13491             :           !f_types_are_compatible(rtp, invocation_type,
   13492             :                                   TCF_IGNORE_THIS_CLASS_TYPE |
   13493             :                                   TCF_IGNORE_CALLING_CONVENTIONS |
   13494             :                                   TCF_ERROR_TYPE_COMPATIBLE_WITH_ANYTHING)) {
   13495             :         pos_error(ec_event_raise_type_mismatch, &dps->start_pos);
   13496             :         err = TRUE;
   13497             :       }  /* if */
   13498             :     }  /* if */
   13499             :   }  /* if */
   13500             :   if (!err) {
   13501             :     if (cppcli_enabled && rtsp->qualifiers != TQ_NONE) {
   13502             :       /* Qualifiers are not permitted on accessor methods in C++/CLI mode
   13503             :          (but they are okay in C++/CX mode). */
   13504             :       pos_error(ec_qualified_cli_accessor, &dps->declarator_pos);
   13505             :       err = TRUE;
   13506             :     } else if (rtsp->has_ellipsis) {
   13507             :       pos_error(ec_ellipsis_cli_accessor, &dps->declarator_pos);
   13508             :       err = TRUE;
   13509             :     }  /* if */
   13510             :   }  /* if */
   13511             : }  /* check_event_accessor_type */
   13512             : 
   13513             : 
   13514             : static void check_event_accessor(a_symbol_ptr            sym,
   13515             :                                  a_member_decl_info_ptr  decl_info,
   13516             :                                  a_class_def_state_ptr   class_state)
   13517             : /*
   13518             : sym represents a member function declared in an event definition.  Check that
   13519             : it is a valid "add", "remove", or "raise" accessor for the event and issue
   13520             : diagnostics as appropriate.  Update the associated IL entries to reflect that
   13521             : the member function is an accessor for the event (if the accessor is valid).
   13522             : */
   13523             : {
   13524             :   a_routine_ptr         rp = sym->variant.routine.ptr;
   13525             :   a_property_or_event_descr_ptr
   13526             :                         pdp = class_state->property_or_event_descr;
   13527             :   a_decl_parse_state    *dps = &decl_info->decl_state;
   13528             : 
   13529             :   check_assertion(pdp->kind == (a_property_or_event_kind)pek_cli_event);
   13530             :   if (rp->special_kind != (a_special_function_kind)sfk_none) {
   13531             :     /* A special member (like a constructor) declared in a property definition.
   13532             :        Issue an error. */
   13533             :     pos_error(ec_invalid_event_accessor_decl, &dps->declarator_pos);
   13534             :   } else if (strcmp(rp->source_corresp.name, "add") == 0) {
   13535             :     if (pdp->get_routine.ptr != NULL) {
   13536             :       pos2_diagnostic(es_error, ec_event_add_already_declared,
   13537             :                       &dps->declarator_pos,
   13538             :                       &pdp->add_routine->source_corresp.decl_position);
   13539             :     } else {
   13540             :       rp->special_kind = (a_special_function_kind)sfk_event_add;
   13541             :     }  /* if */
   13542             :   } else if (strcmp(rp->source_corresp.name, "remove") == 0) {
   13543             :     if (pdp->set_routine.ptr != NULL) {
   13544             :       pos2_diagnostic(es_error, ec_event_remove_already_declared,
   13545             :                       &dps->declarator_pos,
   13546             :                       &pdp->remove_routine->source_corresp.decl_position);
   13547             :     } else {
   13548             :       rp->special_kind = (a_special_function_kind)sfk_event_remove;
   13549             :     }  /* if */
   13550             :   } else if (strcmp(rp->source_corresp.name, "raise") == 0) {
   13551             :     if (pdp->set_routine.ptr != NULL) {
   13552             :       pos2_diagnostic(es_error, ec_event_raise_already_declared,
   13553             :                       &dps->declarator_pos,
   13554             :                       &pdp->raise_routine->source_corresp.decl_position);
   13555             :     } else {
   13556             :       rp->special_kind = (a_special_function_kind)sfk_event_raise;
   13557             :     }  /* if */
   13558             :   } else {
   13559             :     /* We already ensured earlier that the accessor name is valid. */
   13560             :     unexpected_condition();
   13561             :   }  /* if */
   13562             :   if (rout_is_cli_accessor(rp)) {
   13563             :     rp->variant.property_or_event_descr = pdp;

   13581             : 
   13582             : static an_il_entity_list_entry_ptr make_overridden_functions_entry(

   13606             : 
   13607             : static void record_selective_overriding(a_member_decl_info_ptr  decl_info,
   13608             :                                         a_symbol_ptr            overridden_sym)
   13609             : /*
   13610             : decl_info describes a (presumably virtual) member function declaration.  If
   13611             : that declaration selectively overrides specific base class members, record
   13612             : that in the derived-class routine entry.  If the overrides were specified
   13613             : using C++/CLI syntax like "virtual int f() = I::f, K::g;", overridden_sym is
   13614             : NULL, and decl_info->named_overrides will describe the overridden members.
   13615             : If a specific override was specified using a qualified member declarator
   13616             : (e.g., "virtual int B::f();"), overridden_sym describes the overridden member
   13617             : (there cannot be more than one in that case).
   13618             : */
   13619             : {
   13620             :   a_routine_ptr  rp = decl_info->decl_state.sym->variant.routine.ptr;
   13621             : 
   13622             :   if (overridden_sym != NULL) {
   13623             :     check_assertion(decl_info->named_overrides == NULL);

   13625             :     rp->overridden_functions = make_overridden_functions_entry(overridden_sym);
   13626             :   } else if (decl_info->named_overrides != NULL) {
   13627             :     an_il_entity_list_entry_ptr  *p_entry = &rp->overridden_functions;
   13628             :     a_symbol_list_entry_ptr      sym_entry = decl_info->named_overrides;

   13631             :       *p_entry = make_overridden_functions_entry(sym_entry->symbol);

   13634             :   }  /* if */

   13639       24812 : static void update_class_for_special_member(a_class_def_state   *class_state,
   13640             :                                             a_symbol_ptr        sym,
   13641             :                                             a_member_decl_info  *decl_info,
   13642             :                                             a_symbol_ptr        overload_sym)
   13643             : /*
   13644             : Update the class structures associated with class_state to reflect the fact
   13645             : that a special member function (e.g., a constructor) described by sym and
   13646             : decl_info is being declared in the associated class.  If the special member is
   13647             : part of an overload set, overload_sym points to the symbol representing that
   13648             : set; otherwise, it is NULL.

   13761             : static a_boolean is_implicitly_callable_conversion_function_full(
   13762             :                                                     a_type_ptr rout_type,
   13763             :                                                     a_boolean  is_reverse_fn)
   13764             : /*
   13765             : Return TRUE if a conversion function with the indicated routine type is
   13766             : one that can be implicitly called.  As described in [class.conv.fct],
   13767             : a conversion function will not be used implicitly to convert T to T,
   13768             : T to T&, or a number of other conversions that are doable as standard
   13769             : conversions.  is_reverse_fn is TRUE if this the given type is that of a
   13770             : Microsoft C++/CLI static reverse conversion function.

   13866             : static void exclude_special_members_from_value_class_type(
   13867             :                                                 a_routine_ptr      rtn,

   13869             :                                                 a_source_position  *diag_pos)

   13936             : 
   13937             : static void check_for_reserved_dispose_pattern_members(
   13938             :                                                 a_symbol_locator    *locator,
   13939             :                                                 a_decl_parse_state  *dps,
   13940             :                                                 a_type_ptr          class_type)
   13941             : /*
   13942             : locator and dps describe a member function being declared in the given class
   13943             : type.  Issue a diagnostic if it is a Dispose(bool), Dispose(), or Finalize()
   13944             : member being declared in a managed class (such a member is reserved for the
   13945             : C++/CLI dispose pattern).
   13946             : */
   13947             : {
   13948             :   check_assertion(cli_or_cx_enabled);
   13949             :   if (is_managed_class_type(class_type) &&
   13950             :       !class_is_from_metadata(class_type) &&
   13951             :       locator->symbol_header != NULL) {
   13952             :     a_boolean  is_dispose = symbol_header_is_for_identifier_string(
   13953             :                                             locator->symbol_header, "Dispose");
   13954             :     a_boolean  is_finalize = !is_dispose &&
   13955             :                              symbol_header_is_for_identifier_string(
   13956             :                                            locator->symbol_header, "Finalize");
   13957             :     /* "Finalize" is not reserved in C++/CX mode. */
   13958             :     is_finalize = is_finalize && !cppcx_enabled;
   13959             :     if (is_dispose || is_finalize) {
   13960             :       a_param_type_ptr  ptp = function_type_params(skip_typerefs(dps->type));
   13961             :       if (ptp == NULL ||
   13962             :           (is_dispose && ptp->next == NULL && is_bool_type(ptp->type))) {
   13963             :         /* The member being declared is Finalize(), Dispose(), or
   13964             :            Dispose(bool): Issue an error (and disable the implicit generation
   13965             :            of the "dispose pattern" members). */
   13966             :         symbol_supplement_for_class(class_type)
   13967             :                               ->disable_dispose_pattern_implementation = TRUE;
   13968             :         pos_st_error(is_dispose ? ec_reserved_dispose : ec_reserved_finalize,
   13969             :                      &dps->declarator_pos,
   13970             :                      locator->symbol_header->identifier);
   13971             :         set_to_error_locator(*locator);
   13972             :       }  /* if */
   13973             :     }  /* if */
   13974             :   }  /* if */
   13975             : }  /* check_for_reserved_dispose_pattern_members */
   13976             : 
   13977             : 
   13978             : static a_boolean check_accessor_name(a_property_or_event_descr_ptr  pdp,
   13979             :                                      a_symbol_locator               *locator)
   13980             : /*
   13981             : A member function declaration with the given locator appears in a C++/CLI
   13982             : property or event definition described by pdp.  If the name represented by the
   13983             : locator is a valid accessor name, return TRUE.  Otherwise, issue an error,
   13984             : set the locator to an error locator, and return FALSE.
   13985             : */
   13986             : {
   13987             :   a_const_char *id = NULL;

   13993             :       /* Neither "get" nor "set": Issue an error. */

   13995             :       err = TRUE;

   13997             :   } else if (pdp->kind == (a_property_or_event_kind)pek_cli_event) {

   14056     1167720 : void remove_routine_typedef_if_needed(a_symbol_locator    *loc,

   14059             : /*

   14061             : is a typedef, replace it by a copy of the underlying routine type if that type

   14099             : static void adjust_constexpr_member_type_if_needed(a_decl_parse_state  *dps)
   14100             : /*
   14101             : dps describes a nonstatic member function declaration declared "constexpr" that
   14102             : is not a constructor declaration.  If dps->type does not represent a

   14125       38502 : static void add_generated_exception_spec_if_needed(a_routine_ptr  rtn,

   14127             : /*

   14129             : assign it an exception specification as appropriate (in the case of a default
   14130             : constructor, this may be an "indeterminate" specification).  If the routine is

   14132             : Otherwise, the member is left unchanged.

   14183       38502 : static void set_member_function_name_linkage(a_symbol_ptr       sym,

   14186             : /*

   14228       38502 : static void decl_member_function(a_symbol_locator        *locator,
   14229             :                                  a_func_info_block_ptr   func_info,
   14230             :                                  a_class_def_state_ptr   class_state,
   14231             :                                  a_member_decl_info_ptr  decl_info,
   14232             :                                  a_boolean               compiler_generated)
   14233             : /*
   14234             : For a member function declaration: create a symbol entry and a routine entry
   14235             : for the member function, add the symbol to the symbol table, and append the
   14236             : routine entry to the routines list for the current class.  *locator gives the
   14237             : source locator of the declaration.  *func_info contains function-specific
   14238             : information about the function declaration.  *class_state and *decl_info track
   14239             : general information about the class definition and specific information about
   14240             : the member declaration, respectively.  compiler_generated is TRUE for
   14241             : implicitly declared member functions.
   14242             : */

   14244       38502 :   a_decl_parse_state            *decl_state = &decl_info->decl_state;

   14248             :                                                   ->depth_in_scope_stack;

   14251       38502 :   a_routine_ptr                 rtn;

   14761             :            function declarations, if this routine turns out to be

   14763             :         rtn->defined_outside_of_parent = TRUE;
   14764             :         /* A given default argument expression cannot appear both on a
   14765             :            secondary source-sequence entry and on the primary declaration. */
   14766             :         /* Remove default arguments, if any, from the type recorded as the
   14767             :            declared type on the primary declaration.  This means, in the
   14768             :            source-sequence representation the default arguments will be on
   14769             :            the declaration that appears inside the class definition and not
   14770             :            on the definition that appears outside the class definition.  For
   14771             :            example, it has the effect of making the following transformation
   14772             :            in the output of the C++-generating back end:
   14773             :              class A {
   14774             :                void f(int = 0) { }
   14775             :              };
   14776             :            becomes
   14777             :              class A {
   14778             :                void f(int = 0);
   14779             :              };
   14780             :              void A::f(int) { }

   14782             :         if (rtn->declared_type != rtn->type) {
   14783             :           /* There must be default arguments.  Make a new type entry. */

   14796             :            associating the default argument with the out-of-class definition
   14797             :            (e.g., when the current function is a default constructor or when
   14798             :            it is called in the body of a member function already defined
   14799             :            within the current class).  However, if the transformation should
   14800             :            (sometimes or always) produce this:

   14803             :              };
   14804             :              void A::f(int = 0) { }

   15144             :       /* Non-static member declarations implicitly reference the parent class

   15146       36390 :       class_type->source_corresp.referenced = TRUE;
   15147             :     }  /* if */
   15148             :   }  /* if */
   15149             : #if DEBUG
   15150       38502 :   if (debug_level >= 3) db_symbol(sym, "", 4);
   15151             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   15152       38502 :   treat_declaration_as_okay_in_property_or_event(class_state);
   15153       38502 :   db_exit();
   15154       38502 : }  /* decl_member_function */
   15155             : 
   15156             : 
   15157        1853 : static a_boolean compatible_member_function_template_param_types(
   15158             :                                                  a_template_param_ptr  tpl1,
   15159             :                                                  a_type_ptr            tp1,
   15160             :                                                  a_template_param_ptr  tpl2,
   15161             :                                                  a_type_ptr            tp2)
   15162             : /*
   15163             : tp1 and tp2 are the (parameterized) types of member function templates with
   15164             : associated template parameter lists tpl1 and tpl2 (respectively).  Return TRUE
   15165             : if the parameter types of the members (excluding the classes underlying the
   15166             : implied "this" parameter, but including their qualifiers and ref-qualifiers)
   15167             : and their associated template parameter lists are compatible.
   15168             : 
   15169             : The nesting depth of the parameters is ignored for this compatibility checking.
   15170             : */
   15171             : {
   15172        1853 :   a_boolean                 result, restore_tnd1 = FALSE, restore_tnd2 = FALSE;
   15173        1853 :   a_template_param_ptr      tpp1 = tpl1, tpp2 = tpl2;
   15174        1853 :   a_template_param_coordinate_ptr
   15175             :                             tpcp1, tpcp2;
   15176        1853 :   a_template_nesting_depth  tnd1 = NO_NESTING_DEPTH, tnd2 = NO_NESTING_DEPTH;
   15177             : 
   15178             :   /* The actual comparison is done with equiv_template_param_lists and
   15179             :      param_types_are_compatible, but the two parameter lists may be declared at
   15180             :      different nesting depths (e.g., one may be a member template in a class
   15181             :      template that derives from a nontemplate base class in which the other
   15182             :      member template is declared).  We therefore temporarily set the nesting
   15183             :      depth of the two member templates to the "deepest" depth of the two. */
   15184        1853 :   for (; tpp1 != NULL && tpp2 != NULL; tpp1 = tpp1->next, tpp2 = tpp2->next) {
   15185        1853 :     tpcp1 = coordinates_of_template_param(tpp1);
   15186        1853 :     tnd1 = tpcp1->depth;
   15187        1853 :     tpcp2 = coordinates_of_template_param(tpp2);
   15188        1853 :     tnd2 = tpcp2->depth;
   15189        1853 :     if (tnd1 == tnd2) {
   15190             :       /* The two member templates are at the same depth: No adjustment is
   15191             :          needed. */
   15192             :       break;
   15193           0 :     } else if (tnd1 < tnd2) {
   15194           0 :       restore_tnd1 = TRUE;
   15195           0 :       tpcp1->depth = tnd2;
   15196             :     } else {
   15197           0 :       restore_tnd2 = TRUE;
   15198           0 :       tpcp2->depth = tnd1;
   15199             :     }  /* if */
   15200             :   }  /* for */
   15201             :   /* The depths have been updated if needed: Now do the actual compatibility
   15202             :      check. */
   15203        1853 :   result = equiv_template_param_lists(tpl1, tpl2, /*issue_errors=*/FALSE,
   15204             :                                       ETP_NO_OPTIONS, (a_source_position*)NULL,
   15205        2408 :                                       es_error) &&
   15206         555 :            param_types_are_compatible(tp1, tp2, TCF_NO_FLAGS);
   15207          34 :   if (result) {
   15208             :     /* Check member function qualifiers and ref-qualifiers. */
   15209          34 :     a_routine_type_supplement_ptr  rtsp1, rtsp2;
   15210          34 :     rtsp1 = skip_typerefs(tp1)->variant.routine.extra_info;
   15211          34 :     rtsp2 = skip_typerefs(tp2)->variant.routine.extra_info;
   15212          34 :     if (rtsp1->this_class != NULL && rtsp2->this_class != NULL &&
   15213          24 :         (rtsp1->qualifiers != rtsp2->qualifiers ||
   15214          24 :          rtsp1->ref_qualifiers != rtsp2->ref_qualifiers)) {
   15215           0 :       result = FALSE;
   15216             :     }  /* if */
   15217             :   }  /* if */
   15218             :   /* Restore the original depths if needed. */
   15219        1853 :   if (restore_tnd1) {
   15220           0 :     for (tpp1 = tpl1; tpp1 != NULL; tpp1 = tpp1->next) {
   15221           0 :       coordinates_of_template_param(tpp1)->depth = tnd1;
   15222             :     }  /* for */
   15223        1853 :   } else if (restore_tnd2) {
   15224           0 :     for (tpp2 = tpl2; tpp2 != NULL; tpp2 = tpp2->next) {
   15225           0 :       coordinates_of_template_param(tpp2)->depth = tnd2;
   15226             :     }  /* for */
   15227             :   }  /* if */
   15228        1853 :   return result;
   15229             : }  /* compatible_member_function_template_param_types */
   15230             : 
   15231             : 
   15232             : #if !GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
   15233             : /*ARGSUSED*/ /* il_template_entry is not used in all configurations. */
   15234             : #endif /* !GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
   15235             : static void decl_member_function_template(
   15236             :                                 a_symbol_locator        *locator,
   15237             :                                 a_template_param_ptr    templ_param_list,
   15238             :                                 a_template_ptr          il_template_entry,
   15239             :                                 a_func_info_block       *func_info,
   15240             :                                 a_class_def_state_ptr   class_state,
   15241             :                                 a_member_decl_info_ptr  decl_info)
   15242             : /*
   15243             : Process the declaration of a member function template.  *locator is the symbol
   15244             : locator of the template.  templ_param_list is the template parameter list of
   15245             : the function template and il_template_entry the IL entry representing the
   15246             : template.  *func_info contains information gathered in processing the
   15247             : declarator.  *class_state and *decl_info track general information about the
   15248             : class definition and specific information about the member declaration,
   15249             : respectively.  (This function is similar to decl_function_template, which
   15250             : handles non-member function templates and out-of-class template declarations
   15251             : of functions that are members of template classes, and to
   15252             : decl_member_function, which handles in-class member function declarations.)
   15253             : */
   15254             : {
   15255             :   a_decl_parse_state                *dps = &decl_info->decl_state;
   15256             :   a_type_ptr                        class_type = class_state->class_type;
   15257             :   a_type_ptr                        member_type = dps->type;
   15258             :   a_template_symbol_supplement_ptr  tssp;
   15259             :   a_routine_ptr                     rtn;
   15260             :   a_symbol_ptr                      sym = NULL;
   15261             :   a_symbol_ptr                      prototype_sym;
   15262             :   a_symbol_ptr                      other_sym, overload_sym = NULL;
   15263             :   a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr     cssp;
   15264             :   a_scope_depth                     effective_decl_level;
   15265             :   a_boolean                         is_static_member;
   15266             : 
   15267             :   db_enter(3, "decl_member_function_template");
   15268             :   check_assertion(scope_is(&scope_stack_top(), sck_template_declaration));
   15269             :   is_static_member = dps->storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_static;
   15270             :   dps->is_definition = func_info->is_definition;
   15271             :   if (!is_error_locator(*locator)) {
   15272             :     if (locator->is_udl_operator_name) {
   15273             :       /* User-defined literal operators cannot be class members. */
   15274             :       pos_error(ec_udl_cannot_be_class_member, &locator->source_position);
   15275             :       set_to_error_locator(*locator);
   15276             :     } else if (is_single_param_operator_new_or_delete(

   15534             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED

   15536             :       /* C++/CX doesn't permit generic methods. */

   15538             :         pos_error(ec_cppcx_generic_method_not_allowed,
   15539             :                   &locator->source_position);
   15540             :       }  /* if */
   15541             :       /* Generic functions can be virtual (standard member function templates
   15542             :          cannot). */
   15543             :       if (check_virtual_interface_member(class_state, rtn, locator)) {
   15544             :         rtn->is_virtual = TRUE;
   15545             :         make_virtual_function_pure(rtn, class_type);
   15546             :       } else if (dps->dso_flags & DSO_VIRTUAL) {
   15547             :         rtn->is_virtual = TRUE;
   15548             :       }  /* if */
   15549             :       check_for_virtual_override(rtn->is_virtual, decl_info, class_state,
   15550             :                                  func_info);
   15551             :     }  /* if */
   15552             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   15553             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
   15554             :     if (!source_sequence_entries_disallowed) {
   15555             :       check_assertion(il_template_entry != NULL);
   15556             :       remove_declarator_sse(dps, depth_scope_stack);
   15557             :       if (!func_info->is_definition) {
   15558             :         /* Turn the source sequence entry for the a_template entry into a
   15559             :            secondary source sequence entry. */

   15561             :                             secondary_src_seq_for_template(il_template_entry);

   15563             :       } else {
   15564             :         rtn->declared_type = func_info->declared_type;

   15570             :     }  /* if */
   15571             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
   15572             :   }  /* if */
   15573             :   db_exit();
   15574             : }  /* decl_member_function_template */
   15575             : 
   15576             : 
   15577           0 : static void decl_call_operator_for_lambda(a_lambda_ptr        lambda,
   15578             :                                           a_class_def_state   *class_state,
   15579             :                                           a_member_decl_info  *decl_info,
   15580             :                                           a_func_info_block   *func_info,
   15581             :                                           a_tmpl_decl_state   *templ_state)
   15582             : /*
   15583             : Create operator()(...) for the given lambda (except in some error cases).
   15584             : *decl_info and *func_info describe various properties about the construct that
   15585             : was parsed.  *class_state describes the synthesized "closure class" associated
   15586             : with the lambda.  If the lambda is generic, *templ_state describes the
   15587             : declaration of the associated member template.
   15588             : 
   15589             : The heavy lifting for this routine is performed by decl_member_function and
   15590             : decl_member_function_template.
   15591             : */
   15592             : {
   15593           0 :   a_decl_parse_state  *dps = &decl_info->decl_state;
   15594           0 :   a_boolean           generic_lambda_completed = FALSE;
   15595             : 
   15596           0 :   if (!is_error_type(dps->type)) {
   15597           0 :     a_symbol_locator    loc;
   15598           0 :     a_routine_ptr       rp;

   15600           0 :     a_boolean           prev_source_sequence_entries_disallowed

   15610           0 :     source_sequence_entries_disallowed = TRUE;
   15611             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
   15612           0 :     if (lambda->is_generic) {
   15613             :       /* For the generic lambda case, the call operator is a member function
   15614             :          template: Generate it by calling decl_member_function_template. */

   15632             :                                          dps->sym);

   15639           0 :       rp->is_prototype_instantiation =
   15640           0 :                      scope_stack[depth_scope_stack].in_prototype_instantiation;

   15643             :        updated until the class definition is completed.  However, the mangling
   15644             :        rules for lambdas are such that this is sometimes needed earlier for
   15645             :        closure types.  So we set it now (since it's the symbol for the

   15672           0 :     check_assertion(scope_is(&scope_stack_top(), sck_template_declaration));
   15673           0 :     pop_scope();

   15676           0 :       end_caching_fetched_tokens();

   15680             : 
   15681             : 
   15682         216 : static void scan_pure_specifier(a_symbol_ptr            rout_sym,
   15683             :                                 a_type_ptr              class_type,
   15684             :                                 a_member_decl_info_ptr  decl_info,
   15685             :                                 a_func_info_block_ptr   func_info)
   15686             : /*
   15687             : The current token is an "=", encountered just after the scanning of a
   15688             : member or friend function declarator.  A pure specifier is defined as "= 0",
   15689             : and it is legal for virtual member functions only.  rout_sym represents the
   15690             : function being declared (in the definition of class_type).  decl_info and
   15691             : func_info describe the current member function declaration.
   15692             : */
   15693             : {
   15694         216 :   a_routine_ptr  rout;
   15695         216 :   a_boolean      pure_specifier_allowed, pure_specifier_ignored = FALSE;
   15696             : 
   15697         216 :   db_enter(4, "scan_pure_specifier");
   15698             :   /* A pure specifier is allowed for virtual functions only.  (Check the
   15699             :      parent class to exclude friend declarations.) */
   15700         216 :   if (!rout_sym->is_class_member ||
   15701         216 :       sym_parent_class(rout_sym) != class_type) {
   15702             :     rout = NULL;
   15703             :     pure_specifier_allowed = FALSE;
   15704             :   } else {
   15705         432 :     rout = (rout_sym->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_function_template) ?
   15706         216 :                    rout_sym->variant.template_info->variant.function.routine :
   15707             :                    rout_sym->variant.routine.ptr;
   15708         216 :     pure_specifier_allowed = rout->is_virtual;
   15709         216 :     if (!pure_specifier_allowed &&
   15710             :         class_type->variant.class_struct_union.is_prototype_instantiation) {
   15711             :       /* If class_type has a template-dependent base, the routine might be an
   15712             :          overrider of a virtual function in that base, which means the routine
   15713             :          would be virtual too.  In such cases we must also allow the pure
   15714             :          specifier.  GNU, Microsoft, and Sun always allow the pure specifier
   15715             :          in class templates. */
   15716           0 :       if (symbol_supplement_for_class(class_type)
   15717             :                                                ->any_dependent_base_classes) {
   15718             :         pure_specifier_allowed = TRUE;
   15719           0 :       } else if (gpp_mode || microsoft_mode || sun_mode) {
   15720           0 :         pure_specifier_allowed = TRUE;
   15721           0 :         pure_specifier_ignored = TRUE;
   15722             :       }  /* if */
   15723             :     }  /* if */
   15724             :   }  /* if */
   15725         216 :   if (!pure_specifier_allowed && !decl_info->invalid_virtual_specifier) {
   15726           0 :     pos_error(ec_pure_specifier_on_nonvirtual_function, &pos_curr_token);
   15727         216 :   } else if (pure_specifier_allowed &&
   15728         216 :              (rout->final || class_type->variant.class_struct_union.final)) {
   15729             :     /* Making a pure virtual member sealed/final is useless, but while
   15730             :        Microsoft makes the "sealed" case an error, the C++11 standard does not
   15731             :        prohibit the "final" case. */
   15732           0 :     if (!rout->final) {
   15733           0 :       check_assertion(class_type->variant.class_struct_union.final);
   15734           0 :       pos_warning(ec_pure_final_virtual, &pos_curr_token);
   15735             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   15736             :     } else if (func_info->sealed) {
   15737             :       /* The routine was declared with "sealed". */
   15738             :       check_assertion(ms_extensions);
   15739             :       pos_error(ec_pure_specifier_on_sealed_member, &pos_curr_token);
   15740             :       pure_specifier_allowed = FALSE;
   15741             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   15742             :     } else {
   15743             :       /* The routine was declared with "final". */
   15744           0 :       an_attribute_ptr  final_ap =
   15745           0 :                     find_attribute(ak_final, rout->source_corresp.attributes);
   15746           0 :       pos_warning(ec_pure_final_virtual,
   15747             :                   final_ap != NULL ? &final_ap->position : &pos_curr_token);
   15748             :     }  /* if */
   15749             :   }  /* if */
   15750             :   /* Advance past the "=". */
   15751         216 :   (void)get_token();
   15752         216 :   if ((curr_token == tok_int_constant &&
   15753         216 :        (const_for_curr_token.is_simple_zero ||
   15754           0 :         ((microsoft_mode || gpp_mode) &&
   15755           0 :          is_zero_constant(&const_for_curr_token)))) ||
   15756           0 :       (gpp_mode && gnu_version < 30400 && curr_token == tok_null)) {
   15757             :     /* Token following "=" should be "0".  Note that we normally don't test
   15758             :        for an integer value of zero but rather for the literal "0", since
   15759             :        "= 00" should elicit an error.  In Microsoft and early GNU modes,
   15760             :        however, other forms of "zero" are accepted (including "__null" in GNU
   15761             :        mode). */
   15762         216 :     if (pure_specifier_allowed && !pure_specifier_ignored) {
   15763             :       /* Update the routine and class type entities. */
   15764         216 :       make_virtual_function_pure(rout_sym->variant.routine.ptr, class_type);
   15765             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
   15766             :       {
   15767             :       /* Include the pure-specifier in the declarator range.  Note that
   15768             :          the routine entry is updated directly, since decl_member_function
   15769             :          has already been called at this point. */
   15770         216 :       a_decl_position_supplement_ptr  dpsp = rout_sym->variant.routine.ptr->
   15771             :                                                  source_corresp.decl_pos_info;
   15772         216 :       if (dpsp != NULL && dpsp->variant.declarator_range.start.seq != 0) {
   15773         216 :         dpsp->variant.declarator_range.end = pos_curr_token;
   15774             :       }  /* if */
   15775             :       }
   15776             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
   15777             :     }  /* if */
   15778             :     /* Advance past the "0". */
   15779         216 :     (void)get_token();
   15780             :     /* The C++ standard's grammar does not allow a function body to follow a
   15781             :        pure-specifier.  Microsoft compilers, however, accept such
   15782             :        constructs. */
   15783         216 :     if (func_info->is_definition) {
   15784             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   15785             :       if (is_immediate_managed_class_type(class_type)) {
   15786             :         expect_error();
   15787             :       } else
   15788             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   15789             :       /* Do not insert code here. */
   15790             :       {
   15791           0 :         pos_diagnostic(ms_extensions ? es_warning : es_discretionary_error,
   15792             :                        ec_pure_virtual_definition, &pos_curr_token);
   15793             :       }  /* if */
   15794             :     } else {
   15795         216 :       check_assertion_or_expect_error(curr_token == tok_semicolon ||
   15796             :                                       curr_token == tok_comma);
   15797             :     }  /* if */
   15798             :   } else {
   15799           0 :     set_err_pos_to_curr_token();
   15800             :     /* Invalid pure specifier:  something other than "0" follows the "=". */
   15801           0 :     syntax_error(ec_bad_pure_specifier);
   15802             :   }  /* if */
   15803         216 :   db_exit();
   15804         216 : }  /* scan_pure_specifier */
   15805             : 
   15806             : 
   15807             : static void decl_nonstd_member_constant(a_symbol_locator        *locator,
   15808             :                                         a_class_def_state_ptr   class_state,
   15809             :                                         a_member_decl_info_ptr  decl_info)
   15810             : /*
   15811             : Do processing for a nonstandard member constant, including scanning the
   15812             : initializer constant and entering the name in the symbol table.  The member
   15813             : type is guaranteed to be a const-qualified scalar type.  This construct is an
   15814             : extension.  Such a declaration is of the form:
   15815             : 
   15816             :   decl-specifiers declarator = constant-expression ;
   15817             : 
   15818             : where the decl-specifiers have no explicit storage class and "const" but
   15819             : no other qualifier, and where the resulting type is a scalar type -- e.g.,
   15820             : 
   15821             :   class A {
   15822             :     const int i = 10;              // member constant
   15823             :     const float f = 1.0;           // member constant
   15824             :     char * const s = "abc";        // member constant
   15825             :     A * const pa = (A *)0;         // member constant
   15826             :     // Added for comparison:
   15827             :     const int j;                   // nonstatic data member
   15828             :     static const int k;            // static data member
   15829             :     static const int l = 10;       // standard form of member constant,
   15830             :                                    //   not handled here
   15831             :   };
   15832             : 
   15833             : *class_state and *decl_info track general information about the class
   15834             : definition and specific information about the member declaration,
   15835             : respectively.
   15836             : */
   15837             : {
   15838             :   a_type_ptr       class_type = class_state->class_type;
   15839             :   a_type_ptr       member_type = decl_info->decl_state.type;
   15840             :   a_symbol_ptr     sym;
   15841             :   a_constant_ptr   cp;
   15842             : 
   15843             :   db_enter(3, "decl_nonstd_member_constant");
   15844             :   /* The current token is the "=".  Pointing to it issue a diagnostic that this
   15845             :      is a nonstandard construct.  This is a strict ANSI diagnostic in
   15846             :      strict ANSI mode, otherwise it is a warning. */
   15847             :   pos_diagnostic(strict_ansi_mode ? strict_ansi_error_severity : es_warning,
   15848             :                  ec_nonstd_const_member, &pos_curr_token);
   15849             :   /* Advance past the "=". */
   15850             :   (void)get_token();
   15851             :   /* Scan the constant expression. */
   15852             :   cp = alloc_constant((a_constant_repr_kind)ck_error);
   15853             :   scan_constant_initializer_expression(member_type,
   15854             :                                        &decl_info->decl_state,
   15855             :                                        cp);
   15856             :   cp->is_named_constant_definition = TRUE;
   15857             :   add_backing_expression_for_named_constant(cp);
   15858             :   /* Enter the constant name in the symbol table.  Do this after scanning
   15859             :      the expression to avoid problems with a recursive reference, though
   15860             :      it may mean the order in which errors are issued is a little strange. */
   15861             :   sym = enter_local_symbol((a_symbol_kind)sk_constant, locator,
   15862             :                            decl_scope_level, /*suppress_redecl_error=*/FALSE);
   15863             :   /* Update the symbol and the constant entry. */
   15864             :   sym->variant.constant = cp;
   15865             :   set_source_corresp(&(cp->source_corresp), sym);
   15866             :   set_class_membership(sym, &cp->source_corresp, class_type);
   15867             :   decl_info->decl_state.sym = sym;
   15868             :   cp->source_corresp.access = class_state->access;
   15869             :  #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   15870             :   cp->source_corresp.assembly_access = class_state->assembly_access;
   15871             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   15872             :   record_symbol_declaration(SRK_DECLARATION | SRK_DEFINITION, sym,
   15873             :                             &locator->source_position,
   15874             :                             decl_info->decl_state.source_sequence_entry);
   15875             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
   15876             :   update_decl_pos_info(&cp->source_corresp, &decl_info->decl_pos_block);
   15877             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
   15878             :   /* Do processing required for any pragmas that are bound to the current
   15879             :      declaration. */
   15880             :   process_curr_construct_pragmas(sym, (a_statement_ptr)NULL);
   15881             :   add_to_constants_list(cp, /*at_file_scope=*/FALSE);
   15882             :   db_exit();
   15883             : }  /* decl_nonstd_member_constant */
   15884             : 
   15885             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   15886             : 
   15887             : static void decl_literal_field(a_symbol_locator        *locator,
   15888             :                                a_class_def_state_ptr   class_state,
   15889             :                                a_member_decl_info_ptr  decl_info)
   15890             : /*
   15891             : Do processing for a C++/CLI literal field, including scanning the initializer
   15892             : constant and entering the name in the symbol table.
   15893             : */
   15894             : {
   15895             :   a_type_ptr          class_type = class_state->class_type;
   15896             :   a_decl_parse_state  *dps = &decl_info->decl_state;
   15897             :   a_type_ptr          member_type = dps->type;
   15898             : 
   15899             :   db_enter(3, "decl_literal_field");
   15900             :   if (cppcx_enabled) {
   15901             :     pos_error(ec_literal_fields_disallowed_in_cppcx_mode,
   15902             :               &dps->declarator_pos);
   15903             :   } else if (cli_class_type_kind_is(class_type, cctk_standard)) {
   15904             :     pos_error(ec_literal_requires_managed_class, &dps->declarator_pos);
   15905             :   }  /* if */
   15906             :   if (curr_token != tok_assign) {
   15907             :     syntax_error(ec_literal_without_initializer);
   15908             :   } else {
   15909             :     a_constant_ptr     constant;
   15910             :     a_source_position  init_pos = pos_curr_token;
   15911             :     dps->has_initializer = TRUE;
   15912             :     /* Record the starting position of the initialization */
   15913             :     decl_info->decl_pos_block.var_init_range.start = pos_curr_token;
   15914             :     /* Advance past the "=". */
   15915             :     (void)get_token();
   15916             :     if ((dps->auto_type_specifier_seen || dps->decltype_auto_specifier_seen) &&
   15917             :         !is_error_type(member_type)) {
   15918             :       prescan_initializer_for_auto_type_deduction(dps,
   15919             :                                                  /*parenthesized_init=*/FALSE);
   15920             :       member_type = dps->type;
   15921             :     }  /* if */
   15922             :     if (is_scalar_type(member_type) || is_template_param_type(member_type)) {
   15923             :       if (is_const_qualified_type(member_type)) {
   15924             :         /* "const" is useless on a C++/CLI literal field declaration. */
   15925             :         a_source_position  *diag_pos = &dps->qualifiers_pos;
   15926             :         if (!(dps->qualifiers & TQ_CONST)) diag_pos = &dps->start_pos;
   15927             :         pos_warning(ec_literal_const_has_no_effect, diag_pos);
   15928             :       }  /* if */
   15929             :       /* Scan the constant expression. */
   15930             :       constant = alloc_constant((a_constant_repr_kind)ck_error);
   15931             :       scan_member_constant_initializer_expression(dps, constant);
   15932             :       constant->is_literal_field = TRUE;
   15933             :       /* Enter the constant name in the symbol table.  Do this after scanning
   15934             :          the expression to avoid problems with a recursive reference. */
   15935             :       dps->sym = enter_local_symbol((a_symbol_kind)sk_constant, locator,
   15936             :                                     decl_scope_level,
   15937             :                                     /*suppress_redecl_error=*/FALSE);
   15938             :       /* Update the symbol and the constant entry. */
   15939             :       dps->sym->variant.constant = constant;
   15940             :       set_source_corresp(&(constant->source_corresp), dps->sym);
   15941             :       set_class_membership(dps->sym, &constant->source_corresp, class_type);
   15942             :       constant->source_corresp.access = class_state->access;
   15943             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   15944             :       constant->source_corresp.assembly_access = class_state->assembly_access;

   15989             : static a_boolean distinguishable_property_indices(
   15990             :                                              a_property_index_type_ptr  pitp1,
   15991             :                                              a_property_index_type_ptr  pitp2)
   15992             : /*
   15993             : Return TRUE if and only if the given non-empty sequences of property index
   15994             : types are distinguishable when overloading C++/CLI properties.
   15995             : */
   15996             : {
   15997             :   a_boolean  result = FALSE;
   15998             : 
   15999             :   do {
   16000             :     if (pitp1 == NULL || pitp2 == NULL) {
   16001             :       /* One sequence (but not both) has no more elements. */
   16002             :       result = TRUE;
   16003             :       break;
   16004             :     } else if (!types_are_compatible(pitp1->type, pitp2->type)) {
   16005             :       /* Incompatible corresponding index types are distinguishable. */
   16006             :       result = TRUE;
   16007             :       break;
   16008             :     } else {
   16009             :       pitp1 = pitp1->next;
   16010             :       pitp2 = pitp2->next;
   16011             :     }  /* if */
   16012             :   } while (pitp1 != NULL || pitp2 != NULL);
   16013             :   return result;
   16014             : }  /* distinguishable_property_indices */

   16016             :

   16034             : static void remove_property_from_set(a_symbol_ptr  property_set,
   16035             :                                      a_symbol_ptr  property_sym)
   16036             : /*
   16037             : Remove the C++/CLI property given by property_sym and its accessors from the
   16038             : property set given by property_set.

   16041             :   a_property_or_event_descr_ptr
   16042             :                 pedp = property_or_event_descr_for_sym(property_sym);

   16047             :   /* First remove the property member itself. */
   16048             :   remove_symbol_or_projection_from_list(property_sym, &set->properties);
   16049             :   /* Now remove the get accessor (if any). */

   16051             :     accessor_sym = symbol_for(pedp->get_routine.ptr);

   16054             :                                      ->variant.overloaded_function.symbols;

   16057             :         /* Only one symbol is left: An overload set is no longer needed. */

   16061             :       set->get_accessors = NULL;

   16072             :         /* Only one symbol is left: An overload set is no longer needed. */

   16081             : 
   16082             : static void check_for_overloaded_property_conflict(a_symbol_ptr  property_set,
   16083             :                                                    a_symbol_ptr  property_sym)
   16084             : /*
   16085             : property_sym represents a C++/CLI property that has just been declared, and it
   16086             : is a member of the given property set (possibly the only such member).  If the
   16087             : set contains any previously declared properties, diagnose any conflict created
   16088             : by the new property.  If the set contains conflicting projected properties,
   16089             : remove those projections (silently).
   16090             : */
   16091             : {
   16092             :   a_symbol_ptr  sym = property_set->variant.property_info->properties;
   16093             :   a_property_or_event_descr_ptr
   16094             :                 new_pedp, prev_pedp;
   16095             : 
   16096             :   check_assertion(cli_or_cx_enabled);
   16097             :   new_pedp = property_or_event_descr_for_sym(property_sym);
   16098             :   for (; sym != property_sym; sym = sym->next) {
   16099             :     a_boolean  conflict = FALSE;
   16100             :     check_assertion(sym != NULL);
   16101             :     prev_pedp = property_or_event_descr_for_sym(sym);
   16102             :     if ((prev_pedp->indices == NULL) != (new_pedp->indices == NULL)) {
   16103             :       /* One property is indexed, and the other isn't: No conflict. */
   16104             :     } else if (new_pedp->indices == NULL) {
   16105             :       /* Neither property is indexed: They conflict. */
   16106             :       conflict = TRUE; 
   16107             :     } else {
   16108             :       if (!distinguishable_property_indices(prev_pedp->indices,
   16109             :                                             new_pedp->indices)) {
   16110             :         if (symbol_is(sym, sk_projection)) {
   16111             :           remove_property_from_set(property_set, sym);
   16112             :         } else {
   16113             :           conflict = TRUE;
   16114             :         }  /* if */
   16115             :       }  /* if */
   16116             :     }  /* if */
   16117             :     if (conflict) {
   16118             :       pos_sy_error(ec_conflicting_properties, &property_sym->decl_position,
   16119             :                    sym);
   16120             :       break;
   16121             :     }  /* if */
   16122             :   }  /* for */
   16123             : }  /* check_for_overloaded_property_conflict */
   16124             : 
   16125             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   16126             :

   16202             : static void record_inclass_initializer_fixup(
   16203             :                                 a_class_def_state_ptr   class_state,
   16204             :                                 a_decl_parse_state      *dps)
   16205             : /*
   16206             : The next tokens must be an in-class initializer for a data member.
   16207             : Cache those tokens and create a fixup record so the initializer can be parsed
   16208             : in the context of the completed class later on.
   16209             : (See also inclass_initializer_fixup_for_class.)
   16210             : */
   16211             : {
   16212             :   a_token_cache_ptr             token_cache;
   16213             : 
   16214             :   /* Cache the initializer. */
   16215             :   token_cache = cache_inclass_initializer(dps->sym);
   16216             :   if (ms_extensions && symbol_is(dps->sym, sk_field) &&
   16217             :       !nonclass_prototype_instantiations &&
   16218             :       in_class_template_definition(class_state)) {
   16219             :     /* Field symbols in prototype instantiations do not have their fixup
   16220             :        entries recorded because Microsoft does not evaluate them. */
   16221             :   } else {
   16222             :     /* Record the fixup in the class symbol supplement. */
   16223             :     a_scope_stack_entry       *ssep = &scope_stack_top();
   16224             :     an_initializer_fixup_ptr  ifp = alloc_initializer_fixup();
   16225             :     ifp->symbol = dps->sym;
   16226             :     ifp->token_cache = token_cache;
   16227             :     check_assertion(scope_is(ssep, sck_class_struct_union));
   16228             :     /* Indicate that unprocessed initializer fixups are associated with this
   16229             :        class (e.g., to delay the generation of a default constructor body). */
   16230             :     class_symbol_supp(symbol_for(ssep->assoc_type))
   16231             :                                                ->has_initializer_fixups = TRUE;

   16233             :        outermost enclosing class.  If this is a nested class, move up the
   16234             :        scope stack to find the appropriate entry. */

   16237             :       class_symbol_supp(symbol_for(ssep->assoc_type))
   16238             :                                                 ->initializer_fixup_list = ifp;

   16240             :       ssep->last_initializer_fixup->next = ifp;

   16308         630 : a_boolean is_valid_static_member_constant_type(
   16309             :                                         a_type_ptr      type,
   16310             :                                         a_variable_ptr  var,
   16311             :                                         a_boolean       const_type,
   16312             :                                         a_boolean       is_template,
   16313             :                                         a_boolean       nonreal_context)
   16314             : /*
   16315             : Return TRUE if type is a valid type for a static data member with an
   16316             : in-class initializer.  var is the variable for the static data member
   16317             : or variable template.  const_type is TRUE if type is const-qualified.
   16318             : is_template is TRUE if the check is being done for a variable template
   16319             : declaration.  nonreal_context is TRUE if the declaration is in a
   16320             : prototype instantiation context.
   16321             : */
   16322             : {
   16323         630 :   a_boolean     result = FALSE;
   16324             : 
   16325             :   /* A static data member of const integral or const enumeration type may
   16326             :      be initialized inside the class definition.  C++11 extended this to
   16327             :      literal type members for constexpr static data members.  In either case
   16328             :      the static data member becomes usable as a member constant.  Note that
   16329             :      the variable entry will have an initializer but it is not yet
   16330             :      considered defined.  GNU compilers allow floating-point in-class
   16331             :      initializers (also in the non-constexpr case), and some versions even
   16332             :      allow pointers to be initialized in this way.  C++/CLI also allows
   16333             :      in-class initializers for initonly static data members. */
   16334        1260 :   if ((const_type &&
   16335         630 :       (is_integral_or_enum_type(type) ||
   16336          76 :        (gpp_mode &&
   16337          38 :         (is_floating_type(type) ||
   16338          38 :          (gnu_version < 30300 && is_pointer_type(type)))))) ||
   16339          38 :        (var->is_constexpr && is_literal_type(type)) ||
   16340             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   16341             :         var->is_initonly ||
   16342             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   16343          76 :         ((nonreal_context || is_template) &&
   16344          38 :          is_template_param_type(var->is_constexpr ? skip_array_types(type)
   16345             :                                                   : type))) {
   16346             :     result = TRUE;
   16347             :   }  /* if */
   16348         630 :   return result;
   16349             : }  /* is_valid_static_member_constant_type */
   16350             : 
   16351             : 
   16352           0 : a_type_ptr check_for_invalid_member_constant(a_decl_parse_state_ptr     dps,

   16379             : 
   16380        1321 : static void decl_static_data_member(a_symbol_locator        *locator,
   16381             :                                     a_class_def_state_ptr   class_state,
   16382             :                                     a_tmpl_decl_state_ptr   templ_state,
   16383             :                                     a_member_decl_info_ptr  decl_info)
   16384             : /*
   16385             : Do processing for a static data member, including entering it in the symbol
   16386             : table.  *locator is the symbol-locator for the current declaration, and
   16387             : *p_member_type is the type with which the member was declared.  *class_state
   16388             : and *decl_info track general information about the class definition and
   16389             : specific information about the member declaration, respectively.  templ_state
   16390             : points to a block of information that is provided if this is a member
   16391             : template declaration and is NULL otherwise.
   16392             : */
   16393             : {

   17064             : 
   17065         487 : static a_boolean check_valid_union_field(a_type_ptr         field_type,
   17066             :                                          a_type_ptr         class_type,
   17067             :                                          a_boolean          is_nonstd,
   17068             :                                          a_boolean          has_initializer,
   17069             :                                          a_source_position  *pos)
   17070             : /*
   17071             : Check that a union field's type (field_type) is valid.  class_type is the type
   17072             : of the union.  is_nonstd is TRUE if class_type is a nonstandard anonymous
   17073             : union.  has_initializer is TRUE if the field has an initializer (a C++11
   17074             : feature).  pos is the position for diagnostics.
   17075             : 
   17076             : In traditional C++, nonstatic data members of a union may not be objects with
   17077             : a constructor, a destructor, or a user-defined assignment operator.  (In C++11
   17078             : those restrictions were removed.)  If any such member functions are present
   17079             : and unrestricted_unions_enabled is FALSE, then: in cfront mode issue a warning
   17080             : if there's only a user-defined assignment operator; otherwise, issue an error
   17081             : and return FALSE.  If any such member functions are present and
   17082             : unrestricted_unions_enabled is TRUE, record that fact in the symbol supplement
   17083             : for the union type (class_type).
   17084             : */
   17085             : {
   17086         487 :   a_type_ptr                     tp = skip_typerefs(field_type);
   17087         487 :   a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr  cssp, parent_cssp;
   17088         487 :   an_error_severity              severity = es_none;
   17089             : 
   17090         487 :   db_enter(4, "check_valid_union_field");

   17092         197 :     tp = underlying_array_element_type(tp);
   17093         197 :     tp = skip_typerefs(tp);
   17094             :   }  /* if */
   17095         487 :   if (is_immediate_class_type(tp)) {

   17099             :          will be repeated when a real instantiation of the enclosing union is
   17100             :          performed. */

   17102          65 :       if (class_type != NULL) {
   17103          65 :         parent_cssp = symbol_supplement_for_class(class_type);
   17104          65 :         if (cssp->has_nontrivial_default_constructor &&
   17105           0 :             !((gpp_mode || clang_mode) && has_initializer)) {
   17106           0 :           parent_cssp->variant_member_with_nontrivial_default_ctor = TRUE;
   17107             :         }  /* if */
   17108          65 :         if (cssp->makes_copy_construction_nontrivial) {
   17109           0 :           parent_cssp->variant_member_with_nontrivial_copy_ctor = TRUE;
   17110             :         }  /* if */

   17112           0 :           parent_cssp->variant_member_with_nontrivial_dtor = TRUE;

   17120           0 :           has_nontrivial_destructor(cssp)) {
   17121             :         /* A union member's (underlying) type cannot be a class with a
   17122             :            nontrivial constructor or destructor. */
   17123             :         severity = es_error;
   17124           0 :       } else if ((cssp->makes_copy_assignment_nontrivial ||
   17125           0 :                   cssp->makes_move_assignment_nontrivial) &&
   17126           0 :                  class_has_nontrivial_copy_assignment(tp)) {

   17128             :            nontrivial assignment operator, but that involves knowing which
   17129             :            variant in the union is active. */
   17130             :         /* There is no error with cfront 2.1, but it is fixed in cfront 3.0. */
   17131           0 :         severity = cfront_2_1_mode ? es_warning : es_error;

   17137           0 :           if (severity == es_error) {

   17139             :                nonstandard anonymous unions (GNU C++ imposes the constraints,
   17140             :                but Microsoft C++ doesn't).  So at most a discretionary error
   17141             :                should be issued. */
   17142           0 :             severity = es_discretionary_error;
   17143             :           }  /* if */
   17144             :         } else {

   17147           0 :         pos_ty_diagnostic(severity, err_code, pos, tp);

   17155             : 
   17156             : 
   17157             : static void diagnose_duplicate_union_field_init(
   17158             :                                      a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr  cssp,
   17159             :                                      a_symbol_ptr                   new_sym,
   17160             :                                      a_source_position              *diag_pos)
   17161             : /*
   17162             : The caller has determined that a field about to be declared (possibly through
   17163             : anonymous union field promotion) would add a second field initializer to the
   17164             : class associated with cssp.  Issue a diagnostic at the given position and
   17165             : mark the new field (described by new_sym) as not having an associated
   17166             : initializer.
   17167             : */
   17168             : {
   17169             :   a_symbol_ptr  sym = cssp->symbols != NULL ? cssp->symbols
   17170             :                                             : cssp->pointers_block.symbols;
   17171             : 
   17172             :   /* Search for the prior initializer through the symbol list so that
   17173             :      anonymous union members are also found. */
   17174             :   for (; sym != NULL; sym = sym->next_in_scope) {
   17175             :     if (symbol_is(sym, sk_field) && sym->variant.field.ptr->has_initializer) {
   17176             :       break;

   17179             :   if (sym == NULL) {

   17190           0 : static a_symbol_ptr find_anonymous_parent_object_symbol_clone(
   17191             :                                                a_symbol_ptr  apo_sym,
   17192             :                                                a_symbol_ptr  *new_apo_sym_list,
   17193             :                                                a_symbol_ptr  assoc_object_sym)
   17194             : /*
   17195             : apo_sym is an anonymous parent object symbol whose "clone" needs either to
   17196             : be found or created.  Finding means looking on the list pointed to by

   17202           0 :   a_symbol_ptr  new_apo_sym;
   17203             :

   17212             :       break;
