   17250         764 : static void promote_anonymous_union_field_symbol(
   17251             :                                          a_symbol_ptr         sym,
   17252             :                                          a_type_ptr           class_type,
   17253             :                                          a_symbol_ptr         *new_apo_syms,
   17254             :                                          a_symbol_ptr         assoc_object_sym,
   17255             :                                          an_access_specifier  new_access,
   17256             :                                          a_boolean            reuse_symbol,
   17257             :                                          a_boolean            is_nonstd)
   17258             : /*
   17259             : sym represents a field in an anonymous union.  This procedure promotes it to
   17260             : the surrounding (class or namespace) scope.  class_type is the class into which
   17261             : the field is being promoted (or NULL if the promotion is into a namespace
   17262             : scope).  *new_apo_syms is a list of newly created anonymous union parent
   17263             : symbols that may need to be fixed up later on.  assoc_object_sym represents the
   17264             : anonymous union object (field or variable) and new_access is the access that
   17265             : must be given to the promoted field symbol.  If reuse_symbol is TRUE, sym can
   17266             : just be moved; otherwise, it needs to be copied.  is_nonstd is TRUE if the
   17267             : promotion is for a nonstandard anonymous union.
   17268             : */
   17269             : {
   17270         764 :   a_symbol_ptr  apo_sym = sym->variant.field.anonymous_parent_object;
   17271         764 :   a_field_ptr   field = sym->variant.field.ptr;
   17272             :  
   17273         764 :   if (is_nonstd && gpp_mode &&
   17274           0 :       !check_valid_union_field(field->type, class_type, /*is_nonstd=*/TRUE,
   17275           0 :                                field->has_initializer,
   17276             :                                &field->source_corresp.decl_position)) {
   17277             :     /* GNU C++ compilers apply the same constraints to nonstandard anonymous
   17278             :        unions (which aren't really unions) as to ordinary unions.  There is
   17279             :        nothing to do because check_valid_union_field already issued the
   17280             :        diagnostic.  This test was already done for standard anonymous (and
   17281             :        named) unions, but for nonstandard anonymous unions it had to wait
   17282             :        until the lack of a declarator determined that this is in fact a
   17283             :        nonstandard anonymous union. */
   17284         764 :   }  /* if */
   17285         764 :   if (reuse_symbol) {
   17286             :     /* Allow conflicts with existing fields in GNU C and Microsoft C++ bugs
   17287             :        modes. */
   17288         764 :     a_boolean  suppress_error = gcc_mode || (microsoft_bugs && !C_mode());
   17289             :     /* Unlink the symbol from the inactive list and link it back into
   17290             :        the symbol table in the current scope. */
   17291         764 :     remove_anonymous_union_member_from_inactive_symbols_list(sym);
   17292             :       /* Enter the symbol back into the current scope. */
   17293         764 :     reenter_symbol(sym, depth_scope_stack, suppress_error);
   17294             :   } else {
   17295             :     /* The symbol has to be kept bound to the type, since the latter
   17296             :        may be used again.  Therefore, we have to clone the symbol,
   17297             :        making a copy of it in the new class scope.  Note that there may
   17298             :        turn out to be a many-to-one mapping between member symbols and
   17299             :        field-of-assoc-object-type.  Note that the new symbol should
   17300             :        normally not conflict with existing fields, but in GNU C mode
   17301             :        such conflicts are ignored and only the first declaration is
   17302             :        visible. */
   17303           0 :     a_symbol_locator loc;
   17304           0 :     make_locator_for_symbol(sym, &loc);
   17305           0 :     loc.source_position = field->source_corresp.decl_position;
   17306           0 :     sym = enter_local_symbol(sym->kind, &loc, depth_scope_stack,
   17307             :                              /*suppress_error=*/gcc_mode);
   17308           0 :     sym->variant.field.ptr = field;
   17309             :   }  /* if */
   17310             :   /* Set parent information in the symbol but not in the IL entry.  The
   17311             :      symbol is promoted, but the type remains nested. */
   17312         764 :   if (class_type != NULL) {
   17313             :     /* The members of an anonymous union within a class take on the access
   17314             :        specifier of the anonymous union itself (except in some GNU C++ mode
   17315             :        cases); the members of a variable anonymous union should be (i.e.,
   17316             :        should remain) public. */
   17317         764 :     if (gpp_mode &&
   17318         148 :         !same_entities(parent_class_of(parent_class_of(field)), class_type)) {
   17319             :       /* GNU compilers only adjust the accessibility of a promoted field the
   17320             :          first time it is promoted.  I.e., if the field appears within
   17321             :          multiple levels of anonymous unions, it may not eventually acquire
   17322             :          the accessibility of the outermost anonymous union.  For example:
   17323             :              class C { union { struct { int i; }; }; };
   17324             :          Here, field "i" is adjusted as it is promoted from the nonstandard
   17325             :          anonymous to the standard anonymous union (which leaves the
   17326             :          accessibility as public), but it is not adjusted during the second
   17327             :          promotion from the union to class C (the end result is that C::i is
   17328             :          publicly accessible). */
   17329             :       /* The field should normally already have public access, but to avoid
   17330             :          repeated errors on private members of nested anonymous unions, we
   17331             :          force access to be public here. */
   17332           0 :       field->source_corresp.access = (an_access_specifier)as_public;
   17333             :     } else {
   17334         764 :       field->source_corresp.access = new_access;
   17335             :     }  /* if */
   17336             :     /* If the promoted field has an initializer, the default constructor of
   17337             :        the enclosing class cannot be trivial. */
   17338         764 :     if (field->has_initializer) {
   17339           0 :       check_assertion(scope_is(&scope_stack_top(), sck_class_struct_union));
   17340           0 :       scope_stack_top().class_def_state->default_ctor_is_nontrivial = TRUE;
   17341             :     }  /* if */
   17342         764 :     set_class_membership(sym, (a_source_correspondence *)NULL, class_type);
   17343             :   } else {
   17344           0 :     set_namespace_membership(sym, (a_source_correspondence *)NULL,
   17345             :                              (a_namespace_ptr)NULL);
   17346             :   }  /* if */
   17347         764 :   if (apo_sym == NULL) {
   17348         764 :     sym->variant.field.anonymous_parent_object = assoc_object_sym;
   17349           0 :   } else if (reuse_symbol) {
   17350             :     /* Only update the anonymous-parent-object pointer for a given
   17351             :        symbol on the first promotion. */
   17352             :     /* Walk up the chain of anonymous_parent_objects, which represent
   17353             :        nested anonymous unions.  Stop if the current assoc_object_sym
   17354             :        is found -- it will have been recorded, presumably, for a
   17355             :        previously promoted field). */
   17356           0 :     while (apo_sym != assoc_object_sym) {
   17357           0 :       if (apo_sym->variant.field.anonymous_parent_object == NULL) {
   17358             :         /* The end of the list: add assoc_object_sym and stop. */
   17359           0 :         apo_sym->variant.field.anonymous_parent_object = assoc_object_sym;
   17360           0 :         break;
   17361             :       }  /* if */
   17362             :       /* Advance up the chain. */
   17363             :       apo_sym = apo_sym->variant.field.anonymous_parent_object;
   17364             :     }  /* while */
   17365             :   } else {
   17366             :     /* Just as the original anonymous union member symbol had to be
   17367             :        cloned, so too must its parent chain be cloned.  Go through the
   17368             :        list of anonymous-union-parent symbols that have already been
   17369             :        cloned and look for a match.  If none is found, make a new one. */
   17370           0 :     sym->variant.field.anonymous_parent_object =
   17371           0 :                  find_anonymous_parent_object_symbol_clone(apo_sym,
   17372             :                                                            new_apo_syms,
   17373             :                                                            assoc_object_sym);
   17374             :   }  /* if */
   17375         764 : }  /* promote_anonymous_union_field_symbol */
   17376             : 
   17377             : 
   17378         382 : void check_anonymous_union_symbols(a_symbol_ptr           assoc_object_sym,
   17379             :                                    a_boolean              is_nonstd)
   17380             : /*
   17381             : assoc_object_sym is a symbol for an unnamed field or variable that is the
   17382             : object associated with an anonymous union.  The type of the field or
   17383             : variable is an anonymous union type.  Process the member symbols of the
   17384             : anonymous union: make a pass over all its members, perform some error
   17385             : checking, and promote each field from the anonymous union to its containing
   17386             : scope.  The scope to which the symbols are promoted is decl_scope_level.
   17387             : 
   17388             : If extended anonymous unions are accepted, then, when assoc_object_sym refers
   17389             : to a field, its type may also be an unnamed struct or class, or a typedef
   17390             : referring to an unnamed class, struct, or union.  If the type is a typedef,
   17391             : or a named struct or class, the symbols are not promoted, but rather new
   17392             : ones are allocated in the scope specified by decl_scope_level.  For such
   17393             : nonstandard anonymous unions is_nonstd is TRUE.
   17394             : */
   17395             : {
   17396         382 :   a_symbol_ptr                   sym, next_sym, mf_sym, last_prev_sym = NULL;
   17397         382 :   a_type_ptr                     class_type;
   17398         382 :   a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr  cssp, parent_cssp = NULL;
   17399         382 :   a_class_type_supplement_ptr    ctsp;
   17400         382 :   an_access_specifier            access;
   17401         382 :   an_access_specifier            assoc_object_access =
   17402             :                                           (an_access_specifier)as_inaccessible;
   17403         382 :   a_boolean                      access_error_already_issued = FALSE;
   17404         382 :   a_boolean                      member_function_error_already_issued = FALSE;
   17405         382 :   a_boolean                      is_overloaded;
   17406         382 :   a_type_ptr                     assoc_object_type = NULL, tp;
   17407         382 :   a_boolean                      reuse_symbol = TRUE;
   17408         382 :   a_field_ptr                    au_field;
   17409         382 :   a_symbol_ptr                   new_apo_sym_list = NULL;
   17410             : 
   17411         382 :   db_enter(4, "check_anonymous_union_symbols");
   17412             :   /* If the anonymous union is a class member, set class_type to the
   17413             :      enclosing class type. */
   17414         382 :   if (scope_is(&scope_stack_top(), sck_class_struct_union)) {
   17415         382 :     class_type = scope_stack_top().assoc_type;
   17416             :   } else {
   17417             :     class_type = NULL;
   17418             :   }  /* if */
   17419         382 :   if (class_type != NULL) {
   17420             :     /* Record the last symbol in the class prior to the addition of promoted
   17421             :        fields.  This simplifies traversing the added symbols later on. */
   17422         382 :     check_assertion(scope_is(&scope_stack_top(), sck_class_struct_union));
   17423         382 :     last_prev_sym = assoc_pointers_block_of(&scope_stack_top())->last_symbol;

   17425             :   }  /* if */

   17433             :       }  /* if */

   17435             :       break;

   17437         382 :       au_field = assoc_object_sym->variant.field.ptr;
   17438         382 :       assoc_object_type = au_field->type;
   17439         382 :       assoc_object_access = au_field->source_corresp.access;
   17440         382 :       if (au_field->is_mutable) {
   17441             :         /* No storage class is allowed at all, but the others are diagnosed
   17442             :            elsewhere already. */
   17443           0 :         pos_error(ec_no_mutable_allowed_on_anonymous_union,
   17444             :                   &assoc_object_sym->decl_position);
   17445             :       }  /* if */
   17446         382 :       check_assertion(is_class_struct_union_type(assoc_object_type));
   17447         382 :       if (assoc_object_type->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_typeref ||
   17448         382 :           has_name(assoc_object_type)) {
   17449           0 :         check_assertion(C_mode() || (gpp_mode && gnu_version < 30400));
   17450             :         reuse_symbol = FALSE;
   17451             :       }  /* if */
   17452             :       break;
   17453           0 :     default:
   17454           0 :       unexpected_condition_str(

   17456             :   }  /* switch */
   17457             : #if DEBUG

   17482             :     }  /* if */

   17485             :        does not consider anonymous union types to be unnamed for mangling

   17487             :        here). */
   17488             : #if IA64_ABI

   17493             :     } else

   17502             :   }  /* if */
   17503             :   /* Get the list of symbols that are to be either promoted (i.e., reused
   17504             :      in the new scope) or cloned. */
   17505         382 :   cssp = symbol_supplement_for_class(assoc_object_type);
   17506         382 :   sym = cssp->symbols;

   17508             :     /* The symbols list for the anonymous union will be eliminated.  Its
   17509             :        field symbols are promoted to the scope of the containing class. */
   17510         382 :     cssp->symbols = NULL;

   17515             :     check_assertion(cssp->finalizer == NULL &&

   17517             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   17518         382 :     cssp->trivial_default_constructor = NULL;

   17550             :          list when it is reentered in the symbol table. */
   17551         830 :       sym->next_in_scope = NULL;
   17552         830 :       sym->prev_in_scope = NULL;
   17553         830 :       remove_symbol_from_lookup_table(sym, &cssp->pointers_block);
   17554         830 :       if (!is_template_symbol(sym)) {

   17556             :            rather it will be a member of the class_type.  (Templates are not
   17557             :            permitted and their symbols will be removed without being promoted.
   17558             :            To avoid inconsistencies between the template symbol and the
   17559             :            prototype instantiation, we don't clear the parent state.) */
   17560         830 :         sym->is_class_member = FALSE;
   17561         830 :         sym->parent.class_type = NULL;
   17562             :       }  /* if */
   17563             :     } else {
   17564             : #if DEBUG
   17565           0 :       if (debug_level >= 4) {
   17566           0 :         db_symbol(sym, "cloning: ", 2);
   17567             :       }  /* if */
   17568             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   17569             :       /* Creation of a new symbol is only implemented for fields, because it
   17570             :          can only happen in C mode or with C++ classes that have no C++
   17571             :          features.  (Compiler-generated special members are fine.) */
   17572           0 :       check_assertion_str(
   17573             :                      symbol_is(sym, sk_field) ||
   17574             :                      (symbol_is(sym, sk_member_function) &&

   17845             : static a_boolean is_compiler_generated_member_function(a_symbol_ptr  sym)
   17846             : /*

   17873             : 
   17874        1186 : static a_boolean is_anonymous_union_decl(a_member_decl_info_ptr  decl_info)
   17875             : /*
   17876             : A declaration has appeared in which there is no declarator.  Return TRUE if
   17877             : it is an anonymous union or anonymous structure declaration (in a mode that
   17878             : accepts such a feature).  If this is not a standard C++ anonymous union,
   17879             : return TRUE and also set the is_nonstd_anonymous_union flag in the
   17880             : member-decl-info block.  (Note that, for historical reasons, C11 anonymous
   17881             : unions and anonymous structs use the "nonstandard" terminology in this
   17882             : context.)
   17883             : */
   17884             : {
   17885        1186 :   a_type_ptr       member_type = decl_info->decl_state.type;
   17886        1186 :   a_decl_flag_set  dso_flags = decl_info->decl_state.dso_flags;
   17887        1186 :   a_boolean        c11_case = c11_mode;
   17888             : 
   17889        1186 :   if (!C_mode() && member_type->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_union) {
   17890             :     /* Consider the standard C++-mode feature first. */
   17891          94 :     if (member_type->source_corresp.name != NULL ||
   17892          74 :         !(dso_flags & DSO_DEFINES_SOMETHING)) {
   17893             :       /* This union was named and/or is a reference to a previously defined
   17894             :          type -- in any case, it's not an anonymous union. */
   17895          74 :     } else if (dso_flags & (DSO_DECLARES_SOMETHING | DSO_FRIEND)) {
   17896             :       /* This cannot be a standard or a nonstandard anonymous union in C++. */
   17897             :     } else {
   17898          74 :       decl_info->is_anonymous_union = TRUE;
   17899             :     }  /* if */
   17900        1092 :   } else if (!allow_nonstandard_anonymous_unions &&
   17901           0 :              !allow_c11_anonymous_unions) {
   17902             :     /* Not a mode that would accept an anonymous union/struct feature. */
   17903        1092 :   } else if (!is_class_struct_union_type(member_type)) {
   17904             :     /* Not a pseudo-anonymous-union -- it's not a class, struct,
   17905             :        or union type. */

   17907         308 :               ((gcc_mode && gnu_version >= 30300) && !ms_extensions)) &&

   17909         308 :               !(skip_typerefs(member_type))->
   17910             :                             variant.class_struct_union.originally_unnamed)) {

   17912             :        declaration, or it's a typedef name and a tag was declared originally,
   17913             :        or else it's a C++ friend declaration. */

   17924             :            E.g.:  typedef union { int i; } U;
   17925             :                   struct S { U; };

   17927             :            don't accept it; disallowing this in C++ also simplifies lowering
   17928             :            later on).  C11 doesn't permit this form either. */
   17929           0 :       } else if ((microsoft_mode || gnu_mode)) {
   17930             :         /* In Microsoft and GNU modes, cv-qualifiers are allowed on anonymous-
   17931             :            union-like constructs not expressed through a typedef.  In
   17932             :            Microsoft C mode, cv-qualifiers are also allowed on anonymous-union-
   17933             :            like constructs expressed through a typedef (the C++-mode case was
   17934             :            already handled above). */
   17935           0 :         if (microsoft_mode) {

   17938             :           /* GNU mode and member_type is a qualified immediate class type
   17939             :              (i.e., there is no typedef involved). */
   17940           0 :           tp = skip_typerefs(tp);
   17941             :         } else {
   17942             :           /* GNU C mode nonstandard anonymous union expressed through a
   17943             :              typedef: Ignore the typedef, but not any cv-qualifiers.  */
   17944           0 :           check_assertion(C_mode());
   17945           0 :           tp = skip_typedefs(tp);
   17946             :         }  /* if */
   17947             :       } else {
   17948           0 :         tp = skip_typedefs(tp);

   17950             :     }  /* if */

   17952             :       /* This must be a cv qualifier on top of what we already know to be a
   17953             :          class, struct, or union type, or a typedef in C++ mode.  Either way,
   17954             :          it is disqualified from being treated as an anonymous-union-like
   17955             :          construct (except sometimes in Microsoft and GNU C++ modes; in those
   17956             :          cases tp will have been adjusted above). */
   17957             :     } else {
   17958         308 :       if (C_mode()) {
   17959             :         /* In C mode that's all we need to know. */

   17962             :         /* Some C++ features cannot appear in nonstandard anonymous unions
   17963             :            (e.g., member functions, static data members). */

   17972           0 :             decl_info->is_anonymous_union = TRUE;

   17974           0 :               if (sym->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_field) {
   17975             :                 /* Okay. */
   17976           0 :               } else if (sym == cssp->trivial_default_constructor) {
   17977             :                 /* Okay. */
   17978           0 :               } else if (is_type_symbol(sym) &&
   17979           0 :                          same_entities(tp, member_type)) {
   17980             :                 /* Okay if the nonstandard anonymous union is not of the
   17981             :                    variety introduced with a typedef. */
   17982           0 :               } else if (is_compiler_generated_member_function(sym)) {
   17983             :                 /* A compiler generated function -- most likely a default
   17984             :                    assignment operator.  This is okay. */
   17985             :               } else {
   17986           0 :                 decl_info->is_anonymous_union = FALSE;
   17987           0 :                 break;
   17988             :               }  /* if */
   17989             :             }  /* for */
   17990             :           }  /* if */
   17991             :         }  /* if */
   17992             :       }  /* if */
   17993         308 :       if (decl_info->is_anonymous_union) {
   17994             :         /* Set the nonstandard flag. */
   17995         308 :         decl_info->is_nonstd_anonymous_union = TRUE;
   17996             :         /* If appropriate, issue a diagnostic that this is an extension. */

   17999         308 :         } else if (strict_ansi_mode) {

   18002             :                                     ec_nonstd_unnamed_member,

   18012        1186 :   return decl_info->is_anonymous_union;

   18015             : 
   18016           0 : static void add_error_field(a_type_ptr  class_type,
   18017             :                             a_field_ptr *end_of_list)

   18043             : 
   18044           0 : static void check_enum_type_for_bit_field(a_type_ptr    bit_field_type,
   18045             :                                           unsigned long bit_field_size,
   18046             :                                           a_boolean     *need_signed_type)
   18047             : /*
   18048             : Check to see that the values of the enumerated type bit_field_type will all
   18049             : fit in a bit field of size bit_field_size.  If not, give a warning.  Return
   18050             : *need_signed_type TRUE if the bit field type must be signed, FALSE if it
   18051             : must be unsigned.
   18052             : */
   18053             : {
   18054           0 :   a_boolean      use_signed = FALSE, smallest_is_negative;
   18055           0 :   a_constant_ptr smallest, largest;
   18056           0 :   unsigned long  bits_needed, bits_needed_largest, bits_needed_smallest;
   18057           0 :   a_constant_ptr enum_con;
   18058             : 
   18059           0 :   enum_con = enum_constants(bit_field_type);
   18060           0 :   if (enum_con == NULL) {
   18061             :     /* There are no enumeration constants, so no bits are needed to
   18062             :        represent all of them; by definition, they fit in the bit field. */
   18063             :   } else {
   18064             :     /* Check the constants on the list.  Start by finding the largest and
   18065             :        smallest constants.  We are assuming most enum type lists
   18066             :        won't be too long, and there won't be too many bit fields with enum
   18067             :        type, so a linear search should be acceptable.  Furthermore,
   18068             :        the usual case is that the bit field is big enough, so we're probably
   18069             :        going to scan the whole constant list; therefore it's okay to always
   18070             :        scan the whole list even though some errors could be detected during
   18071             :        the scan. */
   18072             :     smallest = enum_con;
   18073             :     largest = enum_con;
   18074           0 :     for (;;) {
   18075           0 :       enum_con = enum_con->next;
   18076           0 :       if (enum_con == NULL) break;
   18077           0 :       if (cmp_integer_constants(enum_con, smallest) < 0) smallest = enum_con;
   18078           0 :       if (cmp_integer_constants(enum_con, largest)  > 0) largest  = enum_con;
   18079             :     }  /* for */
   18080             :     /* Determine the number of bits needed to represent largest value. */
   18081           0 :     bits_needed_largest =
   18082           0 :                         bits_required_to_represent_integer_constant(largest);
   18083             :     /* See if the smallest value is negative. */
   18084           0 :     smallest_is_negative = (sign_of_integer_constant(smallest) < 0);
   18085           0 :     if (targ_enum_bit_fields_are_always_unsigned) {
   18086             :       /* Enum bit fields are always unsigned (many ABIs require this). */
   18087             :       use_signed = FALSE;
   18088             :       bits_needed = bits_needed_largest;
   18089             :     } else {
   18090             :       /* Determine the proper signedness for the bit field.  One can't
   18091             :          simply use the signedness of the enum type, since that was chosen
   18092             :          for efficiency reasons: if the enum values just fit in the bit
   18093             :          field size, an unsigned field might be necessary even though a 
   18094             :          signed type was a good choice for the enum type. */
   18095           0 :       if (smallest_is_negative) {
   18096             :         /* Some enum values are negative, so a signed type is required.
   18097             :            The enum type must already be signed. */
   18098             :         use_signed = TRUE;
   18099           0 :       } else if (bits_needed_largest >= bit_field_size) {
   18100             :         /* The largest value is nonnegative (because the smallest is
   18101             :            nonnegative), and it's big enough that it wouldn't fit in a
   18102             :            signed field.  Therefore, an unsigned type is required. */
   18103             :         use_signed = FALSE;
   18104             :       } else {
   18105             :         /* The signedness is not forced by the enum values, so use the 
   18106             :            target preference. */
   18107             :         /* Note that because bits_needed_largest is at least 1, we can
   18108             :            never get here for a bit field of length one. */
   18109           0 :         use_signed = !targ_nonnegative_enum_bit_field_is_unsigned;
   18110             :       }  /* if */
   18111           0 :       if (use_signed && sign_of_integer_constant(largest) > 0) {
   18112             :         /* Using a signed bit field and the largest is positive, so the
   18113             :            largest value really requires one more bit for a zero sign. */
   18114           0 :         bits_needed_largest++;
   18115             :       }  /* if */
   18116             :       /* Determine the number of bits needed. */
   18117           0 :       bits_needed_smallest =
   18118           0 :                         bits_required_to_represent_integer_constant(smallest);
   18119           0 :       if (bits_needed_largest > bits_needed_smallest) {
   18120             :         bits_needed = bits_needed_largest;
   18121             :       } else {
   18122             :         bits_needed = bits_needed_smallest;
   18123             :       }  /* if */
   18124             :     }  /* if */
   18125             :     /* Check that the enum values will fit in the bit field. */
   18126           0 :     if (bits_needed > bit_field_size) {
   18127           0 :       pos_warning(ec_enum_bit_field_too_small, &error_position);
   18128             :     }  /* if */
   18129           0 :     if (targ_enum_bit_fields_are_always_unsigned && smallest_is_negative) {
   18130           0 :       type_warning(ec_unsigned_enum_bit_field_with_signed_enumerator,
   18131             :                    bit_field_type);
   18132             :     }  /* if */
   18133             :   }  /* if */
   18134           0 :   *need_signed_type = use_signed;
   18135           0 : }  /* check_enum_type_for_bit_field */
   18136             : 
   18137             : 
   18138          88 : static void apply_bit_field_size(a_field_ptr       field,
   18139             :                                  a_constant_ptr    size_constant,
   18140             :                                  a_boolean         *unnamed_bit_field,
   18141             :                                  a_type_ptr        *p_base_type,
   18142             :                                  a_symbol_locator  *locator)
   18143             : /*
   18144             : The given field is declared as a bit field with the given size constant:
   18145             : 
   18146             :     unsigned int j: 5 ;
   18147             :                     ^---- this size.
   18148             : 
   18149             : If *unnamed_bit_field is TRUE, the bit-field is unnamed.  *p_base_type gives
   18150             : the base type of the declaration (unsigned int in the above example); it may
   18151             : be updated on return.
   18152             : */
   18153             : {
   18154          88 :   unsigned long    bit_field_size, max_size_allowed;
   18155          88 :   unsigned long    declared_bit_field_size;
   18156          88 :   a_type_ptr       base_type = *p_base_type;
   18157          88 :   a_boolean        err = FALSE, is_signed = FALSE, templated_type = FALSE;
   18158          88 :   a_type_ptr       bit_field_type;
   18159          88 :   an_integer_kind  int_kind;
   18160             : 
   18161          88 :   db_enter(3, "apply_bit_field_size");
   18162             :   /* ANSI C says the type of a bit-field must be int, unsigned int,
   18163             :      or signed int, but we also allow enums and integral types (see A.6.5.8
   18164             :      in the Common Extensions appendix).  pcc and C++ (ARM 9.6) allow any
   18165             :      integral or enum type. */
   18166          88 :   bit_field_type = skip_typerefs(base_type);
   18167          88 :   if (is_template_param_type(bit_field_type)) {
   18168             :     templated_type = TRUE;
   18169          88 :   } else if (!is_integral_or_enum_type(bit_field_type)) {
   18170             :     /* Diagnostic has already been issued. */
   18171           0 :     bit_field_type = integer_type((an_integer_kind)ik_int);
   18172             :   }  /* if */
   18173             :   /* Note that if the base type was not integral it has been replaced by
   18174             :      "int" by this point. */
   18175          88 :   field->bit_size_constant = alloc_shareable_constant(size_constant);
   18176          88 :   if (is_error_constant(size_constant)) {
   18177             :     /* Use small value to avoid more errors, but not 1 which is special. */
   18178           0 :     declared_bit_field_size = bit_field_size = targ_char_bit;
   18179           0 :     err = TRUE;
   18180          88 :   } else if (size_constant->kind != (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_integer &&
   18181           0 :              is_template_dependent_context()) {
   18182             :     /* During the prototype instantiation, the size constant may not be an
   18183             :        integer (it could be a template parameter or even an aggregate
   18184             :        constant).  Since the actual value is not known, use a small value
   18185             :        that is not 1. */
   18186           0 :     declared_bit_field_size = bit_field_size = targ_char_bit;
   18187             :   } else {
   18188          88 :     a_boolean  ovflo = FALSE;
   18189             : #if CHECKING
   18190          88 :     if (size_constant->kind != (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_integer) {
   18191           0 :       internal_error("apply_bit_field_size: size not int");
   18192             :     }  /* if */
   18193             : #endif /* CHECKING */
   18194             :     /* The size of the bit field must be non-negative and must not exceed
   18195             :        the size of the underlying type. */
   18196          88 :     if (templated_type) {
   18197           0 :       max_size_allowed =
   18198           0 :                   (unsigned long)(targ_sizeof_largest_integer*targ_char_bit);
   18199             :     } else {
   18200          88 :       max_size_allowed = (unsigned long)(bit_field_type->size*targ_char_bit);
   18201             :     }  /* if */

   18203          88 :                      unsigned_value_of_integer_constant(size_constant, &ovflo);
   18204          88 :     declared_bit_field_size = bit_field_size;

   18209             :         /* An error has already been issued. */

   18213           0 :         pos_error(ec_bad_bit_field_size, &error_position);

   18215           0 :         err = TRUE;
   18216           0 :       } else if (bit_field_size > max_size_allowed) {

   18218           0 :         char  buffer[8];

   18223             :              turned into ordinary fields. */

   18226             :         }  /* if */
   18227             :       }  /* if */

   18229          88 :     } else if (bit_field_size == 0) {
   18230             :       /* The bit-field size is zero, so the field must be unnamed. */
   18231           0 :       if (*unnamed_bit_field) {
   18232             :         /* Okay. */
   18233           0 :       } else if (any_cfront_mode()) {
   18234             :         /* Cfront compatibility -- permit named bit fields to have zero
   18235             :            size, but change the value of *unnamed_bit_field so that they
   18236             :            will not be entered into the symbol table.  Note that it would
   18237             :            be possible for the name to be used again (though this would not
   18238             :            be acceptable to cfront), but it also means the field will not
   18239             :            be subject to initialization (cfront allows such fields to be
   18240             :            initialized and may generate invalid C as a result) and it means
   18241             :            the field cannot be referenced (again, cfront allows it and
   18242             :            generates invalid C). */
   18243           0 :         pos_warning(ec_zero_length_bit_field_must_be_unnamed,
   18244             :                     &locator->source_position);
   18245           0 :         *unnamed_bit_field = TRUE;
   18246             :       } else {
   18247             :         /* Error. */
   18248           0 :         pos_error(ec_zero_length_bit_field_must_be_unnamed,
   18249             :                   &locator->source_position);
   18250           0 :         bit_field_size = 1;
   18251           0 :         err = TRUE;
   18252             :       }  /* if */
   18253             :     }  /* if */
   18254             :   }  /* if */
   18255             :   /* Determine the signedness of the bit field. */
   18256          88 :   if (templated_type) {
   18257             :     /* Signedness constraints cannot be checked. */
   18258          88 :   } else if (bit_field_type->variant.integer.enum_type) {
   18259             :     /* The integral type is an enum type.  Give a warning if any of the
   18260             :        enumeration's constants will not fit in the bit field, and determine
   18261             :        whether the bit field should be signed or unsigned. */
   18262           0 :     if (size_constant->kind != (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_template_param) {
   18263           0 :       check_enum_type_for_bit_field(bit_field_type, bit_field_size,
   18264             :                                     &is_signed);
   18265             :     }  /* if */
   18266             :   } else {
   18267          88 :     int_kind = bit_field_type->variant.integer.int_kind;
   18268          88 :     if (bit_field_type->variant.integer.explicitly_signed ||
   18269          88 :         (C_dialect != C_dialect_pcc &&
   18270             :          int_kind == (an_integer_kind)ik_signed_char)) {
   18271             :       /* The integral type was explicitly signed in the source, e.g.,
   18272             :          "signed int" instead of just "int".  (This information comes from
   18273             :          the type entry itself.)  That forces the bit field to be signed.
   18274             :          The integral type already has the right kind and signedness.  Note
   18275             :          that this won't happen in pcc mode because "signed" is not part of
   18276             :          the pcc language. */
   18277           0 :       is_signed = TRUE;
   18278          88 :     } else if (!int_kind_is_signed[int_kind]) {
   18279             :       /* The integral type must have been explicitly declared "unsigned", or
   18280             :           else it's a plain "char" that is treated as unsigned. */
   18281           0 :       is_signed = FALSE;
   18282             :     } else {
   18283             :       /* The integral type is "plain" (i.e., plain "int", "char", "short",
   18284             :          "long", or "long long") -- it's not explicitly signed or unsigned and
   18285             :          it's not an enum type. */
   18286          88 :       if (any_cfront_mode()) {
   18287             :         /* cfront treats all bit fields as unsigned. */
   18288           0 :         is_signed = FALSE;
   18289          88 :       } else if (targ_plain_int_bit_field_is_unsigned) {
   18290             :         /* The default for plain integral types in bit fields is unsigned. */
   18291           0 :         is_signed = FALSE;
   18292           0 :         if (C_dialect == C_dialect_pcc) {
   18293             :           /* In pcc mode when the environment expects plain-int bit fields to
   18294             :              be unsigned, change the underlying type to reflect that -- this
   18295             :              produces more accurate IL for expressions in which integral
   18296             :              promotion is not done. */
   18297           0 :           int_kind = unsigned_int_kind_of[int_kind];
   18298           0 :           bit_field_type = integer_type(int_kind);
   18299             :         }  /* if */
   18300          88 :       } else if (bit_field_size == 1 &&
   18301           0 :                  (targ_force_one_bit_bit_field_to_be_unsigned ||
   18302           0 :                   is_bool_type(bit_field_type))) {
   18303             :         /* Force a one-bit bit field to be unsigned, because a bit field
   18304             :            consisting of only a sign is not very useful.  Also force one-bit
   18305             :            bool bit fields to have an unsigned underlying type (the bool type
   18306             :            itself is neither signed nor unsigned, but its underlying type is
   18307             :            often signed). */
   18308           0 :         is_signed = FALSE;
   18309             :       } else {
   18310             :         /* The default for plain integral types in bit fields is signed. */
   18311          88 :         is_signed = TRUE;
   18312             :       }  /* if */
   18313             :     }  /* if */
   18314             :   }  /* if */
   18315             :   /* Give a warning for a signed one-bit field; ANSI C allows it, but it's
   18316             :      strange.  If the bit field type is an enumeration type, warnings were
   18317             :      already issued if the enumerator constant value cannot be represented
   18318             :      by the field; so we don't issue another warning here. */
   18319          88 :   if (!err && !*unnamed_bit_field && is_signed && bit_field_size == 1 &&
   18320           0 :       !bit_field_type->variant.integer.enum_type) {
   18321           0 :     pos_warning(ec_signed_one_bit_field, &locator->source_position);
   18322             :   }  /* if */
   18323             :   /* Set base_type to bit_field_type with the proper type qualifiers. */
   18324          88 :   if (bit_field_type == skip_typerefs(base_type)) {
   18325             :     /* The original type, base_type, has turned out to be correct after all.
   18326             :        Use it directly to avoid wasting the type qualifiers, if any. */
   18327             :   } else {
   18328             :     /* Build a type with the right qualifiers.  Note that bit_field_type
   18329             :        should not have any qualifiers at this point; the qualifiers from the
   18330             :        base type, if any, are added. */
   18331           0 :     base_type = make_identically_qualified_type(bit_field_type, base_type);

   18335          88 :   field->declared_bit_size = declared_bit_field_size;
   18336          88 :   field->bit_field_is_signed = is_signed;
   18337          88 : done:;
   18338          88 :   db_exit();

   18341             : 
   18342       24401 : static void check_field_type(a_symbol_locator        *locator,
   18343             :                              a_class_def_state_ptr   class_state,
   18344             :                              a_member_decl_info_ptr  decl_info,
   18345             :                              a_boolean               is_bit_field)
   18346             : /*
   18347             : Check that the type of a nonstatic data member is valid, and report incomplete
   18348             : types and incorrect types on bit-field declarations.  *locator is the symbol
   18349             : locator for the field being declared.  *class_state and *decl_info track
   18350             : general information about the class definition and specific information about
   18351             : the member declaration, respectively.  is_bit_field is TRUE for bit field
   18352             : declarations.
   18353             : */
   18354             : {
   18355       24401 :   a_decl_parse_state  *decl_state = &decl_info->decl_state;
   18356       24401 :   a_type_ptr          field_type = decl_state->type;
   18357       24401 :   a_type_ptr          ufield_type = skip_typerefs(field_type);
   18358       24401 :   a_type_ptr          class_type = class_state->class_type;
   18359       24401 :   a_boolean           err = is_error_type(ufield_type);
   18360             : 
   18361             :   /* First check whether there was a preceding field of incomplete array type
   18362             :      for which an error should now be issued. */
   18363       24401 :   if (class_state->last_field_is_incomplete_array) {
   18364           0 :     a_field_ptr  prev_field = class_state->end_of_field_list;
   18365             : 
   18366           0 :     check_assertion(prev_field != NULL &&
   18367             :                     !is_union_type(class_state->class_type));
   18368           0 :     pos_error(ec_incomplete_type_not_allowed,
   18369             :               &prev_field->source_corresp.decl_position);
   18370           0 :     prev_field->type = error_type();
   18371           0 :     class_state->last_field_is_incomplete_array = FALSE;
   18372       24401 :   } else if (ms_extensions || (c99_mode && !gcc_mode)) {
   18373             :     /* In Microsoft mode a class or struct may include a member whose type
   18374             :        contains a final field that is an unknown-size array (in nonstrict C99
   18375             :        mode, we accept this as an extension).  Such a member must be the last
   18376             :        field.  If the previous field was of such a type, no error was issued,
   18377             :        in case it was the last field; issue the error now.  (In GNU mode,
   18378             :        such members are also allowed, but they are not constrained to be the
   18379             :        last field.) */
   18380           0 :     if (!is_union_type(class_type) &&
   18381             :         class_type->variant.class_struct_union
   18382             :                            .contains_flexible_array_member) {
   18383           0 :       a_field_ptr  prev_field = class_state->end_of_field_list;
   18384           0 :       check_assertion(prev_field != NULL &&
   18385             :                       is_class_struct_union_type(prev_field->type) &&
   18386             :                       skip_typerefs(prev_field->type)->
   18387             :                                         variant.class_struct_union.
   18388             :                                         contains_flexible_array_member);
   18389           0 :       pos_error(ec_flexible_array_member_not_allowed,

   18756             : 
   18757       24401 : static a_field_ptr decl_nonstatic_data_member(
   18758             :                                       a_symbol_locator        *locator,
   18759             :                                       a_class_def_state_ptr   class_state,
   18760             :                                       a_member_decl_info_ptr  decl_info,
   18761             :                                       a_scope_depth           decl_scope_depth)
   18762             : /*
   18763             : Create the IL for a nonstatic data member of a class, struct, or union.
   18764             : Create an entry in the symbol table for it if it has a name.  *locator is
   18765             : the symbol locator for the declaration.  *class_state and *decl_info track
   18766             : general information about the class definition and specific information
   18767             : about the member declaration, respectively.  Return the field entry that was
   18768             : created.  decl_scope_depth is the depth at which the member symbol should
   18769             : be entered.
   18770             : */
   18771             : {
   18772       24401 :   a_decl_parse_state             *decl_state = &decl_info->decl_state;
   18773       24401 :   a_type_ptr                     class_type = class_state->class_type;
   18774       24401 :   a_type_ptr                     member_type, member_element_type;
   18775       24401 :   a_field_ptr                    field;
   18776       24401 :   a_symbol_ptr                   member_sym = NULL;
   18777             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   18778             :   a_symbol_ptr                   property_set = NULL;
   18779             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   18780       24401 :   a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr  cssp;

   19261       23121 : static void scan_nonstatic_data_member(a_symbol_locator        *locator,
   19262             :                                        a_class_def_state_ptr   class_state,
   19263             :                                        a_member_decl_info_ptr  decl_info)
   19264             : /*
   19265             : Scan a nonstatic data member of a class, struct, or union.  Call
   19266             : decl_nonstatic_data_member to create the field entry to represent it, etc.

   19431       15852 : static void generate_special_function(a_class_def_state_ptr   class_state,
   19432             :                                       a_member_decl_info_ptr  decl_info,
   19433             :                                       a_func_info_block_ptr   func_info,
   19434             :                                       a_param_type_ptr        ptp)
   19435             : /*
   19436             : Create a routine entry for a compiler generated constructor, destructor, or
   19437             : assignment operator.  The created routine is a member function of the class
   19438             : described by class_state.  If it has any parameter besides the implicit "this"
   19439             : parameter (i.e., for a copy constructor or assignment operator), a non-NULL
   19440             : param type pointer is passed in as ptp.  *decl_info tracks information about
   19441             : the declaration, including whether a constructor, destructor, or assignment
   19442             : operator should be created.  No routine body is generated at this time.
   19443             : */
   19444             : {
   19445       15852 :   a_type_ptr                rout_type, class_type = class_state->class_type;
   19446       15852 :   a_routine_type_supplement *extra_info;
   19447       15852 :   a_symbol_locator          locator;
   19448       15852 :   a_source_position         *class_decl_pos;
   19449       15852 :   a_routine_ptr             routine;
   19450             : 
   19451       15852 :   db_enter(3, "generate_special_function");
   19452             :   /* Allocate and initialize the routine type entry for the function. */
   19453       15852 :   rout_type = alloc_type((a_type_kind)tk_routine);
   19454       15852 :   extra_info = rout_type->variant.routine.extra_info;
   19455       15852 :   if (decl_info->is_constructor) {
   19456             :     /* Constructors are given a return type of void. */
   19457        2967 :     rout_type->variant.routine.return_type = void_type();
   19458        2967 :     extra_info->assoc_routine_is_ctor = TRUE;
   19459       12885 :   } else if (decl_info->is_destructor) {
   19460             :     /* Destructors are given a return type of void. */
   19461          45 :     rout_type->variant.routine.return_type = void_type();

   19465             :              (decl_info->is_static_constructor ||
   19466             :               decl_info->is_idisposable_dispose ||
   19467             :               decl_info->is_dispose_bool ||
   19468             :               decl_info->is_object_finalize)) {
   19469             :     rout_type->variant.routine.return_type = void_type();

   19528       15852 :   decl_member_function(&locator, func_info, class_state, decl_info,

   19530       15852 :   done_with_func_info(*func_info);

   19538       15852 :   routine = decl_info->decl_state.sym->variant.routine.ptr;

   19551        1959 : void set_class_assoc_operator_new_routine(a_type_ptr class_type)

   19729             : 
   19730             : static void default_copy_constructor_check(a_type_ptr  class_type,
   19731             :                                            a_boolean   *const_okay)
   19732             : /*
   19733             : When the compiler generates a default copy constructor, it should be declared
   19734             : for copying a const object only if all the copy constructors it implicitly
   19735             : invokes can also copy const objects (ARM 12.8).  Check all direct and virtual
   19736             : base classes and all fields, and return TRUE if all class subobjects have copy
   19737             : constructors that can copy const objects.
   19738             : */
   19739             : {
   19740             :   a_base_class_ptr               bcp;
   19741             :   a_type_ptr                     tp;
   19742             :   a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr  cssp;
   19743             :   a_field_ptr                    fp;
   19744             : 
   19745             :   db_enter(4, "default_copy_constructor_check");
   19746             :   *const_okay = TRUE;
   19747             :   /* First check the base classes. */
   19748             :   for (bcp = base_classes_of(class_type); bcp != NULL; bcp = bcp->next) {
   19749             :     if (bcp->direct || bcp->is_virtual) {
   19750             :       cssp = symbol_supplement_for_class(bcp->type);
   19751             :       if (cssp->has_copy_constructor &&
   19752             :           !cssp->has_copy_constructor_for_const_object) {
   19753             :         /* Class lacks a copy constructor that can copy a const object. */
   19754             :         *const_okay = FALSE;
   19755             :         goto done;
   19756             :       }  /* if */
   19757             :     }  /* if */
   19758             :   }  /* for */
   19759             :   /* Base classes are okay.  Now check the nonstatic data members. */
   19760             :   fp = class_type->variant.class_struct_union.field_list;
   19761             :   for (; fp != NULL; fp = fp->next) {
   19762             :     tp = fp->type;
   19763             :     /* Get the element type if this is an array field. */
   19764             :     if (is_array_type(tp)) tp = underlying_array_element_type(tp);
   19765             :     if (is_class_struct_union_type(tp)) {
   19766             :       cssp = symbol_supplement_for_class(tp);
   19767             :       if (cssp->has_copy_constructor &&
   19768             :           !cssp->has_copy_constructor_for_const_object) {
   19769             :         /* Class lacks a copy constructor that can copy a const object. */
   19770             :         *const_okay = FALSE;
   19771             :         goto done;
   19772             :       }  /* if */
   19773             :     }  /* if */
   19774             :   }  /* for */
   19775             : done:;
   19776             :   db_exit();

   19809        2896 : static void check_base_or_mbr_class_type_for_suppression(
   19810             :                             a_type_ptr                          class_type,
   19811             :                             a_generated_special_function_descr  *gsfd,
   19812             :                             a_type_ptr                          type,
   19813             :                             a_base_class_ptr                    base_class,
   19814             :                             a_boolean                           is_mutable,
   19815             :                             a_boolean                           variant_field)
   19816             : /*
   19817             : This is a helper routine for check_suppressed_special_functions.  For the given
   19818             : class type it checks a base class or field of class type "type" to see if any
   19819             : conditions exist that would prevent the successful generation of the implicit
   19820             : definition of a copy/move assignment operator, copy/move constructor, or
   19821             : destructor.  type may be const/volatile qualified but if the corresponding
   19822             : subobject is an array, type is the underlying class type (possibly qualified).
   19823             : For base class subobject base_class designates the base class.
   19824             : 
   19825             : *gsfd is updated accordingly and warnings or remarks may be issued in some
   19826             : cases.  is_mutable is TRUE if the given type is that of a mutable field.
   19827             : variant_field is TRUE if the given type is that of a variant field (i.e., a
   19828             : member of a union or anonymous union).

   19831        2896 :   a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr  cssp;

   19949        2587 : skip_assignment_operators:
   19950             :   /* Abstract class type constructors and destructors do not construct or
   19951             :      destroy their virtual base classes since that will be done by a more
   19952             :      derived object. */
   19953        2896 :   if (class_type->variant.class_struct_union.abstract &&
   19954          16 :       base_class != NULL && base_class->is_virtual) {

   19957             :   /* Check the copy constructor. */
   19958        2896 :   if (gsfd->suppress_copy_ctor) {

   19961        2842 :   } else if (type->variant.class_struct_union.copy_ctor_decl_suppressed) {

   19963             :        one, too. */

   20079             : 
   20080        6989 : static void check_suppressed_special_functions(
   20081             :                                a_type_ptr                          class_type,
   20082             :                                a_generated_special_function_descr  *gsfd)
   20083             : /*
   20084             : Check to see if any errors exist that would prevent the successful generation
   20085             : of the implicit definition of a copy (or move) assignment operator, copy (or
   20086             : move) constructor, or destructor for the specified class_type.  This is called
   20087             : in some modes to suppress the declaration of these member functions or to mark
   20088             : them as deleted (standard C++11 behavior) if generating the definition would
   20089             : otherwise lead to an error.  Not declaring the member at all emulates the
   20090             : behavior of Microsoft compilers: It allows overload resolution to select a
   20091             : non-copy constructor or assignment operator for copy operations and prevents
   20092             : errors resulting from an unused destructor.  *gsfd is updated accordingly and
   20093             : warnings or remarks may be issued.
   20094             : */
   20095             : {
   20096        6989 :   a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr cssp = symbol_supplement_for_class(class_type);

   20098        6989 :   a_base_class_ptr              bcp;
   20099        6989 :   a_type_ptr                    tp;
   20100             : 
   20101             :   /* First, scan through all the nonstatic data members, using the symbol list
   20102             :      rather than the field list to be sure that only user-defined fields are
   20103             :      checked and to be sure that anonymous union fields are picked up. */

   20113         469 :         tp = underlying_array_element_type(tp);

   20120             :            should be suppressed. */
   20121        3852 :       } else if (is_const_qualified_type(tp)) {

   20353         665 : static void ensure_all_field_initializers_scanned(a_type_ptr  class_type)

   20355             : Scan any field initializers of the given class type that haven't yet been
   20356             : scanned.

   20367           9 :       a_field_ptr  field = sym->variant.field.ptr;
   20368           9 :       if (field->has_initializer && field->initializer == NULL) {

   20375             :              of any other field initializers, so we can exit the loop). */

   20386             : 
   20387             : 
   20388        2188 : static a_boolean fields_initialized_for_constexpr_constructor(
   20389             :                                                      a_type_ptr  class_type,
   20390             :                                                      a_boolean   limited_check)
   20391             : /*
   20392             : Return TRUE if the field initialization constraints for a generated constexpr
   20393             : default constructor are satisfied by the given class type.  For non-union
   20394             : types, all fields must be initialized, and for union types exactly one field
   20395             : must be initialized.  The initializers must also be constants, but we do not
   20396             : enforce that when limited_check is TRUE or for template classes (to avoid
   20397             : forcing the premature instantiation of the initializers).  Volatile fields are
   20398             : never validly initialized in a constant-expression and thus cause this routine
   20399             : to return FALSE unless limited_check is TRUE.
   20400             : */
   20401             : {
   20402        2188 :   a_boolean    okay = TRUE, initializer_seen = FALSE;
   20403        2188 :   a_field_ptr  fp = class_type->variant.class_struct_union.field_list;
   20404             : 
   20405        2188 :   if (!is_unspecialized_template_class(class_type)) {
   20406         633 :     ensure_all_field_initializers_scanned(class_type);
   20407             :   }  /* if */
   20408        2188 :   fp = next_proper_initializable_field(fp);
   20409        2188 :   if (fp != NULL) {
   20410           9 :     a_boolean  is_union = class_type->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_union;
   20411           9 :     for (; fp != NULL; fp = next_proper_initializable_field(fp->next)) {
   20412           9 :       a_boolean  member_initialized;
   20413           9 :       if (fp->has_nonconstant_initializer && !limited_check) {
   20414             :         /* A nonconstant initializer is never okay. */
   20415             :         okay = FALSE;
   20416             :         break;
   20417           9 :       } else if (is_volatile_qualified_type(fp->type) && !limited_check) {
   20418             :         /* A volatile field cannot be initialized in a constant-expression. */
   20419             :         okay = FALSE;
   20420             :         break;
   20421           9 :       } else if (fp->compiler_generated) {
   20422           0 :         if (fp->is_anonymous_parent_object) {
   20423             :           /* If this field represents an anonymous union, apply the
   20424             :              requirement recursively. */
   20425           0 :           member_initialized = fields_initialized_for_constexpr_constructor(
   20426           0 :                                       skip_typerefs(fp->type), limited_check);
   20427             :         } else {
   20428           0 :           continue;
   20429             :         }  /* if */
   20430             :       } else {
   20431          18 :         member_initialized = fp->has_initializer ||
   20432           9 :                              type_is_constexpr_default_constructible(
   20433             :                                                         fp->type, class_type);
   20434             :       }  /* if */
   20435           9 :       if (is_union) {
   20436             :         /* Unions must have exactly one initialized member. */
   20437           0 :         if (member_initialized) {
   20438           0 :           if (initializer_seen) {
   20439             :             /* A second initializer: Not valid for a constexpr
   20440             :                constructor. */
   20441             :             okay = FALSE;
   20442             :           } else {
   20443           0 :             initializer_seen = TRUE;
   20444             :           }  /* if */
   20445             :         }  /* if */
   20446             :       } else {
   20447             :         /* Non-unions must have all fields initialized. */
   20448           9 :         if (!member_initialized) {
   20449             :           okay = FALSE;
   20450             :           break;
   20451             :         }  /* if */
   20452             :       }  /* if */
   20453             :     }  /* for */
   20454           9 :     if (is_union && !initializer_seen) okay = FALSE;
   20455             :   }  /* if */
   20456        2188 :   return okay;
   20457             : }  /* fields_initialized_for_constexpr_constructor */
   20458             : 
   20459             : 
   20460         124 : void resolve_indeterminate_exception_specification(a_routine_ptr  rp)
   20461             : /*

   20552        7046 : a_boolean check_if_constexpr_generated_default_constructor(
   20553             :                                                        a_type_ptr  class_type)
   20554             : /*
   20555             : If the given class type has a generated default constructor, determine if that
   20556             : constructor is "constexpr" (this in turn may require parsing the field

   20587             :          parent class has no virtual bases, (b) every field has a constant

   20719             : static a_boolean has_simple_default_constructor(a_type_ptr  class_type)
   20720             : /*

   20722             : other than perhaps a traditional ellipsis parameter.  This is a subset of the
   20723             : standard notion of "default constructor": It doesn't allow for default
   20724             : constructors with default arguments, parameter packs, or parameter arrays.

   20726             : for C++/CLI.

   20749             : 
   20750             : static void check_suppressed_default_ctor(
   20751             :                                a_type_ptr                          class_type,
   20752             :                                a_generated_special_function_descr  *gsfd)
   20753             : /*
   20754             : Check whether the generated default constructor for class_type should be
   20755             : suppressed.  In Microsoft mode, this may mean (if microsoft_version < 1900)
   20756             : that it shouldn't be declared at all.  In C++11 mode (and in Microsoft mode
   20757             : with microsoft_version >= 1900), it means that the generated default
   20758             : constructor should be deleted.
   20759             : */
   20760             : {
   20761             :   if (cpp11_mode || microsoft_mode) {
   20762             :     a_symbol_ptr      sym;
   20763             :     a_base_class_ptr  bcp;
   20764             :     a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr
   20765             :                       mcssp, cssp = symbol_supplement_for_class(class_type);
   20766             :     /* First, scan through all the nonstatic data members, using the symbol
   20767             :        list rather than the field list to be sure that only user-defined
   20768             :        fields are checked and to be sure that anonymous union fields are
   20769             :        picked up. */
   20770             :     for (sym = cssp->symbols; sym != NULL; sym = sym->next_in_scope) {
   20771             :       if (symbol_is(sym, sk_field)) {
   20772             :         a_field_ptr  field = sym->variant.field.ptr;
   20773             :         a_type_ptr   tp = field->type, utp;
   20774             :         a_boolean    const_member_okay = FALSE;
   20775             :         if (field->has_initializer) {
   20776             :           /* Fields with a C++11-style in-class initializer are initialized
   20777             :              by that initializer rather than "default initialized". */
   20778             :           continue;
   20779             :         } else if (field_is_property_or_event(field)) {
   20780             :           /* Property fields and events do not affect the special member
   20781             :              functions. */
   20782             :           continue;
   20783             :         }  /* if */
   20784             :         if (is_reference_type(tp)) {
   20785             :           /* References cannot be default-initialized. */
   20786             :           gsfd->suppress_default_ctor = TRUE;
   20787             :           break;
   20788             :         }  /* if */
   20789             :         if (is_array_type(tp)) {
   20790             :           tp = underlying_array_element_type(tp);
   20791             :         }  /* if */
   20792             :         utp = skip_typerefs(tp);
   20793             :         if (is_immediate_class_type(utp)) {
   20794             :           /* Check that the member can be default-initialized. */
   20795             :           a_boolean  error_detected, err;
   20796             :           mcssp = class_symbol_supp(symbol_for(utp));

   20798             :                                                 /*declarative_context=*/TRUE,
   20799             :                                                 /*evaluated=*/TRUE,

   20801             :                                                 /*no_explicit=*/FALSE,
   20802             :                                                 &error_detected, &err);
   20803             :           if (error_detected) {
   20804             :             gsfd->suppress_default_ctor = TRUE;
   20805             :             break;

   20807             :             const_member_okay = TRUE;
   20808             :           }  /* if */
   20809             :         }  /* if */
   20810             :         if (!const_member_okay && is_const_qualified_type(tp)) {
   20811             :           /* Default initialization of const members is only allowed if a
   20812             :              user-provided default constructor is available. */
   20813             :           gsfd->suppress_default_ctor = TRUE;
   20814             :           break;
   20815             :         }  /* if */
   20816             :       }  /* if */
   20817             :     }  /* for */
   20818             :     if (!gsfd->suppress_default_ctor) {
   20819             :       /* Now scan through all the direct base classes of this class. */
   20820             :       a_boolean  abstract = class_type->variant.class_struct_union.abstract;
   20821             :       for (bcp = base_classes_of(class_type); bcp != NULL; bcp = bcp->next) {
   20822             :         if (bcp->direct  &&
   20823             :             !(bcp->is_virtual &&

   20825             :                 virtual_base_class_is_indirect(bcp, class_type)))) {
   20826             :           a_boolean  error_detected, err;
   20827             :           (void)select_default_constructor_full(
   20828             :                                     bcp->type, &pos_curr_token, class_type,
   20829             :                                     /*declarative_context=*/TRUE,

   20844        6989 : static a_boolean check_if_default_ctor_needed(

   21047           0 : void add_trivial_dtor_representation(a_type_ptr  class_type)
   21048             : /*

   21107             : static void mark_trivial_special_members(
   21108             :                               a_class_def_state_ptr               class_state,
   21109             :                               a_generated_special_function_descr  *gsfd)
   21110             : /*
   21111             : Set the is_trivial_copy_function flag to TRUE for every trivial copy/move
   21112             : constructor routine or trivial copy/move assignment routine of the class
   21113             : described by class_state and gsfd.  Also set the is_trivial_destructor flag if
   21114             : the destructor of that class is trivial.  (These are compiler-generated or
   21115             : explicitly defaulted member functions.)  In addition, if a copy function is
   21116             : deleted, disable bitwise copying.
   21117             : */
   21118             : {
   21119             :   a_type_ptr  class_type = class_state->class_type;
   21120             :   a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr
   21121             :               cssp = class_symbol_supp(symbol_for(class_type));
   21122             : 
   21123             :   /* At this point, cssp->assignment_by_bitwise_copy_allowed and
   21124             :      cssp->construction_by_bitwise_copy_allowed only reflect whether the
   21125             :      class' subcomponents are bitwise copyable (that includes the fact that
   21126             :      e.g. virtual function table pointers are not bitwise copyable).  The
   21127             :      flags do not yet reflect the presence of user-provided copy constructors
   21128             :      or user-provided copy assignment operators. */
   21129             :   if (!cssp->makes_copy_construction_nontrivial ||
   21130             :       !cssp->makes_move_construction_nontrivial ||
   21131             :       !cssp->makes_copy_assignment_nontrivial ||
   21132             :       !cssp->makes_move_assignment_nontrivial) {
   21133             :     /* Trivial copying is possible: Traverse the member to find defaulted or
   21134             :        compiler-generated copy/move constructors and copy/move assignment
   21135             :        operators. */
   21136             :     a_routine_ptr  rp = class_type_supp(class_type)->assoc_scope->routines;
   21137             :     a_boolean      cli_class = is_immediate_managed_class_type(class_type);

   21139             :       if (rp->compiler_generated || rp->is_defaulted || rp->is_deleted) {
   21140             :         a_type_qualifier_set  tqs = TQ_NONE;
   21141             :         a_boolean             is_move = FALSE;
   21142             :         if (rp->special_kind == (a_special_function_kind)sfk_constructor &&

   21144             :                                 /*include_move_ctors=*/TRUE,

   21155             :                been generated, the function is not trivial.  (Exclude managed

   21157             :                semantics.) */

   21166             :               class_state->rule_out_bitwise_copy_for_deleted_ctor = TRUE;
   21167             : #endif /* DELETED_COPY_FUNCTION_CLEARS_BITWISE_COPY_FLAG */

   21169             :                 /* Early drafts of C++11 made deleted functions nontrivial, and
   21170             :                    GCC versions from that era implemented that rule. */
   21171             :                 rp->is_trivial_copy_function = FALSE;
   21172             :               }  /* if */
   21173             :             }  /* if */
   21174             :           }  /* if */
   21175             :           if (rp->is_deleted) {
   21176             :             cssp->has_deleted_copy_or_move_constructor = TRUE;
   21177             :           }  /* if */
   21178             :         } else if (rp->special_kind == (a_special_function_kind)sfk_operator &&

   21187             : #endif /* NEAR_AND_FAR_ALLOWED */

   21189             :               tqs != (is_move ? TQ_NONE : gsfd->copy_assign_qualifiers)) {

   21191             :                been generated, the function is not trivial.  (Exclude managed
   21192             :                classes from this because they follow different copy
   21193             :                semantics.) */
   21194             :             rp->is_trivial_copy_function = FALSE;
   21195             :             cssp->makes_copy_assignment_nontrivial = TRUE;

   21198             :                             is_move ? !cssp->makes_move_assignment_nontrivial

   21203             : #endif /* DELETED_COPY_FUNCTION_CLEARS_BITWISE_COPY_FLAG */
   21204             :               if (gpp_mode && gnu_version < 40700) {

   21206             :                    GCC versions from that era implemented that rule. */

   21208             :               }  /* if */
   21209             :             }  /* if */

   21213             :           }  /* if */
   21214             :         }  /* if */
   21215             :       }  /* if */

   21220             :     if (dtor->compiler_generated || dtor->is_defaulted || dtor->is_deleted) {
