   21225             : 
   21226             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   21227             : 
   21228             : static a_type_ptr find_base_ref_class(a_type_ptr  class_type)
   21229             : /*
   21230             : Returns the direct base ref class of the specified class, or NULL if the class
   21231             : is System::Object itself.
   21232             : */
   21233             : {
   21234             :   a_type_ptr        base_class_type = NULL;
   21235             :   a_base_class_ptr  bcp;
   21236             : 
   21237             :   check_assertion(cli_or_cx_enabled && is_ref_class_type(class_type));
   21238             :   bcp = base_classes_of(class_type);
   21239             :   for (; bcp != NULL; bcp = bcp->next) {
   21240             :     if (bcp->direct && is_ref_class_type(bcp->type)) {
   21241             :       base_class_type = bcp->type;
   21242             :       break;
   21243             :     }  /* if */
   21244             :   }  /* for */
   21245             :   return base_class_type;
   21246             : }  /* find_base_ref_class */
   21247             : 
   21248             : 
   21249             : static a_boolean is_dispose_bool_function(a_symbol_ptr  sym,
   21250             :                                           a_boolean     *p_is_valid)
   21251             : /*
   21252             : Returns TRUE if sym is a member function that has a single bool parameter.
   21253             : Furthermore, *p_is_valid is set to TRUE if that function also meets the
   21254             : requirements of a valid dispose pattern implementation of Dispose(bool) (i.e.,
   21255             : "protected: virtual void Dispose(bool);").  The caller must initialize
   21256             : *p_is_valid.
   21257             : */
   21258             : {
   21259             :   a_boolean  result = FALSE;
   21260             : 
   21261             :   check_assertion(sym != NULL && p_is_valid != NULL);
   21262             :   if (symbol_is(sym, sk_member_function)) {
   21263             :     a_routine_ptr     routine = sym->variant.routine.ptr;
   21264             :     a_param_type_ptr  ptp = function_type_params(routine->type);
   21265             :     if (ptp != NULL && ptp->next == NULL && is_bool_type(ptp->type)) {
   21266             :       result = TRUE;
   21267             :       if (routine->is_virtual &&
   21268             :           is_void_type(routine->type->variant.routine.return_type) &&
   21269             :           routine->source_corresp.access ==
   21270             :                                           (an_access_specifier)as_protected) {
   21271             :         *p_is_valid = TRUE;
   21272             :       }  /* if */
   21273             :     } /* if */
   21274             :   }  /* if */
   21275             :   return result;
   21276             : }  /* is_dispose_bool_function */
   21277             : 
   21278             : 
   21279             : static a_boolean is_dispose_void_function(
   21280             :                                       a_symbol_ptr  sym,
   21281             :                                       a_type_ptr    class_type,
   21282             :                                       a_boolean     *p_is_idisposable_dispose)
   21283             : /*
   21284             : Returns TRUE if sym is a member function that has an empty parameter list.
   21285             : Furthermore, *p_is_idisposable_dispose is set to TRUE if that function also
   21286             : meets the requirements of a valid implementation of IDisposable::Dispose().
   21287             : The caller must initialize *p_is_idisposable_dispose.
   21288             : */
   21289             : {
   21290             :   a_boolean  result = FALSE;
   21291             : 
   21292             :   check_assertion(sym != NULL && p_is_idisposable_dispose != NULL);
   21293             :   if (symbol_is(sym, sk_member_function)) {
   21294             :     a_routine_ptr  routine = sym->variant.routine.ptr;
   21295             :     if (function_type_params(routine->type) == NULL) {
   21296             :       /* A member function with an empty parameter list: Return TRUE. */
   21297             :       a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr
   21298             :                                cssp = symbol_supplement_for_class(class_type);
   21299             :       result = TRUE;
   21300             :       /* Determine if this routine implements IDisposable::Dispose() for the
   21301             :          specified class. */
   21302             :       if (cssp->is_disposable && routine->is_virtual &&
   21303             :           !routine->pure_virtual &&
   21304             :           is_void_type(routine->type->variant.routine.return_type) &&
   21305             :           routine->source_corresp.access == (an_access_specifier)as_public &&
   21306             :           is_overriding_function(class_type, routine,
   21307             :                                  get_idisposable_dispose_routine())) {
   21308             :         *p_is_idisposable_dispose = TRUE;
   21309             :       }  /* if */
   21310             :     } /* if */
   21311             :   }  /* if */
   21312             :   return result;
   21313             : }  /* is_dispose_void_function */
   21314             : 
   21315             : 
   21316             : static void check_for_dispose_pattern(a_type_ptr  class_type)
   21317             : /*
   21318             : Find any Dispose(bool), Dispose(), and Finalize() functions in the specified
   21319             : class.  The results are used to determine how a derived class dispose pattern
   21320             : should be implemented.  The results are stored in the class symbol supplement.
   21321             : */
   21322             : {
   21323             :   a_source_position              *pos;
   21324             :   a_type_ptr                     base_class;
   21325             :   a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr  cssp, base_cssp;
   21326             :   a_symbol_locator               locator;
   21327             :   a_symbol_ptr                   sym = NULL;
   21328             :   a_routine_ptr                  dispose_void_routine = NULL;
   21329             :   a_routine_ptr                  dispose_bool_routine = NULL;
   21330             :   a_routine_ptr                  object_finalize_routine = NULL;
   21331             :   a_boolean                      is_valid_object_finalize = FALSE;
   21332             :   a_boolean                      is_valid_dispose_bool = FALSE;
   21333             :   a_boolean                      is_idisposable_dispose = FALSE;
   21334             :   a_boolean                      has_dispose_pattern_idisposable_dispose =
   21335             :                                                                         FALSE;
   21336             :   a_boolean                      has_dispose_pattern_object_finalize = FALSE;
   21337             :   a_boolean                      needs_new_idisposable_dispose = FALSE;
   21338             : 
   21339             :   check_assertion(is_ref_class_type(class_type));
   21340             :   cssp = symbol_supplement_for_class(class_type);
   21341             :   pos = &class_type->source_corresp.decl_position;
   21342             :   if (cssp->checked_for_dispose_pattern) goto done;
   21343             :   cssp->checked_for_dispose_pattern = TRUE;
   21344             :   if (is_cli_system_object_type(class_type)) {
   21345             :     /* The dispose pattern in C++/CX mode does not use a Finalize()
   21346             :        function. */
   21347             :     if (cppcx_enabled) goto done;
   21348             :     /* This is the System::Object type, which is special since it doesn't have
   21349             :        a base class.  Just record its "Finalize" member. */
   21350             :     cssp->object_finalize = symbol_for(get_object_finalize_routine());
   21351             :     goto done;
   21352             :   }  /* if */
   21353             :   if (cppcli_enabled) {
   21354             :     /* Look for a Finalize() function in the class. */
   21355             :     object_finalize_routine = find_finalize_routine(class_type,
   21356             :                                                     &is_valid_object_finalize);
   21357             :   }  /* if */
   21358             :   if (object_finalize_routine != NULL && !is_valid_object_finalize) {
   21359             :     /* The Finalize() function does not override Object::Finalize(). */
   21360             :     a_symbol_ptr  object_finalize_symbol = symbol_for(object_finalize_routine);
   21361             :     pos_sy_error(ec_finalize_does_not_override_object_finalize,
   21362             :                  &object_finalize_symbol->decl_position,
   21363             :                  object_finalize_symbol);
   21364             :     object_finalize_routine = NULL;
   21365             :   }  /* if */
   21366             :   /* Look for any Dispose(bool) or Dispose() functions in the class. */
   21367             :   clear_locator(&locator, pos);
   21368             :   (void)find_symbol("Dispose", sizeof("Dispose")-1, &locator);
   21369             :   /* Clear the specific symbol so that it does not influence the lookup. */
   21370             :   clear_specific_symbol(locator);
   21371             :   sym = class_qualified_id_lookup(&locator, class_type,
   21372             :                                   IDL_DIRECT_CLASS_MEMBERS_ONLY);
   21373             :   if (sym != NULL && is_member_function_symbol(sym)) {
   21374             :     a_boolean  is_overloaded_function;
   21375             :     /* Lookup found one or more Dispose member functions. */
   21376             :     if (symbol_is(sym, sk_overloaded_function)) {
   21377             :       sym = sym->variant.overloaded_function.symbols;
   21378             :       is_overloaded_function = TRUE;
   21379             :     } else {
   21380             :       is_overloaded_function = FALSE;
   21381             :     }  /* if */
   21382             :     for (; sym != NULL; sym = is_overloaded_function ? sym->next : NULL) {
   21383             :       if (dispose_bool_routine == NULL &&
   21384             :           /* Only the C++/CLI dispose pattern uses a Dispose(bool) function. */
   21385             :           cppcli_enabled &&
   21386             :           is_dispose_bool_function(sym, &is_valid_dispose_bool)) {
   21387             :         /* A Dispose(bool) function. */
   21388             :         dispose_bool_routine = sym->variant.routine.ptr;
   21389             :       } else if (dispose_void_routine == NULL &&
   21390             :                  is_dispose_void_function(sym, class_type,
   21391             :                                           &is_idisposable_dispose)) {
   21392             :         /* A Dispose() function. */
   21393             :         dispose_void_routine = sym->variant.routine.ptr;
   21394             :       }  /* if */
   21395             :       if (dispose_void_routine != NULL &&
   21396             :           (cppcx_enabled || dispose_void_routine != NULL)) {
   21397             :         /* No other functions are of interest. */
   21398             :         break;
   21399             :       }  /* if */
   21400             :     }  /* for */
   21401             :   }  /* if */
   21402             :   if (cppcx_enabled && is_idisposable_dispose) {
   21403             :     /* We found a valid Dispose() member: This is a valid C++/CX dispose
   21404             :        pattern. */
   21405             :     has_dispose_pattern_idisposable_dispose = TRUE;
   21406             :   } else if (is_valid_dispose_bool) {
   21407             :     if (is_idisposable_dispose) {
   21408             :       /* We found valid Dispose(bool) and Dispose() members: This is a valid
   21409             :          dispose pattern. */
   21410             :       has_dispose_pattern_idisposable_dispose = TRUE;
   21411             :     }  /* if */
   21412             :     if (object_finalize_routine != NULL) {
   21413             :       /* We found valid Dispose(bool) and Finalize() members: This is a valid
   21414             :          dispose pattern. */
   21415             :       has_dispose_pattern_object_finalize = TRUE;
   21416             :     }  /* if */
   21417             :   }  /* if */
   21418             :   /* Check for a base class dispose pattern implementation. */
   21419             :   base_class = find_base_ref_class(class_type);
   21420             :   check_assertion(base_class != NULL);
   21421             :   base_cssp = symbol_supplement_for_class(base_class);
   21422             :   check_for_dispose_pattern(base_class);
   21423             :   if (cppcx_enabled) {
   21424             :     if (dispose_void_routine == NULL &&
   21425             :         base_cssp->has_dispose_pattern_idisposable_dispose) {
   21426             :       /* This class does not have a Dispose() function.  However, a base
   21427             :          class has an IDisposable::Dispose() function, thereby satisfying the
   21428             :          requirements for a C++/CX dispose pattern implementation. */
   21429             :       has_dispose_pattern_idisposable_dispose = TRUE;
   21430             :     }  /* if */
   21431             :   } else if (base_cssp->dispose_bool != NULL) {
   21432             :     /* The base class may be providing the dispose pattern implementation.
   21433             :        This is only worth checking for if class_type itself doesn't do so, and
   21434             :        if it either has no Dispose(bool) member or that member is a valid
   21435             :        overrider of the base class' Dispose(bool) member. */
   21436             :     if ((dispose_void_routine == NULL || object_finalize_routine == NULL) &&
   21437             :         (dispose_bool_routine == NULL ||
   21438             :          (is_valid_dispose_bool &&
   21439             :           is_overriding_function(
   21440             :                             class_type, dispose_bool_routine,
   21441             :                             base_cssp->dispose_bool->variant.routine.ptr)))) {
   21442             :       /* This class extends a base class dispose pattern. */
   21443             :       if (dispose_void_routine == NULL &&
   21444             :           base_cssp->has_dispose_pattern_idisposable_dispose) {
   21445             :         /* This class does not have a Dispose() function.  However, a base
   21446             :            class has an IDisposable::Dispose() function that is part of a
   21447             :            dispose pattern implementation.  Therefore, this class will not
   21448             :            need to implement one. */
   21449             :         has_dispose_pattern_idisposable_dispose = TRUE;
   21450             :       }  /* if */
   21451             :       if (object_finalize_routine == NULL &&
   21452             :           base_cssp->has_dispose_pattern_object_finalize) {
   21453             :         /* This class does not have a Finalize() function that overrides
   21454             :            Object::Finalize().  However, a base class has an override of
   21455             :            Object::Finalize() that is part of a dispose pattern
   21456             :            implementation.  Therefore, this class will not need to implement
   21457             :            one. */
   21458             :         has_dispose_pattern_object_finalize = TRUE;
   21459             :       }  /* if */
   21460             :     }  /* if */
   21461             :     if (dispose_bool_routine == NULL) {
   21462             :       /* Look for a Dispose(bool) member in a base class that a derived class'
   21463             :          Dispose(bool) implementation should invoke. */
   21464             :       dispose_bool_routine = base_cssp->dispose_bool->variant.routine.ptr;
   21465             :     }  /* if */
   21466             :   }  /* if */
   21467             :   if (dispose_void_routine == NULL) {
   21468             :     if (base_cssp->idisposable_dispose != NULL) {
   21469             :       /* Find the IDisposable::Dispose() overrider in a base class that should
   21470             :          be invoked by the derived class' Dispose(bool) implementation. */
   21471             :       dispose_void_routine = base_cssp->idisposable_dispose
   21472             :                                       ->variant.routine.ptr;
   21473             :       is_idisposable_dispose = TRUE;
   21474             :     }  /* if */
   21475             :     /* The virtual Dispose() function in the base class is sealed or it does
   21476             :        not implement IDisposable::Dispose().  Derived classes that implement
   21477             :        IDisposable::Dispose() will need to mark the declaration with the "new"
   21478             :        modifier. */
   21479             :     needs_new_idisposable_dispose = base_cssp->needs_new_idisposable_dispose;
   21480             :   } else if (dispose_void_routine->is_virtual &&
   21481             :              (dispose_void_routine->final || !is_idisposable_dispose)) {
   21482             :     /* The virtual Dispose() function in this class is sealed or it does not
   21483             :        implement IDisposable::Dispose().  Derived classes that implement
   21484             :        IDisposable::Dispose() will need to mark the declaration with the "new"
   21485             :        modifier. */
   21486             :     needs_new_idisposable_dispose = TRUE;
   21487             :   }  /* if */
   21488             :   if (cppcli_enabled && object_finalize_routine == NULL) {
   21489             :     /* Find an override of Object::Finalize() in a base class that must be
   21490             :        invoked by a derived class' Dispose(bool) implementation. */
   21491             :     check_assertion(base_cssp->object_finalize != NULL);
   21492             :     object_finalize_routine = base_cssp->object_finalize->variant.routine.ptr;
   21493             :   }  /* if */
   21494             :   /* Store the results of the search for the dispose pattern in the class
   21495             :      symbol supplement. */
   21496             :   if (is_idisposable_dispose) {
   21497             :     cssp->idisposable_dispose = symbol_for(dispose_void_routine);
   21498             :   }  /* if */
   21499             :   if (dispose_bool_routine != NULL && dispose_bool_routine->is_virtual) {
   21500             :     cssp->dispose_bool = symbol_for(dispose_bool_routine);
   21501             :   }  /* if */
   21502             :   if (object_finalize_routine != NULL) {
   21503             :     cssp->object_finalize = symbol_for(object_finalize_routine);
   21504             :   }  /* if */
   21505             :   cssp->has_dispose_pattern_idisposable_dispose =
   21506             :                                     has_dispose_pattern_idisposable_dispose;
   21507             :   cssp->has_dispose_pattern_object_finalize =
   21508             :                                         has_dispose_pattern_object_finalize;
   21509             :   cssp->needs_new_idisposable_dispose = needs_new_idisposable_dispose;
   21510             : done:
   21511             :   return;
   21512             : }  /* check_for_dispose_pattern */
   21513             : 
   21514             : 
   21515             : static void add_cli_system_idisposable_base(a_class_def_state_ptr  class_state)
   21516             : /*
   21517             : Add System::IDisposable as a direct (implicit) base of the given class.
   21518             : (This is a class implementing the C++/CLI dispose pattern, including an
   21519             : implementation of IDisposable::Dispose().)
   21520             : */
   21521             : {
   21522             :   a_type_ptr                     class_type = class_state->class_type;
   21523             :   a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr  cssp;
   21524             :   a_base_class_ptr               bcp, last_bcp = NULL;
   21525             :   a_boolean                      may_be_first_direct_nonvirtual_base = TRUE;
   21526             :   a_base_class_sequence_number   direct_base_number = 0;
   21527             : 
   21528             :   cssp = symbol_supplement_for_class(class_type);
   21529             :   check_assertion(cli_class_type_kind_is(class_type, cctk_ref));
   21530             :   /* Determine the last base class entry and the last direct base number. */
   21531             :   bcp = base_classes_of(class_type);
   21532             :   if (bcp != NULL) {
   21533             :     direct_base_number = largest_direct_base_number(bcp, &last_bcp);
   21534             :     /* There are no virtual base classes for managed classes.  So if there
   21535             :        is already a base class, there must also be a direct nonvirtual
   21536             :        base class. */
   21537             :     may_be_first_direct_nonvirtual_base = FALSE;
   21538             :   }  /* if */
   21539             :   add_direct_base_of_type(cli_class_type_for(csk_system_idisposable),
   21540             :                           class_state, direct_base_number+1,
   21541             :                           &last_bcp, &may_be_first_direct_nonvirtual_base);
   21542             :   cssp->is_disposable = TRUE;
   21543             :   /* Unlike other base classes, this one is added after the body of the class
   21544             :      is completely parsed: Call wrapup_base_classes again to ensure the base
   21545             :      class post-processing takes the new base class into account. */
   21546             :   wrapup_base_classes(class_state);
   21547             : }  /* add_cli_system_idisposable_base */
   21548             : 
   21549             : 
   21550             : static void implement_dispose_pattern_if_needed(
   21551             :                                            a_class_def_state_ptr  class_state)
   21552             : /*
   21553             : Implement the C++/CLI dispose pattern for this class if it is needed.
   21554             : */
   21555             : {
   21556             :   a_type_ptr                     class_type = class_state->class_type;
   21557             :   a_boolean                      is_ref_class;
   21558             :   a_boolean                      is_value_class;
   21559             :   a_boolean                      implement_dispose_pattern = FALSE;
   21560             :   a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr  cssp;
   21561             :   a_class_type_supplement_ptr    ctsp;
   21562             :   a_source_position              *pos;
   21563             : 
   21564             :   is_ref_class = cli_class_type_kind_is(class_type, cctk_ref);
   21565             :   is_value_class = cli_class_type_kind_is(class_type, cctk_value);
   21566             :   check_assertion(is_ref_class || is_value_class);
   21567             :   cssp = symbol_supplement_for_class(class_type);
   21568             :   ctsp = class_type_supp(class_type);
   21569             :   pos = &class_type->source_corresp.decl_position;
   21570             :   if (!cssp->disable_dispose_pattern_implementation) {
   21571             :     if (is_ref_class) {
   21572             :       /* A ref class requires a dispose pattern implementation if it has a
   21573             :          destructor, finalizer, or any disposable data members. */
   21574             :       implement_dispose_pattern = cssp->destructor || cssp->finalizer ||
   21575             :                                   cssp->any_disposable_data_members;
   21576             :     } else if (is_value_class) {
   21577             :       /* If a value class implements the IDisposable interface, an
   21578             :          IDisposable::Dispose() function should be generated; however,
   21579             :          that function will do nothing. */
   21580             :       implement_dispose_pattern = cssp->is_disposable;
   21581             :     }  /* if */
   21582             :   }  /* if */
   21583             :   if (implement_dispose_pattern) {
   21584             :     an_access_specifier            saved_access = class_state->access;
   21585             :     a_func_info_block              func_info;
   21586             :     a_member_decl_info             decl_info;
   21587             :     a_param_type_ptr               ptp;
   21588             :     a_type_ptr                     base_class_type = NULL;
   21589             :     a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr  base_cssp = NULL;
   21590             :     if (is_ref_class) {
   21591             :       base_class_type = find_base_ref_class(class_type);
   21592             :       check_assertion(base_class_type != NULL);
   21593             :       base_cssp = symbol_supplement_for_class(base_class_type);
   21594             :       check_assertion(base_cssp != NULL);
   21595             :       /* Determine what dispose pattern functions need to be implemented
   21596             :          and what base class functions they should chain to. */
   21597             :       check_for_dispose_pattern(base_class_type);
   21598             :     }  /* if */
   21599             :     /* The C++/CX dispose pattern does not require a Dispose(bool) or an
   21600             :        Object::Finalize() function. */
   21601             :     if (cppcli_enabled && is_ref_class) {
   21602             :       /* Generate the Dispose(bool) function. */
   21603             :       class_state->access = (an_access_specifier)as_protected;
   21604             :       initialize_member_decl_info(&decl_info, pos);
   21605             :       decl_info.is_dispose_bool = TRUE;
   21606             :       decl_info.decl_state.dso_flags |= DSO_VIRTUAL;
   21607             :       clear_func_info(&func_info);
   21608             :       if (base_cssp->dispose_bool == NULL) {
   21609             :         /* No base class has a virtual Dispose(bool) function. An "override"
   21610             :            or "new" modifier is not required. */
   21611             :       } else if (base_cssp->has_dispose_pattern_idisposable_dispose ||
   21612             :                  base_cssp->has_dispose_pattern_object_finalize) {
   21613             :         /* Override the virtual Dispose(bool) that exists in the base class'
   21614             :            dispose pattern implementation. */
   21615             :         func_info.override = TRUE;
   21616             :       } else {
   21617             :         /* Hide any Dispose(bool) in the base class that is not part of a
   21618             :            valid dispose pattern implementation. */
   21619             :         func_info.new_member = TRUE;
   21620             :       }  /* if */
   21621             :       ptp = alloc_param_type(bool_type());
   21622             :       generate_special_function(class_state, &decl_info, &func_info, ptp);
   21623             :       check_assertion(cssp->dispose_bool != NULL);
   21624             :       /* Record the routines that the generated Dispose(bool) function will
   21625             :          call in the class type supplement. */
   21626             :       if (base_cssp->has_dispose_pattern_object_finalize ||
   21627             :           base_cssp->has_dispose_pattern_idisposable_dispose) {
   21628             :         /* Extend the base class dispose pattern: Dispose(bool) calls the base
   21629             :            class Dispose(bool) function. */
   21630             :         check_assertion(base_cssp->dispose_bool != NULL);
   21631             :         ctsp->base_dispose_bool_routine = base_cssp->dispose_bool
   21632             :                                                    ->variant.routine.ptr;
   21633             :       }  else {
   21634             :         /* Introduce the base class dispose pattern: Dispose(bool) calls the
   21635             :            base class' Dispose() and Finalize() implementations if present. */
   21636             :         if (base_cssp->idisposable_dispose) {
   21637             :           ctsp->base_idisposable_dispose_routine =

   21709             : 
   21710             : static void check_for_user_defined_inheritance_conversions(
   21711             :                                                        a_type_ptr  class_type)
   21712             : /*
   21713             : Look for user-defined conversions declared in the base classes of class_type
   21714             : that now turn out to correspond to derived-to-base or base-to-derived
   21715             : conversions: If that is the case, issue a warning on the function and remove
   21716             : the function from the conversion functions list associated with the type of
   21717             : the base.  With standard nonstatic conversion functions this check is handled
   21718             : when they are declared.  However, with C++/CLI static conversion functions
   21719             : it couldn't be done if a source or destination class type was incomplete at
   21720             : the point of declaration of the conversion function.
   21721             : */
   21722             : {
   21723             :   a_base_class_ptr  bcp = base_classes_of(class_type);
   21724             : 
   21725             :   for (; bcp != NULL; bcp = bcp->next) {
   21726             :     a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr
   21727             :                              cssp = symbol_supplement_for_class(bcp->type);
   21728             :     a_symbol_list_entry_ptr  *slep = &cssp->conversion_list, to_remove;
   21729             :     while (*slep != NULL) {
   21730             :       a_symbol_ptr   sym = fundamental_symbol_of((*slep)->symbol);
   21731             :       a_routine_ptr  rp = sym->variant.routine.ptr;
   21732             :       if (!routine_type_is_nonstatic_member_function(rp->type) &&
   21733             :           !is_implicitly_callable_conversion_function_full(
   21734             :                               rp->type, rp->is_reverse_conversion_function)) {
   21735             :         /* A static conversion function (the only kind that cannot always be
   21736             :            handled at the point of declaration) that turns out to be marked by
   21737             :            a standard conversion after all. */
   21738             :         pos_sy_warning(ec_conversion_function_not_usable,
   21739             :                        &sym->decl_position, sym);
   21740             :         to_remove = *slep;
   21741             :         *slep = to_remove->next;
   21742             :         to_remove->next = NULL;
   21743             :         free_list_of_symbol_list_entries(to_remove);
   21744             :       } else {
   21745             :         /* This conversion function is not suspect: Move to the next one. */
   21746             :         slep = &(*slep)->next;
   21747             :       }  /* if */
   21748             :     }  /* while */
   21749             :   }  /* for */
   21750             : }  /* check_for_user_defined_inheritance_conversions */
   21751             : 
   21752             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   21753             : 
   21754        6989 : static void set_move_assign_operator_flags(a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr  cssp)

   21785        6989 : static void check_defaulted_members(
   21786             :                                a_type_ptr                          class_type,
   21787             :                                a_generated_special_function_descr  *gsfd)

   21865        6989 : static void check_special_member_functions(a_type_ptr            class_type,
   21866             :                                            a_class_def_state_ptr class_state)
   21867             : 
   21868             : /*
   21869             : Check for the existence of constructors (including copy constructor) and
   21870             : destructor among the user defined member functions for the class specified

   22069             :        is declared so that "= default" definitions can be suppressed if

   22270             : static void count_params_for_inheriting_ctor(a_routine_ptr  brp,
   22271             :                                              uint32_t       *p_n_params,
   22272             :                                              uint32_t       *p_min_n_args)
   22273             : /*
   22274             : For the given routine, return in *p_n_params how many parameters it has, and
   22275             : in *p_min_n_args how many arguments it requires at a minimum for a call (which
   22276             : equals the number of parameters with no default argument).
   22277             : */
   22278             : {
   22279             :   uint32_t              n_params = 0, n_default_args = 0;
   22280             :   a_param_type_ptr      ptp, base_param_list;
   22281             : 
   22282             :   check_assertion(brp->type->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_routine);
   22283             :   base_param_list = function_type_params(brp->type);
   22284             :   for (ptp = base_param_list; ptp != NULL; ptp = ptp->next) {
   22285             :     ++n_params;
   22286             :     if (ptp->has_default_arg) ++n_default_args;
   22287             :   }  /* if */
   22288             :   *p_n_params = n_params;
   22289             :   *p_min_n_args = n_params-n_default_args;
   22290             : }  /* count_params_for_inheriting_ctor */
   22291             : 
   22292             : 
   22293             : static a_type_ptr create_inheriting_ctor_type(a_routine_ptr  brp,
   22294             :                                               uint32_t       n_base_params,
   22295             :                                               uint32_t       n_params,
   22296             :                                               a_type_ptr     class_type)
   22297             : /*
   22298             : brp is a base class constructor (possibly a base class constructor prototype
   22299             : instantiation) from which an inheriting constructor (or constructor template)
   22300             : will be generated for the given class type.  n_base_params is the number of
   22301             : parameters of the base class constructor, and the new inheriting constructor is
   22302             : to have n_params parameters (n_base_params and n_params may be different if the
   22303             : base class constructor has default arguments).  
   22304             : */
   22305             : {
   22306             :   a_type_ptr        new_tp = alloc_type((a_type_kind)tk_routine);
   22307             :   a_param_type_ptr  base_param_list = function_type_params(brp->type);
   22308             :   a_routine_type_supplement_ptr
   22309             :                     new_rtsp = new_tp->variant.routine.extra_info;
   22310             : 
   22311             :   /* Copy the base constructor type without its parameter list and without
   22312             :      its exception specification. */
   22313             :   brp->type->variant.routine.extra_info->param_type_list = NULL;
   22314             :   copy_type(brp->type, new_tp);
   22315             :   brp->type->variant.routine.extra_info->param_type_list = base_param_list;
   22316             :   new_rtsp->exception_specification = NULL;
   22317             :   /* Now copy the n_params first parameters. */
   22318             :   new_rtsp->param_type_list = copy_param_type_list(base_param_list,
   22319             :                                                /*copy_default_args=*/FALSE,
   22320             :                                                n_params);
   22321             :   new_rtsp->this_class = class_type;
   22322             :   new_rtsp->assoc_routine = NULL;

   22324             :     new_rtsp->has_ellipsis = FALSE;
   22325             :   }  /* if */
   22326             :   return new_tp;
   22327             : }  /* create_inheriting_ctor_type */
   22328             : 
   22329             : 
   22330             : static void generate_inheriting_constructors_for_base_template(
   22331             :                                                  a_symbol_ptr           bctor,
   22332             :                                                  a_using_decl_ptr       udp,
   22333             :                                                  a_class_def_state_ptr  cdsp)
   22334             : /*
   22335             : cdsp represents a class whose definition has just been completed, and whose
   22336             : implicitly-declared special members, if any, have been generated.  udp points
   22337             : to the representation of a using-declaration for inheriting constructors and
   22338             : bctor is one of the potentially inherited constructor templates associated
   22339             : with that using-declaration.  Generate any needed inheriting constructor
   22340             : templates from that base template.
   22341             : */
   22342             : {
   22343             :   a_routine_ptr         brp, drp;
   22344             :   uint32_t              n_params, n_base_params;
   22345             :   a_template_symbol_supplement_ptr
   22346             :                         btssp, dtssp, new_tssp;
   22347             :   a_template_param_ptr  btpl, dtpl, new_tpl;
   22348             :   a_type_ptr            new_tp;
   22349             :   a_symbol_ptr          dctor;
   22350             :   an_access_specifier   saved_access = cdsp->access;
   22351             : 
   22352             :   check_assertion(symbol_is(bctor, sk_function_template));
   22353             :   btssp = bctor->variant.template_info;
   22354             :   btpl = btssp->variant.function.decl_cache.decl_info->parameters;
   22355             :   brp = btssp->variant.function.routine;
   22356             :   count_params_for_inheriting_ctor(brp, &n_base_params, &n_params);
   22357             :   /* Attempt to declare an inheriting constructor for each valid number of
   22358             :      arguments that could be passed to the base constructor, but exclude the
   22359             :      zero-argument case. */
   22360             :   if (n_params == 0) ++n_params;
   22361             :   for (; n_params <= n_base_params; ++n_params) {
   22362             :     new_tp = create_inheriting_ctor_type(brp, n_base_params, n_params,
   22363             :                                          cdsp->class_type);
   22364             :     /* Check if the derived class already contains a user-declared constructor
   22365             :        with this signature: */
   22366             :     dctor = class_symbol_supp(symbol_for(cdsp->class_type))->constructor;
   22367             :     if (dctor != NULL && symbol_is(dctor, sk_overloaded_function)) {
   22368             :       dctor = dctor->variant.overloaded_function.symbols;
   22369             :     }  /* if */
   22370             :     for (; dctor != NULL; dctor = dctor->next) {
   22371             :       if (!symbol_is(dctor, sk_function_template)) {
   22372             :         /* Probably a non-template constructor.  In any case, there is no
   22373             :            conflict. */
   22374             :         continue;
   22375             :       }  /* if */
   22376             :       dtssp = dctor->variant.template_info;
   22377             :       dtpl = dtssp->variant.function.decl_cache.decl_info->parameters;
   22378             :       /* Check template parameter list and type. */
   22379             :       if (!equiv_template_param_lists(btpl, dtpl, /*issue_errors=*/FALSE,
   22380             :                                       ETP_NESTING_DEPTH_MISMATCH_OKAY,
   22381             :                                       (a_source_position*)NULL, es_none)) {
   22382             :         continue;
   22383             :       }  /* if */
   22384             :       drp = dtssp->variant.function.routine;
   22385             :       if (!drp->compiler_generated &&
   22386             :           f_types_are_compatible(drp->type, new_tp,
   22387             :                                  TCF_REDECLARATION |
   22388             :                                  TCF_IGNORE_NESTING_DEPTH |
   22389             :                                  TCF_IGNORE_THIS_CLASS_TYPE)) {
   22390             :         /* Don't inherit constructors templates that match a constructor
   22391             :            template explicitly declared in the derived class. */
   22392             :         break;
   22393             :       }  /* if */
   22394             :     }  /* for */
   22395             :     if (dctor == NULL) {
   22396             :       /* There is no user-declared constructor template with this signature
   22397             :          yet: Generate one now (the declaration only; the definition is
   22398             :          generated for instantiations at the point of use). */
   22399             :       a_member_decl_info  decl_info;
   22400             :       a_func_info_block   func_info;
   22401             :       a_symbol_locator    loc;
   22402             :       a_tmpl_decl_state   templ_decl_state;
   22403             :       a_token_kind        final_token = tok_semicolon;
   22404             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
   22405             :       /* Don't issue source sequence entries for generated entities. */
   22406             :       a_boolean           saved_source_sequence_entries_disallowed;
   22407             :       saved_source_sequence_entries_disallowed =
   22408             :                                             source_sequence_entries_disallowed;
   22409             :       scope_stack_top().source_sequence_entries_disallowed = TRUE;
   22410             :       source_sequence_entries_disallowed = TRUE;
   22411             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
   22412             :       initialize_member_decl_info(&decl_info, &udp->position);
   22413             :       decl_info.is_constructor = TRUE;
   22414             :       decl_info.decl_state.is_inheriting_ctor = TRUE;
   22415             :       decl_info.decl_state.first_decl = TRUE;
   22416             :       decl_info.decl_state.type = new_tp;
   22417             :       if (brp->is_constexpr) {
   22418             :         decl_info.decl_state.dso_flags |= (a_decl_flag_set)DSO_CONSTEXPR;

   22485           0 : static void generate_inheriting_constructors_for_base_ctor(

   22642       11934 : static void check_base_class_destructors(a_class_def_state_ptr  class_state)
   22643             : /*
   22644             : Issue a remark in some situations where class_type is a class derived from a
   22645             : base class with no virtual destructor.  Only truly suspect cases are diagnosed
   22646             : (e.g., no diagnostic is issued if none of the subobjects of class_type have a
   22647             : nontrivial destructor).
   22648             : */
   22649             : {
   22650       11934 :   a_type_ptr        class_type = class_state->class_type;
   22651       11934 :   a_base_class_ptr  bcp;
   22652             : 
   22653       11934 :   if ((int)error_threshold > (int)es_remark) {
   22654             :     /* Only a remark would have been issued.  Don't bother checking for a
   22655             :        diagnosable condition. */
   22656           0 :   } else if ((bcp = base_classes_of(class_type)) != NULL) {
   22657             :     /* The derived class has base classes.  We issue a remark only if a base
   22658             :        does not have a virtual destructor and at least one of the following
   22659             :        is true:
   22660             :            - the derived class has a user-provided destructor
   22661             :            - a member added by the derivation requires destruction
   22662             :            - another direct nondependent base has a nontrivial destructor
   22663             :        This may require two passes through the list of base classes.  */
   22664           0 :     a_symbol_ptr  dtor_sym;
   22665           0 :     a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr
   22666           0 :                   cssp = symbol_supplement_for_class(class_type);

   22668             :                                    class_state->member_destruction_required);

   22670             :       /* The derivation itself does not require a destructor, but at least
   22671             :          one base does.  Compare the number of direct bases with the number
   22672             :          of virtual destructors in those bases to decide whether remarks are
   22673             :          warranted. */
   22674             :       unsigned long  base_count = 0, virtual_dtor_count = 0;

   22676           0 :         if (bcp->direct &&
   22677           0 :             (!bcp->ignore_during_dependent_lookup ||
   22678           0 :              !is_template_dependent_type(bcp->type))) {            
   22679           0 :           dtor_sym = symbol_supplement_for_class(bcp->type)->destructor;

   22686           0 :       issue_remarks = base_count > 1 && base_count > virtual_dtor_count;

   22689             :       /* We know there are suspect direct base classes with no virtual
   22690             :          destructors: Issue a remark on each one. */

   22693           0 :             (!bcp->ignore_during_dependent_lookup ||
   22694           0 :              !is_template_dependent_type(bcp->type))) {

   22708           0 : static a_boolean conversion_template_matches_base_member(a_symbol_ptr  dsym,
   22709             :                                                          a_symbol_ptr  bsym)

   22729             :        conversion function" (only possible with static conversion functions),
   22730             :        they are never considered a "match". */
   22731             :     check_assertion(cli_or_cx_enabled);

   22737           0 :     a_type_ptr  tp1 = rp1->type->variant.routine.return_type;

   22744           0 :   return result;
   22745             : }  /* conversion_template_matches_base_member */
   22746             : 
   22747             : 
   22748          16 : static a_boolean conversion_matches_base_member(a_symbol_ptr  dsym,
   22749             :                                                 a_symbol_ptr  bsym)
   22750             : /*
   22751             : Return TRUE if dsym (a conversion function in a derived class) and bsym (a
   22752             : conversion function in a base class) convert to the same type.
   22753             : */
   22754             : {
   22755          16 :   a_boolean  result;
   22756             : 
   22757          16 :   if (!cli_or_cx_enabled) {
   22758             :     /* In ordinary (non-CLI) C++, the symbol header is determined by the
   22759             :        destination type. */
   22760          16 :     result = dsym->header == bsym->header;
   22761             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   22762             :   } else {
   22763             :     /* In C++/CLI, the symbol header doesn't tell the whole story with static
   22764             :        conversion functions.  E.g.:
   22765             :          ref class D;
   22766             :          ref struct B {
   22767             :            static operator D^(B%);  // (1)
   22768             :          };
   22769             :          ref struct D: B {
   22770             :            static operator D^(int); // Same header as (1), but doesn't
   22771             :          };                         // supersede it.
   22772             :       More generally, "reverse conversion functions" don't appear to supersede
   22773             :       each other.  E.g.:
   22774             :         ref class D;
   22775             :         ref struct B { static operator B^(D%); };
   22776             :         ref struct D: B { static operator B^(D%); };
   22777             :         void f(D %t) {
   22778             :           B ^h = t;  // Ambiguous.
   22779             :         }
   22780             :     */
   22781             :     a_routine_ptr  rp1 = fundamental_symbol_of(dsym)->variant.routine.ptr;
   22782             :     a_routine_ptr  rp2 = fundamental_symbol_of(bsym)->variant.routine.ptr;
   22783             :     if (rp1->is_reverse_conversion_function ||
   22784             :         rp2->is_reverse_conversion_function) {
   22785             :       result = FALSE;
   22786             :     } else {
   22787             :       result = dsym->header == bsym->header;
   22788             :     }  /* if */
   22789             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   22790             :   }  /* if */
   22791          16 :   return result;
   22792             : }  /* conversion_matches_base_member */
   22793             : 
   22794             : 
   22795        5182 : static void check_base_class_conversion_list(a_type_ptr       class_type,
   22796             :                                              a_base_class_ptr base_class,
   22797             :                                              a_boolean        is_template_list,
   22798             :                                              a_boolean        *updated)
   22799             : /*
   22800             : For each entry on the conversion list of the indicated base class (or, if
   22801             : is_template_list is TRUE, on the conversion template list), look for an
   22802             : overriding conversion function on the corresponding list of class_type.  If
   22803             : none is found, create a projection symbol for it and add it to the list of
   22804             : class_type.  Set *updated if a projection symbol is created.
   22805             : */
   22806             : {
   22807        5182 :   a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr cssp, bcssp;
   22808        5182 :   a_symbol_list_entry_ptr       slep, bcslep;
   22809             : 
   22810        5182 :   bcssp = symbol_supplement_for_class(base_class->type);
   22811        5182 :   bcslep = is_template_list ? bcssp->conversion_template_list :
   22812             :                               bcssp->conversion_list;
   22813        5182 :   if (bcslep != NULL) {
   22814        1592 :     a_symbol_ptr  sym, bcsym;
   22815        1592 :     cssp = symbol_supplement_for_class(class_type);
   22816        3184 :     for (; bcslep != NULL; bcslep = bcslep->next) {
   22817             :       /* Compare the conversion list entry from the base class with each
   22818             :          conversion list entry for the current class.  They convert to the
   22819             :          same type if they have the same header. */
   22820        1592 :       bcsym = bcslep->symbol;
   22821        1592 :       slep = is_template_list ? cssp->conversion_template_list :
   22822             :                                 cssp->conversion_list;
   22823        1592 :       for (; slep != NULL; slep = slep->next) {
   22824          16 :         sym = slep->symbol;
   22825          16 :         if (conversion_matches_base_member(sym, bcsym) ||
   22826           0 :             (is_template_list &&
   22827           0 :              conversion_template_matches_base_member(sym, bcsym))) {
   22828             :           /* A conversion to the same type.  If this is from the current class
   22829             :              (i.e., it is not a projection symbol) we should ignore the one
   22830             :              from the base class.  If the entry on the current class list
   22831             :              is a projection to the same routine as the symbol from
   22832             :              the base class, it can also be ignored. */
   22833          16 :           if (!symbol_is(sym, sk_projection)) {
   22834             :             /* The symbol is from the current class.  Ignore the base
   22835             :                symbol. */
   22836             :             break;
   22837             :           } else {
   22838             :             /* A projection symbol.  Ignore this entry if it refers to the
   22839             :                same function or template as one already on the list. */
   22840          16 :             a_symbol_ptr  fund_curr_sym = fundamental_symbol_of(sym);
   22841          32 :             a_symbol_ptr  fund_base_sym =
   22842          16 :                                          fundamental_symbol_of(bcsym);

   22844           0 :               if (same_entities(fund_curr_sym->variant.template_info->

   22846             :                                 fund_base_sym->variant.template_info->
   22847             :                                      il_template_entry->canonical_template)) {
   22848             :                 break;

   22850          16 :             } else if (same_entities(fund_curr_sym->variant.routine.ptr,
   22851             :                                      fund_base_sym->variant.routine.ptr)) {
   22852             :               break;
   22853           0 :             } else if (base_class->is_virtual) {
   22854             :               /* Check if slep represents a projection from a base class that
   22855             :                  also derives virtually from base_class.  In that case, this
   22856             :                  projection should be skipped (per the resolution of Core
   22857             :                  issue 39, through paper N1626). */
   22858           0 :               if (is_on_any_derivation_of(base_class,
   22859           0 :                                           sym->variant.projection.extra_info
   22860             :                                              ->fundamental_base_class)) {

   22863             :             }  /* if */

   22869             :            represent its projection into the current class and record it in

   22874             :            ambiguity). */
   22875        1576 :         a_symbol_ptr      fund_sym = fundamental_symbol_of(bcsym);

   22895        5182 : }  /* check_base_class_conversion_list */
   22896             : 
   22897             : 
   22898        6989 : static void project_base_class_conversion_functions(a_type_ptr class_type)
   22899             : /*
   22900             : Go through all the direct base classes of the current class class_type and
   22901             : create projection symbols to represent inherited conversion functions.  Also
   22902             : create a symbol_list_entry for each new projection symbol and link it to
   22903             : the list for the current class.  Only create a new projection symbol if the
   22904             : destination type is not yet on the current class's conversion list.
   22905             : */
   22906             : {
   22907        6989 :   a_base_class_ptr  bcp;
   22908        6989 :   a_boolean         updated = FALSE, has_direct_virtual_base = FALSE;
   22909             : 
   22910        6989 :   db_enter(4, "project_base_class_conversion_functions");
   22911             :   /* Examine each direct base class.  This may require two passes because we
   22912             :      must deal specially with direct virtual bases.  Consider:
   22913             :        struct V { operator int () const; };
   22914             :        struct B: virtual V { operator int () const; };
   22915             :        struct D: A, virtual V {};
   22916             :        int r = D();
   22917             :      The rules of N1626 ([class.member.lookup] 10.2/6 in the C++14 standard)
   22918             :      cause "V::operator int" to be hidden by "B::operator int".  To implement
   22919             :      that, we deal with direct virtual base classes after direct nonvirtual
   22920             :      base classes, and project their conversion functions only if no "masking"
   22921             :      projection has been projected before.
   22922             :   */
   22923       10523 :   for (bcp = base_classes_of(class_type); bcp != NULL; bcp = bcp->next) {
   22924        3534 :     if (bcp->direct) {
   22925        2591 :       if (bcp->is_virtual) {
   22926          32 :         has_direct_virtual_base = TRUE;
   22927          32 :         continue;
   22928             :       }  /* if */
   22929             :       /* Examine each conversion list entry in the base class. */
   22930        2559 :       check_base_class_conversion_list(class_type, bcp,
   22931             :                                        /*is_template_list=*/FALSE, &updated);
   22932        2559 :       check_base_class_conversion_list(class_type, bcp,
   22933             :                                        /*is_template_list=*/TRUE, &updated);
   22934             :     }  /* if */
   22935             :   }  /* for */
   22936        6989 :   if (has_direct_virtual_base) {
   22937             :     /* Perform an additional pass to deal with direct virtual bases. */
   22938          96 :     for (bcp = base_classes_of(class_type); bcp != NULL; bcp = bcp->next) {
   22939          64 :       if (bcp->direct && bcp->is_virtual) {
   22940          32 :         check_base_class_conversion_list(class_type, bcp,
   22941             :                                          /*is_template_list=*/FALSE, &updated);
   22942          32 :         check_base_class_conversion_list(class_type, bcp,
   22943             :                                          /*is_template_list=*/TRUE, &updated);
   22944             :       }  /* if */
   22945             :     }  /* for */
   22946             :   }  /* if */
   22947        6989 :   if (updated) {
   22948             :     /* Since the scope symbol list may have been empty before and since
   22949             :        at least one new symbol has been added, update the symbols list
   22950             :        attached to the class. */
   22951        1576 :     symbol_supplement_for_class(class_type)->symbols =
   22952        3152 :           assoc_pointers_block_of(&scope_stack[depth_scope_stack])->symbols;
   22953             :   }  /* if */
   22954             : #if DEBUG
   22955        6989 :   if (debug_level >= 3) {
   22956           0 :     a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr cssp = 
   22957           0 :                                    symbol_supplement_for_class(class_type);
   22958           0 :     a_symbol_list_entry_ptr       slep = cssp->conversion_list;
   22959             : 
   22960           0 :     fputs("conversion list for ", f_debug);
   22961           0 :     db_type_name(class_type);
   22962           0 :     fprintf(f_debug, ": %s\n", slep == NULL ? "NULL" : "");
   22963           0 :     for (; slep != NULL; slep = slep->next) {
   22964           0 :       db_symbol(slep->symbol, "  ", 4);
   22965             :     }  /* for */
   22966           0 :     slep = cssp->conversion_template_list;
   22967           0 :     fputs("conversion template list for ", f_debug);
   22968           0 :     db_type_name(class_type);
   22969           0 :     fprintf(f_debug, ": %s\n", slep == NULL ? "NULL" : "");
   22970           0 :     for (; slep != NULL; slep = slep->next) {
   22971           0 :       db_symbol(slep->symbol, "  ", 4);
   22972             :     }  /* for */

   22975        6989 :   db_exit();

   22978             : 
   22979         309 : static a_boolean is_duplicate_member_using_decl(a_symbol_ptr       sym,
   22980             :                                                 a_source_position  *err_pos)
   22981             : /*
   22982             : Check for a duplicate class member using declaration.  sym represents the
   22983             : base-class member resulting from the current using declaration.  If this
   22984             : declaration does duplicate a previous using declaration, issue a diagnostic

   22997         309 :   udp = sp->using_decls;

   23001        1292 :       scp = source_corresp_for_il_entry(udp->entity.ptr,

   23035         345 : static void create_member_using_declaration(
   23036             :                                           a_symbol_ptr         sym,
   23037             :                                           a_symbol_ptr         declared_sym,
   23038             :                                           a_symbol_ptr         *other_sym,
   23039             :                                           a_base_class_ptr     bcp,
   23040             :                                           a_boolean            dummy_base,
   23041             :                                           a_type_ptr           class_type,
   23042             :                                           a_using_decl_ptr     *prev_udp,
   23043             :                                           an_access_specifier  access)
   23044             : /*
   23045             : Check that a valid explicit projection (a class-scope using-declaration) can
   23046             : be created for the symbol "sym", and if so create it.  "declared_sym" is
   23047             : either equal to "sym", or it points to the overload set symbol of which "sym"
   23048             : is an element.  "*other_sym" points to a declaration of the same name in the
   23049             : scope of the derived class "class_type" (NULL if none exists).  "bcp" is the
   23050             : base class from which the symbol is being projected (or, when "dummy_base" is
   23051             : TRUE, a dummy entry created only to represent the using-declaration in a
   23052             : prototype instantiation).  "*prev_udp" is the previous a_using_decl structure
   23053             : created for the using-declaration that is currently being processed.  "access"
   23054             : is the access specifier applicable to the new declaration.
   23055             : */
   23056             : {
   23057         345 :   a_symbol_ptr       fund_sym = fundamental_symbol_of(sym);
   23058         345 :   a_source_position  decl_pos;
   23059             : 
   23060         345 :   decl_pos = locator_for_curr_id.source_position;
   23061         345 :   if (!have_access_to_symbol(sym) &&
   23062             :       !(ms_compat &&
   23063             :         sym->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_projection &&
   23064             :         sym->variant.projection.is_using_decl &&
   23065             :         is_function_symbol(fund_sym))) {
   23066             :     /* The specified symbol (either the explicitly declared symbol or
   23067             :        a member of the overload set the symbol refers to) is inaccessible.

   23193           0 : static a_boolean in_overload_set(a_symbol_ptr  member,

   23222             : 
   23223           0 : static void check_member_using_visibility(a_type_ptr    class_type,
   23224             :                                           a_symbol_ptr  fund_sym,
   23225             :                                           a_boolean     *err)
   23226             : /*
   23227             : Members (represented by fund_sym) designated by a member using-declaration must
   23228             : be visible in a direct base class of the class (represented by class_type) in
   23229             : which the using-declaration appears.  If that is not the case, *err is set to
   23230             : TRUE and an error is issued (*err should be passed in as FALSE).
   23231             : */
   23232             : {
   23233           0 :   a_base_class_ptr  direct_bcp = base_classes_of(class_type);
   23234           0 :   a_symbol_locator  locator;
   23235             : 
   23236           0 :   check_assertion(!*err);
   23237           0 :   if (fund_sym->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_overloaded_function) {
   23238             :     /* Treat each member of the overload set separately. */
   23239           0 :     fund_sym = fund_sym->variant.overloaded_function.symbols;

   23272           0 : static void record_inheriting_ctor_using_decl(a_class_def_state_ptr  cdsp,
   23273             :                                               a_source_position      *pos)
   23274             : /*
   23275             : A member using-declaration appears to introduce inheriting constructors into
   23276             : the class type being defined (described by cdsp).   pos is the position of the

   23341             : 
   23342        1631 : static void member_using_or_alias_declaration(a_class_def_state_ptr  cdsp)
   23343             : /*
   23344             : Scan what is either a using-declaration (possibly introducing one or more
   23345             : inheriting constructors), an alias declaration, or (if tok_using is not the
   23346             : current token) a deprecated access-adjustment declaration.  The semantics and
   23347             : representation of using-declarations (excluding the inheriting constructors
   23348             : case) and access-adjustment declarations are identical.  cdsp describes the
   23349             : class being defined.  (The alias declaration case is almost entirely handled
   23350             : by a call to alias_declaration.  The latter call is made in this routine
   23351             : because the tok_using token must be consumed to distinguish an alias
   23352             : declaration from a using-declaration.)
   23353             : */
   23354             : {
   23355        1631 :   a_type_ptr           class_type = cdsp->class_type;
   23356        1631 :   an_access_specifier  access = cdsp->access;

   23358        1631 :   a_symbol_ptr         other_sym, fund_sym;

   23361             :                        pesep;

   23363        1631 :   a_boolean            check_for_packs = FALSE, any_more = TRUE;
   23364        1631 :   a_symbol_locator     locator;

   23755             : 
   23756         102 : a_symbol_ptr find_corresp_prototype_tag_sym(a_symbol_ptr  curr_sym)
   23757             : /*
   23758             : If a given tag symbol (curr_sym) represents an instantiation of a class
   23759             : template, return the corresponding tag symbol for the prototype instantiation
   23760             : of the same template.  If curr_sym is not an instantiation or if it is
   23761             : itself a prototype instantiation, return NULL.
   23762             : 
   23763             : For example, given
   23764             : 
   23765             :   template <class T> class A {
   23766             :     class B {
   23767             :       class C { };
   23768             :     };
   23769             :   };
   23770             :   A<int> a;
   23771             : 
   23772             : a prototype instantiation for A<T> will have been done, and in the process
   23773             : symbols for the nested classes A<T>::B and A<T>::B::C will have been created.
   23774             : With the real instantiation A<int> the "corresponding prototype instantiations"
   23775             : are:   A<T> for A<int>, A<T>::B for A<int>::B, and A<T>::B::C for A<int>::B::C.
   23776             : */
   23777             : {
   23778         102 :   a_symbol_ptr                   corresp_prototype_tag_sym = NULL;
   23779         102 :   a_symbol_ptr                   sym, templ_sym;
   23780         102 :   a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr  cssp;
   23781         102 :   a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr  proto_cssp;
   23782         102 :   a_type_ptr                     tp;
   23783         102 :   a_symbol_ptr                   parent_sym;
   23784             : 
   23785         102 :   db_enter(3, "find_corresp_prototype_tag_sym");
   23786         102 :   if (is_nonreal_instance_class_symbol(curr_sym)) {
   23787             :     /* Return NULL. */
   23788         102 :   } else if (curr_sym->is_class_member) {
   23789             :     /* curr_sym represents a nested class.  Get the corresponding prototype
   23790             :        tag symbol of its parent class; then find the corresponding nested
   23791             :        class within it.  The prototype tag symbol of the parent class is
   23792             :        stored in the latter's class symbol supplement. */
   23793         102 :     parent_sym = symbol_supplement_for_class(sym_parent_class(curr_sym))->
   23794             :                                                        corresp_prototype_sym;
   23795         102 :     if (parent_sym != NULL) {
   23796             :       /* sym is the corresponding prototype tag symbol of the parent class.
   23797             :          It represents a prototype instantiation of a class template or a
   23798             :          class nested within a prototype instantiation. One of its own nested
   23799             :          classes will be the nested class that corresponds to curr_sym: find
   23800             :          a symbol for that nested class. */
   23801         102 :       tp = parent_sym->variant.class_struct_union.type;
   23802         102 :       if (is_unnamed_tag_symbol(curr_sym) || curr_sym->is_error) {

   23804             :            Look through the types list associated with the parent class. */

   23820             :                                              curr_sym->header);

   23826             :                token sequence numbers uniquely identify a translation unit. */
   23827          70 :             if (cssp->prototype_token_sequence_number ==

   23829             :               corresp_prototype_tag_sym = sym;
   23830             :               break;

   23832             :           }  /* if */
   23833             :         }  /* for */
   23834             :       }  /* if */
   23835         102 :       if (corresp_prototype_tag_sym == NULL) {
   23836             :         /* In some cases involving anonymous unions the symbol may not
   23837             :            be found in the lookup tables (these cases are nonstandard).
   23838             :            Go through the active or inactive symbols to look for a match. */
   23839           0 :         if (is_incomplete_type(parent_sym->variant.class_struct_union.type)) {
   23840             :           /* We must still be in the midst of the prototype instantiation, so

   23895             : 
   23896         405 : static void check_nonreal_nested_class(a_symbol_ptr                  tag_sym,
   23897             :                                        a_template_symbol_supplement_ptr tssp)
   23898             : /*

   23900             : If the nested class is defined inside a template definition, set fields of
   23901             : *tssp, its template-symbol-supplement, based on the template-symbol-supplement

   23904             : {
   23905         405 :   a_scope_stack_entry_ptr           instantiation_ssep;
   23906         405 :   a_template_symbol_supplement_ptr  parent_tssp;

   23908         405 :   instantiation_ssep = &scope_stack[depth_innermost_instantiation_scope];
