   23937             : 
   23938             : 
   23939             : static a_boolean scan_access_specification(a_class_def_state  *state)
   23940             : /*
   23941             : Check for an access specifier in a class definition (described by state).  If
   23942             : one is found return TRUE and update state->access accordingly.
   23943             : In C++/CLI mode we also check for the extended forms of access specifiers:
   23944             : "internal", "public protected", "protected public", "protected private", and
   23945             : "private protected".  state->assembly_access is updated accordingly.
   23946             : */
   23947             : {
   23948             :   a_boolean   found = FALSE;
   23949             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   23950             :   a_type_ptr  class_type = state->class_type;
   23951             :   a_boolean   in_managed_class = is_immediate_managed_class_type(class_type);
   23952             :   a_boolean   internal_seen = FALSE;
   23953             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   23954             : 
   23955             :   /* The check is implemented as a loop because successive access
   23956             :      specifications are permitted. */
   23957             :   while (curr_token == tok_public || curr_token == tok_private ||
   23958             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   23959             :          (in_managed_class &&
   23960             :           (internal_seen =
   23961             :                       curr_token_is_identifier_string("internal")) == TRUE) ||
   23962             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   23963             :          curr_token == tok_protected) {
   23964             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   23965             :     a_token_kind       next_tok = tok_error;
   23966             :     a_source_position  pos_access;
   23967             :     pos_access = pos_curr_token;
   23968             :     if (cli_or_cx_enabled) {
   23969             :       next_tok = next_token();
   23970             :       if ((is_class_type_keyword(next_tok) || next_tok == tok_enum) &&
   23971             :           (curr_token == tok_public || curr_token == tok_private)) {
   23972             :         /* A C++/CLI top-level visibility specifier is not handled here. */
   23973             :         break;
   23974             :       } else if (internal_seen && next_tok != tok_colon &&
   23975             :                  is_member_decl_start()) {
   23976             :         /* "internal" appeared as an ordinary identifier credibly starting a
   23977             :            new member declaration.  Don't attempt to process it as an access
   23978             :            specifier.  (The is_member_decl_start() test could be omitted, but
   23979             :            if the test fails, an accidentally omitted colon seems the most
   23980             :            likely cause of the error and we therefore continue processing the
   23981             :            token as an access specifier.) */
   23982             :         break;
   23983             :       }  /* if */
   23984             :     }  /* if */
   23985             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   23986             :     found = TRUE;
   23987             :     if (curr_token == tok_public) {
   23988             :       state->access = (an_access_specifier)as_public;
   23989             :     } else if (curr_token == tok_protected) {
   23990             :       state->access = (an_access_specifier)as_protected;
   23991             :     } else {
   23992             :       state->access = (an_access_specifier)as_private;
   23993             :     }  /* if */
   23994             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   23995             :     if (ms_extensions) {
   23996             :       if (in_managed_class) {
   23997             :         char  specifier_name[20];
   23998             :                         /* Large enough for "protected protected". */
   23999             :         /* For the C++/CLI extended form of access specifiers state->access
   24000             :            and state->assembly_access are set in accordance with the
   24001             :            table below:
   24002             :               ==============================================================
   24003             :              |       access        | state->access | state->assembly_access |
   24004             :              |==============================================================|
   24005             :              | public              | public        | public                 |
   24006             :              |--------------------------------------------------------------|
   24007             :              | protected           | protected     | protected              |
   24008             :              |--------------------------------------------------------------|
   24009             :              | private             | private       | private                |
   24010             :              |--------------------------------------------------------------|
   24011             :              | internal            | public        | private                |
   24012             :              |--------------------------------------------------------------|
   24013             :              | protected public    | public        | protected              |
   24014             :              | public protected    |               |                        |
   24015             :              |--------------------------------------------------------------|
   24016             :              | private protected   | protected     | private                |
   24017             :              | protected private   |               |                        |
   24018             :              |--------------------------------------------------------------|
   24019             :              | public public       | public        | public                 |
   24020             :              | (deprecated)        |               |                        |
   24021             :              |--------------------------------------------------------------|
   24022             :              | protected protected | protected     | protected              |
   24023             :              | (deprecated)        |               |                        |
   24024             :              |--------------------------------------------------------------|
   24025             :              | private private     | private       | private                |
   24026             :              | (deprecated)        |               |                        |
   24027             :              |--------------------------------------------------------------|
   24028             :              | public private      | public        | private                |
   24029             :              | private public      |               |                        |
   24030             :              | (deprecated)        |               |                        |
   24031             :               --------------------------------------------------------------
   24032             :            Since for many cases state->assembly_access can be set to
   24033             :            state->access we start with that and adjust as needed. */
   24034             :         state->assembly_access = state->access;
   24035             :         if (internal_seen) {
   24036             :           /* "internal" access specifier. */
   24037             :           state->access = (an_access_specifier)as_public;
   24038             :           state->assembly_access = (an_access_specifier)as_private;
   24039             :           /* Clear internal_seen in case other access specifiers follow. */
   24040             :           internal_seen = FALSE;
   24041             :         } else if (curr_token == next_tok) {
   24042             :           /* "public public", "private private", or "protected protected".
   24043             :              Issue a warning that these are deprecated. */
   24044             :           sprintf(specifier_name, "%s %s",
   24045             :                   token_names[(int)curr_token], token_names[(int)curr_token]);
   24046             :           pos_st2_warning(ec_deprecated_access_specifier, &pos_access,
   24047             :                           specifier_name, token_names[(int)curr_token]);
   24048             :           (void)get_token();
   24049             :         } else if ((curr_token == tok_private && next_tok == tok_public) ||
   24050             :                    (curr_token == tok_public && next_tok == tok_private)) {
   24051             :           /* "private public" or "public private".  Issue a warning that these
   24052             :              are deprecated and correct the access state as if "internal" had
   24053             :              appeared. */
   24054             :           sprintf(specifier_name, "%s %s",
   24055             :                   token_names[(int)curr_token], token_names[(int)next_tok]);
   24056             :           pos_st2_warning(ec_deprecated_access_specifier, &pos_access,
   24057             :                           specifier_name, "internal");
   24058             :           state->access = (an_access_specifier)as_public;
   24059             :           state->assembly_access = (an_access_specifier)as_private;
   24060             :           (void)get_token();
   24061             :         } else if ((curr_token == tok_protected && next_tok == tok_public) ||
   24062             :                    (curr_token == tok_public && next_tok == tok_protected)) {
   24063             :           state->access = (an_access_specifier)as_public;
   24064             :           state->assembly_access = (an_access_specifier)as_protected;
   24065             :           (void)get_token();
   24066             :         } else if ((curr_token == tok_private && next_tok == tok_protected) ||
   24067             :                    (curr_token == tok_protected && next_tok == tok_private)) {
   24068             :           state->access = (an_access_specifier)as_protected;
   24069             :           state->assembly_access = (an_access_specifier)as_private;
   24070             :           (void)get_token();
   24071             :         }  /* if */
   24072             :         /* Reflect the current assembly-level access in the scope stack. */
   24073             :         scope_stack_top().current_assembly_access = state->assembly_access;
   24074             :       }  /* if */
   24075             :       if (state->access != (an_access_specifier)as_public ||
   24076             :           (cli_or_cx_enabled &&
   24077             :            state->assembly_access != (an_access_specifier)as_public)) {
   24078             :         /* "protected" and "private" cannot appear in __interface classes nor
   24079             :            in C++/CLI interfaces. */
   24080             :         if (class_type->variant.class_struct_union.is_interface ||
   24081             :             (cli_or_cx_enabled &&
   24082             :              cli_class_type_kind_is(class_type, cctk_interface))) {
   24083             :           pos_error(ec_interface_cannot_have_private_or_protected,
   24084             :                     &pos_access);

   24086             :         } else {
   24087             :           state->potentially_interface_like = FALSE;
   24088             :         }  /* if */
   24089             :       }  /* if */
   24090             :     }  /* if */
   24091             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   24092             :     scope_stack[decl_scope_level].current_access = state->access;
   24093             :     /* Advance to the colon, which is required. */
   24094             :     (void)get_token();
   24095             :     if (curr_token == tok_colon) {
   24096             :       /* Advance past it. */
   24097             :       (void)get_token();
   24098             :     } else {
   24099             :       /* Calling is_member_decl_start involves calling curr_type_symbol,
   24100             :          which suppresses access and ambiguity errors when looking up what
   24101             :          may be a qualified name.  This is correct in this case since we do
   24102             :          not want to do the access check until after excluding the possibility
   24103             :          of an access adjustment declaration. */
   24104             :       if (curr_token == tok_identifier || is_member_decl_start()) {
   24105             :         pos_error(ec_exp_colon, &error_position);
   24106             :       } else {
   24107             :         syntax_error(ec_exp_colon);
   24108             :       }  /* if */
   24109             :     }  /* if */
   24110             :     check_for_if_exists_pragmas();

   24112             :        should be added to those that appear before.  This means the access
   24113             :        specifier is ignored as a "construct" -- the binding skips over it. */

   24115             :   }  /* while */
   24116             :   return found;
   24117             : }  /* scan_access_specification */
   24118             : 
   24119             : 
   24120         251 : static void check_friend_class_decl(a_type_ptr              class_type,
   24121             :                                     a_member_decl_info_ptr  decl_info)
   24122             : /*
   24123             : The current construct seems to make member_type a friend of class_type.
   24124             : Check that this is a valid type and if so make member_type a friend.
   24125             : *decl_info contains some additional information about the declaration.
   24126             : */
   24127             : {
   24128         251 :   a_decl_parse_state  *state = &decl_info->decl_state;
   24129         251 :   a_type_ptr          member_type = state->specifiers_type;
   24130             : 
   24131         251 :   if (is_error_type(member_type)) {
   24132             :     /* An error was already issued. */
   24133             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   24134             :   } else if (cppcli_enabled && is_immediate_managed_class_type(class_type)) {
   24135             :     pos_error(ec_managed_class_cannot_have_friend, &state->start_pos);
   24136             :   } else if (ms_extensions &&
   24137             :              class_type->variant.class_struct_union.is_interface) {
   24138             :     pos_error(ec_interface_cannot_have_friend, &state->start_pos);
   24139             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   24140         251 :   } else if ((state->dso_flags & DSO_HAS_EXPLICIT_TYPE_SPECIFIER) == 0) {
   24141             :     /* No type was specified at all; e.g. "friend;". */
   24142           0 :     pos_error(ec_bad_friend_decl, &state->start_pos);
   24143         267 :   } else if ((((is_class_struct_union_type(member_type) ||
   24144          16 :                 is_template_param_type(member_type)) &&
   24145         251 :                !is_top_level_qualified_type(member_type)) ||
   24146           0 :               (extended_friends_enabled && state->qualifiers == TQ_NONE)) &&
   24147         251 :              depth_template_declaration_scope == NO_SCOPE_DEPTH) {
   24148             :     /* This is a friend class declaration.  Normally, only the form
   24149             :            friend class A;  // or "struct" or "union" instead of "class"
   24150             :        is allowed, but many compilers also accept friend declarations
   24151             :        without a class-key.  For example:
   24152             :             friend A;
   24153             :        We also accept the latter form as an extension (except in strict
   24154             :        mode).  The C++11 standard allows many other forms (e.g., "friend int;",
   24155             :        but not "friend int const;").  We implement those rules when
   24156             :        extended_friends_enabled is TRUE (e.g., in C++11 mode). */

   24158         251 :                                (!extended_friends_enabled ||  /* For speed. */

   24162             :       /* "friend typename ..." is not allowed in many modes. */

   24177             :         /* This is a friend declaration that names neither a class type nor a
   24178             :            template-dependent type.  For example, "friend int;".  Such friend
   24179             :            declarations have no effect, but we may need to record them in the
   24180             :            list of source sequence entries.  Since these do not have any
   24181             :            effect, we do not record them in the source sequence list if they
   24182             :            result from a template instantiation (even when instances are
   24183             :            otherwise recorded in the source sequence entry list).  Among other

   24270        1464 : static void check_missing_declarator_in_member_declaration(
   24271             :                                            a_type_ptr              class_type,
   24272             :                                            a_member_decl_info_ptr  decl_info)
   24273             : /*
   24274             : This routine is called while a member declaration is being scanned when a
   24275             : semicolon is encountered immediately after the declaration-specifiers.  In
   24276             : other words, there is no declarator in the member declaration.  Issue an error
   24277             : if appropriate.  class_type is the class whose definition is being scanned.
   24278             : *decl_info contains information about the declaration as it has been scanned
   24279             : thus far; moreover, several fields of *decl_info may be updated by this
   24280             : routine.
   24281             : */

   24283        1464 :   a_decl_parse_state  *decl_state = &decl_info->decl_state;

   24474       41376 : static void check_completed_member_type(a_symbol_locator        *locator,
   24475             :                                         a_class_def_state_ptr   class_state,
   24476             :                                         a_member_decl_info_ptr  decl_info)
   24477             : /*

   24479             : which is the type produced by the combined processing of decl_specifiers
   24480             : and declarator. locator points to the symbol locator for the member.

   24492             :          been previously been declared like this:

   24494             :          meaning "t" names a routine type taking an int argument, returning
   24495             :          void, and having an implicit this-param type of const-ptr-to-A.
   24496             :          (This "member function typedef" is not part of the standard language
   24497             :          nor of the ARM; it's allowed for cfront compatibility only.)  The
   24498             :          only supported use is to declare a pointer-to-member type, e.g.,
   24499             :               t *pm;                   // Okay

   24506             :   }  /* if */
   24507       41376 :   if ((decl_state->dso_flags & DSO_DEFINES_SOMETHING) && !ms_extensions) {

   24548           0 : static void check_typedef_function_type(a_type_ptr         *member_type,

   24647           0 : static void report_missing_constructor(a_symbol_ptr  tag_sym)
   24648             : /*

   24729             : 
   24730       26252 : static void check_if_function_defined_in_class(a_func_info_block   *func_info,
   24731             :                                                a_member_decl_info  *decl_info)
   24732             : /*
   24733             : We've just parsed a member function declarator in a class definition (the
   24734             : declaration is described by *func_info and *decl_info).  Record in *func_info
   24735             : if this is part of a function definition.  If that is the case, record some
   24736             : additional properties related to the definition and issue an error if the
   24737             : current declarator was preceded by another one sharing the same specifiers
   24738             : (e.g., "int f(), g() {};" is an error).
   24739             : */
   24740             : {
   24741       26252 :   if (curr_token == tok_semicolon) {
   24742             :     /* Probably the most common case: Not a definition. */
   24743       10578 :   } else if (curr_token == tok_lbrace || curr_token == tok_try) {
   24744        7556 :     func_info->is_definition = TRUE;
   24745        3022 :   } else if (decl_info->is_constructor && curr_token == tok_colon) {
   24746        1396 :     func_info->is_definition = TRUE;
   24747        1626 :   } else if (curr_token == tok_assign) {
   24748             :     /* This could be "= default" or "= delete" (which are treated as
   24749             :        definitions), or a pure-virtual specifier (which can only be a
   24750             :        definition in Microsoft mode). */
   24751        1100 :     a_token_cache  cache;
   24752        1100 :     clear_token_cache(&cache, /*reusable=*/FALSE);
   24753             :     /* Put the current token (tok_assign) in the cache. */
   24754        1100 :     cache_curr_token(&cache);
   24755        1100 :     (void)get_token();
   24756        1100 :     if (deleted_functions_enabled && curr_token == tok_delete) {
   24757         300 :       func_info->is_deleted = TRUE;
   24758         300 :       func_info->is_definition = TRUE;
   24759         300 :       report_gnu_cpp11_extension_if_needed(
   24760             :                               &pos_curr_token, ec_deleted_functions_is_cpp11);
   24761         800 :     } else if (defaulted_special_members_enabled &&
   24762         800 :                (curr_token == tok_default ||
   24763             :                 (microsoft_mode && microsoft_version >= 1400 &&
   24764             :                  check_context_sensitive_keyword(tok_default, "default")))) {
   24765             :       /* Note that "default" is a context-sensitive keyword in some Microsoft
   24766             :          modes. */
   24767         584 :       func_info->is_defaulted = TRUE;
   24768         584 :       func_info->is_definition = TRUE;
   24769         584 :       report_gnu_cpp11_extension_if_needed(
   24770             :                             &pos_curr_token, ec_defaulted_functions_is_cpp11);
   24771         216 :     } else if (curr_token == tok_int_constant) {
   24772             :       /* A pure virtual specifier (presumably).  If a definition follows,
   24773             :          that will usually be diagnosed as an error (elsewhere), but in
   24774             :          Microsoft compatibility mode it is valid.  Either way, record
   24775             :          whether a definition does in fact follow. */
   24776         216 :       cache_curr_token(&cache);
   24777             :       /* Advance past the constant and see if the next token is a left
   24778             :          brace. */
   24779         216 :       if (get_token() == tok_lbrace) func_info->is_definition = TRUE;
   24780             :     }  /* if */
   24781             :     /* Restore the lexical state. */
   24782        1100 :     rescan_cached_tokens(&cache);
   24783             :   }  /* if */
   24784       26252 :   func_info->is_inline = func_info->is_definition ||
   24785       16416 :                          (decl_info->decl_state.dso_flags & DSO_INLINE);
   24786       26252 :   if (func_info->is_definition) {
   24787        9836 :     if (!decl_info->is_first_in_declarator_list) {
   24788           0 :       pos_error(ec_exp_semicolon, &pos_curr_token);
   24789             :     }  /* if */
   24790             :     /* Record the current setting of the maximum alignment for local class
   24791             :        members (an adjustment may be required for packing). */
   24792        9836 :     func_info->max_member_alignment =
   24793        9836 :                                     current_max_alignment_for_class_members();

   24795       26252 : }  /* check_if_function_defined_in_class */
   24796             : 
   24797             : 
   24798        8380 : static void cache_in_class_function_definition(
   24799             :                                              a_func_info_block   *func_info,
   24800             :                                              a_member_decl_info  *decl_info,
   24801             :                                              a_class_def_state   *class_state)
   24802             : /*
   24803             : A function definition appears in a class definition described by class_state.
   24804             : *func_info and *decl_info describe the function declaration.  Skip past the
   24805             : function definition and cache its tokens if appropriate.
   24806             : */
   24807             : {
   24808        8380 :   a_symbol_ptr  rout_sym = decl_info->decl_state.sym;
   24809        8380 :   a_boolean     is_friend;
   24810             : 
   24811        8380 :   is_friend = (decl_info->decl_state.dso_flags & DSO_FRIEND) != 0;
   24812             : #if CHECKING
   24813        8380 :   if (is_friend) {
   24814             :     /* The inline flag is set for friend functions in decl_friend_function,
   24815             :        which also handles cases in which it should be left unset despite the
   24816             :        presence of a function body. */
   24817        8284 :   } else if (rout_sym->variant.routine.ptr->is_inline) {
   24818             :     /* The usual case: In-class member function definitions are
   24819             :        inline. */
   24820             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   24821           0 :   } else if (rout_sym->variant.routine.ptr->never_inline) {
   24822             :     /* An in-class definition may have been declared with the "noinline"
   24823             :        attribute.  (Note: The Microsoft __declspec(noinline) attribute does
   24824             :        not make a function non-inline.) */
   24825             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   24826           0 :   } else if (func_info->is_deleted || func_info->is_defaulted) {
   24827             :     /* "= delete;" or "= default;" was encountered, but the routine entry is
   24828             :        not marked as inline.  This can happen in error cases (the "= delete;"
   24829             :        or "= default;" is essentially discarded). */
   24830           0 :     expect_error();
   24831             :   } else {
   24832           0 :     unexpected_condition();
   24833             :   }  /* if */
   24834             : #endif /* CHECKING */
   24835        8380 :   if (func_info->is_deleted || func_info->is_defaulted) {
   24836             :     /* Consume three tokens: "= delete ;" or "= default ;". */
   24837         884 :     check_assertion(curr_token == tok_assign);
   24838         884 :     (void)get_token();
   24839         884 :     check_assertion(curr_token == tok_delete || curr_token == tok_default);
   24840         884 :     (void)get_token();
   24841         884 :     (void)required_token(tok_semicolon, ec_exp_semicolon);
   24842             :   } else {
   24843             :     /* Cache the tokens comprising the function definition so that they can be
   24844             :        rescanned once the entire class definition has been processed. */
   24845        7496 :     a_token_sequence_number  first_token_number, last_token_number;
   24846        7496 :     a_token_cache            body_cache;
   24847        7496 :     a_type_ptr               class_type = class_state->class_type;
   24848        7496 :     if (prescan_function_definition(&first_token_number, &last_token_number,
   24849             :                                     &body_cache,
   24850        7496 :                                     (a_boolean)decl_info->is_constructor)) {
   24851             :       /* Advance past the terminating right brace. */
   24852        7496 :       (void)get_token();
   24853             :     }  /* if */
   24854        7496 :     if (curr_token == tok_semicolon) {
   24855             :       /* Advance past the optional semicolon. */
   24856           2 :       (void)get_token();
   24857             :     }  /* if */
   24858        7496 :     if ((class_state->is_nonreal_instantiation ||
   24859             :          class_state->is_generic_definition) &&
   24860             :         !class_type->variant.class_struct_union.
   24861        5283 :                                             is_ms_instantiated_nonreal_class &&
   24862        5283 :         !class_type->variant.class_struct_union.is_specialized &&
   24863        5283 :         !class_type->source_corresp.is_local_to_function) {
   24864             :       /* The test of is_specialized is done to exclude Microsoft mode
   24865             :          specializations in a class template scope.  Similarly, a member
   24866             :          function of a local class of a prototype instantiation is nonreal
   24867             :          but not a template of itself. */
   24868        5227 :       if (is_friend) {
   24869             : #if NONCLASS_TEMPLATE_INSTANTIATIONS_IN_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
   24870             :         /* A template cache segment entry is created for a friend function
   24871             :            that is defined in a class template.  This information is used
   24872             :            when creating template strings to eliminate the friend function
   24873             :            body from the template string. */
   24874          20 :         a_template_cache_segment_ptr    tcsp;
   24875          20 :         tcsp = alloc_template_cache_segment(
   24876             :                          rout_sym, (a_template_symbol_supplement_ptr)NULL);
   24877          20 :         tcsp->first_token_number = first_token_number;
   24878          20 :         tcsp->last_token_number = last_token_number;
   24879          20 :         tcsp->is_friend = TRUE;
   24880             : #endif /* NONCLASS_TEMPLATE_INSTANTIATIONS_IN_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
   24881        5207 :       } else if (rout_sym->variant.routine.instance_ptr == NULL) {
   24882             :         /* Normally, rout_sym->variant.routine.instance_ptr should be non-
   24883             :            NULL since we're apparently dealing with a member function of a
   24884             :            nonreal class.  However, severely ill-formed cases may get here
   24885             :            nonetheless. */
   24886           0 :         expect_error();
   24887             :       } else {
   24888             :         /* A member function of a nonreal class serves as a template, and
   24889             :            since this is the definition the template_info associated with
   24890             :            this member function must be updated, based on the template_info
   24891             :            of the prototype instantiation.  Note that the current class may
   24892             :            be nested within the prototype instantiation. */
   24893        5207 :         a_template_symbol_supplement_ptr  tssp, class_tssp;
   24894             :         /* A member function of a template class whose body is supplied in
   24895             :            the class shares the template declaration information with the
   24896             :            enclosing class. */
   24897        5207 :         tssp = rout_sym->variant.routine.instance_ptr->template_info;
   24898        5207 :         class_tssp = symbol_supplement_for_class(class_type)->template_info;
   24899             :         /* The body cache is saved here, but will be updated later during
   24900             :            routine fixup.  This is needed for the generation of template
   24901             :            strings to be done properly. */
   24902        5207 :         if (class_tssp != NULL) {
   24903        5207 :           set_template_cache_info(&tssp->cache, &body_cache,
   24904             :                                   class_tssp->cache.decl_info);
   24905             :         } else {
   24906             :           /* We may get here with severe errors (e.g., with a class defined in
   24907             :              an alias template). */
   24908           0 :           expect_error();
   24909             :         }  /* if */
   24910        5207 :         tssp->cache_segment = alloc_template_cache_segment(rout_sym, tssp);
   24911        5207 :         tssp->cache_segment->first_token_number = first_token_number;
   24912        5207 :         tssp->cache_segment->last_token_number = last_token_number;
   24913             :         /* Save a checksum of this template to be used for cross
   24914             :            translation unit comparisons. */
   24915        5207 :         record_cache_checksum(tssp, &body_cache);
   24916             :       }  /* if */
   24917             :     }  /* if */
   24918             :   }  /* if */
   24919        8380 : }  /* cache_in_class_function_definition */
   24920             : 
   24921             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   24922             : 
   24923             : static void scan_microsoft_member_decl_prefix(
   24924             :                                           a_class_def_state    *class_state,
   24925             :                                           an_ms_attribute_ptr  *ms_attributes,
   24926             :                                           a_boolean            *complete_decl)
   24927             : /*
   24928             : Scan Microsoft-specific leading components of a member declaration.  Normally,
   24929             : these are the Microsoft attributes enclosed in square brackets: *ms_attributes
   24930             : is updated to point to any such attributes.  If attributes are scanned and if
   24931             : they are followed by a semicolon, *complete_decl is set to TRUE; otherwise,
   24932             : *complete_decl is to FALSE.  Some Microsoft compilers also have a bug that
   24933             : allows for a member declaration to start with a left parenthesis: We scan the
   24934             : parenthesis here (with a warning) and record its presence in *class_state.
   24935             : The "matching" right parenthesis (which Microsoft compilers accept almost
   24936             : anywhere in the member declaration) should be consumed using the macro
   24937             : consume_any_stray_microsoft_rparen.
   24938             : */
   24939             : {
   24940             :   *complete_decl = FALSE;
   24941             :   if (microsoft_attribute_tokens_next()) {
   24942             :     /* A Microsoft attribute of the form "[ ... ]". */
   24943             :     *ms_attributes = scan_microsoft_attributes(/*is_param_or_base=*/FALSE);
   24944             :     if (curr_token == tok_semicolon) {
   24945             :       /* This is a standalone attribute block.  Make sure all of the specified
   24946             :          attributes are standalone attributes.  This also sets ms_attributes
   24947             :          to NULL. */
   24948             :       if (!is_template_context()) {
   24949             :         verify_standalone_attributes(ms_attributes);
   24950             :       } else {
   24951             :         dispose_of_unapplied_attributes(ms_attributes, ec_ms_attr_not_allowed);
   24952             :       }  /* if */
   24953             :       cannot_bind_to_curr_construct();
   24954             :       (void)get_token();
   24955             :       *complete_decl = TRUE;
   24956             :       if (class_state->property_or_event_descr != NULL) {
   24957             :         /* Something like "property int P { [assembly:MSAttr]; }".  Avoid
   24958             :            spurious errors by treating this as a valid declaration. */
   24959             :         treat_declaration_as_okay_in_property_or_event(class_state);
   24960             :       }  /* if */
   24961             :     }  /* if */
   24962             :   }  /* if */
   24963             :   class_state->ms_parenthesized_member = FALSE;
   24964             :   if (microsoft_bugs && microsoft_version >= 1310 && !C_mode() &&
   24965             :       curr_token == tok_lparen) {
   24966             :     /* In some Microsoft versions a member declaration can start with a left
   24967             :        parenthesis that can be closed just about anywhere in the declaration
   24968             :        (or not at all). */
   24969             :     pos_warning(ec_microsoft_parenthesized_member, &error_position);
   24970             :     (void)get_token();
   24971             :     if (curr_token != tok_rparen) {
   24972             :       class_state->ms_parenthesized_member = TRUE;
   24973             :     } else {
   24974             :       /* The member declaration started with "()", which is accepted and
   24975             :          ignored by the Microsoft compiler. */
   24976             :       (void)get_token();
   24977             :     }  /* if */
   24978             :   }  /* if */
   24979             : }  /* scan_microsoft_member_decl_prefix */
   24980             : 
   24981             : 
   24982             : void f_consume_any_stray_microsoft_rparen(void)
   24983             : /*
   24984             : Some Microsoft compilers accept a member declaration that starts with a left
   24985             : parenthesis.  The "matching" right parenthesis can appear almost anywhere in
   24986             : the declaration (or not at all).  This function consumes the right parenthesis
   24987             : token and clears the flag that was set when the left parenthesis was scanned.
   24988             : Call this function through the macro consume_any_stray_microsoft_rparen.
   24989             : */
   24990             : {
   24991             :   a_scope_stack_entry_ptr  ssep = &scope_stack[depth_scope_stack];
   24992             : 
   24993             :   if (ssep->kind == (a_scope_kind)sck_class_struct_union) {
   24994             :     /* The Microsoft bug only occurs in class scope. */
   24995             :     a_class_def_state  *class_state = ssep->class_def_state;
   24996             :     if (class_state->ms_parenthesized_member && curr_token == tok_rparen) {
   24997             :       /* We're in a member declaration that started with a left parenthesis. */
   24998             :       (void)get_token();
   24999             :       class_state->ms_parenthesized_member = FALSE;
   25000             :     }  /* if */
   25001             :   }  /* if */
   25002             : }  /* f_consume_any_stray_microsoft_rparen */
   25003             : 
   25004             : 
   25005             : static a_boolean type_specifiers_next(a_token_cache  *cache)
   25006             : /*
   25007             : Look ahead in the token stream (saving tokens in the given cache) to see if a
   25008             : sequence of type specifiers followed by a declarator comes next.  If so,
   25009             : return TRUE; otherwise, return FALSE.
   25010             : This is used in C++/CLI mode to determine if the identifiers "delegate",
   25011             : "event", "initonly", "literal", and "property" should be treated as context-
   25012             : sensitive keywords.
   25013             : */
   25014             : {
   25015             :   a_boolean  result = FALSE;
   25016             : 
   25017             :   for (;;) {
   25018             :     if (is_type_qualifier()) {
   25019             :       /* A type qualifier is always part of the sequence. */
   25020             :     } else if (is_type_specifier() || curr_token == tok_colon_colon) {
   25021             :       /* A keyword introducing a type specifier always denotes a type, which
   25022             :          implies that the previously-encountered identifier was indeed a
   25023             :          context-sensitive keyword.  Similarly, since a "::" cannot start a
   25024             :          member declarator or a delegate declarator, it must introduce a type
   25025             :          name. */
   25026             :       result = TRUE;
   25027             :       goto done;
   25028             :     } else if (curr_token == tok_identifier) {
   25029             :       /* An identifier naming a type, on the other hand, could be
   25030             :          a declarator-id. */
   25031             :       if (curr_type_symbol(/*is_new_type_name=*/FALSE,
   25032             :                            /*in_prescan=*/TRUE,
   25033             :                            /*in_type_check=*/FALSE,
   25034             :                            /*is_sizeof_context=*/FALSE) == NULL) {
   25035             :         /* The current identifier is not a type.  So it should be a
   25036             :            declarator-id and the potential context-sensitive keyword should be
   25037             :            a type name.  However, in some error cases better error recovery is
   25038             :            achieved if the identifier is assumed to be a mistyped type name. */
   25039             :         cache_curr_token(cache);
   25040             :         (void)get_token();
   25041             :         if (curr_token == tok_identifier || curr_token == tok_star ||
   25042             :             curr_token == tok_ampersand || curr_token == tok_and_and ||
   25043             :             curr_token == tok_excl_or || curr_token == tok_remainder) {
   25044             :           /* The next token is clearly a declarator.  Assume the identifier
   25045             :              was meant to be a type name. */
   25046             :           expect_error();
   25047             :           result = TRUE;
   25048             :           goto done;
   25049             :         }  /* if */
   25050             :         break;
   25051             :       } else {
   25052             :         /* The current identifier can be resolved as a type.  It is not a type
   25053             :            but a declarator-id if it is followed by: a semicolon (end of
   25054             :            declaration), a left bracket (array field or indexed property), a
   25055             :            left brace (property definition), an equal sign (in-class
   25056             :            initializer), or a colon (bit field).  It may also not be a type
   25057             :            name if it is followed by a left parenthesis (it could be a
   25058             :            function or delegate declarator).  */
   25059             :         cache_curr_token(cache);
   25060             :         (void)get_token();
   25061             :         if (curr_token == tok_semicolon || curr_token == tok_lbracket ||
   25062             :             curr_token == tok_lbrace || curr_token == tok_assign ||
   25063             :             curr_token == tok_colon) {
   25064             :           break;
   25065             :         } else if (curr_token == tok_lparen) {
   25066             :           cache_curr_token(cache);
   25067             :           (void)get_token();
   25068             :           if (curr_token == tok_rparen ||
   25069             :               is_decl_start(IDS_REAL_DECLARATOR_ALLOWED |
   25070             :                             IDS_MS_ATTRIB_NOT_ALLOWED) ||
   25071             :               curr_token == tok_ellipsis) {
   25072             :             /* Function declarator rather than a nested declarator. */
   25073             :             break;
   25074             :           }  /* if */
   25075             :         }  /* if */
   25076             :         result = TRUE;
   25077             :         goto done;
   25078             :       }  /* if */
   25079             :     } else if (is_declarator_start()) {
   25080             :       /* The start of a declarator.  Since we haven't seen a type name yet,
   25081             :          the potential context-sensitive keyword is presumably a type. */
   25082             :       break;
   25083             :     } else if (curr_token == tok_end_of_source ||
   25084             :                curr_token == tok_semicolon ||
   25085             :                curr_token == tok_lbrace || curr_token == tok_rbrace) {
   25086             :       /* We've scanned too far: The code contains a syntax error.  Assume a
   25087             :          context-sensitive keyword since collisions with user-declared
   25088             :          identifiers are presumably rare. */
   25089             :       expect_error();
   25090             :       result = TRUE;
   25091             :       goto done;
   25092             :     } else if ((!is_file_or_namespace_scope(&scope_stack_top()) &&
   25093             :                 (curr_token == tok_typedef || curr_token == tok_extern)) ||
   25094             :                curr_token == tok_friend || curr_token == tok_asm ||
   25095             :                curr_token == tok_explicit) {
   25096             :       /* These specifiers cannot appear in a declaration involving a
   25097             :          context-sensitive specifier and they are unlikely to accidentally
   25098             :          appear in a malformed declaration involving such a specifier: Don't
   25099             :          attempt to parse this assuming the identifier is a keyword. */
   25100             :       break;
   25101             :     } else if (curr_token == tok_declspec) {
   25102             :       /* A __declspec attribute: Cache the tokens until (but not including)
   25103             :          the closing right parenthesis. */
   25104             :       cache_curr_token(cache);
   25105             :       (void)get_token();
   25106             :       if (curr_token != tok_lparen ||
   25107             :           cache_token_stream_until_matching_token(cache, CTS_NO_OPTIONS)) {
   25108             :         /* A syntax error.  Assume a context-sensitive error. */
   25109             :         expect_error();
   25110             :         result = TRUE;
   25111             :         goto done;
   25112             :       } else {
   25113             :         /* The closing parenthesis will be cached below. */
   25114             :         check_assertion(curr_token == tok_rparen);
   25115             :       }  /* if */
   25116             :     } else {
   25117             :       /* Presumably another specifier token. */
   25118             :     }  /* if */
   25119             :     cache_curr_token(cache);
   25120             :     (void)get_token();
   25121             :   }  /* for */
   25122             : done:
   25123             :   return result;
   25124             : }  /* type_specifiers_next */
   25125             : 
   25126             : 
   25127             : static a_boolean identifier_starts_name_qualifier_or_template_id(void)
   25128             : /*
   25129             : The current token is an identifier that might be a C++/CLI context-sensitive
   25130             : declaration specifier (e.g., "delegate" or "property").  Return TRUE if it
   25131             : starts a name qualifier (i.e., it is a class, enum, or namespace name followed
   25132             : by a "::") or if it is followed by a "<" (which presumably means that it
   25133             : starts a template-id), but is not the special case for "generic <...".
   25134             : */
   25135             : {
   25136             :   a_boolean     result = FALSE;
   25137             :   a_token_kind  next_tok = next_token();
   25138             : 
   25139             :   if (next_tok == tok_colon_colon) {
   25140             :     /* "<identifier>::" Determine if this starts a qualified name.  We cannot
   25141             :        call is_generalized_identifier_start here because that would trigger
   25142             :        errors if the identifier doesn't name a tag or namespace.  Copy
   25143             :        locator_for_curr_id before performing the lookup to avoid biasing
   25144             :        future lookups. */
   25145             :     a_symbol_locator  loc;
   25146             :     a_symbol_ptr      sym;
   25147             :     loc = locator_for_curr_id;
   25148             :     sym = normal_id_lookup(&loc, IDL_MUST_BE_CLASS_OR_NAMESPACE);
   25149             :     if (sym == NULL) {
   25150             :       /* No valid qualifier was found. */
   25151             :     } else {
   25152             :       /* Not all potential name qualifiers are allowed here.  In particular,
   25153             :          even though C++/CLI generally accepts typedef names for fundamental
   25154             :          types as qualifiers, it doesn't recognize those in this context.
   25155             :          So for example:
   25156             :             typedef int delegate, I;
   25157             :             delegate ::I D();
   25158             :          does in fact define a delegate type. */
   25159             :       sym = fundamental_symbol_of(sym);
   25160             :       if (symbol_is(sym, sk_namespace)) {
   25161             :         result = TRUE;
   25162             :       } else if (is_class_symbol(sym)) {
   25163             :         result = TRUE;
   25164             :       }  /* if */
   25165             :     }  /* if */
   25166             :   } else if (is_start_of_generic_decl()) {
   25167             :     /* We have "generic < class" or "generic < typename".  This is the
   25168             :        start of a generic declaration. */
   25169             :   } else if (next_tok == tok_lt) {
   25170             :     result = TRUE;
   25171             :   }  /* if */
   25172             :   return result;
   25173             : }  /* identifier_starts_name_qualifier_or_template_id */
   25174             : 
   25175             : 
   25176             : a_boolean check_for_cli_delegate_definition(void)
   25177             : /*
   25178             : We're in a scope that allows a C++/CLI delegate definition and any prefix
   25179             : Microsoft attributes have been scanned.  Check if what follows looks like a
   25180             : delegate definition.  If it is, return TRUE; otherwise, return FALSE.
   25181             : */
   25182             : {
   25183             :   a_boolean      result = FALSE;
   25184             :   a_token_cache  cache;
   25185             : 
   25186             :   clear_token_cache(&cache, /*reusable=*/FALSE);
   25187             :   while (curr_token == tok_public || curr_token == tok_private) {
   25188             :     cache_curr_token(&cache);
   25189             :     (void)get_token();
   25190             :   }  /* if */
   25191             :   if (curr_token_is_identifier_string("delegate")) {
   25192             :     if (identifier_starts_name_qualifier_or_template_id()) {
   25193             :       /* "delegate" is part of qualified name or template-id and therefore not
   25194             :           a keyword. */
   25195             :     } else {
   25196             :       /* "delegate" is a simple unqualified name: Treat it as a keyword if a
   25197             :          type specifier follows. */
   25198             :       cache_curr_token(&cache);
   25199             :       (void)get_token();
   25200             :       result = type_specifiers_next(&cache);
   25201             :     }  /* if */
   25202             :   }  /* if */
   25203             :   rescan_cached_tokens(&cache);
   25204             :   return result;
   25205             : }  /* check_for_cli_delegate_definition */
   25206             : 
   25207             : 
   25208             : static void add_cli_system_base_class(a_class_def_state_ptr  class_state,
   25209             :                                       a_symbol_ptr           base_type_symbol)
   25210             : /*
   25211             : Add to the given C++/CLI class a base class of the type indicated by
   25212             : base_type_symbol (which is a System::... type).  The given class should have
   25213             : no other base classes.
   25214             : */
   25215             : {
   25216             :   a_type_ptr        type;
   25217             :   a_base_class_ptr  last_base = NULL;
   25218             :   a_boolean         may_be_first_direct_nonvirtual_base = TRUE;
   25219             : 
   25220             :   check_assertion(base_classes_of(class_state->class_type) == NULL);
   25221             :   check_assertion(base_type_symbol != NULL);
   25222             :   type = type_symbol_type(base_type_symbol);
   25223             :   check_assertion(type != NULL && is_class_struct_union_type(type));
   25224             :   add_direct_base_of_type(type, class_state, /*direct_base_number=*/1,
   25225             :                           &last_base, &may_be_first_direct_nonvirtual_base);
   25226             : }  /* add_cli_system_base_class */
   25227             : 
   25228             : 
   25229             : void scan_cli_delegate_definition(a_decl_parse_state  *dps,
   25230             :                                   a_symbol_locator    *loc,
   25231             :                                   a_func_info_block   *func_info)
   25232             : /*
   25233             : The caller has determined that the upcoming tokens look like a C++/CLI
   25234             : delegate definition.  Scan the specifiers and declarator of that definition
   25235             : and record the result in *dps, *loc, and *func_info (the caller should
   25236             : initialize *dps, but not *loc or *func_info).  The type recorded in dps->type
   25237             : is a function type or an error type (in which case a diagnostic is also
   25238             : issued).  This function must be called in namespace scope or in the scope
   25239             : of a managed class (possibly a generic class).
   25240             : */
   25241             : {
   25242             :   a_decl_pos_block         decl_pos_block;
   25243             :   a_decl_flag_set          dsi_flags = DSI_TYPE_SPECIFIER_ALLOWED |
   25244             :                                        DSI_NO_TAG_DEFINITION |
   25245             :                                        DSI_VACUOUS_TAG_DECL_ALLOWED;
   25246             :   a_decl_flag_set          di_flags = DI_REAL_DECLARATOR_ALLOWED;
   25247             :   a_scope_stack_entry_ptr  ssep = &scope_stack_top();
   25248             : 
   25249             :   clear_decl_pos_block(&decl_pos_block);
   25250             :   check_assertion(curr_token_is_identifier_string("delegate"));
   25251             :   if (scope_is(ssep, sck_template_declaration)) {
   25252             :     /* Skip the an enclosing template declaration scope.  If one is found,
   25253             :        indicate that in the dsi_flags. */
   25254             :     ssep = previous_scope_of(ssep);
   25255             :     dsi_flags |= DSI_IS_TEMPLATE_DECLARATION;
   25256             :   }  /* if */
   25257             :   if (scope_is(ssep, sck_class_struct_union)) {
   25258             :     a_type_ptr  parent_type = ssep->assoc_type;
   25259             :     if (!is_immediate_managed_class_type(parent_type)) {
   25260             :       pos_error(ec_delegate_requires_managed_class, &pos_curr_token);
   25261             :     } else if (cppcx_enabled &&
   25262             :                is_cppcx_externally_visible_assembly_access(
   25263             :                                              ssep->current_assembly_access)) {
   25264             :       pos_error(ec_cppcx_public_nested_delegate, &pos_curr_token);
   25265             :     }  /* if */
   25266             :     dsi_flags |= DSI_IS_MEMBER_DECLARATION;
   25267             :   }  /* if */
   25268             :   /* Record that we are scanning a delegate definition. */
   25269             :   check_assertion(!ssep->scanning_cli_delegate_definition);
   25270             :   ssep->scanning_cli_delegate_definition = TRUE;
   25271             :   /* Skip over the "delegate" token. */
   25272             :   (void)get_token();
   25273             :   decl_specifiers(dsi_flags, dps, &decl_pos_block);
   25274             :   clear_func_info(func_info);
   25275             :   declarator(di_flags, dps, /*member_parent_type=*/(a_type_ptr)NULL, loc,
   25276             :              func_info, &decl_pos_block);
   25277             :   /* Record that we are no longer scanning a delegate definition. */
   25278             :   ssep->scanning_cli_delegate_definition = FALSE;
   25279             :   if (is_template_dependent_context() &&
   25280             :       !is_cli_generic_definition_context()) {
   25281             :     /* Type checks are unreliable: Delay them until a real instantiation.
   25282             :        E.g. "template<class T> ref struct S { delegate T D; };". */
   25283             :   } else if (!is_function_type(dps->type)) {
   25284             :     if (is_error_type(dps->type)) {
   25285             :       expect_error();
   25286             :     } else {
   25287             :       pos_ty_error(ec_invalid_delegate_type, &dps->declarator_pos, dps->type);
   25288             :       dps->type = error_type();
   25289             :     }  /* if */
   25290             :   }  /* if */
   25291             : }  /* scan_cli_delegate_definition */
   25292             : 
   25293             : 
   25294             : void create_cli_delegate_class_definition(a_type_ptr          class_type,
   25295             :                                           a_scope_depth       decl_level,
   25296             :                                           a_decl_parse_state  *dps,
   25297             :                                           a_func_info_block   *func_info)
   25298             : /*
   25299             : class_type is an incomplete delegate class (i.e., a ref class) that is
   25300             : declared at the given scope stack depth.  dps and func_info describe the
   25301             : declared properties of the corresponding delegate definition (i.e., the
   25302             : entities produced by the call to scan_cli_delegate_definition).  Create the
   25303             : definition of the class by deriving it from System::MulticastDelegate and
   25304             : adding the appropriate member functions (including the Invoke member with a
   25305             : signature that matches that of the delegate definition).
   25306             : */
   25307             : {
   25308             :   a_class_def_state            class_state;
   25309             :   a_member_decl_info           member_info;
   25310             :   a_decl_parse_state           *mdps = &member_info.decl_state;
   25311             :   a_symbol_locator             member_loc;
   25312             :   a_class_type_supplement_ptr  ctsp = class_type_supp(class_type);
   25313             :   a_type_ptr                   htype = make_handle_type(class_type);
   25314             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
   25315             :   a_boolean                    saved_source_sequence_entries_disallowed;
   25316             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
   25317             : 
   25318             :   /* Start the class definition (and associated class scope). */
   25319             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
   25320             :   class_type->autonomous_primary_tag_decl = TRUE;
   25321             :   /* Don't issue source sequence entries for generated entities. */
   25322             :   saved_source_sequence_entries_disallowed =
   25323             :                                             source_sequence_entries_disallowed;
   25324             :   scope_stack_top().source_sequence_entries_disallowed = TRUE;
   25325             :   source_sequence_entries_disallowed = TRUE;
   25326             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
   25327             :   initialize_class_def_state(class_type, &class_state);
   25328             :   /* Add System::MulticastDelegate (or Platform::Delegate in C++/CX mode)
   25329             :      as a base class. */
   25330             :   add_cli_system_base_class(
   25331             :          &class_state, cli_symbol_from_kind(cppcx_enabled ?
   25332             :                                               csk_system_delegate :
   25333             :                                               csk_system_multicast_delegate));
   25334             :   wrapup_base_classes(&class_state);
   25335             :   class_state.access = (an_access_specifier)as_public;
   25336             :   ctsp->assoc_scope =
   25337             :              push_scope((a_scope_kind)sck_class_struct_union, NO_SCOPE_NUMBER,
   25338             :                         class_type, (a_routine_ptr)NULL);
   25339             :   scope_stack_top().class_def_state = &class_state;
   25340             :   if (!is_error_type(dps->type)) {
   25341             :     /* Add the Invoke member (declaration only). */
   25342             :     clear_locator(&member_loc, &dps->declarator_pos);
   25343             :     (void)find_symbol("Invoke", sizeof("Invoke")-1, &member_loc);
   25344             :     initialize_member_decl_info(&member_info, &dps->specifiers_pos);
   25345             :     mdps->declared_type = dps->declared_type;
   25346             :     /* The type of Invoke is the declared type of the delegate with the
   25347             :        addition of a type for "this" (i.e., a nonstatic member function
   25348             :        type). */
   25349             :     if (is_function_type(dps->type)) {
   25350             :       mdps->type = copy_routine_type_with_param_types(
   25351             :                                                  skip_typerefs(dps->type),
   25352             :                                                  /*copy_default_args=*/FALSE);
   25353             :       check_assertion(mdps->type->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_routine);
   25354             :       mdps->type->variant.routine.extra_info->this_class = class_type;
   25355             :       ensure_underlying_function_type_is_modifiable(&dps->type,
   25356             :                                                     &ctsp->invocation_type);
   25357             :       if (cppcli_enabled) {
   25358             :         ctsp->invocation_type->variant.routine.extra_info
   25359             :                              ->calling_convention =
   25360             :                                              (a_calling_convention)cc_clrcall;
   25361             :       }  /* if */
   25362             :       decl_member_function(&member_loc, func_info, &class_state, &member_info,
   25363             :                            /*compiler_generated=*/TRUE);
   25364             :     } else {
   25365             :       /* Presumably a template parameter type or an error type. */
   25366             :       mdps->type = dps->type;
   25367             :       ctsp->invocation_type = dps->type;
   25368             :     }  /* if */
   25369             :     if (cppcli_enabled && is_function_type(dps->type)) {
   25370             :       /* Add the BeginInvoke member (declaration only) in the C++/CLI case. */
   25371             :       clear_locator(&member_loc, &dps->declarator_pos);
   25372             :       (void)find_symbol("BeginInvoke", sizeof("BeginInvoke")-1, &member_loc);
   25373             :       initialize_member_decl_info(&member_info, &dps->specifiers_pos);
   25374             :       mdps->type = copy_routine_type_with_param_types(
   25375             :                                                  skip_typerefs(dps->type),
   25376             :                                                  /*copy_default_args=*/FALSE);
   25377             :       mdps->type->variant.routine.return_type =
   25378             :                make_handle_type(cli_class_type_for(csk_system_iasync_result));
   25379             :       (void)add_param_type(mdps->type,
   25380             :                            make_handle_type(
   25381             :                               cli_class_type_for(csk_system_async_callback)));
   25382             :       (void)add_param_type(mdps->type,
   25383             :                            make_handle_type(
   25384             :                                       cli_class_type_for(csk_system_object)));
   25385             :       mdps->type->variant.routine.extra_info->this_class = class_type;
   25386             :       mdps->declared_type = mdps->type;
   25387             :       decl_member_function(&member_loc, func_info, &class_state, &member_info,
   25388             :                            /*compiler_generated=*/TRUE);
   25389             :       /* Add the EndInvoke member (declaration only). */
   25390             :       clear_locator(&member_loc, &dps->declarator_pos);
   25391             :       (void)find_symbol("EndInvoke", sizeof("EndInvoke")-1, &member_loc);
   25392             :       initialize_member_decl_info(&member_info, &dps->specifiers_pos);
   25393             :       mdps->type = make_routine_type(
   25394             :                         skip_typerefs(dps->type)->variant.routine.return_type,
   25395             :                         make_handle_type(
   25396             :                                 cli_class_type_for(csk_system_iasync_result)),
   25397             :                         /*param2_type=*/NULL, /*param3_type=*/NULL,
   25398             :                         /*param4_type=*/NULL);
   25399             :       mdps->type->variant.routine.extra_info->this_class = class_type;
   25400             :       mdps->declared_type = mdps->type;
   25401             :       decl_member_function(&member_loc, func_info, &class_state, &member_info,
   25402             :                            /*compiler_generated=*/TRUE);
   25403             :     } else {
   25404             :       /* Presumably a template parameter type or an error type.  Don't
   25405             :          generate BeginInvoke and EndInvoke in that case. */
   25406             :     }  /* if */
   25407             :   } else {
   25408             :     /* Some error occurred: Don't treat the class type as a delegate type in
   25409             :        what follows. */
   25410             :     expect_error();
   25411             :     class_type->variant.class_struct_union.is_delegate_class = FALSE;
   25412             :   }  /* if */
   25413             :   /* Add the one-argument constructor (declaration only). */
   25414             :   make_locator_for_symbol(symbol_for(class_type), &member_loc);
   25415             :   change_class_locator_into_constructor_locator(&member_loc,
   25416             :                                                 &dps->declarator_pos,
   25417             :                                                 /*is_static_ctor=*/FALSE);
   25418             :   initialize_member_decl_info(&member_info, &dps->specifiers_pos);
   25419             :   member_info.is_constructor = TRUE;
   25420             :   mdps->declared_type = mdps->type =
   25421             :                   make_routine_type(void_type(), make_pointer_type(dps->type),
   25422             :                                     /*param2_type=*/(a_type_ptr)NULL,
   25423             :                                     /*param3_type=*/(a_type_ptr)NULL,
   25424             :                                     /*param4_type=*/(a_type_ptr)NULL);
   25425             :   decl_member_function(&member_loc, func_info, &class_state, &member_info,
   25426             :                        /*compiler_generated=*/TRUE);
   25427             :   /* Add static operators "+" and "-" (again, declarations only). */
   25428             :   /* C++/CX does not support multicast delegates, so do not generate the
   25429             :      "+" and "-" operators in that case. */
   25430             :   if (cppcli_enabled) {
   25431             :     make_opname_locator((an_opname_kind)onk_plus, &member_loc,
   25432             :                         &dps->declarator_pos);
   25433             :     initialize_member_decl_info(&member_info, &dps->specifiers_pos);
   25434             :     mdps->storage_class = mdps->declared_storage_class =
   25435             :                                                    (a_storage_class)sc_static;
   25436             :     mdps->declared_type = mdps->type =
   25437             :                           make_routine_type(htype, htype, htype,
   25438             :                                             /*param3_type=*/(a_type_ptr)NULL,
   25439             :                                             /*param4_type=*/(a_type_ptr)NULL);
   25440             :     decl_member_function(&member_loc, func_info, &class_state, &member_info,
   25441             :                          /*compiler_generated=*/TRUE);
   25442             :     make_opname_locator((an_opname_kind)onk_minus, &member_loc,
   25443             :                         &dps->declarator_pos);
   25444             :     initialize_member_decl_info(&member_info, &dps->specifiers_pos);
   25445             :     mdps->storage_class = mdps->declared_storage_class =
   25446             :                                                    (a_storage_class)sc_static;
   25447             :     mdps->declared_type = mdps->type =
   25448             :                           make_routine_type(htype, htype, htype,
   25449             :                                             /*param3_type=*/(a_type_ptr)NULL,
   25450             :                                             /*param4_type=*/(a_type_ptr)NULL);
   25451             :     decl_member_function(&member_loc, func_info, &class_state, &member_info,
   25452             :                          /*compiler_generated=*/TRUE);
   25453             :   } /* if */
   25454             :   /* Wrap up the definition. */
   25455             :   complete_class_definition(class_type, decl_level, &class_state);
   25456             :   pop_scope();
   25457             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
   25458             :   /* Restore the previous state wrt. generating source sequence entries. */
   25459             :   source_sequence_entries_disallowed =
   25460             :                                      saved_source_sequence_entries_disallowed;
   25461             :   scope_stack_top().source_sequence_entries_disallowed 
   25462             :                                     = saved_source_sequence_entries_disallowed;
   25463             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
   25464             : }  /* create_cli_delegate_class_definition */
   25465             : 
   25466             : 
   25467             : void scan_and_record_cli_delegate_definition(a_decl_parse_state  *dps,
   25468             :                                              a_type_ptr          class_type)
   25469             : /*
   25470             : The caller has determined that the upcoming tokens look like a C++/CLI
   25471             : delegate definition (e.g., by calling check_for_cli_delegate_definition).
   25472             : Scan the definition and record it in the IL (as a special-purpose class type).
   25473             : 
   25474             : This routine is sometimes called to load the definition of a delegate class
   25475             : whose declaration was already loaded: class_type represents the corresponding
   25476             : (still incomplete) class type in such cases (otherwise, class_type is NULL).
   25477             : */
   25478             : {
   25479             :   an_assembly_visibility       visibility;
   25480             :   a_source_position            visibility_pos;
   25481             :   a_symbol_locator             loc;
   25482             :   a_symbol_ptr                 prev_decl = NULL;
   25483             :   a_func_info_block            func_info;
   25484             :   a_class_type_supplement_ptr  ctsp;
   25485             :   a_scope_depth                decl_level = depth_scope_stack;
   25486             : 
   25487             :   visibility = scan_cli_visibility_specifier_if_any(&visibility_pos);
   25488             :   scan_cli_delegate_definition(dps, &loc, &func_info);
   25489             :   if (class_type != NULL) {
   25490             :     /* An imported delegate type. */
   25491             :     prev_decl = symbol_for(class_type);
   25492             :   } else {
   25493             :     /* A regular declaration of a delegate type: Look for a prior
   25494             :        declaration. */
   25495             :     prev_decl = curr_scope_id_lookup(&loc, IDL_MUST_BE_TAG);
   25496             :   }  /* if */
   25497             :   if (prev_decl != NULL) {
   25498             :     /* If a delegate is generated from an assembly (metadata) file, it was
   25499             :        previously loaded as an incomplete ref class.  Only in this case is a
   25500             :        "redeclaration" allowed. */
   25501             :     class_type = type_symbol_type(prev_decl);
   25502             :     if (class_is_from_metadata(class_type)) {
   25503             :       /* The delegate was loaded from an assembly file. */
   25504             :       a_boolean      is_local = FALSE;
   25505             :       decl_level = scope_depth_of_symbol(prev_decl, &is_local);
   25506             :       check_assertion(!is_local);
   25507             :       dps->sym = prev_decl;
   25508             :     } else {
   25509             :       /* A redeclaration of a user-declared delegate: Ignore the previous
   25510             :          declaration, which will trigger an error later on. */
   25511             :       prev_decl = NULL;
   25512             :       class_type = NULL;
   25513             :       expect_error();
   25514             :     }  /* if */
   25515             :   }  /* if */
   25516             :   if (prev_decl == NULL) {
   25517             :     /* Create the delegate class type (a sealed ref class). */
   25518             :     class_type = alloc_type((a_type_kind)tk_struct);
   25519             :   }  /* if */
   25520             :   ctsp = class_type_supp(class_type);
   25521             :   ctsp->cli_class_type_kind = (a_cli_class_type_kind)cctk_ref;
   25522             :   ctsp->is_hide_by_sig = TRUE;
   25523             :   class_type->variant.class_struct_union.is_delegate_class = TRUE;
   25524             :   class_type->variant.class_struct_union.final = TRUE;
   25525             :   if (prev_decl == NULL) {
   25526             :     /* Associate a symbol with the new type created above and record
   25527             :        membership information. */
   25528             :     dps->sym = enter_local_symbol((a_symbol_kind)sk_class_or_struct_tag, &loc,
   25529             :                                   decl_level, /*suppress_redecl_error=*/FALSE);
   25530             :     dps->sym->variant.class_struct_union.type = class_type;
   25531             :     set_source_corresp(&(class_type->source_corresp), dps->sym);
   25532             :     update_membership_of_class(dps->sym, /*def_or_vacuous_decl=*/TRUE,
   25533             :                                /*is_event_interface=*/FALSE, decl_level,
   25534             :                                &dps->start_pos);
   25535             :     add_to_types_list(class_type, decl_level);
   25536             :   }  /* if */
   25537             :   record_symbol_declaration(SRK_DECLARATION | SRK_DEFINITION, dps->sym,
   25538             :                             &loc.source_position, dps->source_sequence_entry);
   25539             :   set_cli_visibility(class_type, visibility, &visibility_pos,
   25540             :                      /*is_definition=*/TRUE);
   25541             :   if (cppcx_enabled) {
   25542             :     error_if_cppcx_public_global_type(class_type, &visibility_pos);
   25543             :   }  /* if */
   25544             :   if (dps->ms_attributes != NULL && prev_decl == NULL) {
   25545             :     /* Apply the specified attributes. */
   25546             :     apply_microsoft_attributes_to_type(&dps->ms_attributes, class_type);
   25547             :   }  /* if */
   25548             :   /* Create the definition of the delegate class type. */
   25549             :   create_cli_delegate_class_definition(class_type, decl_level, dps,
   25550             :                                        &func_info);
   25551             : }  /* scan_and_record_cli_delegate_definition */
   25552             : 
   25553             : 
   25554             : void scan_cli_delegate_definition_from_assembly_import(a_type_ptr  class_type)
   25555             : /*
   25556             : Scan a delegate definition generated from assembly metadata.  The type of the
   25557             : delegate is given by class_type.  (Delegates from assemblies are first loaded
   25558             : as incomplete ref class declarations that can later be completed via a call to
   25559             : this function.  The caller has already ensured that the token stream contains
   25560             : a delegate definition corresponding to the assembly file.)
   25561             : */
   25562             : {
   25563             :   a_decl_parse_state  dps;
   25564             : 
   25565             :   init_decl_parse_state(&dps);
   25566             :   if (microsoft_attribute_tokens_next()) {
   25567             :     dps.ms_attributes = scan_microsoft_attributes(/*is_param_or_base=*/FALSE);
   25568             :   }  /* if */
   25569             :   scan_and_record_cli_delegate_definition(&dps, class_type);
   25570             : }  /* scan_cli_delegate_definition_from_assembly_import */
   25571             : 
   25572             : 
   25573             : static a_boolean check_for_event_interface_declaration(void)
   25574             : /*
   25575             : Returns TRUE if the next two tokens are "__event" and "__interface", indicating
   25576             : a COM event interface.  Note that these two tokens must be sequential
   25577             : (though they're not treated as a single keyword).
   25578             : */
   25579             : {
   25580             :   return curr_token == tok_event && next_token() == tok_interface;
   25581             : }  /* check_for_event_interface_declaration */
