   25582             : 
   25583             : 
   25584             : static a_boolean check_for_cli_field_modifier(a_decl_parse_state  *dps)
   25585             : /*
   25586             : This function must be called at the beginning of a class member declaration
   25587             : in C++/CLI mode and returns TRUE if the following tokens appear to form a
   25588             : C++/CLI property or event declaration, an initonly field declaration, or a
   25589             : literal field declaration.  Otherwise, FALSE is returned.  If TRUE is
   25590             : returned, flags in *dps are set to reflect which kind of declaration was
   25591             : encountered (i.e., which kind of context-sensitive keyword appeared:
   25592             : "property", "event", "initonly", or "literal").
   25593             : */
   25594             : {
   25595             :   a_boolean      result = FALSE, property_or_event_only = FALSE;
   25596             :   a_token_cache  cache;
   25597             : 
   25598             :   clear_token_cache(&cache, /*reusable=*/FALSE);
   25599             :   while (curr_token == tok_static || curr_token == tok_virtual) {
   25600             :     if (curr_token == tok_virtual) {
   25601             :       /* "initonly" and "literal" cannot be combined with "virtual". */
   25602             :       property_or_event_only = TRUE;
   25603             :     }  /* if */
   25604             :     cache_curr_token(&cache);
   25605             :     (void)get_token();
   25606             :   }  /* if */
   25607             :   if (curr_token != tok_identifier) {
   25608             :     /* Not an identifier and hence not a context-sensitive keyword. */
   25609             :     goto done;
   25610             :   } else {
   25611             :     a_symbol_header_ptr  sym_hdr = locator_for_curr_id.symbol_header;
   25612             :     if (symbol_header_is_for_identifier_string(sym_hdr, "property")) {
   25613             :       dps->has_cli_property_keyword = TRUE;
   25614             :     } else if (symbol_header_is_for_identifier_string(sym_hdr, "event")) {
   25615             :       dps->has_cli_event_keyword = TRUE;
   25616             :     } else if (property_or_event_only) {
   25617             :       /* We already ruled out identifiers not spelled "property" or "event". */
   25618             :       goto done;
   25619             :     } else if (symbol_header_is_for_identifier_string(sym_hdr, "initonly")) {
   25620             :       dps->has_cli_initonly_keyword = TRUE;
   25621             :     } else if (symbol_header_is_for_identifier_string(sym_hdr, "literal")) {
   25622             :       dps->has_cli_literal_keyword = TRUE;
   25623             :     } else {
   25624             :       /* Not one of the identifiers used for context-sensitive keywords. */
   25625             :       goto done;
   25626             :     }  /* if */
   25627             :     if (identifier_starts_name_qualifier_or_template_id()) {
   25628             :       /* The identifier is part of qualified name or template-id and can
   25629             :          therefore not be a keyword. */
   25630             :       goto done;
   25631             :     }  /* if */
   25632             :   }  /* if */
   25633             :   /* Cache the identifier (which now appears likely to be a context-sensitive
   25634             :      specifier keyword). */
   25635             :   cache_curr_token(&cache);
   25636             :   (void)get_token();
   25637             :   /* For this to be a field-like declaration preceded by a context-sensitive
   25638             :      keyword, a sequence of decl-specifiers including a type must follow. */
   25639             :   if (type_specifiers_next(&cache)) {
   25640             :     result = TRUE;
   25641             :     dps->has_cli_context_sensitive_keyword = TRUE;
   25642             :   } else {
   25643             :     dps->has_cli_property_keyword = FALSE;
   25644             :     dps->has_cli_initonly_keyword = FALSE;
   25645             :     dps->has_cli_literal_keyword = FALSE;
   25646             :   }  /* if */
   25647             : done:
   25648             :   rescan_cached_tokens(&cache);
   25649             :   return result;
   25650             : }  /* check_for_cli_field_modifier */
   25651             : 
   25652             : 
   25653             : static void generate_trivial_accessor(a_class_def_state  *class_state,
   25654             :                                       a_type_ptr         type,
   25655             :                                       a_const_char       *name)
   25656             : /*
   25657             : Declare an accessor function with the given name and type for a trivial
   25658             : property or event being defined in the class described by class_state (the
   25659             : property or event is described by class_state->property_or_event_descr).
   25660             : The given type is an unshared routine type that does not include a "this"
   25661             : parameter: This function adds that parameter if the accessor is nonstatic.
   25662             : */
   25663             : {
   25664             :   a_property_or_event_descr_ptr
   25665             :                       pdp = class_state->property_or_event_descr;
   25666             :   a_symbol_locator    member_loc;
   25667             :   a_func_info_block   func_info;
   25668             :   a_member_decl_info  member_info;
   25669             :   a_decl_parse_state  *mdps = &member_info.decl_state;
   25670             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
   25671             :   a_boolean           saved_source_sequence_entries_disallowed;
   25672             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
   25673             : 
   25674             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
   25675             :   /* Don't issue source sequence entries for generated entities. */
   25676             :   saved_source_sequence_entries_disallowed =
   25677             :                                             source_sequence_entries_disallowed;
   25678             :   scope_stack_top().source_sequence_entries_disallowed = TRUE;
   25679             :   source_sequence_entries_disallowed = TRUE;
   25680             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
   25681             :   clear_locator(&member_loc, &pos_curr_token);
   25682             :   (void)find_symbol(name, strlen(name), &member_loc);
   25683             :   member_loc.is_property_or_event_accessor = TRUE;
   25684             :   initialize_member_decl_info(&member_info, &pos_curr_token);;
   25685             :   clear_func_info(&func_info);
   25686             :   if (pdp->is_static) {
   25687             :     /* The accessor is a static member function. */
   25688             :     mdps->storage_class = mdps->declared_storage_class =
   25689             :                                                    (a_storage_class)sc_static;
   25690             :     member_loc.property_or_event_parent = symbol_for(pdp->variant.variable);
   25691             :   } else {
   25692             :     /* The accessor is a nonstatic, possibly virtual, member function. */
   25693             :     if (pdp->is_virtual) mdps->dso_flags |= DSO_VIRTUAL;
   25694             :     member_loc.property_or_event_parent = symbol_for(pdp->variant.field);
   25695             :   }  /* if */
   25696             :   check_assertion(type->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_routine);
   25697             :   if (!pdp->is_static) {
   25698             :     /* The accessor must have a "this" parameter. */
   25699             :     type->variant.routine.extra_info->this_class = class_state->class_type;
   25700             :   }  /* if */
   25701             :   mdps->type = mdps->declared_type = type;
   25702             :   decl_member_function(&member_loc, &func_info, class_state, &member_info,
   25703             :                        /*compiler_generated=*/TRUE);
   25704             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
   25705             :   /* Restore the previous state wrt. generating source sequence entries. */
   25706             :   source_sequence_entries_disallowed =
   25707             :                                      saved_source_sequence_entries_disallowed;
   25708             :   scope_stack_top().source_sequence_entries_disallowed 
   25709             :                                     = saved_source_sequence_entries_disallowed;
   25710             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
   25711             : }  /* generate_trivial_accessor */
   25712             : 
   25713             : 
   25714             : static void record_trivial_property_accessors(a_class_def_state  *class_state)
   25715             : /*
   25716             : Generate "get" and "set" accessor declarations (but not definitions) for the
   25717             : trivial property described by class_state->property_or_event_descr.
   25718             : */
   25719             : {
   25720             :   a_property_or_event_descr_ptr
   25721             :                       pdp = class_state->property_or_event_descr;
   25722             :   a_type_ptr          prop_type, get_type, set_type;
   25723             : 
   25724             :   check_assertion(pdp != NULL);
   25725             :   if (pdp->is_static) {
   25726             :     prop_type = pdp->variant.variable->type;
   25727             :   } else {
   25728             :     prop_type = pdp->variant.field->type;
   25729             :   }  /* if */
   25730             :   get_type = make_routine_type(prop_type, /*param1_type=*/(a_type_ptr)NULL,
   25731             :                                           /*param2_type=*/(a_type_ptr)NULL,
   25732             :                                           /*param3_type=*/(a_type_ptr)NULL,
   25733             :                                           /*param4_type=*/(a_type_ptr)NULL);
   25734             :   generate_trivial_accessor(class_state, get_type, "get");
   25735             :   if (cppcx_enabled &&
   25736             :       is_handle_to_nonconst_cppcx_plain_array_type(prop_type) &&
   25737             :       is_cppcx_externally_visible_assembly_access(
   25738             :                                               class_state->assembly_access)) {
   25739             :     /* The property is of type "Platform::Array<T>^".  For externally-visible
   25740             :        setters, the parameter type must be "const Platform::Array<T>^". */
   25741             :     a_type_ptr const_array_prop_type = NULL;
   25742             :     const_array_prop_type = make_handle_type(make_qualified_type(
   25743             :                                                    type_pointed_to(prop_type),
   25744             :                                                    TQ_CONST));
   25745             :     set_type = make_routine_type(void_type(), const_array_prop_type,
   25746             :                                  /*param2_type=*/(a_type_ptr)NULL,
   25747             :                                  /*param3_type=*/(a_type_ptr)NULL,
   25748             :                                  /*param4_type=*/(a_type_ptr)NULL);
   25749             :   } else {
   25750             :    set_type = make_routine_type(void_type(), prop_type,
   25751             :                                 /*param2_type=*/(a_type_ptr)NULL,
   25752             :                                 /*param3_type=*/(a_type_ptr)NULL,
   25753             :                                 /*param4_type=*/(a_type_ptr)NULL);
   25754             :   }  /* if */
   25755             :   generate_trivial_accessor(class_state, set_type, "set");
   25756             : }  /* record_trivial_property_accessors */
   25757             : 
   25758             : 
   25759             : static void record_trivial_event_accessors(a_class_def_state  *class_state)
   25760             : /*
   25761             : Generate "add", "remove", and "raise" accessor declarations (but not
   25762             : definitions) for the trivial event described by
   25763             : class_state->property_or_event_descr.
   25764             : */
   25765             : {
   25766             :   a_property_or_event_descr_ptr
   25767             :                       pdp = class_state->property_or_event_descr;
   25768             :   a_type_ptr          event_type, add_type, remove_type, raise_type;
   25769             :   check_assertion(pdp != NULL);
   25770             :   if (pdp->is_static) {
   25771             :     event_type = pdp->variant.variable->type;
   25772             :   } else {
   25773             :     event_type = pdp->variant.field->type;
   25774             :   }  /* if */
   25775             :   if (cppcx_enabled) {
   25776             :     a_type_ptr event_registration_token_type = cli_class_type_for(
   25777             :                              csk_windows_foundation_event_registration_token);
   25778             :     add_type = make_routine_type(event_registration_token_type,
   25779             :                                  event_type,
   25780             :                                  /*param2_type=*/(a_type_ptr)NULL,
   25781             :                                  /*param3_type=*/(a_type_ptr)NULL,
   25782             :                                  /*param4_type=*/(a_type_ptr)NULL);
   25783             :   } else {
   25784             :     add_type = make_routine_type(void_type(), event_type,
   25785             :                                  /*param2_type=*/(a_type_ptr)NULL,
   25786             :                                  /*param3_type=*/(a_type_ptr)NULL,
   25787             :                                  /*param4_type=*/(a_type_ptr)NULL);
   25788             :   }  /* if */
   25789             :   generate_trivial_accessor(class_state, add_type, "add");
   25790             :   if (cppcx_enabled) {
   25791             :     a_type_ptr event_registration_token_type = cli_class_type_for(
   25792             :                              csk_windows_foundation_event_registration_token);
   25793             :     remove_type = make_routine_type(void_type(),
   25794             :                                     event_registration_token_type,
   25795             :                                     /*param2_type=*/(a_type_ptr)NULL,
   25796             :                                     /*param3_type=*/(a_type_ptr)NULL,
   25797             :                                     /*param4_type=*/(a_type_ptr)NULL);
   25798             :   } else {
   25799             :     remove_type = add_type;
   25800             :   }  /* if */
   25801             :   generate_trivial_accessor(class_state, remove_type, "remove");
   25802             :   /* Declare the event's "raise" accessor: It is always protected (ECMA says
   25803             :      it is private, but Microsoft compilers make it protected).  Do not
   25804             :      declare it in interface types since interfaces cannot have non-public
   25805             :      members. */
   25806             :   if (is_template_dependent_type(event_type)) {
   25807             :     /* During prototype instantiations, we cannot always know the invocation
   25808             :        type if the event type is template-dependent.  Do not create the "raise"
   25809             :        member in that case. */
   25810             :   } else if (!is_handle_type(event_type)) {
   25811             :     expect_error();
   25812             :   } else {
   25813             :     a_type_ptr  delegate_type = type_pointed_to(event_type);
   25814             :     if (!is_delegate_type(delegate_type)) {
   25815             :       expect_error();
   25816             :     } else if (is_immediate_cli_interface_type(class_state->class_type)) {
   25817             :       /* No "raise" accessor is generated for trivial events in interfaces. */
   25818             :     } else {
   25819             :       an_access_specifier  saved_access = class_state->access;
   25820             :       class_state->access = (an_access_specifier)as_protected;
   25821             :       raise_type = copy_routine_type_with_param_types(
   25822             :                                       delegate_invocation_type(delegate_type),
   25823             :                                       /*copy_default_args=*/FALSE);
   25824             :       raise_type->variant.routine.extra_info->this_class = NULL;
   25825             :       generate_trivial_accessor(class_state, raise_type, "raise");
   25826             :       class_state->access = saved_access;
   25827             :     }  /* if */
   25828             :   }  /* if */
   25829             : }  /* record_trivial_event_accessors */
   25830             : 
   25831             : 
   25832             : static void scan_cli_property_indices(a_property_or_event_descr_ptr  pdp)
   25833             : /*
   25834             : Scan a list of C++/CLI property index types and record them in the pdp->indices
   25835             : list.
   25836             : */
   25837             : {
   25838             :   /* Skip over the left bracket. */
   25839             :   check_assertion(curr_token == tok_lbracket);
   25840             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
   25841             :   pdp->indices_range.start = pos_curr_token;
   25842             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
   25843             :   (void)get_token();
   25844             :   if (curr_token == tok_rbracket) {
   25845             :     pos_error(ec_empty_property_indices, &pos_curr_token);
   25846             :   } else {
   25847             :     /* Scan the list of types. */
   25848             :     a_property_index_type_ptr  *p_pitp = &pdp->indices;
   25849             :     add_stop_token(tok_rbracket);
   25850             :     do {
   25851             :       add_stop_token(tok_comma);
   25852             :       *p_pitp = alloc_property_index_type();
   25853             :       (*p_pitp)->position = pos_curr_token;
   25854             :       type_name(&(*p_pitp)->type);
   25855             :       if (is_void_type((*p_pitp)->type)) {
   25856             :         pos_error(ec_void_property_index_type, &(*p_pitp)->position);
   25857             :         (*p_pitp)->type = error_type();
   25858             :       }  /* if */
   25859             :       p_pitp = &(*p_pitp)->next;
   25860             :       remove_stop_token(tok_comma);
   25861             :     } while (loop_token(tok_comma));
   25862             :     remove_stop_token(tok_rbracket);
   25863             :   }  /* if */
   25864             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
   25865             :   pdp->indices_range.end = end_pos_curr_token;
   25866             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
   25867             :   (void)required_token(tok_rbracket, ec_exp_rbracket);
   25868             : }  /* scan_cli_property_indices */
   25869             : 
   25870             : 
   25871             : static void decl_property_or_event_member(
   25872             :                                       a_class_def_state          *class_state,
   25873             :                                       a_property_or_event_descr  *pdp)
   25874             : /*
   25875             : class_state and pdp describe a property or event declaration.  Create the
   25876             : associated field or static data member as appropriate.  For trivial properties
   25877             : and events, this is done as soon as the "head" of the property/event
   25878             : declaration is parsed.  For nontrivial properties and events, this is delayed
   25879             : until the storage specifier of the first accessor has been seen, because that
   25880             : storage specifier may affect whether the property/event is static or not.
   25881             : */
   25882             : {
   25883             :   a_member_decl_info_ptr  decl_info = class_state->pe_info;
   25884             :   a_decl_parse_state      *dps = &decl_info->decl_state;
   25885             :   a_pending_pragma_ptr    new_pragmas;
   25886             : 
   25887             :   /* Since the property or event "head" was scanned, we may have encountered
   25888             :      new pragmas: Temporarily set them aside and restore any pragmas that were
   25889             :      saved for the property/event declaration. */
   25890             :   new_pragmas = scope_stack_top().curr_construct_pragmas;
   25891             :   scope_stack_top().curr_construct_pragmas = decl_info->suspended_pragmas;
   25892             :   decl_info->suspended_pragmas = NULL;
   25893             :   if (pdp->is_static) {
   25894             :     decl_static_data_member(class_state->pe_loc, class_state,
   25895             :                             (a_tmpl_decl_state_ptr)NULL,
   25896             :                             decl_info);
   25897             :     check_assertion(dps->sym != NULL &&
   25898             :                     dps->sym->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_static_data_member);
   25899             :     pdp->variant.variable = dps->sym->variant.static_data_member.variable;
   25900             :   } else {
   25901             :     a_scope_depth effective_decl_level;
   25902             :     effective_decl_level = class_type_supp(class_state->class_type)
   25903             :                                          ->assoc_scope->depth_in_scope_stack;
   25904             :     check_assertion(effective_decl_level != NO_SCOPE_DEPTH);
   25905             :     pdp->variant.field = decl_nonstatic_data_member(class_state->pe_loc,
   25906             :                                                     class_state, decl_info,
   25907             :                                                     effective_decl_level);
   25908             :   }  /* if */
   25909             :   if (dps->ms_attributes != NULL) {
   25910             :     dispose_of_unapplied_attributes(&dps->ms_attributes,
   25911             :                                     ec_ms_attr_not_allowed);
   25912             :   }  /* if */
   25913             :   run_end_of_parse_actions(dps, /*more_declarators=*/FALSE);
   25914             :   scope_stack_top().curr_construct_pragmas = new_pragmas;
   25915             : }  /* decl_property_or_event_member */
   25916             : 
   25917             : 
   25918             : static void scan_cli_property_or_event_head(a_class_def_state   *class_state,
   25919             :                                             a_member_decl_info  *decl_info)
   25920             : /*
   25921             : A C++/CLI property or event declaration is next.  Scan its "head", which has
   25922             : the following syntax:
   25923             :    property-or-event-modifier(opt) property type-specifier-seq declarator
   25924             :      property-indices(opt) {-or-;
   25925             : where the optional property-or-event-modifier is either the "static" or
   25926             : "virtual" keyword, and the final token is a left brace (introducing accessor
   25927             : member declarations) or a semicolon (in the case of a trivial scalar property).
   25928             : The "head" of an event declaration is similar:
   25929             :    property-or-event-modifier(opt) event type-specifier-seq ^(opt)
   25930             :      identifier {-or-;
   25931             : *class_state holds information of the enclosing class (whose definition is
   25932             : being parsed) and *decl_info describes the current member declaration.
   25933             : This function creates an entry of type a_property_or_event_descr and points
   25934             : class_state to it.  For trivial properties and events, the associated field or
   25935             : static data member is also created (along with a symbol).  For nontrivial
   25936             : properties and events that processing must be delayed until the first accessor
   25937             : declaration is seen; store the information to do so in *class_state->pe_info
   25938             : and *class_state->pe_loc.
   25939             : */
   25940             : {
   25941             :   a_decl_parse_state    *dps = &decl_info->decl_state;
   25942             :   a_symbol_locator      loc;
   25943             :   a_type_ptr            class_type = class_state->class_type;
   25944             :   a_class_type_supplement_ptr
   25945             :                         ctsp = class_type_supp(class_type);
   25946             :   a_decl_flag_set       dsi_flags = DSI_TYPE_SPECIFIER_ALLOWED |
   25947             :                                     DSI_STORAGE_CLASS_SPECIFIER_ALLOWED |
   25948             :                                     DSI_NO_TAG_DEFINITION |
   25949             :                                     DSI_VACUOUS_TAG_DECL_ALLOWED |
   25950             :                                     DSI_IS_MEMBER_DECLARATION;
   25951             :   a_property_or_event_descr_ptr
   25952             :                         pdp;
   25953             :   a_boolean             ptr_to_member_scanned, use_error_type = FALSE;
   25954             :   a_source_position     decl_pos, type_pos;
   25955             :   a_source_position     *p_virtual_or_static_pos = NULL;
   25956             :   a_boolean             is_property = dps->has_cli_property_keyword;
   25957             : 
   25958             :   add_stop_token(tok_semicolon);
   25959             :   add_stop_token(tok_lbrace);
   25960             :   decl_pos = pos_curr_token;
   25961             :   if (is_property) {
   25962             :     pdp = alloc_property_or_event_descr(
   25963             :                                   (a_property_or_event_kind)pek_cli_property);
   25964             :   } else {
   25965             :     check_assertion(dps->has_cli_event_keyword);
   25966             :     pdp = alloc_property_or_event_descr(
   25967             :                                      (a_property_or_event_kind)pek_cli_event);
   25968             :   }  /* if */
   25969             :   class_state->class_aggregate_ruled_out = TRUE;
   25970             :   class_state->cpp03_POD_ruled_out = TRUE;
   25971             :   /* First scan leading static/virtual keywords, and skip over the "property"
   25972             :      or "event" token. */
   25973             :   while (curr_token == tok_static || curr_token == tok_virtual) {
   25974             :     if (curr_token == tok_static) {
   25975             :       if (pdp->is_static) pos_error(ec_dupl_decl_specifier, &pos_curr_token);
   25976             :       pdp->is_static = TRUE;
   25977             :     } else {
   25978             :       /* Microsoft compilers only warn about duplicate "virtual" keywords. */
   25979             :       if (pdp->is_virtual) pos_warning(ec_dupl_decl_specifier,
   25980             :                                        &pos_curr_token);
   25981             :       pdp->is_virtual = TRUE;
   25982             :     }  /* if */
   25983             :     (void)get_token();
   25984             :   }  /* while */
   25985             :   if (pdp->is_static || pdp->is_virtual) p_virtual_or_static_pos = &decl_pos;
   25986             :   check_assertion(is_property ? curr_token_is_identifier_string("property")
   25987             :                               : curr_token_is_identifier_string("event"));
   25988             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
   25989             :   pdp->property_or_event_position = pos_curr_token;
   25990             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
   25991             :   if (cppcx_enabled && is_value_class_type(class_type) && !is_property) {
   25992             :     pos_error(ec_event_in_cppcx_value_type, &pos_curr_token);
   25993             :     use_error_type = TRUE;
   25994             :   } else if (!is_immediate_managed_class_type(class_type)) {
   25995             :     pos_error(is_property ? ec_property_requires_managed_class
   25996             :                           : ec_event_requires_managed_class,
   25997             :               &pos_curr_token);
   25998             :     use_error_type = TRUE;
   25999             :   }  /* if */
   26000             :   (void)get_token();
   26001             :   type_pos = pos_curr_token;
   26002             :   decl_specifiers(dsi_flags, dps, &decl_info->decl_pos_block);
   26003             :   /* Most nontype specifiers will have been diagnosed by decl_specifiers (or
   26004             :      caused check_for_cli_field_modifier not to treat "property" or "event" as
   26005             :      a keyword): */
   26006             :   if (dps->dso_flags & DSO_VIRTUAL) {
   26007             :     /* ECMA-372 requires "virtual" to precede the context-sensitive keywords
   26008             :        "property" and "event", but Microsoft's compiler also accepts it after
   26009             :        those keywords. */
   26010             :     if (pdp->is_virtual) {
   26011             :       pos_warning(ec_dupl_decl_specifier, &dps->virtual_pos);
   26012             :     } else {
   26013             :       pdp->is_virtual = TRUE;
   26014             :       p_virtual_or_static_pos = &dps->virtual_pos;
   26015             :     }  /* if */
   26016             :   }  /* if */
   26017             :   if (dps->declared_storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_static) {
   26018             :     /* ECMA-372 requires "static" to precede the context-sensitive keywords
   26019             :        "property" and "event", but Microsoft's compiler also accepts it after
   26020             :        those keywords. */
   26021             :     if (pdp->is_static) {
   26022             :       pos_warning(ec_dupl_decl_specifier, &dps->storage_class_pos);
   26023             :     } else {
   26024             :       pdp->is_static = TRUE;
   26025             :       p_virtual_or_static_pos = &dps->storage_class_pos;
   26026             :     }  /* if */
   26027             :   } else if (dps->declared_storage_class != (a_storage_class)sc_unspecified ||
   26028             :              (dps->dso_flags & DSO_MUTABLE)) {
   26029             :     /* All other storage class specifiers should be disallowed. */
   26030             :     pos_error(dps->declared_storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_typedef ?
   26031             :                 ec_typedef_not_allowed : ec_storage_class_not_allowed,
   26032             :               &dps->storage_class_pos);
   26033             :   } else if (pdp->is_static) {
   26034             :     /* Ordinarily, this is set by the call to decl_specifiers, but if the
   26035             :        keyword "static" was consumed directly above, the storage class must
   26036             :        also be set here. */
   26037             :     dps->declared_storage_class = (a_storage_class)sc_static;
   26038             :   }  /* if */
   26039             :   if (dps->dso_flags & DSO_INLINE) {
   26040             :     /* Enabling storage-class specifiers in the call to decl_specifiers also
   26041             :        enables __inline and __forceinline in Microsoft mode, but they are not
   26042             :        accepted here. */
   26043             :     pos_error(ec_microsoft_inline_not_allowed_here, &dps->specifiers_pos);
   26044             : #if CHECKING
   26045             :   } else {
   26046             :     a_decl_flag_set  okay_output_flags = DSO_HAS_EXPLICIT_TYPE_SPECIFIER |
   26047             :                                          DSO_VIRTUAL |
   26048             :                                          DSO_DECLARES_SOMETHING |
   26049             :                                          DSO_DEFINES_SOMETHING |
   26050             :                                          DSO_JUST_VOID |
   26051             :                                          DSO_TYPENAME;
   26052             :     check_assertion_or_expect_error(!(dps->dso_flags & ~okay_output_flags));
   26053             : #endif /* CHECKING */
   26054             :   }  /* if */
   26055             :   if (pdp->is_static && pdp->is_virtual) {
   26056             :     pos_error(is_property ? ec_virtual_static_property
   26057             :                           : ec_virtual_static_event,
   26058             :               p_virtual_or_static_pos);
   26059             :     pdp->is_static = FALSE;
   26060             :   }  /* if */
   26061             :   dps->type = pointer_declarator(dps->type, dps, /*reference_allowed=*/TRUE,
   26062             :                                  (a_call_conv_descr_ptr)NULL,
   26063             :                                  (a_call_conv_descr_ptr)NULL,
   26064             :                                  (a_type_qualifier_set *)NULL,
   26065             :                                  (a_type_qualifier_set *)NULL,
   26066             :                                  &ptr_to_member_scanned,
   26067             :                                  &decl_info->decl_pos_block);
   26068             :   dps->declared_type = dps->type;
   26069             :   /* The type constraints for properties and events differ. */
   26070             :   if (is_property) {
   26071             :     if (is_array_type(dps->type) || is_function_type(dps->type)) {
   26072             :       pos_error(is_array_type(dps->type) ? ec_array_type_not_allowed
   26073             :                                          : ec_function_type_not_allowed,
   26074             :                 &type_pos);
   26075             :       use_error_type = TRUE;
   26076             :     }  /* if */
   26077             :   } else {
   26078             :     /* An event's type must be handle-to-delegate. */
   26079             :     if (is_handle_type(dps->type)) {
   26080             :       a_type_ptr  underlying_tp = type_pointed_to(dps->type);
   26081             :       if (is_template_param_type(underlying_tp) ||
   26082             :           is_error_type(underlying_tp)) {
   26083             :         /* More specific checking is not needed or possible. */
   26084             :       } else {
   26085             :         complete_type_is_needed(underlying_tp);
   26086             :         if (!is_delegate_type(underlying_tp)) {
   26087             :           pos_error(ec_invalid_event_type, &type_pos);
   26088             :           use_error_type = TRUE;
   26089             :         }  /* if */
   26090             :       }  /* if */
   26091             :     } else if (!is_template_param_type(dps->type) &&
   26092             :                !is_error_type(dps->type)) {
   26093             :       pos_error(ec_invalid_event_type, &type_pos);
   26094             :       use_error_type = TRUE;
   26095             :     }  /* if */
   26096             :   }  /* if */
   26097             :   /* An identifier should be next. */
   26098             :   if (!required_token_no_advance(tok_identifier, ec_exp_identifier)) {
   26099             :     discard_curr_construct_pragmas();
   26100             :     goto done;
   26101             :   } else if (!is_generalized_identifier_start(GID_ERROR_FLAGS)) {
   26102             :     /* Since we already checked that the next token is an identifier, this
   26103             :        can only be a pointer-to-member. */
   26104             :     check_assertion(curr_token == tok_ptr_to_member);
   26105             :     syntax_error(ec_exp_identifier);
   26106             :   } else if (is_property && curr_token_is_identifier_string("default")) {
   26107             :     /* "default" (which is an identifier and not a keyword in Microsoft
   26108             :        modes) has a special meaning for properties but not for events. */
   26109             :     if (pdp->is_static) {
   26110             :       pos_error(ec_static_default_indexed_property, &pos_curr_token);
   26111             :     } else {
   26112             :       pdp->is_default_indexed = TRUE;
   26113             :     }  /* if */
   26114             :   }  /* if */
   26115             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
   26116             :   dps->source_sequence_entry = add_empty_source_sequence_entry();
   26117             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
   26118             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
   26119             :   /* Record the position of the name of the property or event. */
   26120             :   decl_info->decl_pos_block.identifier_range.start = pos_curr_token;
   26121             :   decl_info->decl_pos_block.identifier_range.end = end_pos_curr_token;
   26122             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
   26123             :   class_state->property_or_event_descr = pdp;
   26124             :   dps->is_property_or_event_field = TRUE;
   26125             :   loc = locator_for_curr_id;
   26126             :   (void)get_token();
   26127             :   if (is_property) {
   26128             :     /* Check for index types. */
   26129             :     if (curr_token == tok_lbracket) {
   26130             :       scan_cli_property_indices(pdp);
   26131             :     } else if (pdp->is_default_indexed) {
   26132             :       pos_error(ec_exp_lbracket, &pos_curr_token);
   26133             :     }  /* if */
   26134             :   }  /* if */
   26135             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
   26136             :   pdp->definition_range.start = pos_curr_token;
   26137             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
   26138             :   /* Check for invalid uses of "override", "new", or "sealed" here.
   26139             :      (Intuitively, these modifiers make sense here, but they're not
   26140             :      allowed.) */
   26141             :   if (curr_token == tok_identifier &&
   26142             :       (curr_token_is_identifier_string("override") ||
   26143             :        curr_token_is_identifier_string("new") ||
   26144             :        curr_token_is_identifier_string("sealed"))) {
   26145             :     pos_st_error(ec_bad_use_of_function_modifier, &pos_curr_token,
   26146             :                  locator_for_curr_id.symbol_header->identifier);
   26147             :     (void)get_token();
   26148             :   }  /* if */
   26149             :   if (curr_token == tok_semicolon) {
   26150             :     /* A trivial scalar property or event.  Set the "is_trivial" flag before
   26151             :        calling decl_nonstatic_data_member since it determines whether an
   26152             :        incomplete type is permissible. */
   26153             :     pdp->is_trivial = TRUE;
   26154             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
   26155             :     pdp->definition_range.end = end_pos_curr_token;
   26156             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
   26157             :   }  /* if */
   26158             :   if (use_error_type) {
   26159             :     dps->type = error_type();
   26160             :   }  /* if */
   26161             :   ctsp->has_direct_property_or_event = TRUE;
   26162             :   /* Save the pending pragmas so that they can be restored when the data
   26163             :      member associated with the property or event is created (which may be
   26164             :      delayed until processing of the first accessor has started). */
   26165             :   decl_info->suspended_pragmas = scope_stack_top().curr_construct_pragmas;
   26166             :   scope_stack_top().curr_construct_pragmas = NULL;
   26167             :   /* Save the declaration information for this property or event.  For
   26168             :      nontrivial properties and events, this is necessary because the actual
   26169             :      declaration of the associated data member is delayed until the first
   26170             :      accessor is seen.  For trivial properties and events, this mechanism is
   26171             :      not strictly needed, but it is used for the sake of uniformity. */
   26172             :   *class_state->pe_info = *decl_info;
   26173             :   *class_state->pe_loc = loc;
   26174             :   /* Clear fields in the original state that would cause undesirable side
   26175             :      effects later on. */
   26176             :   dps->ms_attributes = NULL;
   26177             :   dps->end_of_parse_actions = NULL;
   26178             :   if (pdp->is_trivial) {
   26179             :     decl_property_or_event_member(class_state, pdp);
   26180             :     if (is_property) {
   26181             :       if (pdp->indices != NULL) {
   26182             :         /* A trivial property cannot be an indexed property. */
   26183             :         pos_error(ec_trivial_indexed_property, &pos_curr_token);
   26184             :         pdp->indices = NULL;
   26185             :       } else if (is_any_reference_type(dps->type)) {
   26186             :         /* A trivial property cannot have a reference type. */
   26187             :         pos_error(ec_trivial_reference_property, &type_pos);
   26188             :       } else if (get_type_qualifiers(dps->type) & (TQ_CONST | TQ_VOLATILE)) {
   26189             :         /* A trivial property cannot have a const or volatile type. */
   26190             :         pos_error(ec_trivial_const_or_volatile_property, &type_pos);
   26191             :       }  /* if */
   26192             :       record_trivial_property_accessors(class_state);
   26193             :     } else {
   26194             :       record_trivial_event_accessors(class_state);
   26195             :     }  /* if */
   26196             :     (void)get_token();
   26197             :     class_state->property_or_event_descr = NULL;
   26198             :   } else {
   26199             :     /* A nontrivial property or event. */
   26200             :     (void)required_token(tok_lbrace, ec_exp_lbrace);
   26201             :     class_state->property_or_event_descr = pdp;
   26202             :     treat_declaration_as_okay_in_property_or_event(class_state);
   26203             :   }  /* if */
   26204             : done:
   26205             :   remove_stop_token(tok_lbrace);
   26206             :   remove_stop_token(tok_semicolon);
   26207             : }  /* scan_cli_property_or_event_head */
   26208             : 
   26209             : /*
   26210             : Macro that returns TRUE if a property/event description still requires a call
   26211             : to decl_property_or_event_member.
   26212             : */
   26213             : #define property_or_event_is_missing_assoc_data_member(pdp)                  \
   26214             :   (((pdp)->is_static && pdp->variant.variable == NULL) ||                    \
   26215             :    (!(pdp)->is_static && pdp->variant.field == NULL))
   26216             : 
   26217             : 
   26218             : static void check_cli_accessor_decl(a_class_def_state   *class_state,
   26219             :                                     a_source_position   *diag_pos)
   26220             : /*
   26221             : A member declaration was just completed within the braces of a C++/CLI
   26222             : property or event definition.  Check that the declaration is valid and issue
   26223             : a diagnostic at the given position if it is not so.  If the closing brace of
   26224             : the property or event declaration is next, scan it, diagnose any missing
   26225             : accessor functions, and update the IL accordingly.  class_state represents the
   26226             : innermost class being defined.
   26227             : */
   26228             : {
   26229             :   a_property_or_event_descr_ptr  pedp = class_state->property_or_event_descr;
   26230             : 
   26231             :   if (!class_state->current_decl_valid_in_property_or_event_def) {
   26232             :     an_error_code  ec;
   26233             :     if (pedp->kind == (a_property_or_event_kind)pek_cli_property) {
   26234             :       ec = ec_invalid_property_accessor_decl;
   26235             :     } else {
   26236             :       check_assertion(pedp->kind == (a_property_or_event_kind)pek_cli_event);
   26237             :       ec = ec_invalid_event_accessor_decl;
   26238             :     }  /* if */
   26239             :     pos_error(ec, diag_pos);
   26240             :   } else {
   26241             :     /* Reset the flag for a possible subsequent declaration. */
   26242             :     class_state->current_decl_valid_in_property_or_event_def = FALSE;
   26243             :   }  /* if */
   26244             :   if (curr_token == tok_rbrace || curr_token == tok_end_of_source) {
   26245             :     /* The closing brace of a nontrivial property or event definition (or, in
   26246             :        error cases, an end-of-source marker).  Skip over the token and update
   26247             :        class_state to indicate we're no longer in a property or event
   26248             :        definition.  Also check that any required accessor functions have been
   26249             :        declared. */
   26250             :     a_symbol_locator         *pe_loc = class_state->pe_loc;
   26251             :     a_source_correspondence  *scp;
   26252             :     check_assertion_or_expect_error(curr_token == tok_rbrace);
   26253             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
   26254             :     pedp->definition_range.end = end_pos_curr_token;
   26255             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
   26256             :     if (pedp->kind == (a_property_or_event_kind)pek_cli_property) {
   26257             :       /* Check that at least one of the "get" and "set" accessors have been
   26258             :          declared. */
   26259             :       if (pedp->get_routine.ptr == NULL && pedp->set_routine.ptr == NULL) {
   26260             :         pos_error(ec_missing_get_and_set_accessors, &pe_loc->source_position);
   26261             :       } else if (cppcx_enabled &&
   26262             :                  (pedp->is_default_indexed || pedp->indices != NULL) &&
   26263             :                  (((pedp->get_routine.ptr != NULL &&
   26264             :                     is_cppcx_externally_visible_symbol(
   26265             :                                          symbol_for(pedp->get_routine.ptr))) ||
   26266             :                    (pedp->set_routine.ptr != NULL &&
   26267             :                     is_cppcx_externally_visible_symbol(
   26268             :                                       symbol_for(pedp->set_routine.ptr)))))) {
   26269             :         /* Indexed properties with a public "get" or "set" accessor are
   26270             :            disallowed in C++/CX. */
   26271             :         pos_error(ec_cppcx_public_indexed_property, &pe_loc->source_position);
   26272             :       }  /* if */
   26273             :     } else {
   26274             :       /* Check that both "add" and "remove" have been declared. */
   26275             :       if (pedp->add_routine == NULL || pedp->remove_routine == NULL) {
   26276             :         pos_error(ec_missing_add_or_remove_accessor, &pe_loc->source_position);
   26277             :       }  /* if */
   26278             :     }  /* if */
   26279             :     if (property_or_event_is_missing_assoc_data_member(pedp)) {
   26280             :       /* A declaration within the braces of the property or event definition
   26281             :          ordinarily triggers the creation of the associated field or static
   26282             :          data member.  If no such declaration was encountered (an error)
   26283             :          create the associated member now. */
   26284             :       expect_error();
   26285             :       decl_property_or_event_member(class_state, pedp);
   26286             :     }  /* if */
   26287             :     (void)get_token();
   26288             :     class_state->property_or_event_descr = NULL;
   26289             :     /* Restore access to that in effect when the property or event declaration
   26290             :        started (it might have changed inside the braces). */
   26291             :     scp = pedp->is_static ? &pedp->variant.variable->source_corresp
   26292             :                           : &pedp->variant.field->source_corresp;
   26293             :     class_state->access = scp->access;
   26294             :     class_state->assembly_access = scp->assembly_access;
   26295             :   }  /* if */
   26296             : }  /* check_cli_accessor_decl */
   26297             : 
   26298             : 
   26299             : static void scan_named_overrides_if_any(a_member_decl_info_ptr  decl_info,
   26300             :                                         a_class_def_state_ptr   cdsp)
   26301             : /*
   26302             : decl_info describes a member function declaration in the definition of a class
   26303             : described by cdsp.  The top-level function declarator has just been scanned.
   26304             : It may be followed by "= X, Y, ..." (with X, Y, ... qualified or unqualified
   26305             : names), to name specific virtual base class members that are overridden by the
   26306             : newly declared member.  If so, scan and validate the "= X, Y, ..." construct
   26307             : and record the overridden base class members in decl_info->named_overrides.
   26308             : */
   26309             : {
   26310             :   if (curr_token == tok_assign) {
   26311             :     a_type_ptr               class_type = cdsp->class_type;
   26312             :     a_token_cache            cache;
   26313             :     a_symbol_list_entry_ptr  *p_list_entry;
   26314             :     a_boolean                err = FALSE, sym_err;
   26315             :     clear_token_cache(&cache, /*reusable=*/FALSE);
   26316             :     cache_curr_token(&cache);
   26317             :     (void)get_token();
   26318             :     if (!is_generalized_identifier_start(GID_NO_OPTIONS) ||
   26319             :         check_context_sensitive_keyword(tok_default, "default")) {
   26320             :       /* Handle these cases elsewhere. */
   26321             :       rescan_cached_tokens(&cache);
   26322             :       goto done;
   26323             :     }  /* if */
   26324             :     discard_token_cache(&cache);
   26325             :     if (!is_immediate_managed_class_type(class_type)) {
   26326             :       pos_error(ec_named_override_requires_managed_type, &pos_curr_token);
   26327             :       err = TRUE;
   26328             :     } else if (decl_info->is_destructor || decl_info->is_finalizer) {
   26329             :       pos_error(ec_destructor_or_finalizer_with_named_override,
   26330             :                 &pos_curr_token);
   26331             :       err = TRUE;
   26332             :     } else if (decl_info->is_static_constructor) {
   26333             :       pos_error(ec_static_constructor_with_named_override, &pos_curr_token);
   26334             :       err = TRUE;
   26335             :     }  /* if */
   26336             :     p_list_entry = &decl_info->named_overrides;
   26337             :     do {
   26338             :       a_symbol_ptr  sym;
   26339             :       if (!is_generalized_identifier_start(GID_NO_OPTIONS)) goto done;
   26340             :       add_stop_token(tok_comma);
   26341             :       sym = coalesce_and_lookup_generalized_identifier(
   26342             :                                         GID_NO_OPTIONS, ilm_normal, &sym_err);
   26343             :       err |= sym_err;
   26344             :       remove_stop_token(tok_comma);
   26345             :       if (err) {
   26346             :         expect_error();
   26347             :         sym = NULL;
   26348             :       } else if (sym == NULL) {
   26349             :         /* The symbol was not found: Issue an error. */
   26350             :         pos_error(ec_override_name_must_be_a_base_class_member_function,
   26351             :                   &pos_curr_token);
   26352             :       } else if (is_nontype_template_param_symbol(sym)) {
   26353             :         /* A template-dependent symbol (possibly due to the presence of a
   26354             :            dependent base class).  Further checks are not possible at this
   26355             :            time. */
   26356             :       } else if (sym->ambiguous) {
   26357             :         pos_sy_error(ec_ambiguous_name, &pos_curr_token, sym);
   26358             :         sym = NULL;
   26359             :       } else if (!is_member_function_symbol(sym) ||
   26360             :                  find_base_class_of(class_type,
   26361             :                                     sym_parent_class(sym)) == NULL) {
   26362             :         pos_error(ec_override_name_must_be_a_base_class_member_function,
   26363             :                   &pos_curr_token);
   26364             :         sym = NULL;
   26365             :       } else {
   26366             :         if (decl_info->decl_state.is_generic_declaration) {
   26367             :           /* Search for a matching generic. */
   26368             :           check_assertion(scope_is(&scope_stack_top(),
   26369             :                                    sck_template_declaration));
   26370             :           sym = member_function_redecl_sym_with_template_flag(
   26371             :                              sym, &decl_info->decl_state,
   26372             :                              scope_stack_top().template_decl_info->parameters,
   26373             :                              /*templates_only=*/TRUE, (a_symbol_ptr*)NULL);
   26374             :         } else {
   26375             :           /* Search for an ordinary matching member function. */
   26376             :           sym = member_function_redecl_sym_with_template_flag(
   26377             :                                               sym, &decl_info->decl_state,
   26378             :                                               (a_template_param_ptr)NULL,
   26379             :                                               /*templates_only=*/FALSE,
   26380             :                                               (a_symbol_ptr*)NULL);
   26381             :         }  /* if */
   26382             :         if (sym == NULL) {
   26383             :           pos_error(ec_named_override_type_mismatch, &pos_curr_token);
   26384             :         } else {
   26385             :           a_routine_ptr  rp;
   26386             :           reduce_to_underlying_generic_definition_symbol_if_needed(sym);
   26387             :           check_assertion(symbol_is(sym, sk_member_function));
   26388             :           rp = sym->variant.routine.ptr;
   26389             :           if (!rp->is_virtual) {
   26390             :             pos_sy_error(ec_override_name_nonvirtual, &pos_curr_token, sym);
   26391             :             sym = NULL;
   26392             :           } else if (special_kind_is(rp, sfk_destructor) ||
   26393             :                      special_kind_is(rp, sfk_finalizer)) {
   26394             :             pos_error(ec_override_name_is_destructor_or_finalizer,
   26395             :                       &pos_curr_token);
   26396             :             sym = NULL;
   26397             :           }  /* if */
   26398             :         }  /* if */
   26399             :       }  /* if */
   26400             :       if (sym != NULL) {
   26401             :         *p_list_entry = alloc_symbol_list_entry();
   26402             :         (*p_list_entry)->symbol = sym;
   26403             :         p_list_entry = &(*p_list_entry)->next;
   26404             :         mark_referenced(sym, &locator_for_curr_id.source_position);
   26405             :       }  /* if */
   26406             :       (void)get_token();
   26407             :     } while (loop_token(tok_comma));
   26408             : done:;
   26409             :   }  /* if */
   26410             : }  /* scan_named_overrides_if_any */
   26411             : 
   26412             : 
   26413             : static void apply_constraints_to_complete_type(
   26414             :         a_class_def_state_ptr           class_state,
   26415             :         a_base_class_sequence_number    *direct_base_number,
   26416             :         a_base_class_ptr                *last_bcp,
   26417             :         a_boolean                       *may_be_first_direct_nonvirtual_base,
   26418             :         a_boolean                       *default_constructible,
   26419             :         a_generic_constraint_ptr        gc_list)
   26420             : /*
   26421             : Go through the list of constraints specified by gc_list and update the
   26422             : constraint type described by class_state (and in the process of being
   26423             : completed) with the information from the constraints.  direct_base_number,
   26424             : last_bcp, and may_be_first_direct_nonvirtual_base track the state of the base
   26425             : classes as they are being added (corresponding to constraints).
   26426             : *default_constructible is set to TRUE if a gcnew constraint is encountered.
   26427             : This routine calls itself recursively to process naked type parameter
   26428             : constraints.
   26429             : */
   26430             : {
   26431             :   a_type_ptr                proxy_class = class_state->class_type;
   26432             :   a_generic_constraint_ptr  gcp;
   26433             : 
   26434             :   for (gcp = gc_list; gcp != NULL; gcp = gcp->next) {
   26435             :     if (gcp->kind == (a_generic_constraint_kind)gck_type ||
   26436             :         gcp->kind == (a_generic_constraint_kind)gck_naked_type_param) {
   26437             :       a_type_ptr  type = gcp->type;
   26438             :       /* For a naked type parameter constraint, add the proxy class as
   26439             :          a base class. */
   26440             :       if (gcp->kind == (a_generic_constraint_kind)gck_naked_type_param) {
   26441             :         type = proxy_class_for_template_param(type);
   26442             :       }  /* if */
   26443             :       add_direct_base_of_type(type, class_state,
   26444             :                               (*direct_base_number)++, last_bcp,
   26445             :                               may_be_first_direct_nonvirtual_base);
   26446             :       if (is_cli_interface_type(type)) {
   26447             :         proxy_class->variant.class_struct_union.any_interface_constraints =
   26448             :                                                                          TRUE;
   26449             :       } else if (is_class_struct_union_type(type) &&
   26450             :                  skip_typerefs(type)->variant.class_struct_union.final) {
   26451             :         /* final class types are normally not allowed for generic constraints,
   26452             :            but Microsoft does allow them if they result from an instantiation.
   26453             :            The resulting constraint type is also marked "final". */
   26454             :         proxy_class->variant.class_struct_union.final = TRUE;
   26455             :       }  /* if */
   26456             :     } else if (gcp->kind == (a_generic_constraint_kind)gck_gcnew) {
   26457             :       /* The "gcnew()" constraint indicates that the constraint type is
   26458             :          default-constructible. */
   26459             :       *default_constructible = TRUE;
   26460             :     }  /* if */
   26461             :     if (gcp->kind == (a_generic_constraint_kind)gck_naked_type_param) {
   26462             :       a_generic_constraint_ptr  sub_list;
   26463             :       /* For a naked type parameter constraint, apply the indirect
   26464             :          constraints. */
   26465             :       sub_list = gcp->type->variant.template_param.extra_info
   26466             :                           ->generic_constraints;
   26467             :       if (sub_list != NULL) {
   26468             :         apply_constraints_to_complete_type(
   26469             :                    class_state, direct_base_number, last_bcp,
   26470             :                    may_be_first_direct_nonvirtual_base, default_constructible,
   26471             :                    sub_list);
   26472             :       }  /* if */
   26473             :     }  /* if */
   26474             :   }  /* for */
   26475             : }  /* apply_constraints_to_complete_type */
   26476             : 
   26477             : 
   26478             : void complete_generic_constraint_type(a_type_ptr  proxy_class)
   26479             : /*
   26480             : The given type is a generic constraint type (i.e., the proxy class type
   26481             : associated with a generic parameter).  Complete the class by adding base
   26482             : classes and possibly a default constructor as indicated by the constraints.
   26483             : */
   26484             : {
   26485             :   a_class_type_supplement_ptr   ctsp = class_type_supp(proxy_class);
   26486             :   a_type_ptr                    templ_param_type = ctsp->proxy_of_type;
   26487             :   a_generic_constraint_ptr      gc_list;
   26488             :   a_class_def_state             class_state;
   26489             :   a_base_class_ptr              last_bcp = NULL;
   26490             :   a_base_class_sequence_number  direct_base_number = 1;
   26491             :   a_boolean                     may_be_first_direct_nonvirtual_base = TRUE;
   26492             :   a_boolean                     default_constructible = FALSE;
   26493             : 
   26494             :   /* Push a scope to provide a clean context to the constraint type
   26495             :      definition. */
   26496             :   push_instantiation_scope_for_constraint_type();
   26497             :   gc_list = templ_param_type->variant.template_param.extra_info
   26498             :                             ->generic_constraints;
   26499             :   initialize_class_def_state(proxy_class, &class_state);
   26500             :   if (gc_list == NULL) {
   26501             :     /* No constraints: The constraint type derives from System::Object. */
   26502             :     add_direct_base_of_type(cli_system_object_type(), &class_state,
   26503             :                             direct_base_number, &last_bcp,
   26504             :                             &may_be_first_direct_nonvirtual_base);
   26505             :   } else {
   26506             :     /* Add bases corresponding to the various constraints. */
   26507             :     apply_constraints_to_complete_type(
   26508             :                  &class_state, &direct_base_number, &last_bcp,
   26509             :                  &may_be_first_direct_nonvirtual_base, &default_constructible,
   26510             :                  gc_list);
   26511             :   }  /* if */
   26512             :   add_implicit_cli_bases(&class_state);
   26513             :   wrapup_base_classes(&class_state);
   26514             :   /* Complete the proxy class. */
   26515             :   class_state.access = (an_access_specifier)as_public;
   26516             :   ctsp->assoc_scope =
   26517             :            push_scope((a_scope_kind)sck_class_struct_union, NO_SCOPE_NUMBER,
   26518             :                       proxy_class, (a_routine_ptr)NULL);
   26519             :   scope_stack_top().class_def_state = &class_state;
   26520             :   if (default_constructible &&
   26521             :       !cli_class_type_kind_is(proxy_class, cctk_value)) {
   26522             :     class_state.default_ctor_is_nontrivial = TRUE;
   26523             :     generate_default_constructor(&class_state, /*is_deleted=*/FALSE);
   26524             :   }  /* if */
   26525             :   complete_class_definition(proxy_class, DEPTH_OF_FILE_SCOPE, &class_state);
   26526             :   /* Pop the class scope and the "instantiation" scope. */
   26527             :   pop_scope();
   26528             :   pop_instantiation_scope_for_constraint_type();
   26529             : }  /* complete_generic_constraint_type */
   26530             : 
   26531             : 
   26532             : static void rescan_open_constructed_type_constraints(
   26533             :                                 a_template_param_ptr    generic_param_list)
   26534             : /*
   26535             : Go through the constraint types of the generic parameter list specified by
   26536             : generic_param_list and look for any that have open constructed type
   26537             : constraints.  Such constraints are identified by the presence of a
   26538             : token cache for the type constraint.  Rescan the type for any such
   26539             : constraint so that the correct constructed type will be available if and
   26540             : when the constraint type is completed.
   26541             : */
   26542             : {
   26543             :   a_template_param_ptr        tpp;
   26544             :  
   26545             :   for (tpp = generic_param_list; tpp != NULL; tpp = tpp->next) {
   26546             :     a_symbol_ptr                param_sym = tpp->param_symbol;
   26547             :     a_type_ptr                  constraint_type = param_sym->variant.type.ptr;
   26548             :     a_type_ptr                  templ_param_type;
   26549             :     a_generic_constraint_ptr    gcp;
   26550             :     a_generic_constraint_ptr    gc_list;
   26551             : 
   26552             :     templ_param_type = generic_param_if_generic_definition_argument(
   26553             :                                                               constraint_type);
   26554             :     gc_list = templ_param_type->variant.template_param.extra_info
   26555             :                                                          ->generic_constraints;
   26556             :     for (gcp = gc_list; gcp != NULL; gcp = gcp->next) {
   26557             :       if (gcp->kind == (a_generic_constraint_kind)gck_type &&
   26558             :           gcp->type_cache != NULL) {
   26559             :         a_symbol_ptr    sym;
   26560             :         a_boolean       err = FALSE;
   26561             :         /* Rescan the tokens of the constraint type. */
   26562             :         rescan_cached_tokens(gcp->type_cache);
   26563             :         sym = coalesce_and_lookup_generalized_identifier(
   26564             :                                             GID_NO_OPTIONS, ilm_normal, &err);
   26565             :         /* The result should always be a valid class type. */
   26566             :         check_assertion(!err && sym != NULL &&
   26567             :                         is_class_struct_union_symbol(sym));
   26568             :         gcp->type = type_symbol_type(sym);
   26569             :         record_symbol_reference(SRK_REFERENCE, sym,
   26570             :                                 &gcp->position,
   26571             :                                 /*update_il_entry=*/FALSE);
   26572             :         free_token_cache(gcp->type_cache);
   26573             :         gcp->type_cache = NULL;
   26574             :         (void)get_token();
   26575             :       }  /* if */
   26576             :     }  /* for */
   26577             :   }  /* for */
   26578             : }  /* rescan_open_constructed_type_constraints */
   26579             : 
   26580             : 
   26581             : static void apply_constraints_to_type(
   26582             :                                 a_type_ptr                      proxy_class,
   26583             :                                 a_class_type_supplement_ptr     ctsp,
   26584             :                                 a_generic_constraint_ptr        gc_list,
   26585             :                                 a_boolean                       indirect)
   26586             : /*
   26587             : Go through the list of constraints specified by gc_list and update the
   26588             : type specified by proxy_class and ctsp with the information from the
   26589             : constraints.  If indirect is TRUE, this routine was called recursively to
   26590             : process a naked type constraint; indirect ref and value class constraints
   26591             : are not applied.  This routine updates applies the constraints to proxy_class
   26592             : while it is an incomplete type.
   26593             : */
   26594             : {
   26595             :   a_generic_constraint_ptr      gcp;
   26596             : 
   26597             :   for (gcp = gc_list; gcp != NULL; gcp = gcp->next) {
   26598             :     if (gcp->kind == (a_generic_constraint_kind)gck_value_class) {
   26599             :       if (!indirect) {
   26600             :         ctsp->cli_class_type_kind = (a_cli_class_type_kind)cctk_value;
   26601             :       }  /* if */
   26602             :     } else if (gcp->kind == (a_generic_constraint_kind)gck_ref_class) {
   26603             :       if (!indirect) {
   26604             :         ctsp->cli_class_type_kind = (a_cli_class_type_kind)cctk_ref;
   26605             :       }  /* if */
   26606             :     } else if (gcp->kind == (a_generic_constraint_kind)gck_type) {
   26607             :       a_type_ptr  ctp = skip_typerefs(gcp->type);
   26608             :       if (is_immediate_class_type(ctp)) {
   26609             :         ctsp->cli_class_type_kind =
   26610             :                                     class_type_supp(ctp)->cli_class_type_kind;
   26611             :       }  /* if */
   26612             :     } else if (gcp->kind == (a_generic_constraint_kind)gck_naked_type_param) {
   26613             :       a_generic_constraint_ptr  sub_list;
   26614             :       /* For a naked type parameter constraint, apply the indirect
   26615             :          constraints. */
   26616             :       sub_list = gcp->type->variant.template_param.extra_info->
   26617             :                                                           generic_constraints;
   26618             :       if (sub_list != NULL) {
   26619             :         apply_constraints_to_type(proxy_class, ctsp, sub_list,
   26620             :                                   /*indirect=*/TRUE);
   26621             :       }  /* if */
   26622             :     }  /* if */
   26623             :     if (!cli_class_type_kind_is(proxy_class, cctk_interface)) break;
   26624             :   }  /* for */
   26625             : }  /* apply_constraints_to_type */
   26626             : 
   26627             : 
   26628             : void create_generic_constraint_types(a_template_decl_info_ptr   decl_info)
   26629             : /*
   26630             : Loop through the C++/CLI generic parameters of decl_info and create a
   26631             : type for each based on the constraints for the generic parameter.  The
   26632             : completion of the types (by complete_generic_constraint_type) is delayed until
   26633             : a complete type is actually needed.  This permits constraints to e.g. involve
   26634             : the enclosing type of the constrained generic.  For example:
   26635             : 
   26636             :   generic<class T> public ref struct S {
   26637             :     generic<class V> where V: S<V>  // Cannot complete V here since it requires
   26638             :     void foo(V v, W w) { }          // a complete S<V>.
   26639             :   };
   26640             : 
   26641             : */
   26642             : {
   26643             :   a_template_param_ptr        tpp;
   26644             :   a_template_param_ptr        generic_param_list = decl_info->parameters;
   26645             : 
   26646             :   /* If there is an enclosing generic parameter list, process it first. */
   26647             :   if (decl_info->enclosing_template_decl != NULL) {
   26648             :     create_generic_constraint_types(decl_info->enclosing_template_decl);
   26649             :   }  /* if */
   26650             :   for (tpp = generic_param_list; tpp != NULL; tpp = tpp->next) {
   26651             :     a_symbol_ptr              param_sym = tpp->param_symbol;
   26652             :     a_type_ptr                templ_param_type = param_sym->variant.type.ptr;
   26653             :     a_type_ptr                proxy_class;
   26654             :     a_type_ptr                definition_arg_type;
   26655             :     a_generic_constraint_ptr  gc_list;
   26656             :     a_class_type_supplement_ptr
   26657             :                               ctsp;
   26658             :     /* Create a proxy class that will be used as the class type representing
   26659             :        the constraints. */
   26660             :     proxy_class = proxy_class_for_template_param(templ_param_type);
   26661             :     definition_arg_type = proxy_class;
   26662             :     ctsp = class_type_supp(proxy_class);
   26663             :     ctsp->is_hide_by_sig = TRUE;
   26664             :     /* Determine the CLI class type kind of the constraint type. */
   26665             :     gc_list = templ_param_type->variant.template_param.extra_info
   26666             :                               ->generic_constraints;
   26667             :     /* Depending on the constraints, this constraint type could be a value
   26668             :        class, a ref class, or some hybrid. */
   26669             :     ctsp->cli_class_type_kind = (a_cli_class_type_kind)cctk_interface;
   26670             :     /* Update the type with the information from the constraints. */
   26671             :     apply_constraints_to_type(proxy_class, ctsp, gc_list, /*indirect=*/FALSE);
   26672             :     if (cli_class_type_kind_is(proxy_class, cctk_interface)) {
   26673             :       /* The class is a sort of hybrid value/ref class. */
   26674             :       ctsp->cli_class_type_kind = (a_cli_class_type_kind)cctk_ref;
   26675             :       proxy_class->variant.class_struct_union.is_hybrid_constraint = TRUE;
   26676             :     }  /* if */
   26677             :     if (!is_value_class_type(proxy_class)) {
   26678             :       /* Except for constraints known to be value classes, the type used
   26679             :          to process the generic definition is a handle type. */
   26680             :       definition_arg_type = make_handle_type(proxy_class);
   26681             :     }  /* if */
   26682             :     /* Give the definition argument type the same name as the original
   26683             :        template parameter. */
   26684             :     definition_arg_type->source_corresp.name =
   26685             :                                          templ_param_type->source_corresp.name;
   26686             :     proxy_class->variant.class_struct_union.unconstrained = gc_list == NULL;
   26687             :     /* Update the template parameter entry to use the proxy class as the
   26688             :        template parameter value. */
   26689             :     tpp->param_symbol->variant.type.ptr = definition_arg_type;
   26690             :     tpp->variant.type = definition_arg_type;
   26691             :   }  /* for */
   26692             :   /* If any of the type constraints are of the form X<T>, rescan the
   26693             :      constraint now that we have the correct type for T. */
   26694             :   rescan_open_constructed_type_constraints(generic_param_list);
   26695             : }  /* create_generic_constraint_types */
   26696             : 
   26697             : 
   26698             : void make_boxed_enum_type(a_type_ptr  tp)
   26699             : /*
   26700             : Create a C++/CLI or C++/CX class type representing the boxed version of the
   26701             : given enumeration type.  Update the given type to point to its boxed version
   26702             : and, in C++/CLI mode, vice versa.
   26703             : */
   26704             : {
   26705             :   a_type_ptr                   btp;
   26706             :   a_symbol_ptr                 bsym;
   26707             :   a_symbol_locator             loc;
   26708             :   a_class_type_supplement_ptr  ctsp;
   26709             :   a_class_def_state            class_state;
   26710             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
   26711             :   a_boolean                    saved_source_sequence_entries_disallowed;
   26712             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
   26713             : 
   26714             :   check_assertion(is_immediate_enum_type(tp));
   26715             :   if (cppcx_enabled) {
   26716             :     /* In C++/CX mode, the boxed version of an enum is Platform::Box<T>. */
   26717             :     btp = make_cppcx_box_type(tp);
   26718             :     /* Link the enum type with the boxed type.  Although it is done in the
   26719             :        C++/CLI case below, the boxed type is not linked with the enum type
   26720             :        via ctsp->corresponding_basic_type.  That association is used by
   26721             :        form_tag_reference to emit the enum type instead of the boxed type
   26722             :        because the C++/CLI boxed type cannot be written explicitly in source
   26723             :        form.  We don't want that to occur in C++/CX because the boxed type
   26724             :        can be written explicitly in source form as Platform::Box<T>. */
   26725             :     integer_type_supp(tp)->boxed_type = btp;
   26726             :   } else {
   26727             :     /* Create a symbol for the boxed type.  It is not added to the symbol
   26728             :        table since it would conflict with the symbol of the enum type. */
   26729             :     make_locator_for_symbol(symbol_for(tp), &loc);
   26730             :     bsym = make_symbol((a_symbol_kind)sk_class_or_struct_tag, &loc);
   26731             :     bsym->decl_scope = scope_stack[DEPTH_OF_FILE_SCOPE].number;
   26732             :     /* Create the type entry itself. */
   26733             :     btp = alloc_type((a_type_kind)tk_struct);
