   26734             :     ctsp = class_type_supp(btp);
   26735             :     ctsp->cli_class_type_kind = (a_cli_class_type_kind)cctk_value;
   26736             :     ctsp->is_hide_by_sig = TRUE;
   26737             :     btp->variant.class_struct_union.final = TRUE;
   26738             :     bsym->variant.class_struct_union.type = btp;
   26739             :     set_source_corresp(&(btp->source_corresp), bsym);
   26740             :     set_name_linkage_for_type(btp);
   26741             :     add_to_types_list(btp, DEPTH_OF_FILE_SCOPE);
   26742             :     /* Start the class definition (and associated class scope). */
   26743             :     initialize_class_def_state(btp, &class_state);
   26744             :     push_instantiation_scope_for_boxed_enum_type();
   26745             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
   26746             :     btp->autonomous_primary_tag_decl = TRUE;
   26747             :     /* Don't issue source sequence entries for generated entities. */
   26748             :     saved_source_sequence_entries_disallowed =
   26749             :                                             source_sequence_entries_disallowed;
   26750             :     scope_stack_top().source_sequence_entries_disallowed = TRUE;
   26751             :     source_sequence_entries_disallowed = TRUE;
   26752             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
   26753             :     /* Add System::Enum as a base class. */
   26754             :     add_cli_system_base_class(
   26755             :                          &class_state, cli_symbol_from_kind(csk_system_enum));
   26756             :     wrapup_base_classes(&class_state);
   26757             :     class_state.access = (an_access_specifier)as_public;
   26758             :     ctsp->assoc_scope =
   26759             :              push_scope((a_scope_kind)sck_class_struct_union, NO_SCOPE_NUMBER,
   26760             :                         btp, (a_routine_ptr)NULL);
   26761             :     scope_stack_top().class_def_state = &class_state;
   26762             :     /* Wrap up the definition. */
   26763             :     complete_class_definition(btp, DEPTH_OF_FILE_SCOPE, &class_state);
   26764             :     pop_scope();
   26765             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
   26766             :     /* Restore the previous state wrt. generating source sequence entries. */
   26767             :     source_sequence_entries_disallowed =
   26768             :                                      saved_source_sequence_entries_disallowed;
   26769             :     scope_stack_top().source_sequence_entries_disallowed 
   26770             :                                     = saved_source_sequence_entries_disallowed;
   26771             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
   26772             :     pop_instantiation_scope_for_boxed_enum_type();
   26773             :     /* Link the enum type with the boxed type and vice versa. */
   26774             :     integer_type_supp(tp)->boxed_type = btp;
   26775             :     ctsp->corresponding_basic_type = tp;
   26776             :   } /* if */
   26777             : }  /* make_boxed_enum_type */
   26778             : 
   26779             : 
   26780             : static void scan_implements_list(a_class_def_state_ptr  cdsp)
   26781             : /*
   26782             : CLI metadata can contain classes that implement their own member interfaces.
   26783             : However, C++/CLI has no syntax to express that (implemented interfaces must be
   26784             : specified before the class body and nested interfaces must appear in that
   26785             : body).  To work around that limitation, the front end accepts an extension in
   26786             : classes generated from metadata.  It uses a special keyword __implements as
   26787             : follows:
   26788             : 
   26789             :         ref class D: B, __implements ... {  // Marker to indicate that
   26790             :                                             // implemented interfaces will be
   26791             :           ...                               // specified later.
   26792             :           interface struct I;
   26793             :           ref class N;
   26794             :           __implements I, N::I;  // This will cause definitions for D::I and
   26795             :                                  // D::N::I to be loaded, after which those
   26796             :                                  // interfaces are added to the base class
   26797             :                                  // list.
   26798             :         };
   26799             : 
   26800             : This function scans and records the __implements construct appearing the body
   26801             : of such classes (including the trailing semicolon).  cdsp describes the class
   26802             : definition in which the construct appears.
   26803             : */
   26804             : {
   26805             :   check_assertion(curr_token == tok_implements && cdsp->interfaces_pending);
   26806             :   if (cdsp->class_type->variant.class_struct_union.any_virtual_functions) {
   26807             :     /* An __implements list must appear before the declaration of any virtual
   26808             :        member since the declaration of such a member can affect whether an
   26809             :        interface is correctly implemented. */
   26810             :     pos_error(ec_implements_must_precede_virtual_functions, &error_position);
   26811             :   }  /* if */
   26812             :   cannot_bind_to_curr_construct();
   26813             :   scan_base_specifier_list(cdsp);
   26814             :   (void)required_token(tok_semicolon, ec_exp_semicolon);
   26815             :   wrapup_base_classes(cdsp);
   26816             :   /* No additional __implements constructs are permitted. */
   26817             :   cdsp->interfaces_pending = FALSE;
   26818             : }  /* scan_implements_list */
   26819             : 
   26820             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   26821             : 
   26822       60254 : static a_boolean member_declarator(a_class_def_state_ptr    class_state,
   26823             :                                    a_member_decl_info_ptr   decl_info,
   26824             :                                    a_symbol_locator         *locator,
   26825             :                                    a_func_info_block        *func_info,
   26826             :                                    a_boolean                *is_function,
   26827             :                                    a_boolean                *is_typedef)
   26828             : /*
   26829             : Parse a declarator for an in-class declaration (which might be a friend
   26830             : declarator, and therefore not actually the declaration of a class member).
   26831             : class_state describes the class in which the declarator appears and decl_info
   26832             : describes the current member declaration as a whole.  Return through *locator
   26833             : a description of the declarator-id and through *is_function if this declarator
   26834             : is for a function (in which case *func_info will contain a description of the
   26835             : top-level function declarator).  The caller should set *is_typedef to TRUE if
   26836             : the declaration contained a typedef specifier, but this routine may clear that
   26837             : flag if error recovery should be performed as if the specifier didn't occur.
   26838             : */
   26839             : {
   26840       60254 :   a_boolean           okay = TRUE;
   26841       60254 :   a_decl_parse_state  *dps = &decl_info->decl_state;
   26842       60254 :   a_type_ptr          class_type = class_state->class_type;
   26843       60254 :   a_boolean           no_decl_specifiers, is_member_template_rescan;
   26844       60254 :   a_boolean           friend_specified;
   26845             : 
   26846       60254 :   add_stop_token(tok_colon);
   26847       60254 :   add_stop_token(tok_try);
   26848       60254 :   clear_func_info(func_info);
   26849       60254 :   no_decl_specifiers = (dps->dso_flags & DSO_NO_DECL_SPECIFIERS) != 0;
   26850       60254 :   friend_specified = (dps->dso_flags & DSO_FRIEND) != 0;
   26851       60254 :   is_member_template_rescan = (scope_stack[depth_scope_stack].kind ==
   26852             :                                  (a_scope_kind)sck_template_instantiation);
   26853             :   /* Initialize certain decl_info fields for each declarator. */
   26854       60254 :   decl_info->is_unnamed_field = FALSE;
   26855       60254 :   dps->sym = NULL;
   26856       60254 :   if (!decl_info->is_first_in_declarator_list) {
   26857             :     /* Check if a secondary declarator declares a constructor or destructor.
   26858             :        (In C++/CLI mode, also consider static constructors and finalizers.) */
   26859           2 :     decl_info->is_destructor = decl_info->is_constructor = FALSE;
   26860           2 :     dps->dso_flags &= ~(DSO_CONSTRUCTOR | DSO_DESTRUCTOR);
   26861             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   26862             :     decl_info->is_static_constructor = FALSE;
   26863             :     decl_info->is_finalizer = FALSE;
   26864             :     dps->dso_flags &= ~(DSO_STATIC_CONSTRUCTOR | DSO_FINALIZER);
   26865             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   26866           2 :     if (dps->is_lambda) {
   26867             :       /* The rescanning of a generic lambda call operator.  We shouldn't find
   26868             :          a secondary declarator in that case. */
   26869           0 :       expect_error();
   26870           2 :     } else if (curr_token == tok_compl ||
   26871           4 :                (is_generalized_identifier_start(GID_NO_OPTIONS) &&
   26872             :                 locator_for_curr_id.is_destructor_name)) {
   26873           0 :       decl_info->is_destructor = TRUE;
   26874           0 :       dps->type = dps->declared_type = unknown_type();
   26875             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   26876             :     } else if (cli_or_cx_enabled &&
   26877             :                (curr_token == tok_not ||
   26878             :                 (is_generalized_identifier_start(GID_NO_OPTIONS) &&
   26879             :                  locator_for_curr_id.is_finalizer_name))) {

   27108             : static void check_initonly_member_type(a_decl_parse_state  *dps,

   27153             : static a_symbol_ptr class_member_declaration(
   27154             :                       a_class_def_state_ptr    class_state,
   27155             :                       a_tmpl_decl_state_ptr    templ_state,
   27156             :                       an_ms_attribute_ptr      ms_attributes,
   27157             :                       a_boolean                is_member_template,
   27158             :                       a_template_param_ptr     templ_param_list,
   27159             :                       a_boolean                *skip_semicolon_check,
   27160             :                       a_type_ptr               *member_template_instance_type,
   27161             :                       a_template_instance_ptr  instance,
   27162             :                       a_template_ptr           il_template_entry,
   27163             :                       a_decl_pos_block_ptr     decl_pos_block_ptr)
   27164             : /*
   27165             : Scan a member declaration appearing inside a class definition.  class_state
   27166             : points to a block of information tracking general information about the class.
   27167             : ms_attributes points to a list of Microsoft attributes that have already been
   27168             : parsed for this declaration (if any). *skip_semicolon_check is returned TRUE
   27169             : if the caller should suppress the check for a semicolon following the member
   27170             : declaration.  templ_param_list is non-NULL for function template declarations.
   27171             : decl_pos_block_ptr is non-NULL when then extra source position information
   27172             : collected during this declaration needs to be returned to the caller.
   27173             : If prototype instantiations are recorded in the IL, the template header is
   27174             : passed via template_decl.  templ_state points to a block of information
   27175             : that is provided if this is a member template declaration.
   27176             : */
   27177             : {

   27244             :     if (ms_extensions) {

   27249             :       if (cli_or_cx_enabled) {
   27250             :         a_property_or_event_descr  *pdp = class_state->property_or_event_descr;

   27252             :             property_or_event_is_missing_assoc_data_member(pdp)) {
   27253             :           /* A property/event accessor is presumably next.  If that accessor is
   27254             :              declared static, the property/event should also be static (except
   27255             :              for some error situations such as a property declared with
   27256             :              "virtual" having a "static" accessor). */
   27257             :           if (!pdp->is_virtual && !pdp->is_default_indexed &&

   27262             :              associated with the property/event since we now know whether it
   27263             :              is static or not. */

   27265             :         }  /* if */
   27266             :         /* Look ahead to see if the current declaration is for a field or

   27268             :            "event", "initonly", or "literal". */
   27269             :         if (check_for_cli_field_modifier(dps)) {
   27270             :           if (dps->has_cli_property_keyword ||
   27271             :               dps->has_cli_event_keyword) {
   27272             :             scan_cli_property_or_event_head(class_state, &decl_info);
   27273             :             *skip_semicolon_check = TRUE;
   27274             :             goto next_declaration;
   27275             :           } else {
   27276             :             /* "literal" and "initonly" are consumed by the call to
   27277             :                decl_specifiers below. */
   27278             :           }  /* if */
   27279             :         } else if (check_for_cli_delegate_definition()) {
   27280             :           scan_and_record_cli_delegate_definition(dps, (a_type_ptr)NULL);
   27281             :           cannot_bind_to_curr_construct();
   27282             :           goto next_declaration;
   27283             :         }  /* if */
   27284             :       }  /* if */
   27285             :       if (check_for_event_interface_declaration()) {
   27286             :         /* An "__event __interface". */
   27287             :         scan_and_record_event_interface_declaration(dps, class_type);
   27288             :         goto next_declaration;
   27289             :       }  /* if */
   27290             :     }  /* if */
   27291             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   27292             :     /* Scan the declaration specifiers.  In C++ the specifiers may be omitted,
   27293             :        e.g., for a function member with implicit type. */
   27294             :     add_stop_token(tok_colon);
   27295             :     decl_specifiers(dsi_flags, dps, &decl_info.decl_pos_block);
   27296             :     dso_flags = dps->dso_flags;
   27297             :     remove_stop_token(tok_colon);
   27298             :   } else {
   27299             :     /* A lambda operator: There are no attributes or explicit specifiers. */
   27300             :     check_assertion(curr_token == tok_lparen);
   27301             :     dps->specifiers_type = make_auto_type(&pos_curr_token,
   27302             :                                           /*is_decltype_auto=*/FALSE);
   27303             :     dps->type = dps->specifiers_type;

   27307             :   }  /* if */
   27308             :   no_decl_specifiers = (dso_flags & DSO_NO_DECL_SPECIFIERS) != 0;
   27309             :   type_explicitly_specified =
   27310             :                            (dso_flags & DSO_HAS_EXPLICIT_TYPE_SPECIFIER) != 0;

   27312             :   if (friend_specified) {
   27313             :     class_state->any_friend_decls = TRUE;

   27315             :     class_state->potentially_interface_like = FALSE;
   27316             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   27317             :   }  /* if */
   27318             :   decl_info.is_constructor = (dso_flags & DSO_CONSTRUCTOR) != 0;
   27319             :   decl_info.is_destructor = (dso_flags & DSO_DESTRUCTOR) != 0;
   27320             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   27321             :   decl_info.is_static_constructor = (dso_flags & DSO_STATIC_CONSTRUCTOR) != 0;
   27322             :   decl_info.is_finalizer = (dso_flags & DSO_FINALIZER) != 0;
   27323             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   27324             :   mutable_specified = (dso_flags & DSO_MUTABLE) != 0;
   27325             :   is_typedef =
   27326             :             dps->declared_storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_typedef;
   27327             :   consume_any_stray_microsoft_rparen();
   27328             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED || SUN_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   27329             :   if (ms_extensions || sun_mode) {

   27332             :          class template. */
   27333             :       check_assertion(friend_specified && curr_token == tok_semicolon);

   27335             :     }  /* if */
   27336             :   }  /* if */
   27337             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED || SUN_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   27338             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   27339             :   if (ms_extensions && dps->ms_attributes != NULL) {

   27342             :         class_type->source_corresp.is_local_to_function) {

   27352             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   27353             :   if (!C_mode() && (dso_flags & DSO_DEFINES_SOMETHING) &&
   27354             :       !is_error_type(dps->type)) {
   27355             :     /* Should be a class, struct, union, or enum definition. */
   27356             :     a_type_ptr    tp = skip_typerefs(dps->type);

   27362             :       }  /* if */
   27363             : #if CHECKING

   27376             :   } /* if */

   27665             :                  entry, since default arg fixup depends on it. */
   27666             :               a_type_ptr  declared_type = func_info.declared_type;
   27667             :               tip->declared_type_for_default_arg_fixup = declared_type;
   27668             :               if (declared_type == NULL) {
   27669             :                 declared_type = form_declared_type(dps->type,
   27670             :                                                    &func_info);
   27671             :               }  /* if */
   27672             :               tip->declared_type = declared_type;
   27673             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
   27674             :               /* Save the prototype scope symbols and parameter ID list in the
   27675             :                  instance pointer.  The param_id_list is needed during
   27676             :                  instantiation if a noexcept or similar construct references a
   27677             :                  parameter name.  It is also used to reconstruct the declared
   27678             :                  types of the parameters in some configurations. */
   27679             :               tip->prototype_scope_symbols = func_info.prototype_scope_symbols;
   27680             :               tip->param_id_list = func_info.param_id_list;
   27681             :               func_info.keep_param_id_list = TRUE;
   27682             :               if (tip->template_sym != NULL &&
   27683             :                   symbol_is(tip->template_sym, sk_member_function) &&
   27684             :                   symbol_is(rout_sym, sk_member_function)) {
   27685             :                 /* Check whether there were attributes on an in-class
   27686             :                    definition during the prototype instantiations.  If so, any
   27687             :                    attributes recorded here should also be considered to have
   27688             :                    appeared on the definition. */
   27689             :                 an_attribute_ptr  proto_ap=
   27690             :                                        tip->template_sym->variant.routine.ptr
   27691             :                                           ->source_corresp.attributes;

   27693             :                   mark_primary_decl_attributes(
   27694             :                     rout_sym->variant.routine.ptr->source_corresp.attributes);
   27695             :                 }  /* if */
   27696             :               }  /* if */
   27697             :             }  /* if */
   27698             :           }  /* if */
   27699             :         }  /* if */
   27700             :         if (dso_flags & DSO_EXPLICIT) {
   27701             :           if (decl_info.is_constructor) {
   27702             :             rout_sym->variant.routine.ptr->is_explicit_constructor = TRUE;
   27703             :             class_state->class_aggregate_ruled_out = TRUE;
   27704             :           } else if (locator.is_conversion_name &&
   27705             :                      explicit_conversion_functions_enabled) {
   27706             :             if (cli_or_cx_enabled &&

   27708             :                                                   dso_flags)) {
   27709             :               expect_error();
   27710             :             } else {
   27711             :               rout_sym->variant.routine.ptr
   27712             :                       ->is_explicit_conversion_function = TRUE;
   27713             :             }  /* if */
   27714             :           }  /* if */
   27715             :         }  /* if */
   27716             :       }  /* if */
   27717             :       if (!func_info.is_definition ||
   27718             :           (prototype_instantiations_in_il &&
   27719             :            !nonclass_prototype_instantiations &&
   27720             :            class_type
   27721             :                    ->variant.class_struct_union.is_prototype_instantiation)) {
   27722             :         /* Update xref info on param ids.  Note that if we are in a prototype
   27723             :            instantiation and nonclass templates are not parsed in their generic
   27724             :            form, the function should be considered undefined (since it won't
   27725             :            be parsed until the parameters are substituted). */
   27726             :         record_param_id_list_declarations(&func_info);
   27727             :       }  /* if */
   27728             :       if (curr_routine_fixup != NULL) {
   27729             :         /* Update the symbol pointer in the fixup entry -- it's needed when
   27730             :            the default args are scanned (once the entire class has been
   27731             :            scanned). */
   27732             :         curr_routine_fixup->symbol = rout_sym;
   27733             :         curr_routine_fixup->func_info = func_info;
   27734             :       } else {
   27735             :         done_with_func_info(func_info);
   27736             :       }  /* if */
   27737             :       if (curr_token == tok_assign) {
   27738             :         /* Look for a pure specifier ("= 0"), which may appear on virtual
   27739             :            functions, but don't attempt to scan past a C++11 "= default" or
   27740             :            "= delete" construct. */

   27742             :         if (next_tok != tok_delete && next_tok != tok_default) {
   27743             :           scan_pure_specifier(rout_sym, class_type, &decl_info, &func_info);
   27744             :         }  /* if */
   27745             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   27746             :       } else if (func_info.abstract) {
   27747             :         /* The function modifier "abstract" means the same thing as "= 0" (but
   27748             :            it always requires an explicit "virtual" specifier, which was
   27749             :            checked earlier). */
   27750             :         make_virtual_function_pure(rout_sym->variant.routine.ptr, class_type);
   27751             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   27752             :       }  /* if */
   27753             :       if (function_def_present) {
   27754             :         remove_stop_token(tok_comma);
   27755             :         cache_in_class_function_definition(&func_info, &decl_info,
   27756             :                                            class_state);
   27757             :         /* A comma-list of function definitions is not allowed. */
   27758             :         *skip_semicolon_check = TRUE;
   27759             :         goto next_declaration;
   27760             :       } else {
   27761             :         /* Not a function definition. */
   27762             :         if (!friend_specified) {
   27763             :           if (rout_sym->variant.routine.ptr->is_virtual &&
   27764             :               !rout_sym->variant.routine.ptr->pure_virtual) {
   27765             :             /* Virtual member function. */
   27766             :             if (class_state->is_local_class) {
   27767             :               /* A member function declared in a local class definition
   27768             :                  (which is the current case) must be defined within the class
   27769             :                  definition if it is used -- virtual functions are assumed to
   27770             :                  be used (e.g., because an address is needed for a vtbl).
   27771             :                  (For a non-virtual function we issue the error when it is
   27772             :                  referenced.) */
   27773             :               if (strict_ansi_mode) {
   27774             :                 sym_error(ec_local_class_function_def_missing, rout_sym);
   27775             :               } else {
   27776             :                 /* Issue a warning (since g++ and clang allow this if
   27777             :                    the local class is unused). */
   27778             :                 sym_warning(ec_local_class_function_def_missing, rout_sym);
   27779             :               }  /* if */
   27780             :             } else if (class_state->corresp_prototype_tag_sym == NULL) {
   27781             :               /* An undefined virtual member function in an unnamed class (or
   27782             :                  in a named class that is nested in an unnamed class) cannot
   27783             :                  be defined later (there's no way to name it), so issue an
   27784             :                  error.  Note that if the enclosing class is a real template
   27785             :                  instantiation, the function body may actually exist but it
   27786             :                  was replaced by a semicolon in extract_member_bodies.  In
   27787             :                  those cases no error should be issued (but if indeed the
   27788             :                  body is missing, an error will have been issued on the
   27789             :                  prototype instantiation). */
   27790             :               a_type_ptr  tp = class_type;
   27791             :               for (;;) {

   27794             :                             rout_sym);

   27800             :             }  /* if */
   27801             :           }  /* if */
   27802             :         }  /* if */
   27803             :       }  /* if */
   27804             :     } else if (dso_flags & (DSO_FRIEND | DSO_VIRTUAL)) {
   27805             :       if (dso_flags & DSO_FRIEND) {
   27806             :         pos_error(ec_bad_friend_decl, &dps->start_pos);
   27807             :       }  /* if */

   27809             :         pos_error(ec_virtual_not_allowed, &dps->start_pos);
   27810             :       }  /* if */
   27811             :       remove_stop_token(tok_comma);
   27812             :       discard_curr_construct_pragmas();

   27814             :     } else if (dso_flags & DSO_INLINE &&
   27815             :                !(inline_variables_allowed &&
   27816             :                  dps->storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_static)) {

   27818             :          variables are enabled.  For an attempt to declare an inline
   27819             :          nonstatic data member, report an error and continue to process the
   27820             :          member declaration as if "inline" had not been specified; this
   27821             :          suppresses the diagnostic that would otherwise be reported on an
   27822             :          initializer for the member. */
   27823             :       pos_error(ec_inline_nonstatic_data_mem, &dps->start_pos);
   27824             :       scan_nonstatic_data_member(&locator, class_state, &decl_info);

   27827             :                || decl_info.is_finalizer
   27828             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */

   27830             :       /* Error has already been issued if it wasn't processed as a
   27831             :          function. */

   27848             :       if (!type_explicitly_specified) {

   27865             :            the default args are scanned (once the entire class has been

   27868             :       }  /* if */
   27869             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   27870             :       if (microsoft_mode) {
   27871             :         class_state->potentially_interface_like = FALSE;
   27872             :         if (microsoft_bugs) {
   27873             :           /* In Microsoft bugs mode, the typedef is processed before member
   27874             :              function bodies etc. are rescanned.  This makes e.g. the following
   27875             :              legal:
   27876             :                 typedef struct {
   27877             :                   enum { e };
   27878             :                   void f() { S::e; }
   27879             :                 } S;

   27882             :                                                   /*for_instantiation=*/FALSE);

   27884             :       }  /* if */
   27885             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   27886             :     } else if (!is_member_template &&
   27887             :                !field_initializers_enabled &&

   27891             :                 is_template_param_type(dps->type)) &&
   27892             :                dps->storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_unspecified &&
   27893             :                !dps->has_cli_literal_keyword) {
   27894             :       /* Provide support for the nonstandard declaration of a member constant
   27895             :          of scalar type -- e.g., "const int I = 2;". */

   27899             :         decl_nonstd_member_constant(&locator, class_state, &decl_info);
   27900             :       }  /* if */
   27901             :     } else if (!is_member_template_rescan) {
   27902             :       /* A static or nonstatic data member. */

   27905             :         pos_error(ec_mutable_not_allowed, &dps->start_pos);
   27906             :       }  /* if */

   27908             :         report_missing_type_specifier(&declarator_start_pos,

   27911             :                                       /*is_function_def=*/FALSE,

   27918             :       }  /* if */
   27919             :       if (!(missing_declarator || decl_info.is_unnamed_field) &&

   27921             :           is_error_locator(locator)) {
   27922             :         /* Some problem occurred while parsing the declarator.  To avoid
   27923             :            strange error recovery problems, we do not add a member to the

   27925             :            consisted solely of an unnamed bit field length, the locator is
   27926             :            set to an error locator even though there could not possibly be
   27927             :            a declarator-parsing error.) */
   27928             :         check_assertion(total_errors != 0);
   27929             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED

   27935             :         decl_literal_field(&locator, class_state, &decl_info);
   27936             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   27937             :       } else if (dps->storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_static) {
   27938             :         /* Static data member. */
   27939             :         decl_static_data_member(&locator, class_state, templ_state,
   27940             :                                 &decl_info);
   27941             :       } else {
   27942             :         /* Non-static data member (= field). */
   27943             :         scan_nonstatic_data_member(&locator, class_state, &decl_info);
   27944             :       }  /* if */
   27945             :       if (C_dialect == C_dialect_cplusplus) {
   27946             :         /* Issue an error if there appears to be an attempt to initialize a
   27947             :            data member within the class definition. */
   27948             :         if (curr_token == tok_assign) {
   27949             :           set_err_pos_to_curr_token();
   27950             :           /* Issue a syntax error to flush to the comma or semicolon. */
   27951             :           syntax_error(ec_bad_data_member_initialization);
   27952             :         }  /* if */
   27953             :       }  /* if */
   27954             :     } else {
   27955             :       expect_error();
   27956             :     }  /* if */
   27957             :     if (is_member_template &&
   27958             :         (dps->sym == NULL || !symbol_is(dps->sym, sk_variable_template))) {
   27959             :       /* Invalid declaration of a member template. */

   27961             :         pos_error(ec_bad_member_template_decl, &dps->start_pos);

   27963             :       }  /* if */
   27964             :       remove_stop_token(tok_comma);
   27965             :       discard_curr_construct_pragmas();

   27967             :     }  /* if */
   27968             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   27969             :     if (dps->ms_attributes != NULL) {
   27970             :       dispose_of_unapplied_attributes(&dps->ms_attributes,
   27971             :                                       ec_ms_attr_not_allowed);

   27973             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   27974             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
   27975             :     if (!decl_info.is_first_in_declarator_list) {
   27976             :       mark_decl_after_first_in_comma_list(dps);
   27977             :     }  /* if */
   27978             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
   27979             :     remove_stop_token(tok_comma);
   27980             :     decl_info.is_first_in_declarator_list = FALSE;
   27981             :     if (curr_token == tok_comma) {
   27982             :       /* Another declarator is presumably coming next. */
   27983             :       if (!C_mode()) {
   27984             :         check_use_of_placeholder_type(dps);
   27985             :       }  /* if */
   27986             :       /* Before parsing the next declaration, run any end-of-parse actions
   27987             :          needed for the previous declarator. */
   27988             :       run_end_of_parse_actions(dps, /*more_declarators=*/TRUE);
   27989             :       /* Reset certain fields in the declaration parse state. */
   27990             :       start_secondary_declarator(dps);
   27991             :       dps->qualifiers = saved_qualifiers;
   27992             :       dps->qualifiers_pos = saved_qualifiers_pos;
   27993             :     }  /* if */
   27994             :     /* Loop for additional declarators. */
   27995             :     if (gpp_mode && gnu_version >= 30400 && curr_token == tok_comma &&

   27997             :       /* GCC 3.4 and later accepts a member declaration like "int i,;" or
   27998             :          "S(),;". */
   27999             :       pos_warning(ec_nonstd_extra_comma, &pos_curr_token);
   28000             :       (void)get_token();
   28001             :     }  /* if */
   28002             :   } while (loop_token(tok_comma));
   28003             : next_declaration:;
   28004             :   if (dso_flags & DSO_EXPLICIT) {
   28005             :     /* The keyword "explicit" is allowed only on a constructor declaration and
   28006             :        on a conversion function declaration (the latter only in some modes).
   28007             :        Microsoft compilers also allow it on free-standing class/enum
   28008             :        declarations.  This check must occur after any declarator processing
   28009             :        because we cannot know for sure whether the declaration was a
   28010             :        constructor until then. */
   28011             :     if (microsoft_mode && missing_declarator) {
   28012             :       /* Microsoft compilers appear to ignore "explicit" in this case. */
   28013             :     } else if (!(dso_flags & DSO_FRIEND) &&
   28014             :                (decl_info.is_constructor ||
   28015             :                 (explicit_conversion_functions_enabled &&
   28016             :                  locator.is_conversion_name))) {
   28017             :       /* Okay. */
   28018             :     } else {
   28019             :       pos_error(ec_explicit_not_allowed, &dps->start_pos);
   28020             :     }  /* if */
   28021             :   }  /* if */
   28022             :   if (!C_mode()) {
   28023             :     check_use_of_placeholder_type(dps);
   28024             :   }  /* if */
   28025             :   run_end_of_parse_actions(dps, /*more_declarators=*/FALSE);
   28026             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   28027             :   if (ms_extensions) {
   28028             :     /* Restore the default name linkage if a linkage specification appeared
   28029             :        among the decl-specifiers. */

   28032             :       dispose_of_unapplied_attributes(&dps->ms_attributes,
   28033             :                                       ec_ms_attr_not_allowed);
   28034             :     }  /* if */
   28035             :   }  /* if */
   28036             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   28037             :   if (decl_pos_block_ptr != NULL) {
   28038             :     /* Return to the caller the extra source position information collected
   28039             :        for this declaration. */
   28040             :     *decl_pos_block_ptr = decl_info.decl_pos_block;
   28041             :   }  /* if */
   28042             :   db_exit();
   28043             :   return dps->sym;
   28044             : }  /* class_member_declaration */
   28045             : 
   28046             : 
   28047        2926 : a_symbol_ptr class_member_template_declaration(
   28048             :                                           a_tmpl_decl_state_ptr  templ_state)
   28049             : /*
   28050             : Scan a template function declaration that appears inside a class (or class
   28051             : template) definition.  templ_state describes the state of processing the
   28052             : template so far.
   28053             : */
   28054             : {
   28055        2926 :   a_type_ptr            class_type = templ_state->class_declared_in;
   28056        2926 :   a_template_param_ptr  templ_param_list = templ_state->decl_info->parameters;
   28057        2926 :   a_template_ptr        il_template_entry = templ_state->il_template_entry;
   28058        2926 :   a_decl_pos_block_ptr  decl_pos_block_ptr = &templ_state->decl_pos_block;
   28059        2926 :   a_class_def_state     *class_state_ptr;
   28060        2926 :   a_boolean             skip_semicolon_check;
   28061        2926 :   a_scope_depth         scope_level;
   28062        2926 :   a_symbol_ptr          sym;
   28063        2926 :   a_type_ptr            dummy_type;
   28064        2926 :   a_decl_parse_state    *dps = &templ_state->decl_parse;
   28065             : 
   28066        2926 :   db_enter(3, "class_member_template_declaration");
   28067             :   /* Get the class definition state, which is pointed to from the scope-stack
   28068             :      entry. */
   28069        2926 :   scope_level = class_type_supp(class_type)->assoc_scope->depth_in_scope_stack;
   28070        2926 :   check_assertion(scope_level != NO_SCOPE_DEPTH);
   28071        2926 :   class_state_ptr = scope_stack[scope_level].class_def_state;
   28072        2926 :   sym = class_member_declaration(class_state_ptr, templ_state,
   28073             :                                  dps->ms_attributes,
   28074             :                                  /*is_member_template=*/TRUE,
   28075             :                                  templ_param_list, &skip_semicolon_check,
   28076             :                                  &dummy_type, (a_template_instance_ptr)NULL,
   28077             :                                  il_template_entry,
   28078             :                                  decl_pos_block_ptr);
   28079             :   /* Clear the dps->ms_attributes pointer to avoid diagnostics issued by the
   28080             :      caller.  (Any needed diagnostics will already have been issued.) */
   28081        2926 :   dps->ms_attributes = NULL;
   28082        2926 :   if (curr_routine_fixup != NULL) dispose_of_curr_routine_fixup();
   28083        2926 :   if (sym == NULL) {
   28084             :     /* An error has already been issued. */
   28085        2926 :   } else if (sym->is_error) {
   28086             :     /* An error has already been issued -- return null. */
   28087             :     sym = NULL;
   28088        2926 :   } else if (!symbol_is(sym, sk_function_template) &&
   28089             :              !symbol_is(sym, sk_variable_template)) {

   28142           0 : a_boolean is_sized_delete(a_routine_ptr delete_routine,

   28183        6989 : static void check_operator_new_and_delete(a_symbol_ptr  tag_sym)
   28184             : /*
   28185             : Check that the new and delete operators are declared in consistent pairs
   28186             : in the class designated by tag_sym.
   28187             : */
   28188             : {
   28189        6989 :   a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr  cssp;
   28190        6989 :   a_type_ptr                     class_type;
   28191        6989 :   a_symbol_ptr                   new_sym, del_sym;
   28192        6989 :   a_boolean                      array_pass, ambiguous;
   28193        6989 :   an_opname_kind                 new_kind = (an_opname_kind)onk_none;
   28194        6989 :   an_opname_kind                 del_kind = (an_opname_kind)onk_none;
   28195             : 
   28196        6989 :   cssp = tag_sym->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info;
   28197        6989 :   class_type = tag_sym->variant.class_struct_union.type;
   28198             :   /* Do the checking once for the non-array new and delete declarations and
   28199             :      then for the array new and delete declarations.  This is done as loop
   28200             :      that iterates twice, first with array_pass set to FALSE and then with
   28201             :      array_pass set to TRUE. */
   28202        6989 :   if (cssp->has_operator_new || cssp->has_operator_delete) {
   28203             :     /* There are non-array operator new and/or delete declarations in the
   28204             :        current class. */
   28205             :     array_pass = FALSE;
   28206             :     new_kind = (an_opname_kind)onk_new;
   28207             :     del_kind = (an_opname_kind)onk_delete;
   28208             :   } else {
   28209             :     /* Skip the first set of checks and move straight to the array new and
   28210             :        delete checking. */
   28211        6989 :     array_pass = TRUE;
   28212             :   }  /* if */
   28213        6989 :   for (;;) {
   28214        6989 :     if (array_pass) {
   28215        6989 :       if (cssp->has_operator_array_new || cssp->has_operator_array_delete) {
   28216             :         /* There are array operator new and/or delete declarations. */
   28217             :         new_kind = (an_opname_kind)onk_array_new;
   28218             :         del_kind = (an_opname_kind)onk_array_delete;
   28219             :       } else {
   28220             :         /* Skip the second set of checks. */
   28221             :         break;
   28222             :       }  /* if */
   28223             :     }  /* if */
   28224             :     /* Get a pointer to the new and delete symbols (which may be overload
   28225             :        symbols). */
   28226           0 :     new_sym = opname_member_function_symbol(new_kind, class_type);
   28227           0 :     if (new_sym != NULL) {
   28228           0 :       if (new_sym->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_projection &&
   28229           0 :           !new_sym->variant.projection.is_using_decl) {
   28230             :         /* Ignore operator new if it is simply inherited. */
   28231           0 :         new_sym = NULL;
   28232             :       }  /* if */
   28233             :     }  /* if */
   28234           0 :     del_sym = opname_member_function_symbol(del_kind, class_type);
   28235           0 :     ambiguous = FALSE;
   28236           0 :     if (del_sym != NULL) {
   28237           0 :       a_symbol_ptr default_del_sym;
   28238             :       /* Pick the default operator delete (if any) out of the overload set. */
   28239           0 :       default_del_sym = find_default_operator_delete_sym(del_sym, class_type,
   28240             :                                                          &ambiguous);
   28241           0 :       if (array_pass && !ambiguous && default_del_sym != NULL) {
   28242             :         /* Note whether the class operator delete[] is of the two-argument
   28243             :            form. */

   28246           0 :                                         fundamental_symbol_of(default_del_sym);
   28247           0 :         a_boolean     is_aligned_delete;
   28248           0 :         check_assertion(fund_operator_delete->kind ==
   28249             :                                             (a_symbol_kind)sk_member_function);

   28252           0 :           cssp->has_two_argument_operator_array_delete = TRUE;

   28254             :       }  /* if */
   28255           0 :       if (del_sym->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_projection &&
   28256           0 :           !del_sym->variant.projection.is_using_decl) {
   28257             :         /* Ignore operator delete if it is simply inherited. */
   28258           0 :         del_sym = NULL;
   28259           0 :         ambiguous = FALSE;
   28260             :       } else {
   28261             :         del_sym = default_del_sym;
   28262             :       }  /* if */
   28263             :     }  /* if */
   28264             : #if ABI_CHANGES_FOR_PLACEMENT_DELETE
   28265           0 :     if (exceptions_enabled) {
   28266             :       /* When exceptions are enabled, be sure each placement operator new
   28267             :          has a corresponding operator delete. */
   28268           0 :       a_boolean  is_overloaded;
   28269             :

   28337             : static void check_if_potentially_interface_like(a_class_def_state  *state)
   28338             : /*
   28339             : state describes a class type in the process of being defined, and its base
   28340             : classes (if any) have been scanned.  Set state->potentially_interface_like
   28341             : based on the information recorded so far.  Additional elements of the
   28342             : definition may cause the flag to be set to FALSE later on.  (The flag
   28343             : remains set for a class type with properties similar to that of a Microsoft
   28344             : __interface type.  This is significant because __interface types may derive
   28345             : from such interface-like types.)
   28346             : */
   28347             : {
   28348             :   a_type_ptr  type = state->class_type;
   28349             : 
   28350             :   if (!type->variant.class_struct_union.is_interface) {
   28351             :     a_const_char *uuid_str = class_type_supp(type)->uuid_string;
   28352             :     if (type->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_struct &&
   28353             :         uuid_str != NULL &&
   28354             :         type->source_corresp.name != NULL &&
   28355             :         type->source_corresp.name[0] == 'I' &&
   28356             :         ((strcmp(type->source_corresp.name, "IUnknown") == 0 &&
   28357             :           strcmp(uuid_str, "00000000-0000-0000-c000-000000000046") == 0) ||
   28358             :          (strcmp(type->source_corresp.name, "IDispatch") == 0 &&
   28359             :           strcmp(uuid_str, "00020400-0000-0000-c000-000000000046") == 0))) {
   28360             :       state->potentially_interface_like = TRUE;
   28361             :     } else {
   28362             :       /* Check that all the base classes are nonvirtual and public, with
   28363             :          interface or interface-like class types.  There must be at least one
   28364             :          interface-like base class. */

   28366             :       a_boolean         interface_like = TRUE, has_interface_like_base = FALSE;

   28368             :         if (!bcp->direct) continue;
   28369             :         if (bcp->is_virtual ||
   28370             :             bcp->derivation->access == (an_access_specifier)as_private ||
   28371             :             bcp->derivation->access == (an_access_specifier)as_protected) {
   28372             :           interface_like = FALSE;
   28373             :           break;
   28374             :         } else if (bcp->type->variant.class_struct_union.is_interface_like) {
   28375             :           has_interface_like_base = TRUE;
   28376             :         } else if (!bcp->type->variant.class_struct_union.is_interface) {
   28377             :           interface_like = FALSE;
   28378             :           break;

   28385             :   }  /* if */
   28386             : }  /* check_if_potentially_interface_like */

   28390             : static a_using_decl_ptr find_unhiding_using_decl(a_type_ptr    dtype,
   28391             :                                                  a_symbol_ptr  bsym)

   28394             : the name of the given base class member (bsym), return an a_using_decl entry
   28395             : associated with that using declaration.  Otherwise, return NULL.

   28413           0 : static a_boolean sym_hides_base_member(a_symbol_ptr  sym,
   28414             :                                        a_symbol_ptr  *p_bsym)

   28443             : 
   28444       11934 : static void check_base_member_hiding(a_class_def_state  *class_state)
   28445             : /*
   28446             : class_state describes a class definition that was just completed.  Diagnose
   28447             : unintentional hiding of base class members as appropriate.  This may include
   28448             : issuing errors if the class was defined with the C++11 attribute "base_check". 
   28449             : Also diagnose cases where a member declared with the "hiding" attribute does
   28450             : not actually hide a base class member.
   28451             : */
   28452             : {
   28453       11934 :   a_type_ptr    dtype = class_state->class_type;
   28454       11934 :   a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr
   28455       11934 :                 cssp = symbol_supplement_for_class(dtype);
   28456       11934 :   a_symbol_ptr  msym = cssp->symbols;
   28457             : 
   28458             :   /* Don't check for hiding if a base is dependent.  Otherwise, only check
   28459             :      if the class is a "base_check" class or if the "hiding" attribute
   28460             :      appeared on a member declaration. */
   28461       11934 :   if ((cssp->base_check || cssp->check_hiding_attr) &&
   28462           0 :       !has_dependent_base_class(dtype)) {
   28463           0 :     for (; msym != NULL; msym = msym->next_in_scope) {
   28464           0 :       a_boolean     ovl = symbol_is(msym, sk_overloaded_function);
   28465           0 :       a_symbol_ptr  sym = ovl ? msym->variant.overloaded_function.symbols
   28466           0 :                               : msym;
   28467           0 :       for (; sym != NULL; sym = ovl ? sym->next : NULL) {
   28468           0 :         a_source_correspondence  *scp = source_corresp_entry_for_symbol(sym);
   28469           0 :         an_attribute_ptr         ap;
   28470           0 :         a_symbol_ptr             bsym;
   28471           0 :         if (!sym->is_class_member) {
   28472             :           /* This can happen in some error cases. */
   28473           0 :           expect_error();
   28474           0 :         } else if (symbol_is(sym, sk_member_function) &&
   28475           0 :                    sym->variant.routine.ptr->compiler_generated) {
   28476             :           /* Don't check compiler-generated member functions. */
   28477           0 :         } else if (symbol_is(sym, sk_type) &&
   28478           0 :                    sym->variant.type.is_injected_class_name) {
   28479             :           /* Don't check the injected class name. */
   28480           0 :         } else if (symbol_is(sym, sk_projection)) {
   28481             :           /* Don't check using-declarations or implicitly generated
   28482             :              projections. */
   28483           0 :         } else if (scp != NULL &&
   28484           0 :                    (ap = find_attribute(ak_hiding, scp->attributes)) != NULL) {
   28485             :           /* The declaration was marked as [[hiding]]: Check that it does
   28486             :              indeed hide base class member. */
   28487           0 :           if (!sym_hides_base_member(sym, &bsym)) {
   28488             :             /* The declaration does not hide a base member. */
   28489           0 :             pos_error(ec_hiding_attr_on_nonhiding_member, &ap->position);
   28490             :           } else {
   28491             :             /* Check if the hidden base class member is "unhidden" by a
   28492             :                using-declaration in the derived class. */
   28493           0 :             a_using_decl_ptr  udp = find_unhiding_using_decl(dtype, bsym);
   28494           0 :             if (udp != NULL) {
   28495           0 :               pos2_diagnostic(es_error, ec_hiding_attr_on_unhidden_member,
   28496             :                               &ap->position, &udp->position);
   28497             :             }  /* if */
   28498             :           }  /* if */
   28499           0 :         } else if (cssp->base_check) {
   28500             :           /* The declaration was not marked as [[hiding]] but the enclosing
   28501             :              class has the "base_check" attribute: Check that [[hiding]] is
   28502             :              not required. */
   28503           0 :           if (symbol_is(sym, sk_member_function) &&
   28504           0 :               sym->variant.routine.ptr->overrides_base_member) {
   28505             :             /* Don't check for hiding if a member function overrides a base
   28506             :                class (technically, an overriding virtual function hides the
   28507             :                members it overrides, but that is normal). */
   28508           0 :           } else if (scp != NULL &&
   28509           0 :                      find_attribute(ak_override, scp->attributes) != NULL) {

   28511             :                does not actually override a base class member, an error will

   28513             :                hiding is not likely to be helpful. */

   28524             :             }  /* if */

   28537       11934 : }  /* check_base_member_hiding */
   28538             : 
   28539             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   28540             : 
   28541             : static a_boolean check_conflict_with_direct_property_or_event(
   28542             :                                               a_symbol_locator  *ploc,
   28543             :                                               a_type_ptr        class_type,
   28544             :                                               a_symbol_ptr      diag_sym,
   28545             :                                               a_boolean         property_case)
   28546             : /*
   28547             : diag_sym represents a member declared in class_type or a type derived from
   28548             : class_type.  If property_case is TRUE, its name is of the form set_X or get_X;
   28549             : otherwise, it's of the form add_X, remove_X, or raise_X.  ploc is a locator
   28550             : for X.  Issue a diagnostic if class_type contains a conflicting direct (i.e.,
   28551             : not inherited) property or event named X.
   28552             : */
   28553             : {
   28554             :   a_boolean     result = FALSE;
   28555             :   a_symbol_ptr  sym;
   28556             : 
   28557             :   sym = class_qualified_id_lookup(ploc, class_type,
   28558             :                                   IDL_DIRECT_CLASS_MEMBERS_ONLY);
   28559             :   if (sym != NULL) {
   28560             :     a_property_or_event_descr_ptr  pdp = NULL;
   28561             :     a_boolean                      true_conflict = FALSE;
   28562             :     if (symbol_is(sym, sk_property_set)) {
   28563             :       /* A potentially overloaded property: The check can be performed against
   28564             :          any member of the set. */
   28565             :       sym = sym->variant.property_info->properties;
   28566             :     }  /* if */
   28567             :     if (symbol_is(sym, sk_field)) {
   28568             :       pdp = sym->variant.field.ptr->property_or_event_descr;
   28569             :     } else if (symbol_is(sym, sk_static_data_member)) {
   28570             :       pdp = sym->variant.static_data_member.variable->property_or_event_descr;
   28571             :     }  /* if */
   28572             :     if (pdp != NULL) {
   28573             :       switch (pdp->kind) {
   28574             :         case pek_declspec_property:
   28575             :           /* declspec properties don't have associated reserved names. */
   28576             :           true_conflict = FALSE;
   28577             :           break;
   28578             :         case pek_cli_property:
   28579             :           true_conflict = property_case;
   28580             :           break;
   28581             :         case pek_cli_event:
   28582             :           true_conflict = !property_case;
   28583             :           break;
   28584             :         default:
   28585             :           unexpected_condition();
   28586             :       }  /* switch */
   28587             :       if (true_conflict) {
   28588             :         pos_stsy_error(ec_member_name_reserved_by_property,
   28589             :                        &diag_sym->decl_position, diag_sym->header->identifier,
   28590             :                        sym);
   28591             :         result = TRUE;
   28592             :       }  /* if */
   28593             :     }  /* if */
   28594             :   }  /* if */
   28595             :   return result;
   28596             : }  /* check_conflict_with_direct_property_or_event */
   28597             : 
   28598             : 
   28599             : static void check_names_reserved_by_cli_properties_and_events(
   28600             :                                                        a_type_ptr  class_type)
   28601             : /*
   28602             : Check every direct member of class_type to see if it is of the form get_XYZ,
   28603             : set_XYZ, add_XYZ, remove_XYZ, or raise_XYZ.  If it is, issue an error if
   28604             : class_type also contains a (possibly inherited) conflicting property or event
   28605             : named XYZ.
   28606             : */
   28607             : {
   28608             :   a_symbol_ptr  sym = symbol_supplement_for_class(class_type)->symbols;
   28609             : 
   28610             :   for (; sym != NULL; sym = sym->next_in_scope) {
   28611             :     a_const_char *mem_id = sym->header->identifier, *pname = NULL;
   28612             :     a_boolean    property_case = FALSE;
   28613             :     if (symbol_is(sym, sk_type) && sym->variant.type.is_injected_class_name) {
   28614             :       /* The injected class name is not considered. */
   28615             :       continue;
   28616             :     } else if (sym->decl_position.seq == 0) {
   28617             :       /* Ignore compiler-generated declarations. */
   28618             :       continue;
   28619             :     }  /* if */
   28620             :     if ((mem_id[0] == 'g' || mem_id[0] == 's') &&
   28621             :         mem_id[1] == 'e' && mem_id[2] == 't' && mem_id[3] == '_' &&
   28622             :         mem_id[4] != '\0') {
   28623             :       /* "get_..." or "set_...". */
   28624             :       pname = mem_id+4;
   28625             :       property_case = TRUE;
   28626             :     } else if (mem_id[0] == 'a' && mem_id[1] == 'd' && mem_id[2] == 'd' &&
   28627             :                mem_id[3] == '_' && mem_id[4] != '\0') {
   28628             :       /* "add_...". */
   28629             :       pname = mem_id+4;
   28630             :       property_case = FALSE;
   28631             :     } else if (mem_id[0] == 'r' && mem_id[1] == 'e' && mem_id[2] == 'm' &&
   28632             :                mem_id[3] == 'o' && mem_id[4] == 'v' && mem_id[5] == 'e' &&
   28633             :                mem_id[6] == '_' && mem_id[7] != '\0') {
   28634             :       /* "remove_...". */
   28635             :       pname = mem_id+7;
   28636             :       property_case = FALSE;
   28637             :     } else if (mem_id[0] == 'r' && mem_id[1] == 'a' && mem_id[2] == 'i' &&
   28638             :                mem_id[3] == 's' && mem_id[4] == 'e' && mem_id[5] == '_' &&
   28639             :                mem_id[6] != '\0') {
   28640             :       /* "raise_...". */
   28641             :       pname = mem_id+6;
   28642             :       property_case = FALSE;
   28643             :     }  /* if */
   28644             :     if (pname != NULL) {
   28645             :       a_symbol_locator  ploc;
   28646             :       a_base_class_ptr  bcp;
   28647             :       clear_locator(&ploc, &null_source_position);
   28648             :       (void)find_symbol(pname, strlen(pname), &ploc);
   28649             :       if (class_type_supp(class_type)->has_direct_property_or_event &&
   28650             :           check_conflict_with_direct_property_or_event(&ploc, class_type, sym,
   28651             :                                                        property_case)) {
   28652             :         /* A diagnostic has been issued: Additional ones for this symbol
   28653             :            would not be helpful. */
   28654             :         goto next_derived_class_symbol;
   28655             :       }  /* if */
   28656             :       for (bcp = base_classes_of(class_type); bcp != NULL; bcp = bcp->next) {
   28657             :         if (class_type_supp(bcp->type)->has_direct_property_or_event &&
   28658             :             check_conflict_with_direct_property_or_event(&ploc, bcp->type, sym,
   28659             :                                                          property_case)) {
   28660             :           /* A diagnostic has been issued: Additional ones for this symbol
   28661             :              would not be helpful. */
   28662             :           goto next_derived_class_symbol;
   28663             :         }  /* if */
   28664             :       }  /* for */
   28665             :     }  /* if */
   28666             : next_derived_class_symbol:;
   28667             :   }  /* for */
   28668             : }  /* check_names_reserved_by_cli_properties_and_events */
   28669             : 
   28670             : 
   28671             : static void check_names_reserved_by_cli_operators(a_type_ptr  class_type)
   28672             : /*
   28673             : Check every direct member of class_type to see if it uses the name of a CLI
   28674             : operator in a manner in which it is reserved and issue an error if
   28675             : appropriate.
   28676             : */
   28677             : {
   28678             :   a_symbol_ptr  sym = symbol_supplement_for_class(class_type)->symbols;
   28679             : 
   28680             :   for (; sym != NULL; sym = sym->next_in_scope) {
   28681             :     if (sym->header->is_cli_operator) {
   28682             :       a_boolean           is_reserved_name = FALSE;
   28683             :       a_cli_operator_kind cok = sym->header->variant.cli_operator;
   28684             :       if (symbol_is(sym, sk_type) &&
   28685             :           sym->variant.type.is_injected_class_name) {
   28686             :         /* The injected class name is not considered. */
   28687             :         continue;
   28688             :       }  /* if */
   28689             :       switch (cok) {
   28690             :         case cok_none:
   28691             :           unexpected_condition();
   28692             :           break;
   28693             :         case cok_implicit:
   28694             :         case cok_explicit:
   28695             :           /* Members named "op_Implicit" or "op_Explicit" are always
   28696             :              reserved. */
   28697             :           is_reserved_name = TRUE;
   28698             :           break;
   28699             :         default:
   28700             :           if (symbol_is(sym, sk_member_function) &&
   28701             :               routine_symbol_type(sym)->variant.routine.extra_info
   28702             :                                       ->this_class == NULL) {
   28703             :             /* Static member functions are allowed to use the name of CLR
   28704             :                assignment operators and CLI operators for which there is no
   28705             :                C++ mapping, such as "op_True" and "op_UnsignedRightShift". */
   28706             :             a_cli_operator_info_ptr info = cli_operator_info_from_kind(cok);
   28707             :             is_reserved_name = !info->is_assignment_operator &&
   28708             :                                info->cpp_name != NULL;
   28709             :           } else {
   28710             :             /* Other uses of CLI operator names are reserved. */
   28711             :             is_reserved_name = TRUE;
   28712             :           }  /* if */
   28713             :           break;
   28714             :       }  /* switch */
   28715             :       if (is_reserved_name) {
   28716             :         pos_st_error(ec_member_name_reserved_by_cli_operator,
   28717             :                      &sym->decl_position, sym->header->identifier);
   28718             :       }  /* if */
   28719             :     }  /* if */
   28720             :   }  /* for */
   28721             : }  /* check_names_reserved_by_cli_operators */

   28723             : 
   28724             : static void check_for_subscript_mechanism_conflict(a_type_ptr  class_type)
   28725             : /*
   28726             : The given class type is a C++/CLI managed class type whose complete definition
   28727             : has just been parsed.  Issue an error if it contains both a member operator[]
   28728             : and a default-indexed property.
   28729             : */
   28730             : {
   28731             :   a_symbol_locator  loc;
   28732             :   a_symbol_ptr      sym;
   28733             : 
   28734             :   check_assertion(is_immediate_managed_class_type(class_type));
   28735             :   /* Check if this class contains an operator[]. */
   28736             :   make_opname_locator((an_opname_kind)onk_subscript, &loc,
   28737             :                       &null_source_position);
   28738             :   /* Members of interface bases are not considered because they aren't really
   28739             :      inherited members for the purpose of this test. */
   28740             :   sym = class_qualified_id_lookup(&loc, class_type,
   28741             :                                   IDL_EXCLUDE_BASE_INTERFACE_MEMBERS |
   28742             :                                   IDL_DO_NOT_CREATE_PROJ_SYM |
   28743             :                                   IDL_DO_NOT_ADD_TO_NONREAL_CLASS);
   28744             :   if (sym != NULL) {
   28745             :     /* The class contains an operator[]: A conflict is possible. */
   28746             :     a_symbol_ptr  default_indexed_properties =
   28747             :                                     symbol_supplement_for_class(class_type)
   28748             :                                                  ->default_indexed_properties;
   28749             :     if (default_indexed_properties == NULL &&
   28750             :         same_entities(sym_parent_class(sym), class_type)) {
   28751             :       /* Look for a conflict with a default-indexed property in a base class.
   28752             :          (If operator[] were in a base class, this is not needed because a
   28753             :          diagnostic would already have been issued for a conflict in a
   28754             :          base.) */
   28755             :       a_base_class_ptr  bcp = base_classes_of(class_type);
   28756             :       for (; bcp != NULL; bcp = bcp->next) {
   28757             :         if (!cli_class_type_kind_is(bcp->type, cctk_interface)) {
   28758             :           default_indexed_properties = symbol_supplement_for_class(bcp->type)
   28759             :                                                  ->default_indexed_properties;
   28760             :           if (default_indexed_properties != NULL) break;
   28761             :         }  /* if */
   28762             :       }  /* for */
   28763             :     }  /* if */
   28764             :     if (default_indexed_properties != NULL) {
   28765             :       /* A conflict: Issue an error. */
   28766             :       a_source_position_ptr  decl_pos = &default_indexed_properties
   28767             :                                                   ->variant.property_info
   28768             :                                                   ->properties->decl_position;
   28769             :       sym = fundamental_symbol_of(sym);
   28770             :       pos_sy_error(ec_subscript_mechanism_conflict, decl_pos, sym);
   28771             :     }  /* for */
   28772             :   }  /* if */
   28773             : }  /* check_for_subscript_mechanism_conflict */
