   31726             :       }  /* if */
   31727             :     }  /* for */
   31728             :   }  /* if */
   31729           0 : }  /* define_lambda_conversion_functions_if_needed */
   31730             : 
   31731             : 
   31732             : static void scan_lambda_body(a_lambda_ptr       lambda,
   31733             :                              a_func_info_block  *func_info)
   31734             : /*
   31735             : Scan the body of the given lambda (except in some error cases).  If no body is
   31736             : found, set lambda->lambda_routine to NULL.  *func_info describes some
   31737             : properties of the call operator with which the lambda body is associated.
   31738             : The heavy lifting for this routine is performed by scan_function_body.
   31739             : */
   31740             : {
   31741             :   if (lambda->lambda_routine != NULL) {
   31742             :     /* Parse the body of the lambda.  A class reactivation is not pushed for
   31743             :        the lambda closure class because it is still on the scope stack. */
   31744             :     error_position = pos_curr_token;
   31745             :     add_stop_token(tok_rbrace);
   31746             :     if (curr_token != tok_lbrace) {
   31747             :       /* If a lambda body is missing, set lambda to NULL since the parsed
   31748             :          construct may not have been meant as a lambda at all. */
   31749             :       pos_error(ec_missing_lambda_body, &error_position);
   31750             :       /* The return type of the routine might be the unknown type.  Set it to
   31751             :          an error type to avoid surprises (e.g., some IL traversal routines
   31752             :          expect that no unknown types remain in the IL). */
   31753             :       lambda->lambda_routine->type->variant.routine.return_type = error_type();
   31754             :       lambda->lambda_routine = NULL;
   31755             :     } else {
   31756             :       a_routine_ptr      rp = lambda->lambda_routine;
   31757             :       a_decl_flag_set    sfb_flags = SFB_NEW_STRUCT_STMT_STACK_REQUIRED |
   31758             :                                      SFB_NO_CLASS_REACTIVATION;
   31759             :       scan_function_body(rp, func_info, sfb_flags);
   31760             :     }  /* if */
   31761             :     if (curr_token == tok_rbrace) {
   31762             :       /* Don't use required_token, because if we aren't at a brace, an error
   31763             :          has already been issued, and we are at the token to restart parsing
   31764             :          with. */
   31765             :       (void)get_token();
   31766             :     }  /* if */
   31767             :     remove_stop_token(tok_rbrace);
   31768             :   }  /* if */
   31769             : }  /* scan_lambda_body */
   31770             : 
   31771             : 
   31772           0 : a_lambda_ptr scan_lambda(void)
   31773             : /*
   31774             : Scan a C++11 lambda construct and return a pointer to an a_lambda entry
   31775             : describing it.  If errors do not permit the construction of a consistent
   31776             : entry, return NULL.
   31777             : 
   31778             : The grammar for a lambda expression is as follows:
   31779             :   
   31780             :     '[' lambda-capture(opt) ']' lambda-declarator(opt) compound-statement
   31781             : 
   31782             :     lambda-declarator:
   31783             :         '(' parameter-declaration-clause ')' 'mutable'(opt)
   31784             :           exception-specification(opt) tailing-return-type(opt)
   31785             : 
   31786             :     trailing-return-type:
   31787             :         '->' type-id
   31788             : 
   31789             : (parameter-declaration-clause and exception-specification have their counter-
   31790             : parts in function declarators.  See scan_lambda_capture_list for the grammar
   31791             : for lambda-capture.)
   31792             : For example:
   31793             :     [=, &array](int i)->float { return array[i+k]; }
   31794             : */
   31795             : {
   31796           0 :   a_lambda_ptr         lambda = alloc_lambda();
   31797           0 :   a_type_ptr           closure_class;
   31798           0 :   a_scope_depth        decl_level, saved_decl_scope_level = decl_scope_level;
   31799           0 :   a_class_def_state    class_state;
   31800           0 :   a_func_info_block    func_info;
   31801           0 :   a_member_decl_info   decl_info;
   31802           0 :   a_tmpl_decl_state    templ_state;
   31803           0 :   a_boolean            bad_scope;
   31804           0 :   a_def_arg_expr_fixup_ptr
   31805           0 :                        saved_curr_default_args = curr_default_args;
   31806           0 :   a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr
   31807             :                        cssp;
   31808             : 
   31809             :   /* Temporarily stash away default argument fixups to keep them separate
   31810             :      from any additional fixups that might be generated for the lambda
   31811             :      declarator.  (E.g., this lambda expression could itself appear in a
   31812             :      default argument.) */
   31813           0 :   curr_default_args = NULL;
   31814             :   /* Start a new stop token context. */
   31815           0 :   push_stop_token_stack();
   31816           0 :   check_assertion(curr_token == tok_lbracket);
   31817           0 :   lambda->start_position = pos_curr_token;
   31818           0 :   report_gnu_cpp11_extension_if_needed(&pos_curr_token, ec_lambdas_is_cpp11);
   31819           0 :   begin_caching_fetched_tokens(/*include_curr_token=*/TRUE);
   31820             :   /* Initialize the closure class and set up a context in which members
   31821             :      can be added. */
   31822           0 :   decl_level = decl_level_for_lambda_closure_class(&bad_scope);
   31823           0 :   decl_scope_level = decl_level;
   31824           0 :   lambda->closure_class = closure_class =
   31825           0 :                  make_closure_class(decl_level, &lambda->start_position,
   31826             :                                     bad_scope);
   31827           0 :   record_start_of_lambda_header(lambda);
   31828             :   /* Scan the lambda capture list. */
   31829           0 :   (void)get_token();

   31831           0 :   decl_scope_level = saved_decl_scope_level;
   31832           0 :   scan_lambda_capture_list(lambda);
   31833           0 :   decl_scope_level = decl_level;

   31835           0 :   lambda->capture_end_position = end_pos_curr_token;
   31836             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */

   31838           0 :   remove_stop_token(tok_rbracket);

   31842           0 :   int is_cuda_global = FALSE;
   31843           0 :   while (curr_token == tok_host || curr_token == tok_device || curr_token == tok_global) {
   31844           0 :     is_cuda_host   |= (curr_token == tok_host);
   31845           0 :     is_cuda_device |= (curr_token == tok_device);
   31846           0 :     is_cuda_global |= (curr_token == tok_global);
   31847           0 :     (void)get_token();
   31848             :   }
   31849             : #endif
   31850             :   /* Now push the scope stack entry for the closure class. */
   31851           0 :   push_closure_class(lambda, &class_state);

   31858           0 :     end_caching_fetched_tokens();

   31896             :        generate a lambda conversion function. */
   31897           0 :     scan_lambda_body(lambda, &func_info);
   31898             :   }  /* if */
   31899             :   { /* Generate conversion functions and special member functions. */
   31900           0 :     a_generated_special_function_descr  gsfd;

   31910           0 :   complete_class_definition(closure_class, decl_level, &class_state);

   32027           0 : static void make_routine_externally_linked(a_routine_ptr rp,

   32110           0 : static void make_class_components_externally_linked(a_type_ptr type,
   32111             :                                                     int        *count)
   32112             : /*
   32113             : This routine changes the linkage of a type's components from internal to
   32114             : external.  The types it handles directly are class, struct, and union types,
   32115             : for which it adjusts members as needed, and searches for other classes that
   32116             : are entailed in its definition and marks them external as well.

   32119           0 :   a_field_ptr                  fp;

   32129             :     /* Increment the count.  This lets the caller know how many classes
   32130             :        were changed from internal to external linkage and permits an early

   32132             :        nested classes, since the optimization relies on classes at file scope
   32133             :        only. */
   32134           0 :     (*count)++;
   32135             :   }  /* if */
   32136             : #if DEBUG

   32184           0 :       check_type_for_linkage_change(vp->type, count);
   32185             :     }  /* if */
   32186             :     /* Classes nested in the class should also be treated as having external
   32187             :        linkage. */
   32188           0 :     tp = ctsp->assoc_scope->types;
   32189           0 :     for (; tp != NULL; tp = tp->next) {
   32190           0 :       check_type_for_linkage_change(tp, count);
   32191             :     }  /* if */
   32192             :     /* Any class used directly or indirectly in specifying a template class

   32194             :        ARM, but may be inferred. */

   32210             : 
   32211           0 : static void make_class_externally_linked(a_type_ptr type,
   32212             :                                          int        *count)
   32213             : /*
   32214             : This routine changes the linkage of a type and its components from
   32215             : internal to external.  The types it handles directly are class, struct,
   32216             : and union types, for which it sets the name_linkage field, adjusts members
   32217             : as needed, and searches for other classes that are entailed in its
   32218             : definition and marks them external as well.
   32219             : */
   32220             : {
   32221           0 :   db_enter(4, "make_class_externally_linked");
   32222             :   /* Mark the class as externally linked immediately, to avoid infinite
   32223             :      recursion if it is self referential. */
   32224           0 :   type->source_corresp.name_linkage =
   32225             :                                  (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_cplusplus_external;

   32231           0 : static a_boolean is_candidate_for_linkage_change(a_type_ptr  tp)

   32244             :        classes and enum types with internal linkage may be changed. */

   32249             :                                                 template_arg_list == NULL) {

   32267             : 
   32268           0 : static void check_type_for_linkage_change(a_type_ptr type,
   32269             :                                           int        *count)
   32270             : /*
   32271             : If type is a class type that is eligible for change from internal to
   32272             : external linkage, make that change.  If it contains such a type, make

   32276           0 :   a_param_type_ptr             ptp;

   32290             :            linkage, but types involved in its definition may need to have their
   32291             :            name linkage updated. */

   32303             :         /* Nested class -- be sure parent class is also externally linked. */
   32304           0 :         check_type_for_linkage_change(parent_class_of(type), count);
   32305             :       }  /* if */
   32306             :       break;
   32307           0 :     case tk_routine:

   32331           0 :       check_type_for_linkage_change(pm_member_type(type), count);

   32335             :          should be made externally linked, too. */

   32346             :     default:

   32350           0 :   db_exit();

   32352             : 
   32353             : 
   32354             : static a_boolean class_members_force_external_linkage(a_type_ptr  class_type)
   32355             : /*
   32356             : If class_type contains a static data member or a member function that is not
   32357             : defined inline, or if has a nested class with such members, return TRUE.
   32358             : */
   32359             : {
   32360             :   a_scope_ptr    scope;
   32361             :   a_boolean      external = FALSE;
   32362             :   a_routine_ptr  rp;

   32365             :   scope = class_type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info->assoc_scope;
   32366             :   if (scope == NULL) {
   32367             :     /* Class has not been defined. */
   32368             :   } else if (scope->variables != NULL) {
   32369             :     /* At least one static data member: external linkage is required. */
   32370             :     external = TRUE;
   32371             :   } else if (extern_inline_allowed && scope->routines != NULL) {
   32372             :     /* Ordinarily this path is not taken in cfront mode, but if extern inline
   32373             :        was explicitly specified on the command line, then any member function
   32374             :        has external linkage. */
   32375             :     external = TRUE;
   32376             :   } else {
   32377             :     /* Look for noninline member functions. */

   32379             :       if (!rp->is_inline) {

   32392             :           if (class_members_force_external_linkage(tp)) {
   32393             :             /* Nested class contains static data member or noninline

   32395             :             external = TRUE;
   32396             :             break;

   32404             : 
   32405             : 
   32406           0 : void check_class_linkage(void)
   32407             : /*
   32408             : This routine makes a pass over all the classes defined in this translation
   32409             : unit to determine which ones need to be changed from internal to external
   32410             : linkage and to make the change when appropriate.  This processing is
   32411             : required by the C++ language as described in the ARM, but it is no longer
   32412             : part of current C++ specification; consequently, this routine is called in
   32413             : cfront-compatibility mode only.
   32414             : 
   32415             : In cfront mode classes are internally linked (i.e., local to a translation
   32416             : unit) by default, but they become externally linked for one of two reasons:
   32417             : either they have members that are external by default, or they are used in a
   32418             : way that requires external linkage.  To be more specific, if a class has any
   32419             : noninline member functions or any nonstatic data members it is externally
   32420             : linked; or, it is used in the declaration of any externally linked class,
   32421             : variable, or routine it is externally linked (ARM 3.3).
   32422             : 
   32423             : Note that local classes have no linkage.  They are not changed to external
   32424             : linkage.
   32425             : 
   32426             : This routine first examines each class for members that would require it
   32427             : to be external.  When it finds one, it calls make_class_externally_linked,
   32428             : which sets the name_linkage field in the class, adjusts members as needed,
   32429             : and searches for other classes that are entailed in its definition and so
   32430             : must themselves be marked external.
   32431             : 
   32432             : If, once this is done, any classes remain that are have internal linkage,
   32433             : this routine goes on to determine whether they must be made external
   32434             : because they were used in declaring an external function or variable.
   32435             : */
   32436             : {
   32437           0 :   int             num_internally_linked_types, count;
   32438           0 :   a_scope_ptr     scope = il_header.primary_scope;
   32439           0 :   a_type_ptr      tp;
   32440           0 :   a_routine_ptr   rp;
   32441           0 :   a_variable_ptr  vp;
   32442           0 :   a_boolean       external;
   32443           0 :   a_boolean       any_candidates_for_linkage_change = FALSE;
   32444           0 :   a_symbol_ptr    sym;             
   32445             : 
   32446           0 :   db_enter(3, "check_class_linkage");
   32447           0 :   check_assertion(any_cfront_mode());
   32448             :   /* Search for classes by making a pass over all the types associated with
   32449             :      the file scope. */
   32450           0 :   for (tp = scope->types; tp != NULL; tp = tp->next) {
   32451           0 :     if (tp->source_corresp.is_local_to_function) {
   32452             :       /* Local type, possibly promoted to file scope during IL lowering of a
   32453             :          routine.  Ignore it. */
   32454           0 :       continue;
   32455             :     }  /* if */
   32456             : #if DEBUG
   32457           0 :     if (debug_level >= 3) {
   32458           0 :       fputs("file scope type: ", f_debug);
   32459           0 :       db_abbreviated_type(tp);
   32460           0 :       fputc('\n', f_debug);
   32461             :     }  /* if */
   32462             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   32463           0 :     if (is_immediate_class_type(tp)) {
   32464             :       /* Found a class. */
   32465           0 :       if (is_candidate_for_linkage_change(tp)) {
   32466             :         /* Class has internal linkage but nothing prevents it from changing
   32467             :            to external linkage. */
   32468           0 :         if (tp->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info->
   32469             :                                               template_arg_list != NULL) {
   32470             :           /* This is a template class, so it should have external linkage.
   32471             :              (Template classes that should not have external linkage have been
   32472             :              screened out by is_candidate_for_linkage_change. */
   32473             :           external = TRUE;
   32474             :         } else {
   32475           0 :           sym = (a_symbol_ptr)tp->source_corresp.assoc_info;
   32476           0 :           if (sym->force_external_linkage) {
   32477             :             /* Type has been used in a context that requires it to have
   32478             :                external linkage. */
   32479             :             external = TRUE;
   32480             :           } else {
   32481           0 :             external = class_members_force_external_linkage(tp);
   32482             :           }  /* if */
   32483             :         }  /* if */
   32484           0 :         if (external) {
   32485             :           /* Make the class externally linked and propagate this external
   32486             :              linkage into its members and the classes referenced in
   32487             :              declaring the members. */
   32488           0 :           int dummy_count = 0;
   32489           0 :           make_class_externally_linked(tp, &dummy_count);
   32490             :         } else {
   32491             :           /* Keep track of the fact that at least one class was encountered
   32492             :              that did not require external linkage on the basis of its
   32493             :              members. */
   32494             :           any_candidates_for_linkage_change = TRUE;
   32495             :         }  /* if */
   32496             :       }  /* if */
   32497           0 :     } else if (is_immediate_enum_type(tp)) {
   32498           0 :       if (is_candidate_for_linkage_change(tp)) {
   32499           0 :         sym = (a_symbol_ptr)tp->source_corresp.assoc_info;
   32500           0 :         if (sym != NULL && sym->force_external_linkage) {
   32501           0 :           int dummy_count = 0;
   32502           0 :           make_enum_type_externally_linked(tp, &dummy_count);
   32503             :         } else {
   32504             :           any_candidates_for_linkage_change = TRUE;
   32505             :         }  /* if */
   32506             :       }  /* if */
   32507             :     }  /* if */
   32508             :   }  /* for */
   32509           0 :   if (any_candidates_for_linkage_change) {
   32510             :     /* At least one class may have retained internal linkage after the
   32511             :        previous scan.  Since it may have been subsequently referenced in
   32512             :        declaring another class, it may have had its linkage changed to
   32513             :        external after all; we need to make another pass over the class type
   32514             :        entries to get an accurate count.  We keep track of the actual number
   32515             :        of internally linked classes that remain so that we can stop looking
   32516             :        at routines and variables as soon as possible. */
   32517           0 :     num_internally_linked_types = 0;
   32518           0 :     for (tp = scope->types; tp != NULL; tp = tp->next) {
   32519           0 :       if (!tp->source_corresp.is_local_to_function && is_tag_type(tp)) {
   32520           0 :         if (is_candidate_for_linkage_change(tp)) {
   32521           0 :           num_internally_linked_types++;
   32522             :         }  /* if */
   32523             :       }  /* if */
   32524             :     }  /* for */
   32525           0 :     if (num_internally_linked_types > 0) {
   32526             :       /* There is at least one internally linked class or enum type.  Make a
   32527             :          pass over all the variables defined at file scope to determine
   32528             :          whether the declaration of an externally linked variable entails a
   32529             :          reference to a class or enum type that is still marked as internally
   32530             :          linked. */
   32531           0 :       for (vp = scope->variables; vp != NULL; vp = vp->next) {
   32532           0 :         if (vp->source_corresp.name_linkage != (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_none &&
   32533             :             vp->source_corresp.name_linkage !=
   32534             :                                            (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_internal) {
   32535             :           /* This is an externally linked variable.  Check its type. */
   32536           0 :           count = 0;
   32537           0 :           check_type_for_linkage_change(vp->type, &count);
   32538             :           /* "count" is returned as the number of internally linked classes
   32539             :              that were changed to externally linked.  Adjust the number of
   32540             :              internally linked classes remaining.  When it gets down to zero
   32541             :              we can bail out. */
   32542           0 :           num_internally_linked_types -= count;
   32543           0 :           if (num_internally_linked_types < 1) break;
   32544             :         }  /* if */
   32545             :       }  /* for */
   32546             :     }  /* if */
   32547           0 :     if (num_internally_linked_types > 0) {
   32548             :       /* There is still at least one internally linked class or enum type.
   32549             :          Make a pass over the file scope routine entries similar to the one
   32550             :          made for variables. */
   32551           0 :       for (rp = scope->routines; rp != NULL; rp = rp->next) {
   32552           0 :         if (rp->source_corresp.name_linkage != (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_none &&
   32553             :             rp->source_corresp.name_linkage !=
   32554             :                                            (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_internal) {
   32555             :           /* This is an externally linked routine.  Check its type. */
   32556           0 :           count = 0;
   32557           0 :           check_type_for_linkage_change(rp->type, &count);
   32558             :           /* Again, we can bail out when the number of internally linked
   32559             :              classes is reduced to zero. */
   32560           0 :           num_internally_linked_types -= count;
   32561           0 :           if (num_internally_linked_types < 1) break;
   32562             :         }  /* if */
   32563             :       }  /* for */
   32564             :     }  /* if */
   32565             :   }  /* if */
   32566           0 :   db_exit();
   32567           0 : }  /* check_class_linkage */
   32568             :

   32614             : #endif /* if DEBUG */

   32616             :     };
   32617           0 :     register_pch_saved_variables(saved_vars);
   32618             :   }  /* if */
   32619             :   /* Static variables in class_decl.c. */
   32620         320 :   register_trans_unit_variable(avail_derivation_steps);
   32621         320 :   register_trans_unit_variable(deferred_friend_fixup_list);
   32622         320 :   register_trans_unit_variable(deferred_friend_fixup_list_tail);

   32624         320 :   register_trans_unit_variable(override_exception_check_entries);

   32626             : 
   32627             : 
   32628         320 : void class_decl_trans_unit_init(void)
   32629             : /*
   32630             : Initializations for class declaration processing that must be done for each
   32631             : translation unit.
   32632             : */
   32633             : {
   32634             :   /* Static variables in class_decl.c. */
   32635         320 :   curr_routine_fixup = NULL;
   32636         320 :   avail_derivation_steps = NULL;
   32637             :   /* g++ (prior to 3.4) and the Microsoft compiler do not evaluate friend
   32638             :      functions of template classes until the end of the translation unit, and
   32639             :      then only if they are referenced. */
   32640         320 :   use_deferred_friend_fixup_list = (gpp_mode && gnu_version < 30400) ||
   32641             :                                     ms_extensions;
